product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I am enjoying it, the the Kindle 7 is ...
review_body: I am enjoying it, the the Kindle 7 is smoother with more features than my older model, even if it's  a little boxier and not as sleek as my old version (It was a fire hd, but I think it was maybe hdx or something slightly fancier but an older model. It also had a seven inch screen but was more attractive). I wish I had gone for the extra GB but I just couldn't afford it. I wish it were cheaper. But I am enjoying the Kindle and it's a breeze to use, very fast search when searching for terms within your textbooks, much faster than before. I wish it was able to bring up the definitions from the glossary of my biology text book, instead it uses a generic dictionary and Wikipedia.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: One of the best purchases I've made!
review_body: I was surprised at how happy I am with this.  I had a first gen Kindle Fire, and hated it.  The functionality was poor, and I quickly exchanged it for an iPad, even though the iPad was significantly more expensive.  When I moved from an iPad to a Surface Pro 3, the firewalls that my workplace installed (which are remote, too), kept me from being able to access personal email, my kindle books, Netflix, etc, I decided to give the Fire another try, and I am really glad I did.  I use it more than I use my desktop!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
As a long time kindle reader, I was very disappointed with this device. It is bright and the color graphics are great, but after that it is not a pleasant device to work with for the following reasons.. I can't open it without an ad smacking me in the face. I can't by anything without an ad smacking me in the face.I downloaded a free game of solitaire and found that after every game i got smacked with an ad.

It also flips from horizontal to vertical violently. I prefer it to stay in one mode.. I often read in bed and want the screen to stay where I have it.

i had it short time and ordered a case. The case is good, however, I dropped the device from about a foot or less above my dining room table and the screen cracked. it is made of what appears to be cheap window glass. I have had my other kindle for years.no breakage. an I pad,no breakage. Three iphones in succession and never a break. I am careful and rarely put my devices at risk. I think a small drop like the one that cracked the screen on this device says more about the construction of the device than the 8-10 drop.

I would not have bought it if I had realized that I would be harassed with advertizements every time I used it.

review_headline: FOR THE AMOUNT OF MONEY SPENT ON THIS ITEM.
review_body:

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Purchased for 5 year old daughter. OK for what it is, OS needs definite improvement.
review_body:
I purchased this Kindle Fire HD for my 5 year-old daughter. As an adult who can be safely considered a tech-geek, here are the pros and cons for normal folks:

Pros:

1. My daughter loves it.
2. The profile controls and Amazon FreeTime controls to restrict usage are detailed and really exemplary.
3. It's inexpensive.
4. Amazon FreeTime has a lot of games, videos, and apps. The monthly fee is nominal.

Cons:

1. The UI for main OS is so disjointed and ugly that I'd almost prefer it if it were simply command-line based.
2. The actual FreeTime UI is similarly disorganized, and definitely confusing for anyone who is the age of my daughter. It just throws too much right in her face that she can't figure out where everything is.
3. My wife has difficulty figuring out how to navigate through the UI, so if there's a problem finding something or doing something, I'm the one that has to figure it out. iOS, this is not.
4. The tablet stutters a non-trivial amount of time. It also sometimes becomes unresponsive for short periods.

Overall:

The truth is that I'm not willing to hand my daughter an iPad that costs triple the price, no matter how well protected it is. So, this is the next best thing at her age. Amazon FreeTime is a good idea with great parental controls, but definitely needs more polish. Amazon, please fix FireOS. It's hideous.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Great as a tablet, less so as a reader
review_body:
The Fire is excellent as a tablet. I love the games, the accessibility to the web and the clarity of the screen. The lack of apps is sad, but should improve as the Fire becomes more popular. The sound is great. It is light, easily portable and fits comfortably in my hand. I am very disappointed in it as a reader though. Seriously, Amazon? Losing features on a signature product is very bad form. Not being able to access the collections I already have established on other devices, no search function for the ebooks I have, having to scroll through over 1200 ebooks to add them to collections I've already made, not allowing collections in the Cloud, not being able to find if I already have a book without having to go back to the website. I am also not happy with the automatic connection with goodreads. Just because an ebook accidentally opens because the screen is touch-sensitive doesn't mean I am "currently reading" it. Trying to find to special offers after unlocking the screen is also a pain.
All in all, I love the Fire and would never return it. I consider it a worthwhile investment and plan to enjoy it for years to come, just as I have my first gen Kindle and Kindle DX.

review_body: I really like the Kindle fire hd... but i have to give it 3 stars. I see why people went for the nook instead. He told me i can put the items in the cloud storage but i will lose my previous levels and investments into those games. He told me that on some games i can register it through Facebook and try to save it that way... then i was told well i should have just gone for the model up with the unlimited cloud... well i was nice and didn't retort like i normally do since it wasn't offered for me when i bought my fires. Do i feel rooked... of course i do. Do i feel like i got a good deal nah... and what i think about amazon customer service and resolving my 8gb prob which i don't see it show i even have 8gb that i apparently wont see according to customer service, well i think i will just post my review. Sorry. I am an amazon fan. ... and now my foolish self has to try and purchase a bigger fire will check the new one when i receive it that it will cover what i need and it says and shows what its suppose to. Don't shame me twice amazon.com.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Very upset about this situation. I'd rather give no stars. Bought this kindle last summer to watch movies on my nightshift when I work doubles, after about 4-5 months it started turning off by itself after I unlock screen, open apps, just randomly turning off. Sometimes I get an app to open and load but as soon as I touch the screen it turns off and does not restart. If I press the power button to turn it back on, it shows the Kindle Fire loading screen as always when you first turn it on then turns back off, can't even make it to the unlock screen. Finally after a few months of dealing with that and trying to reset my kindle, the problem continued. I baby my electronics, so I never overcharged my kindle, it doesn't make sense as to why it would suddenly give me such issues. I called tech support yesterday, they said I have 85 days left on my warranty so they'll send me a REFURBISHED version, guaranteeing I won't have any problems, and I just opened it up and already have a problem! The back is loose, the battery drains very fast and gets very hot after 2 minutes of use. About 1% of battery drain per minute. Where as my old kindle I fully charged last night, played a couple games, left on all night and is still at 95%. If I pay 160+$ for a 16gb kindle, and it craps out on me only less than half a yr after I buy it, I expect my money back OR a BRAND NEW KINDLE, not a refurbished piece of crap that seems ta be worse than my old kindle! Not sure if I wanna send my old one back to them. I think I'd rather deal with my old kindle constantly turning off when it wants and only way I get it back on is if I plug it in, rather than keep a crappy refurbished one that's absolutely NOT worth the 160$ I had spent on my original kindle in the first place. How is that even fair?

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Kind of wondering what my next step is...
review_body: I have only had my Kindle since the end of December, and I have to say I'm shocked how fast my device has gone downhill.  First of all, coming from the older Kindle, the casing on these new Kindles feels chinsey and cheap.  I fear the day I ever accidentally drop it.  I have had to delete so many apps and books off of my Kindle due to a low storage warning.  Yet there is hardly anything left on my Kindle.  It is glitchy.  If I download books and delete them off of my kindle they stay there no matter how many times I remove them from either the device or the carousel.  Videos will no longer even play on my Kindle.  It runs slow, and the battery runs hot.  Like really hot.  The battery is not as efficient as my old kindle.  My kindle also makes noises.  I don't know if anyone else has experienced this and I would appreciate anyone else letting me know if they hear any kind of pops and knocking noises coming from theirs.  One night I actually had a buzzing noise that reminded me of the sound of a bottle with trapped air that groans.  Has anyone else had this happened?  Needless to say that it freaked me out and I turned it off.  I'm kind of worried that between the noises and the batter heating up so hot that this could be a fire hazard.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Make Sure to Purchase the Extended Warranty
review_body: Great while it lasted.  I got mine as a gift 15 months ago.  Now I have battery and charging issues.  The device is now extremely slow to charge (about 10-15% for 2 hrs charging).  The device also randomly shuts itself off after using it for about 20 mins.  Since I did not purchase the extended warranty, customer service won't be able to replace it for free.  My only option is to purchase a new one.  The factory warranty ran out only 3 months ago.  My suggestion is to get an extended warranty when purchasing.  You will need it with the abundance of battery/charging issues with this device all over the internet.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: NO REPAIR options for the amazon FIRE
review_body:
Amazon bills this product as being sturdier than the competition, so buying these tablets for my kids for Christmas seemed like a no-brainer, but what they don't tell you is that these products cannot be repaired. My eight-year-old cracked his screen. Our local repair shop doesn't deal with Amazon fire's because they aren't popular enough for them to bother with. I contacted Amazon about repair possibilities and they said: "It?? Amazon?? policy to offer our customers a replacement device rather than repair their original device." Then they say they cannot further discuss the matter via email, you must contact them by phone. I called the number provided and had to provide all sort of info only to have to be transferred to another department (a customer service pet peeve of mine. They knew the problem why didn't they provide me a phone number to speak directly to the department that would handle this?). After going through everything, the customer rep said the broken screen would not be covered under warranty and the device would need to be replaced. Amazon does not provide any to repair these devices. Since they knew that would be hard to hear, they provide a discount for the replacement; a discount so small that the price of a replacement was still significantly more expensive that the price of the tablet when I originally bought it. You'd have to be an idiot to rebuy an all new device knowing this would likely happen again (I feel like an idiot for buying this device the first time around).

I feel Amazon is irresponsible for selling a device like this with no way to repair it. BUYER BEWARE!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Once the warranty is up they will refuse to help with anything. Even if you pay. Even though they fix and resell them on this very site. It's just a waste of money.

review_headline: Why can't I remove my credit card info and add a gift card to 1-click?
review_body: The product is good, and I like having access to so many books whenever and where ever I want, but I am facing a rather un-usual problem with my Fire 7. I want to remove my credit card info from 1-click and apply a gift card to it, as the kids use the Kindle more than I do, and I need to control how and what they buy through 1 click using the kindle. Why can?? I have that? Is it too much to ask? It just does not let me remove my credit card info and add a $25 gift card to it, so I can control the amount the kids can spend via my kindle. It?? like forcing you to let your credit card info available free for using without any check (through 1-click) and if you try to remove it, you lose all content. The fire becomes a dumb slab of stone!!! The worst digital product that I have ever used. I wish I knew about it before i purchased my kindle.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Loved it until it died after 15 months and warranty coverage.
review_body:
So today my kindle died. It wouldn't turn on and would only flash the opening screen. I rebooted several times then chatted with tech for a fix. They had me reboot several times and then declared it dead. They of course offered me a replacement at 150% of what I paid for this at Christmas 2013 and an astronomical 14$ off of the regular price. 15 months old and. pfft . No recourse. The wont fix it, they wont prorate some sort of replacement, they basically just said you are S.O.L. So I filled out the evaluation after the chat and up popped a screen that said we would still like to talk to you about this. So I put in my number and they called and said how can i help you. Well you should know since you asked me to call no? Chit chat with call receiver who forwards me to tech who says your kindle is dead. I can sell you a new one for 14$ off regular price. You are kidding me.
And here's the thing. I own 2 other kindles. Another one of these and a 8.9 32 gb. Overall I have spent 700-800 dollars on merchandise that will probably end up being very expensive paperweights. Maybe this is the future, I don't know. I have folks on my block who have had their kindles for years and handed them down to their kids. I thought it was a good buy. I thought surely Amazon stands behind their homegrown products. The last tech told me the average life of electronics is 2-3 years, well then your warranty should be 2 years so I can enjoy the average not 1 year so you can keep me in a buying loop in perpetuity. I will not be buying any more kindles. I'm not sure any other product will be better and have been avoiding apple products, but I am going to try one and see if it lasts longer than 15 months. And if it does then amazon will have lost me forever as a tech consumer. Was it worth the 30-40 bucks they could have discounted on a new unit? Only time will tell.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: A great tablet for what it is but poor selection of apps on the appstore.
review_body:
The kindle fire HD is very good for people that spend a lot of time on Amazon. I do find the direct link to amazon store to be useful especially when you want to quickly buy something from them. Amazon also have a great amount of books to read on the kindle. It runs pretty smoothly and I've never really seen it crashes or struggles with processing but the one thing that lets the kindle down is its lack of apps. The app store for amazon is dismal; there?? hardly anything exciting on there. There?? only the odd app you've heard of like angry birds and temple run but a lot of the main stream games and apps are missing from the app store so you could be missing out if you're an app lover. The apps the store does have seemed to be forgotten about during updates as well and some things are outdated such as facebook and twitter and even amazon's web browser, Silk, appears to still have the old fashioned google which really makes the kindle feel old and I??e only had it for a couple of months. Another little thing that I?? not happy with is the operating buttons for power and volume. It?? quite hard to use??but maybe it?? just me.
Overall, I think the kindle is a nice little piece of kit but I do think you can get better tablets that you can still get amazon books from and all that sort of stuff whilst having the better features and apps.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I do like the kindle fire HD
review_body:
I do like the kindle fire HD, and it's appropriately priced for a device dedicated to reading ebooks.
However, it is not as sophisticated as the iPad. Power button is to small and difficult to activate. The operating system is not intuitive and it takes more time to familiarize yourself with its operation when compared to apple products.
The screen resolution is very nice and it's easier to interface with the kindle store compared to using the kindle app on the iPad.
If planning on using it as an ebook reader and the occasional game, perfect tool for the job because of the price.
If needing something to help with your business, research or education, spend the extra money an get an iPad.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I love it, and it was awesome to have for ...
review_body: I bought a kindle fire a little over a year ago. I love it, and it was awesome to have for reading text-books or educational apps for my son. I have had problems with the charging port on my kindle failing to charge or work, and overtime it has gotten worse. I contacted customer service, but they were not willing to help unless I buy a new kindle. The way they were trying to sell me a new one was insulting! I got offered to buy a new kindle such as a refurbished paper-white kindle for 128.00 if I bought from customer service, while right now on the website I can buy a brand new paper-white for 119.00. Beware that if your kindle is having issues get it fixed asap before the warranty is up, and do not fall for the loyal customer "deals", because they are not any kind of deal. I am disappointed that they are not offering to repair peoples kindles that have the charging issues, because it is one of the better known issues with Amazon kindles.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: saw the advertisments for how wonderfully strong the Kindle HD was
review_body:
I, too, saw the advertisments for how wonderfully strong the Kindle HD was, and had to have one. I received it on March 17th, and on March 28th it slipped out of my hands when I was getting into my car. I had placed it into a neoprene case to protect it, and after seeing all of the impressive falls in the commercial, I figured that everything would be A-OK. But, no, the corner that the Kindle fell on was now seperated from the back!! What the ....
I called customer service who informed me that dropping the Kindle was not covered, and there wsn't anything that she could do for me, her hands were tied. I then called Capital One to figure out if there was anything they could help me with. I had purchased this item on a 5 payment plan and had 4 payments left to pay!! It was 2 weeks old. The credit card company lady called Amazon for me, and then I got back on with the Amazon representative, who informed me that there wasn't anything she could do for me. Then she went away for a while and when she came back on the line, she offered that I could return the Kindle for a refund, but next time, if I wanted to purchase another Kindle I WOULD HAVE TO PAY FULL PRICE FOR IT!! ARE YOU KIDDING ME? I assured her that would not be a problem, that I would never consider buying another Kindle no matter how it was financed. I am supposed to be getting a return lable in my email, so we will see how this all turns out.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I got my Fire HD7 with 8GB storage a little over a month ago, and I have already gotten down to 10% available storage.  I did take about 1.7GB of videos and used 1.86GB of games, but when I connected my Fire to a computer, the computer indicated that there were 782MB free out of 5.05GB!  Since 8GB was advertised, I expected it to say 782MB free of 8GB.  If you have your heart set on getting a Fire tablet, I recommend the 16GB version, but ultimately, I recommend the Samsung Galaxy Tab 4.  The strangest feature on the thing might be a glitch, is that when you plug it in and it's off, it automatically boots up.  The main reason I gave this a 3 star rating instead of a one or two star, is because of the handy feature that lets you drag your finger (or stylus) across the on-screen keyboard to type and despite other reviews, it has a good CPU speed.  Update: If you look at the storage section of the specifications, you will notice that it says: 8 GB (4.5 GB available to user) or 16 GB (11.6 GB available to user) of internal storage.  I do not think it would have been hard for amazon to put in a memory card slot for upgradable storage.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
Hello-

I have been a Fire user for a year or two before this device was released to the public... and not having a phone or any piece of technology; it was greatly welcomed. Let's take this review step by step starting with the build-

BUILD (7/10)

So the device is wrapped in a layer of plastic with a strong glass for the screen. This plastic is not strong at all and is also a fingerprint magnet. This is why I took of some points. However, it claimed it could be dropped off of a car and not scratch and for the 4 months of abuse it's been through it has shown no signs of damage.

APPS (4/10)

The new fire runs off of a new Fire OS now and that means that it has a new app store.. now this app store is already lacking some of the bigger apps already (EX instagram, clash of clans etc.) But now even less because of the new OS. They said that more than 200 apps are added everyday but none really of my interests. I'm sure it will grow but for now it isn't very impressive.

PERFORMANCE (8/10)

Okay so it has a Quad Core processor in the device which makes it lightning fast and I really have to give it to Amazon on this one.. there is virtually no lag in regular everyday use. Also it has two Dolby graded speakers on the back (Speakers sound amazing some of the best I've heard on a tablet) also Amazon has included new "Emoji" characters to the keyboard a nice upgrade if you are into "Emojing"

CAMERA (3/10)

So one of the biggest new features it has is the new rear facing camera! This practically won me over. But then I got to use it... little did I know it is only a 2 MegaPixel camera!!!! It sucks!! It is one of the worst I have ever seen I will tell you, do NOT buy this if you are looking for a tablet with a good camera! (Same goes for the front facing camera as well it is no better)

Now I've said enough bad things let's look at the cool features they addedthis time-

- App collections
-"Emojis"
-nice crystal screen very bright and vibrant
-a little bit of customization but nothing exciting (no wallpapers etc)
-voice command
-Very Fast
-lots a bug fixes from the previous models
-one month free prime (at time of review)
-firefly

Now for some disappointing cons-

- no mayday on these models at this time
-bad cameras
-plastic shell
-lack of customizations
- only comes with 16 GB which is fine but it can get tight.

So that is about it... would I recommend this to a friend... yeah... I probably would. Just not for the camera.

(PS. Not much has changed about the reading experience it is still as good as the previous models)

Hope this review helps you decide!

The price is amazing, so yes I would recommend it ONLY if you think it suits your needs!

Thanks for reading
- Sent from my Fire HD

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: More options, but are they better for the serious reader?
review_body: Unlike the original Kindle book reader, you cannot put books that you have read in a file to keep track of what you have/haven't read.  Do not like that there isn't a button on each side to advance to the next page, unlike the original Kindle, so that you are not sliding always one way on the actual screen which could ultimately damage it and creates a blur on that section of the screen when you use it. For the serious reader, these are critical missing components to have on a Kindle. Other options are amazing. Advises you about the next book in a series. Better bigger typing screen. Lighted screen for night reading. Better extra options--internet, email, games, etc. Because of these options, less battery life than the simple Kindle. Quite cheesy that you have to pay more to have the screen saver NOT show advertisements. Great tablet; average reading device.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I bought my first HD& on Valentine's Day.  A week later, it was a doorstop.  Wouldn't turn on.  I had charged it every night, had a nice cushioned case for it, treated it with TLC. I never let it get below 50% charged.  Took it back to Best Buy where I had bought it, and they said it was defective and replaced it.  I brought home my second HD7.  Had it for 5 weeks.  Same story.  Charged it every night.  Treated it with care.  Three days ago, it wouldn't turn on.  I took it back to Best Buy.  They told me THIS one was defective.  I told them that this time, I wanted my money back.  They wouldn't do it.  Told me that it was warrantied for only 15 days.  Great. I took a store credit instead.  Will NOT buy another HD7..  Using my store credit to buy a meat grinder.

review_body: The Kindle Fire itself is excellent - lightweight, easy to read, very convenient alternative to the computer. Browser leaves a lot to be desired, tho - not user friendly, hard to find bookmarks, etc. Giving this 4 stars for that as well as the fact that it took almost 10 days to arrive for a Christmas gift, even though I am just an hour's drive away from Amazon. Seriously - I could've WALKED there, picked the darn thing up, and walked it back home myself. In the old days, Amazon shipped stuff out the same or next day - now they take their sweet time. Also note that Amazon Prime is a complete waste - don't waste your money on it. Amazon brags and brags on how many things you can download for free - the only free stuff is stuff you wouldn't want anyway, like books by authors you've never heard of. Pointless.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
This is my second Kindle Fire HD. I got this one a few months ago and my husband is now using my first one, from a few generations back, almost exclusively to download, then read and simultaneously listen to books.

I use this every night and very much like its versatility. I first check all my news sources, then read through Twitters posts, play a few games, and read books, all the while listening to classical music via the Pandora app. (The music stays on regardless of what else you're doing on the Kindle, unless you deliberately stop it.) There's an exception to that: now and then the Kindle -- for reasons entirely inexplicable to me -- makes the music cut out and I have to go to the app and restart it. (The sound quality, not incidentally, has improved some from my previous model as well.)

Here and there other apps hang up as well, but not all that frequently. That's a defect of sorts, I guess, but it haven't been serious enough for me to contact Kindle support about it.

Though I don't use the camera all the time, the front and back camera on this model (as opposed to just a front camera from my previous model) is a great improvement and now allows not just for Skype use but for regular picture-taking. The screen resolution is also excellent.

I deliberately don't do email on the Kindle, and don't allow it to track my location. I also don't own a smartphone, and don't want one. But I'd very much miss my Kindle Fire HD if it were, for some reason, taken from me. Besides using it every night at home, I really like being able to take it with me to appointments, etc., when/where I know I'll have to sit and wait for a while. Though I'm still very much a paper-and-ink book person, it's so much easier to read a book with the Kindle in such circumstances -- and/or to dip into several books -- than to take one or more actual physical books along to wherever I'm going.

That amazon is producing these sophisticated littlemachines and offering them for the relatively modest price they're asking is a boon, particularly to us non-Apple users. (Yes, we're "out there"!)

review_body: Many, many or the reviewers claim this device can be used as a lite-tablet. This simply is not the case. I have spent hours on chat with tech support to no avail. I am leaning towards returning it.  Update****************** I've managed to unearth even more problems. While Amazon crows about streaming capabilities--good luck getting them to work consistently. I ran another tablet alongside the FIRE it has NO problem streaming for hours. The fire errored out about every 10-15 minutes. Oh and Amazon-Fan-Boys-Girls....I did all the usual rebooting device and router...etc...BUY SOMETHING ELSE.

review_headline: FIRE HD 7 TABLET Satisfied so far!!
review_body:
Wanted to give a fair review In a nutshell.

This tablet is the (4th. generation). And is a good one, so far.
It has plenty of storage (16g).
It update software on a regular basis.
It has a Family Library, Parental Controls if need for children.
It has Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, etc. (easy set up and connection).
***MUST ADD: THE CAMERA IS NOT THE BEST QUALITY. BUT DO NOT LET THIS DETERMINE WHETHER TO BUY.
Comes with preloaded apps (SOFT BROWSER, EMAIL, FREETIME, AMAZON, ETC.).
LOVE LOVE LOVE...THE AMAZON PRIME APP Preloaded!! GREAT FOR DOWNLOADS!
ALSO...Glad there's a free Word Office (KINGSOFT OFFICE) App that is awesome.
Offers AMAZON VIDEO ON DEMAND.
***OWNERSHIP: ABOUT TWO WEEKS-
There is lots more I could add, but my overall experience has been a good.***

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
First, my only 2 complaints with this device. First, and most important...the picture quality on here is not good. There is no flash, apparently, so you have to hold the tablet still for a few seconds longer than is necessary with a flash...And try to get the child you are photographing to hold still too...which makes that time either seem like an eternity, or just be impossible.

Second complaint, no SD card. (Which I knew full well going into my purchase, so the 4 stars instead of 5 is all for the picture quality.) Don't get me wrong, there is space on here. I have apps, documents, a lot of music, books, all on this tablet. And I STILL have space. But...it would be nice to be able to plug an SD card in, and not have to worry about space.

But, now, the GOOD. I use this tablet for blogging, social media, reading, and a game or two. Plus, I love listening to music and audio books. This tablet is all of that for me, and still small and lightweight enough to fit comfortably in my hands, and for me to be able to read on at night.

I absolutely adore this device, and aside from the pictures not turning out well, it absolutely suits my needs.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I love the Kindle Fire series.I upgraded to the Fire HD 7 with 8GB memory.I like the added camera and video recording features.There is also unlimited Cloud storage...this makes up for the loss of half of the 8GB memory dedicated to the SYSTEM. I am continually having to clear memory to add a book, or app.I do not have a lot of books or apps on my Fire, so this makes it doubly annoying to have to do this.
I never had this issue with my older Fire.In fact I gave it to my nephew loaded with Freetime Unlimited, and over 50. games and apps..it still has all of my apps and books on it also..and has not ever required a storage cleanup.
So, I would recommend buying the version with 16 GB, look for it, as I did not see this option when buying mine.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: the Kindle Fire displays books well, but is a total disaster for organizing or accessing them easily
review_body:
Excellent reliability, and good display options generally, though zoom settings do not freeze - meaning some books in small type that require zoom to read are unreadable on this tablet

You do not have access to the google android store, so the selection of apps is terrible and inadequate
The other major flaw is the display, you have no control over the carousel, cannot switch the display, or customize the view. It locks you in, and also tries to display suggested purchases unlike earlier Kindle and Kobo. Irritating.
The collections mechanic is useless, what should make accessing your books easier is too finicky and inaccessible
In short, the Kindle Fire displays books well, but is a total disaster for organizing or accessing them easily

It says you can run Android apps, but it's not recognized as a Google device so if you have an account with the Play Story you can't add apps you already own. It's being sent back in favor of an actual Android tablet.

review_body:
I got the Generation of Kindle that didn't have the camera's or the 4 core CPU. I've gotten nothing but disappointment from this device. It crashes a lot and can't run many of the apps that other android devices can. It even seems like when an app that I fall in love with does work, an update will cause it to crash and no one ever fixes it. The chat support transferred me a total of 10 times the first time I've had a simple audio issue and no one seemed to know what they were doing.

I recently have gotten a problem will my kindle where it crashes and then repeatedly crashes again on the booting up window and I can't get the device to boot up until I plug it unto an outlet. This happened to me 4 times in a week. The first time it happened was when I was watching a movie on Netflix. When I'm at work and didn't bring my charger, it's impossible to fix the Kindle in that state. The support team decided to send me a refurbished kindle of my same generation but I'd rather just get a refund.

Also, the hard-drive only has 5GB of space available from opening the box and this makes it impossible to keep many items on the device. Some apps in the app store are larger than this space. I couldn't even get Blizzard's new mobile card game to work on this device.

I'll wait to see if the refurbished kindle will fix any of these problems and update my review then.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Great, except for the crashing issue
review_body: UPDATE: I did end up sending an email of complaint to Amazon and they responded that it seems like I needed a replacement due to the repeated issue of not being able to turn on the device. I will be getting my new one in 2 days and if it works fine, then I'll be sending my current one back. I appreciate that Amazon turned around and decided to provide a solution this time.  I originally had the first version of the kindle and when I got this newer version as a Christmas gift, I found that this one is lighter to hold and the interface is better. Browsing on the web is definitely easier and has less complications. I mainly use my Kindle Fire to read books, and I like how it tells you the percentage and your reading speed. However, after 2 months of use, it started crashing randomly - meaning, I wouldn't be able to turn it on. The first time it happened, I thought the battery had died so I let it re-charge fully. The 2nd time happened after I knew that I had already charged it - I called customer support and they had me hold the power button down for 40 seconds and then eventually it came back on. I expressed my concerns that it was doing this after only 2 months of use and the girl's response was "yeah we have found this happens with this version" - I'm sorry, WTF? Since that time about a month ago, it has happened at least twice - the last time was today, after I had just used it 6 hours prior. I don't bother calling customer support or complaining to Amazon (although, maybe I will because if others are having the same issue, maybe they'll do something about it) because it seems like they don't care. To me, this is an issue, and I'm pretty sure that my device is still under warranty. I gave this 4 stars mainly because when it works, it works great - but this crashing thing is annoying. I'm glad that I have saved my old one - just in case my new one crashes completely and can't turn back on. I do not have many apps or even books downloaded - and no videos downloaded - I have the 16 mb, and there's no way that it's crashing because I have too many things on my device. Amazon - maybe you should look into this?

The durability is excellent. She is prone to falls and drops things just like any other 4 year old does. I have witnessed this thing take 2 good drops to a hard ground with no negative effects. The sound is also great. The only thing I can complain about right now is that I have not figured a way out to stream to my chrome cast with the device. I suppose it is because Google is the competition and they won't allow a chrome cast download for an app this is really my only reasoning for 4 stars instead of 5.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Great tablet but this is about the problems.
review_body:
You can read about the good stuff elsewhere. It's great tablet, but I have one OS design issue and a tech completities to discuss.

I will say, before I get into the problems; The speakers are really amazing. I was able to share a youtube video with everyone around a 8' long table and everyone could here.

The Kindle Fire Gen1 did everything I wanted it to until the battery died. Replacing it was the best option. The HUGE issue is a security issue. You can set a strong password on the Gen1. The HD 7uses a 4 digit numeric lock... completely lame. Security is supposed to get better over time, not worse. When I talked to Amazon to see if there why this was the case, it turns out that they had to deal with too many people who forgot their passwords. Reducing helpdesk calls really isn't a good justification for reducing security.

I was able to save my data before the Gen1 to my computer's hard drive. But had huge problems getting HD 7 to communicate via the USB cable with my computer, and I do not envy anyone without professional computer technician abilites figuring the computer doesn't automatically detect the unit. Once I got this problem solved, moving the data over was very cool... with caveats.

Books:

The Kindle really wants you to push all your data out to the cloud (aka centralized server storage). It's the default. There's this little setting thing. If you moved over the entire contents of your books directory from your old device to your new device using a cable, the new Kindle will remember where you were in all your books, but when it pushes your books out to cloud storage your bookmarks are lost. If your wi-fi is turned on, the default location from which the tablet will be the cloud... so if your just reading turn off yoru wi-fi.

Photos

The Gen1 didn't have a photo browser so I had to use a third part photo viewing app. It was pretty cool, because you could organize your photos intofolders. Maybe Great Aunt Milly wants to see the wedding photos, but you're not too keen on her checking out the bachelor/bachelorette party photos, this worked pretty well. The HD 7 has a photo view standard, but it organizes by date, even if you move photos over from a device and create subfolders in the Photos directory. I haven't looked too much into this to see if this setting can be changed, but unless you're careful poor Milly's going to see way more than you want her too using the default settings.

review_headline: Great tablet for a great price!
review_body: I've been using the Fire HD for 2 weeks now and I just love it. It is everything I was looking for in a small tablet and then some! Easy to navigate and the display is incredibly crisp and clear. The Kindle is just not for reading anymore! I am totally impressed with it and the price for it just can't be beat for such a quality product. Thanks Amazon!

I had first generation kindle fire and loved it, so this fourth gen. is upgrade.  The screen is just slightly larger and this makes a big diff believe it or not. It's lighter and batrtery seems to last as long.  However, I am a little confused that it does not recognize renamed (es file browser) mp3s in the music section.  And also the users guide stated under settings that equalizer controls would be available.  I cannot locate the equalizer controls.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Not just for young people.  I'm old and I love it!!
review_body:
I have had my Kindle now for a week. I ordered the 16 GB version. I love it. My eye sight is failing and I needed this to use audio books. I love that I can change the font size and paper like background as well as the lighting. My only complaint is it did not come with an instruction book. I'm sure my children and grandson would have no trouble navigating through it but I'm not tech savvy with this contraption. (I still have a flip phone so there ya go.) It probably does more than I think and will eventually figure it out. Not really a big deal since I bought it just for audio books. I watched a few videos and that helped. The support feature is great! It's right there on the screen and available 24-7. The speakers give a nice quality sound and it has a port for headphones. I haven't tried the cameras yet but will eventually.

I'm so glad I finally decided to buy this. It's so nice to be able to "read" again. Love the "first month" freebies. I already have Amazon Prime and I love the free Kindle benefits it gives me. So many books to choose from. Free games, books, music and apps. I also purchased a protective Kindle case and Kindle face protector. Also quality buys. I highly recommend this Kindle. What a wonderful thing to be able to read again!!

Discovered there is a a User Guide available for help. Good to know.

review_body: Hi, I like my Kindle. I need some coaching. I am not from the generation of computers. I got it because I wanted to take pictures. read books, read my e-mail, facebook, and Wikipedia, mostly. I am happy with it. I get friends and our computer tech to help me.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: These kindles are AMAZING!  These are rugged little cases, even without purchasing an additional protection case.  I found out the hard way that these kindles have great features that I didn't even see advertised.  My son lost his kindle and my husband couldn't find it anywhere.  These kindles have a "find my kindle" feature through my amazon account where it can be tracked if you have the location based services turned on.  (I did not since this was for my child) but it also has an alarm feature.  You can turn on a remote alarm via your amazon account so that the kindle can be tracked down! WONDERFUL when you have children taking off with the kindle!  The kindle itself is a great little product that works beautifully for kids games, browsing the internet and reading books. Everything I need it for!

I am not overly fond of the web browser, and I have downloaded a few games that caused the whole thing to lock up - not sure what that was about, but since I wasn't married to any of those games, I just deleted them. Battery life is ok - I use my kindle a lot, so I run it down more often. All in all, not a perfect product (do they make such a thing?), but one that I am very happy with.

review_headline: I loved my Fire HD until it stopped working only 45 ...

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Great for all your eBooks and checking your emails!
review_body:
I absolutely love my Kindle Fire HD. I upgraded to the 7-inch screen because I wanted a bigger screen. I love how I can watch most YouTube videos on it and I can check my emails easily. It even gives me notices when I have a new email that I have not seen yet. Of course, the Kindle Fire is really meant for eBooks and I love that too. I have many eBooks that I have read on this Kindle. I like that it remembers where you left off and I can bookmark many different pages that I might want to return to later. This is especially helpful for cookbooks.

Now when I wake up in the morning and I want to check my emails, I don't have to go over to the computer. I can just grab this open it up and click on my emails, which I do every day. I love the convenience of just sitting on the couch doing stuff that I normally would have to do at my desk. If I plan to type a reply in an email than I will go to my desk because it has a keyboard and that?? a lot easier if you??e doing a lot of typing. There is actually a lot more you can do with this Kindle than I thought there would be. I am still discovering new stuff. Anyways, I am very excited to have this Kindle and I would definitely recommend it if you??e looking for any kind of e-reader.

review_body: I have been a fan of the Kindle Fire for a few years now.  This updated and affordable version got better with the rear facing camera for pictures and video.  Only offered with 8gs of memory though.  I'm still trying to figure out a way to purchase Google apps for it.  New interface is a little different from past versions. product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I love my new Kindle Fire HD 7"
review_body:
I love my new Kindle Fire HD 7"! This is my third Kindle in 6 years and they just keep getting better and better. To be fair the Kindle Fire is more of a tablet than an E-reader so you really can't compare. My last Kindle was the Kindle Paper White which is incredible as an E-reader. The screen on the Fire HD is extremely clear and crisp. The sound is also very good. I've watched a few movies on it already and couldn't be happier. The only issue I have is that you get a fair amount of glare when watching a movie in a well lit room or if you have direct sunlight. I've found this same problem on any tablet really so no surprise there.

What sets this apart from other E-readers is that if what you're reading has pictures they are quite clear. f you use it for web browsing it is very responsive and easy to maneuver.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I was quite satisfied with the original
review_body:
I owned an original Kindle Fire. I was quite satisfied with the original, but time did take it's toll. I ordered the HD7 an am impressed with it's improved operating speed, clear display and very nicely loud speakers. Volume controls are a nice touch, along with blue tooth, cameras and the new improved navigating menu screen. It is easy to set up and use and quite enjoyable to use. I plan on purchasing a key board for the HD7. One limitation, as was in the original kindle, is the micro-usb power plug. I think this set up could be improved. Of all electronics I have owned, the plug is the weakest link. I'd also like to see a SD slot for transfer of files, extended memory etc. I often go where there is no wi-fi and would like that addition.
The HD7 is a very good tablet for its price.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
In short, I love it. It's easy to set up and use; the graphics are clear; and it's very responsive to touch. I also purchased a detachable keyboard and case (by Bear Motion) for it as I find on screen keyboards difficult to use. With the detachable keyboard, the Fire replaces my laptop.

The camera isn't all that great. Pictures turn out very grainy. However this doesn't impact my overall rating as it's not an important feature for me.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
3 Strikes you're out Amazon! Sorry. I want to love this new version of the Kindle Fire but I absolutely cannot. I have the first version of Kindle Fire and loved it. It however, after 2 years is starting to die even with 50% battery life still on the charge. So my husband bought me this new one. The battery life was so bad, I returned the first one thinking it was a lemon. The second one arrived, same thing but with added speaker issues. Now I have the 3rd replacement and it just died after 3 hours!!!!! AMAZON I EXPECT WAY MORE FROM YOU!

In this day and age a 3 hour batter life is not even good enough for our phones, let alone a tablet. I was planning on using this on my upcoming trip with my toddler. The problem is, the Kindle won't even last long enough for the flight, let alone airport waiting time. Besides the battery life, the speakers are TERRIBLE! I almost have to have the volume all the way up just to understand what is being said.

Another glitch that I cannot live with is, the notifications while watching a movie. If I am on Netflix and a notification comes in, the volume automatically adjusts WAY down and does NOT go back up. You have to exit out of Netflix completely then go back in for it to be fixed. How many notifications do you get in any give 2 hours? Watch a movie on the new Kindle and you will notice how many.

Amazon, it seems like you had a hit with the Kindle Fire and in your haste to make a quick dime, you sacrificed quality to satisfy the masses. It's too bad that is going to drive away any business you could have received from very satisfied customers. You MIGHT be able to win me back with a quality product down the road, but I don't know what would make me try your Kindles again.

review_headline: Although the tablet itself is fine we choose the 8 GB thinking all the boys ...
review_body: We got these in Dec 2015 for both our sons to finally have their own. Although the tablet itself is fine we choose the 8 GB thinking all the boys want it for is apps. Well... they are unable to have anymore then about 4 game apps on tablet or wifi shuts off and say storage critically low!!! This happens all the time!!!! The cannot have any pictures or videos at all because storage will be critically low with the any games on it and then shut downs wifi!!! I think that is the most ridiculous feature for wifi to be locked off when storage it low. My cell phone is 8GB and I have more games and apps then this tablet!! So unhappy and think it was a big waste of our money!!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I purchased this Kindle Fire 7 HD for my wife and she loves it! She is 49 years old and this is her first touch screen device ever (she's still using an antiquated flip phone that we'll be upgrading shortly). The audio and video quality is amazing. For folks not used to touch screen devices, there is definitely a learning curve. For those of you who are familiar, you will have no problem with this software. I purchased this with the understanding that this would be able to mirror the tablet to my LCD TV. I should have researched that feature further because the list of compatible devices is remarkably small. Unfortunately nothing i already own is compatible. That was a let down for sure. The other let down after the fact was the limited storage space on the device itself. The default 8 GB would have been fine if the OS didn't occupy about half of it. Especially since there are no slots for expandable storage cards. The unlimited on line cloud storage is fantastic, but we are constantly removing older items and apps in order to make room for new items and apps. At the time I ordered this, the 16 GB model was out of stock and had a min. 30 day time line before I would receive it. So basically I settled for 8 GB and am having to deal with it. All in all it is a great little tablet and my wife is happy. She can play her games, quickly browse on line, and have quick and easy access to her Facebook account. For $130 +/- what more could I ask for?

It loads quickly, the screen is very clear. My magazines, books and news papers appears brighter and record legoble. I also use it for my homework and it works fine.

It handles multiple platforms very well and no stalling with multiple browsers being open at the same time
Front and rear cameras are great and the best part...it fits perfectly in my handbag. See love all the FIRE products my husband bought the 6 for our son, and he is now using the larger one.

Do not hesitate to make your purchase you won,t be disappointed.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Great upgrade from the 1st gen Fire
review_body:
I just upgraded from the first gen Fire to the Fire 7HD. While I was expecting it to be a bit bigger, the Fire 7 addressed most of my wishlist for the old Fire: External volume control- BIG check, Bluetooth-check. Camera- check Bonus-front and rear camera. It packs a BIG bang compared dollar for dollar to my friends iPad. It's big enough to read some Architectural drawings on the go (hence 4 stars, I thought would be an inch or so bigger) with ease. And now with the BeyonPod app I can play all the podcasts I used to keep my ancient gen 2 iPhone for.
I read reviews of the back feeling cheap, but it doesn't seem as such. It's slightly lighter than the gen 1, but I don't convey that as cheap in the slightest.

review_headline: The Only Tablet You Should Buy!
review_body:
I am in love with my kindle. First thing I loved was how fast it shipped, I bought it thursday evening and I kid you not, it got here the very next day! My favorite thing about it is the battery life because I can use it ALL DAY non-stop and it won't die on me. I got the 8GB one and I regret it because it only has about 5GB, with the system information taking a huge chunk out of the memory.
Also when I saw the commercial where the kindle falls from the top of a car with no damage, I didn't buy it but I have a very clumsy boyfriend whose dropped it a lot already and it works perfectly.
Overall I highly recommend it but be sure to spend a little more for a higher GB kindle, it'll be better in the long run.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Can I have my 2012 version back?
review_body:
I have been truly disappointed in this Kindle. I purchased the Kindle Fire HD 2012 and loved it! The only reason I bought a new one was so that I could leave 1 at home with my 4 year old to play when going to the doctor's office or other appointments. Now I want to give him the new one so that I can use my old one!
The new Fire (HD 2014) has been a disappointment. The WiFi is an extra step to turn it on and off - and I don't leave it on since I am often where I don't have an accessible WiFi signal and it drains the battery so much faster. I have several apps on both Kindles - and they perform so much worse on the new 2014 version - from the alarm clock either waking up 5 minutes late or not at all and the games freezing and a hard shutdown required to use my Kindle again. I also do not like the favorites set up compared to the old version - it's like they were pre-loaded by what they think my favorites are, rather than what I want in there.
The only benefit I see to the new Kindle - I now can take pictures facing me versus only selfies. I am very disappointed - I want my old one back!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
The Kindle Fire is perfect for all different kinds of users. There are an abundant amount of apps designed for children on the amazon app store. These apps range from educational to simple games to occupy time on long car rides. The Kindle Fire has an advanced parental control center so parents can limit the ways their child is able to interact with their tablet. The parental control center can limit the time the kindle is used, it can block any option for a child to buy things online or through games, and it can block content that is deemed inappropriate by the parents. Anyone who likes reading would also be interested in purchasing the Kindle tablet. It has access to the amazon bookstore so books can be downloaded directly to the tablet. People who are avid shoppers would also be happy to know that the amazon tablet comes with access to the amazon store built in. Frequently there are deals posted on the store only available to Kindle users. I am an avid reader and a student; this tablet was perfect for me because I had an entire library at my fingertips and I could find electronic copies of my textbooks at reduced prices. The kindle also allowed me to download the Adobe app so I could sort and view my reading assignments that were in pdf format.
The most prominent features on the Kindle Fire are the vivid 7??display, the sleek button-less appearance, and the Dolby Dual Stereo speakers. The kindle?? size is perfect for holding with two hands. It isn?? so large that it feels like a laptop and it isn?? so small that it feels like a smartphone. The buttons for the kindle are on the back side and they are slightly indented into the back of the tablet. The button placement lends to your hands being placed in an area that amplifies the sound from the speakers directly to your ears. Even if the tablet is placed on a flat surface, the Dolby Dual Stereo sound is surprisingly loud for such a small device.
The main benefits of the Fire are the access to amazon cloud, amazon prime, and the relatively low price. The amazon cloud lets the user access their purchased material from any device with an internet connection. Amazon offers a service called amazon prime that offers discounts on all products and access to unlimited television and movie streaming. The Kindle Fire 7??is available brand new on amazon for $139. This is much cheaper than comparable tablets. The only negative side to the Kindle is the eight hour battery life and limited access to android app store. Compared to other e-readers, the kindle?? eight hour battery life is low. This is because the kindle fire has a much more powerful and graphics intensive screen. Other e-readers use screens that use e-ink. This uses next to no power so they can have batteries that last for days of use.
Overall I would recommend the Kindle Fire HD 7??tablet. It can be a great tool for many types of people; students, children and professionals can gain something from what the kindle fire offers. The kindle can be used to play children?? games or a graphics heavy online game, read books for school or pleasure, and has many productivity apps that can help the student or professional.

review_headline: A great buy, and well worth the money.
review_body: I received my Fire as a Christmas gift, and have enjoyed using it ever since.  It is very efficient on battery life, only having charged it three times since December, and this is mid March.  It is smooth to operate, had loads of extras, and a very clear screen with good definition.  I highly recommend the Kindle Fire for anyone wanting to graduate from the basic E-reader or replacing an aged one, especially if you don't wish to shell out more money for an Apple tablet.  I find everything I need on this one, and love the idea of one click shopping on Amazon.  The one small thing I wish they would have done is put in the 3G cellular access my first Kindle had.  I loved that ability to go anywhere, and not need WI-FI to link up.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: almost to the day and my daughter hasn't even used it every day so I was very disappointed when the wifi completely stopped work
review_body:
So far we have only had this item one month, almost to the day and my daughter hasn't even used it every day so I was very disappointed when the wifi completely stopped working on it. We tried multiple soft and hard resets and even went so far as to do a factory default reset and wipe the unit but it would not connect back to the wifi. The problem was with the unit, as our other devices were connected and still working just fine. Customer service was prompt and agreed to send a new one and have me send the old unit back. But this is frustrating to have had the unit such a short amount of time before having to send it back. It was in excellent shape with both a screen protector (which is now useless as it can't be reapplied) and a child proof case on it.

The tablet seems alright otherwise, when it was working. The Amazon free time allows her to download a lot of child friendly materials including games, books and tv shows. I do hate the ads that appear on the screen when you first turn on the machine. There is the option to pay to not have these appear and I think that is an absurd rip off to have to pay even more money to keep my child from seeing ads for romance novels. I assume it shows the romance novels since the kindle is registered to my account and I have purchased them in the past for myself. But to have a bodice heaving chick appear on the screen of your 7 year olds device is disturbing. I think they should just remove the ads altogether because I guarantee I won't buy a single item that appears on it, if anything just out of spite for being inundated with the ads.

She has the Amazon e-book subscription and loves her Kindle, so no regrets.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I wrote a positive review on my Kindle Fire HD shortly after I purchased it.  Today, I wish to retract the positive review.  The kindle worked fine right up to the point when it stopped working.  The first one stopped while still in warranty so Amazon sent a replacement. The replacement worked right up until two weeks after the warranty expired then it stopped.  This time catastrophically.  It won't turn on, it won't take a charge and after spending an hour with the technical support folks and having tried every trick in their book, they concluded that it should be replaced.  Then they discovered that it was two weeks past warranty. So tough luck. Amazon offered to sell me a new one.  I consider myself reasonably smart - two advanced degrees - so I was amazed that Amazon would expect me to buy yet another poorly manufactured product from them. I initially thought the Kindle was a good buy but if it has only a one year life, you are better off buying a higher priced, better quality device.  My advice - don't buy a kindle.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I have always liked,the kindle as a media device.  The processor  on this model is better than the original fire, so it's fairly decent as a web browser.  That said, I still have an iPad for serious web use and printing but I find i reach for this much more often.  The main reason I wanted this fire is the sound.  There simply is no tablet on the market where you can do dishes, clank around the kitchen, and watch a video without headphones.  However, the 8 gig is a little short on memory.  With just Facebook installed, I have only 2.5 gig left for downloading.  For twenty more dollars, I'd get the 16 gig, especially if this is your  only tablet.  I also am a bit disappointed that the text to read option has gone away.  Listening to articles on the web was something I liked to do while working that I cant do here.  I can on my ipad.  Yes, understandably, I know they  want to sell audio books, but what about the sight impaired and why not have it available for web pages?  That's a personal perk for me but if you don't care about that,  read on.  It's a very user friendly tablet.  Grandma will get it.  The keyboard is easy to use.  It's small enough to hold in one hand, though a tad heavy compared,to an iPad.  Still with my small hands, I find it easier to hold than my iPad mini. A grippy back would be nice.  I'm not a case fan but there's no way you're  going to use this without, so get a light one.  The roocase I review is perfect.  Durability:  seems these guys don't quite measure up to Apple.  Mom had an hdx die just short of a year and she treats it with kid gloves.  Luckily it was just short of the warranty expiration  and got replaced.  Keep in mind Apple is just 30 or 90 days (forget which) and Apple care is insanely high priced.  That said, my ipad mini is in its third year of heavy use and still going strong.  I just can't hear it at a distance and  it's still too big to hold in one hand.  Also mega pricey.  For under 200 dollars this is a nice tablet, especially for prime members.  Amazon's customer service is  impeccable. I have never had the problems others complain about in all the years I've been dealing with them.ally for prime members.  Amazon's customer service is  impeccable. I have never had the problems others complain about in all the years I've been dealing with them.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: It has been my experience that the help line is filled with very nice people who don't always know the answer
review_body: A very powerful tablet.  There are features that require a call to customer service to enable.  I suppose there is a reason why not everything is activated.  But if you have any difficulty with an app that is sold (even free) on Amazon Prime, call them to help you thru making it work.  It has been my experience that the help line is filled with very nice people who don't always know the answer, but send you to someone who does know.  So be patient and just keep asking.  I purchased mine without the ad blocker.  So at first I hated the thing after having the first version of the kindle fire for years.  I called and (for a fee) I could pay to have them remove the ads.  It is well worth it, however, It doesn't stop all the ads.  When playing a game, you have to turn off your internet (wifi) access in order to truly play ad free.  I also miss the simplicity of the first version of kindle fire screen.  This one is a bit annoying in that all the apps are in the lower screen all the time.  I haven't found any way to sort them efficiently.  Also, It is too complicated for my elderly parents to manage because there is too much on the screen at one time.  I do like it.  I use it all the time.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Great product that could get even better
review_body:
BLUF: Great product that would be greatly improved with a more robust app store and a larger library of available media for video and music.Definitely get something to protect it from damage if you have children.

Great product; I really wish that they had used a modified version of Android software as this would have helped the appstore out tremendously (currently lacking). It's mostly intuitive to use, but could use some upgrades.

I bought this for two reasons:
1: I have a young daughter who might like this on long car trips
2: I'm trying to convince my wife to get rid of the $99.97 cable (just cable; not internet) bill that we get every month

Results:
1: My daughter loves it; she is currently 6 months old. Yes, she sits in a rear-facing car seat, but we used one of her headbands to secure the Fire to the rear seat headrest that is above her car seat. She doesn't mind that there is a headband through the middle of the screen. She is absolutely enamored with it; we hear nothing but small "coos" from her (unless she's hungry or she has delivered a huge "present" for us") as she watches "Despicable Me" over and over. I haven't figured out how to play a video on repeat so when it's over my wife leans and reaches over from the passenger seat to re-start the video.

2. We have an older TV: 2007 Plasma (Pioneer if you're wondering). It still has a great picture, yadda yadda. It does not have a plug-in for USB power so I have to run a charger from the wall to the HDMI adapter to the TV. First world problems, I know. The picture is great and the sound is fine when running from Amazon Prime programs. The problem is that my wife can't do without her f****ing housewife programs which are not offered by Amazon Prime nor any other service that I know of (Hulu, Netflix, etc).

Conclusion: This is a great product that is somewhat lacking in the apps department. It has good battery life, good picture, decent durability, and a wide range of uses. It does not get 5 stars because it needs a more robust app store and because the Amazon Library is lacking in some areas.

review_body: So far so good...I wanted a tablet to stream movies on & mirror it on my big screen TV this tablet is pretty good at that (after you purchase a slim port adapter) I'm only giving the tablet 3stars because of a few things..first off you can not use any ringtones,notication tones,etc you can't change or add wallpaper & this isn't a good gaming tablet at all!! You can't get a lot of popular games (clash of clans ,boom beach) & the games I like to play (like uno) says its free but when I tried to load the app that says uno of kindle isn't compatible with my device?? My device is a 4th generation kindle fire HD 7" tablet. I noticed that the same uno app that cost .99 is available for my kindle lol...it's OK tablet if you don't mind giving up all that I have talked about & don't care that you are walking around with a full time commercial/ advertising tablet that you can't turn off

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Excellent product and a great upgrade from my old kindle 7! I was really happy to get my new kindle and tested many of the new features almost immediately. It is faster, stronger and more resilient than its predecessor, so I am glad I took the plunge. I mostly upgraded to have a front and back camera handy as I rarely take phone pics, always forget my phone, but always have my kindle. The interface takes a bit of getting used to from old kindle fire. Volume buttons on top and not on screen and you have to swipe from side not touch to get the side controlls. The camera is fairly good, not great but better than most in good light. I wish the 199 version had a rear and front camera, because I would have gotten it. Very bad move Amazon, because the higher upgrade was too pricey and had a lot of features I didn't need in a kindle so the only choice was the kindle 7. All in all great product and looking forward to years of use.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Great Kindle (5 stars), don't like the cover (2 stars)
review_body: While I love all the Kindle products and have had several Kindles thus necessitating a new cover each time, I do not particularly care for this new "oragami" cover.  I have trouble getting it in the proper position to serve as a book stand and when opening the Kindle I find it harder to open the cover due to the bend in the cover.  I love the my Kindle and am glad to have the keyboard to use with it.  However, it is a shame that the keyboard is not identical in size to the Kindle so they can be stored in one package for traveling.  I have suggested to Amazon that they give each new Kindle an easy identifying name instead of just using Fire HD7 as it makes it difficult to find a product to buy for the product when making a purchase.  I guess they don't like my suggestion as it has remained the same.  And without good descriptive wording I have found it difficult to find accessories for each of the 4 Kindles I have owned.  There is always some tweaking to be done with new products and this is the only complaint I have about a Kindle.  Otherwise, it is a fantastic product.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
No Disrespect to Amazon, but with this product they are almost yelling :WE ARE PEFECTLY FINE WITH INCOMPETENT AND MEDIOCRE PRODUCT"

Tablet performance:
I have two of these. The first gen and latest one. Thankfully both were gifted, so no money wasted..... First generation was horrible quality, touch was just ok, and crashes a lot while in app. Latest generation is slight better in touch but battery stinks compared to other major tablets.

Apps:
Missing major apps. Amazon needs to customize everything I guess (a major eye roll here). Leaving this more vanilla android would have been a better choice, than trying to push Amazon twist in every app down customer throats.

Customer support for kindle:
Absolutely down right atrocious. Alarmingly unfriendly and complete lack of professionalism.
People pick up your chat or phone inquiry in distant lands where they rotate you between 4-5 departments before you get sick of it and hang up.

I will never buy a Kindle or recommend it to anyone.

All they are good for is reading books or watching your own videos. Thats all.....

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: The space would be my only concern with this one.  If you're looking to download apps (more than a few) and do a lot (taking pictures, downloading books, etc.), then you'll want another with more space.  I love this tablet, though, as it is very light-weight (easy to carry), swift in response to touch, and it takes amazing pictures and video.  Watching movies and streaming videos from the internet (including Netflix) is superb.  I love the color and the manageability of the different profiles for the family.  I haven't experienced any drops or damage to the device, but I am looking to purchase an Otterbox-like case (haven't been able to find one directly from Otterbox designed for this tablet).  So far this device is delivering, and again, my next review will be based on how long it lasts before any major problems.

review_headline: Replacement not as good as original
review_body: My first Kindle Fire was stolen in a burglary.  It was 2 years old.  This replacement HD does have a better picture, and all (plus more) capabilities.... but it sometimes loses a link as it chances screens...and takes just a tiny bit longer to load graphics.....also, I can hear it working (inside mechanism)...the outer case doesn't feel as sturdy.  If I had my choice, I would trade for my original one back. II'm afraid this one won't last two years.  But 4 stars because it works.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
Pros:
Absolutely love it! Always wanted a tablet and for the price I thought that this would be the best choice to get me started. As a college student my main reason for getting it was to take it to class with me for ebooks and note taking, which works great for this. Games are a huge plus as well, they look great, and are responsive. Its fast for browsing the web as long as my internet cooperates. (its sluggish sometimes because there is over 7 devices on it at any given time) The screen is nice and clear, and the tablet is small enough to fit in your hand but still large enough where you can see everything. I love the color, and while many people complain about the plastic back, I kind of like it. Better that they save costs there and use plastic rather than cut performance or image quality and use a metal case. It feels solid enough to me as well, and has some weight behind it, its heavier than my moms 2012 HD 7 and comes with a lot more features.

Cons:
The only issues that I have with it thus far is the lack of apps in the Amazon App Store. You don't get the same apps as the Google Play Store, or Apples app store. For example the Amazon app store does not have Clash of Clans or Snapchat. They do offer alternatives though such as Snapgrab or Castle Clash. I just wish they offered a little more selection. They do offer a number of books though, so if you are into reading thats a plus. Another downside to this tablet is the camera quality. The rear facing camera has a 2MP camera, which is worse than nearly all smart phones today, and not much better than my basic phone that I had a while ago. Shooting video is okay at best, but taking pictures with the rear facing camera is just god awful. The pictures come out grainy and if the object you are taking a picture of has any sort of movement it comes out very blurry. The front facing camera is alright if you plan on using it a Skype call. Camera quality could deffinitely use an improvement, however the cameras do get better as you move higher up in the price range and begin looking at the HDX. The final issue is storage. I got the 8gb and that only leaves 4gb for the user. Which really limits you on what you can put on it. They do give you unlimited cloud storage, but some apps can take up a large amount of space, including ebooks.

Overall:
So the bottom line is that this tablet is great. If you can look past the camera then I would look into getting this tablet. Storage is not that great, but surprisingly I havent filled it up yet, and I have a number (about 13 or so) of games and apps installed right now, the largest being 1.26gb. It hasnt been slow or sluggish yet, and the screen is amazing to look at, all the webpages come in clear and crisp. The app store is a bit of a downside but you can enable the option to install third party apps from another market place if you would like.

review_body: I was happy to get a Kindle to read books and do a little Tablet surfing. It has worked great for a month until I let the battery completely die. Now it will not come back on, no matter how long I charge it or leave it plugged in and try to turn it on. My problem has no been customer service. It has taken me 5 people via phone,chat, and email to get a response. They are going to send me a replacement( thankfully i bought a warranty). But three days and 5 people is not what it should take. Hopefully the new one wont have the same issue.  Update #1 Checked the status of my order and apparently they are sending me a refurbished one. I do not agree with sending a customer something used when they paid for it new and it broke only 1 month later. Warranty should garnish me getting a brand new one.

review_headline: I am a Kindle fan--but was totally disappointed in the Kindle Fire HD7
review_body: I am a Kindle fan--but was totally disappointed in the Kindle Fire HD7.  I recently purchased three Kindle Fire HD7s to replace two Kindle Fire 8gb and one previous generation Kindle Fire HDX7.  I loved all of our old Kindles and never had an issue with them.  However, with the new Kindle Fire HD7s we found that the battery life to be horrible--4 hours or less (usually less).  Our previous Kindles had awesome battery life of 8 hours or more.  I was expecting the same quality or better from the new Kindle HD7s but the comparison wasn't even close.  Since Kindle really works for our kids, I sent the HD7s back and will be replacing them with the HDX7.
