product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I bought it to replace my 3rd generation Fire HD, which I recycled by gifting it to my adult son.  I continue to be amazed by the quality Amazon is able to put into these gadgets, and for so little money.  My original intent was to buy a second 3rd gen unit for my son, but when I learned the new model was available, I kept it for myself and gifted the older model.  I was wowed by the cameras, which I have yet to use.  I almost wish I had kept the 3rd gen unit for myself as i was so comfortable with it.  The cameras and the quad-core processor are the big changes, but they come with a price.  The new unit only has single band wifi, whereas the old one had dual-band.  So far, that has not inconvenienced me.  The old battery life is a bit better, than the new, but that has yet to inconvenience me as well.  I liked the older 3rd gen origami case better than the current model and I was more comfortable with the old on/off switch and micro-usb connection.  All small stuff.  The snappier quad-core processor is nice and I will become accustomed to the other stuff in time to bitch about the small changes that will come with the 5th gen HD.

The only songs I have on the device itself are songs I got from purchasing the albums via Amazon. I would prefer to have more songs on the device itself for when the wifi goes out. The battery drains a bit faster than I expected. Overall, I am very pleased with my new toy and I hope it lasts a long time.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Love my Kindle, but please, Amazon, help me with organizing and finding books!
review_body: I have had my Kindle Fire for just over one year.  I had held off buying a tablet because I really like books and the satisfaction of turning a page and physically interacting with the book.  However, my family gave this to me for a Christmas gift and I am really glad they did!    There is so much to like about my Kindle Fire HD, 16 GB.  While I primarily use it for reading, I must admit to being hooked on many games and apps, many of which I got free through the Amazon Store.  I like the easy backup to the cloud as I keep most of my games, apps and books on it and download when I am ready to read it.  Since I read to fall asleep, I had difficulty at first, being stimulated by the light, but now I turn the brightness down to its lowest point and often fall asleep with it.  Luckily it turns off by itself.    I also want to thank you for the design of the USB connector.  I sometimes forget I have it plugged in and accidentally yank on the cord when moving the device and no matter how many times I have done this, the USB port is still securely fastened and not loose.  I can't tell you how many laptops I have had to have serviced or replaced because the power connection loosens over time.    The main reason I am leaving a review is that I want Amazon to improve some things so that when I buy the next generation it fulfills my needs even better.  So while these may be viewed as criticisms, they are really a request for improvements.    Management of Books  I am a prolific reader.  Sometimes I am in the mood for a literary, mystery, romance, or a cookbook, however, Kindle has no way of organizing books by genre, only by title, author or date purchased.  With well over a hundred books in my library, this can take forever to find the book I would like to read at the time of reading.  Also, sometimes, I'd like a novella due to time constraints so I'd like to know how many pages as well.  The only way to do this is to go back to the Store to get this information and I can't scroll the library and the store at the same time.    Secondly, I'd like to delete a book right after I read it without having to go the Manage My Kindle App.  As it is, every week or two I go to the Manage the Kindle App to delete all books I have read and this can take a long time.  Its especially frustrating when the alpha order in Manage My Kindle does not match the Alpha order on my Kindle, so I have resorted to typing each book in manually, making the process even longer.  Sometimes its an issue with the word THE at the beginning of the Title, but sometimes the title doesn't match and I have to go searching by author instead.    Thirdly, the scrolling function is not there for games.  There is one for Apps and Books but not for games. I surprised myself with how many games I have on my Kindle with many downloaded for my nephew when he comes to visit.    I really like the Favorites section in which I can add a book that I want to read and/or purchase in the future.  I would Amazon to expand on this and add Favorite Authors and not just Titles.  So often, I read a Kindle Book that I like and want to read more by the author.  While I could go in and add each of the author's books individually this is time consuming especially if the author is prolific.  Even worse, if the author comes out with a new book, it won't be on my list.    Like others, I don't like the delay between when apps and games are published for Android and for when I want to get them on my Kindle.  There are some great Android apps that I would like to have on my Kindle but can't download to it from a non-Amazon store.  Likewise I have some compatibility issues even after they have been received from the Amazon store.    Overall, I love my Kindle Fire, but with the aforementioned features and a couple other tweaks (not mentioned) I would be even happier.  to be honest, a more robust way of organizing and deleting novels would have me jumping quickly to upgrade to the next version.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: This is great. Already have the Fire HD 8", so I don't have to learn how to use this one.  The camera is nice because it works without needing to be in a WiFi area.  Wanted a smaller size for reading outside or upstairs. This is great for that and everything else.  My only gripe? There needs to be a little more hand-holding area around this and the other smaller tablets and e-readers. As soon as your finger barely touches the screen, something happens to change what you were doing.  Would loved to have been able to afford the extra money for the added 3g service.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Really enjoying all the great features of my Fire HD 7. I'm reading books, taking photos and videos, playing free-download games, getting and sending email, browsing the web, etc.  It's my first tablet, so I was concerned about not having a keyboard, but the Fire guesses the words I'm typing quickly and fairly accurately. I've even experimented with just speaking my message and it worked better at speech recognition than any other such program or app that I've tried. It might even teach ME to better enunciate my words.  Picture definition is great and I like having my photos and videos automatically added into Amazon Cloud. Only photography problem I've run into is taking pictures outside, where the glare on the screen made it hard to see if my subject was centered properly - even made it hard to see the icons for taking the picture or turning video recording on and off.  Thanks to the family ebook sharing feature, I started out with a great collection of books (already bought by my husband for his Kindle) for me to read. It was simple to set up my reading options and I've learned how to sort the books into collections.  I'm sure there are many features and options that I haven't yet explored. There's always a learning curve with any new tech, but so far this has been easy.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Works great - very easy to use, but destroyed by constant Amazon advertising!!
review_body:
The Fire tablet works very well. It pretty much does everything that an iPad will do, at a fraction of the cost. I purchased two of them (one for my wife and one for myself). The battery life is very good, wifi connection is very easy, good signal, amazing camera, great various other features.

Now, for the bad part. There is no background option, unlike all other electronic devices. NO, you cannot have a picture of your dog, wife, or loved one as your background. Here's why: each time you return from any period of inactivity, there is a big stupid ad for one of the absurd games that Amazon is constantly peddling. These games actually start out free, but then cost as much as 99 Cents per level. I don't play games on my Fire, so this is a big problem for me. I don't want games -- and I don't want ads for games.

Next, you will find that Google Play and the Android market place are unavailable, because Amazon wants you to only buy the items that they are peddling. Another BIG PROBLEM. I've researched and found that high-tech users can go through various hoops to 'ROOT AND INSTALL" the other market places and apps. This is something that should not be required. Amazon did not tell me that the Fire would be able to only install Amazon products.

If I had it to do over again - - AND I DON'T! -- I would just buy Samsung Tablets.
I give Amazon an A- for the performance of the Fire, but an F for all the bogus ads

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I bought this as a gift for a totally non-tech elderly (87 year old) family member.  I preloaded it with games and books, and she loves it.  It is so easy to navigate.  The 7" screen is large enough to easily play the games.  The range of games from very easy to more challenging is terrific.  The auto off and on when closing and opening the cover is a great battery saver for those who might forget to shut off their Kindle.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I'm not as happy with this Kindle as with the prior version of the Kindle Fire. I don't know what is up with the software updates, but they are definitely of the scorched-earth, take-no-prisoners variety. In the first three months of ownership, it received three major software updates that erased absolutely everything on the devise -- specialized dictionary entries, websites, ALL passwords, histories, games and progress of games, notes and downloaded books and music. While it is surely a first-world problem to have to go back and reenter everything on my tablet, it is also annoying. Most importantly, I would have preferred to have an "update now?" warning. There is something that is just not as intuitive as prior versions. I'm not recommending this one as enthusiastically as I did prior versions.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: LOVE these kindles! We didn't care what color we purchased for our girls (6 and 4) because we knew we were going to put solid waterproof/drop-proof cases on them (Poetic Fires) so the color didn't matter. The yellow isn't my fave but with the cases on, you have no clue what color it is anyway! We didn't want to buy them the Kids' Version Kindles b/c they're limited to what can be downloaded and such. Instead, we purchased 2 of these and added child profiles to them. This way, I can use the Kindle whenever they aren't using them and download things in the admin profile for myself (that might be inappropriate for them) and password protect the admin profile. They have passwords for their profiles, as well, to lockout intruders from using the Kindle. All-in-all, these are fabulous. You can set turn-off times, reading limits, and so on. There are always unlimited FREE app downloads on Amazon available, much of which are their faves anyway; i.e. Doc McStuffins, ABCMouse, Starfall and so on. We're so thankful for these Kindles and would certainly recommend them to parents who are tired of sharing their smart devices with their kiddos! A great app-capable product suitable for children that DOESN'T bust your budget like an iPad :)

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I am definitely "Old School" and not of the tech generation.  My first Kindle was the first generation e-reader. It was simple to use and I loved being able to carry my library with me.  I finally became brave enough to upgrade to the Kindle Fire, 2nd generation which I absolutely loved!! The only reason I bought a new Kindle Fire was because I accidently left mine on top of the car...AAHH!!! I originally bought the 6" Kindle Fire HD  to replace it and HATED it; there were glitches in the software which meant it took several tries to go from one website to another. Needless to say, that Kindle was returned.  I decided upgrade to the 16GB and 7" display which turned out to be a very wise decision...LOVE this Kindle! I especially like the fact that the new Kindle has descriptions for each book, unlike my first Kindle Fire.  However when the opening screen shows a product for which I would like information, it takes forever to access the next screen...in fact my patience usually wears out before the next screen appears. A little "Shout Out" to the wonderful people of South Georgia...the individual who found my old Kindle Fire went through quite a bit a detective work and returned it to me about two weeks later.  Several months later...is it me or does Silk really mean Suck?? Trying to navigate the Web has been one giant headache. SLOW....I get thrown out of websites or "tab has stopped working". I refresh and it last for a few seconds. This is first time I have ever changed a review...I don't know what Amazon has done to Kindle, but I am not a happy camper.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
Initially we were skeptical of the tablet scene with all the typical questions and comments. "I could just use my laptop for browsing or online shopping", or "I could use my phone for quick references or take out orders". After purchasing our first Kindle Fire 3 years ago we became instant fans and eventually added 2 more to the house due to high demand, from the kids (wink wink). I found myself using the Kindle everyday for tasks that I had used my phone for in the past such as for a portable Netflix/YoutTube viewer when doing dishes or house chores and quick general browsing for recipes, etc. We also found that we use the Kindle the most when traveling for entertaining the children in the car or hotel room and as a reference when looking or booking places to eat or visit.

Comparatively, the Kindle Fire stacks up very well to the competition. We all know iPads are nice but not everyone wants to spend $300 on a tablet that gets carried around a lot and used often by the kids. Additionally, I really like the 7" screen as it is plenty big for general use without being so bulky that you cant bring it wherever you would need it.

Pros:
-Great overall quality and finish to the product
-Intuitive interface that is sure to be a breeze to learn
-Size
-Price
-Accessories

Cons:
-You have to pay to remove advertisements
-Variation between generations requires new cases (but not power cords which is very nice)

In conclusion, if you are looking for a great tablet for the entire family, look no further. I have no problem endorsing this product (which I shouldn't considering we have 3 in the house now) and fully believe that you will love it too.

review_headline: Love love my kindle but why I didn't give 5 stars!
review_body:
I am an iPhone user and former iPad user. I really enjoy my kindle being a first time user. It does most of everything I use to do on my iPad. There are some apps that the Apple store has that I wished amazon had but I know in time that will probably happen. All the features of the kindle are great and it was super easy to transfer pictures and music from iTunes.

The only problem I have is...being able to use my husband's amazon prime on my kindle for music and videos. I contacted customer support about this issue and they informed me that he can transfer the shipping benefits of prime to me but not music and videos on my kindle.

Anyways, I don't regret getting a kindle and look forward using it for a long time!

You guys missed on this one.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: much, much better choice than the kids version
review_body: Better than the kids version, good enough for a basic everyday tablet for sure. I do want to say that we've only had this a few weeks so my opinion could change over time but I think barring a.anything major my star rating wood remain the same. I originally purchased my 3 yr old the 6" 8gb kids fire and it was truly awful (no memory, slow processing) but returned for the adult version in a larger screen size and with more memory for apps, movies and pics. The extra inch of viewing space makes it more useable and he hasn't used up all the memory in a wk like he did with the other version. He finds this mostly easier to navigate than my iPad but it took him about a week to get used to it and sometimes still steals my iPad from me. I find this to be useful for using the internet and watching movies, probably playing games if I did that (when my son takes my iPad) but the small screen still frustrates me even at 7" when trying to do any serious shopping since you can barely view one item on the pg tho the small size makes it easy to carry about with you during the day. This version moves fast enough for basic purposes, screen resolution is decent and so is the camera. I will say that it doesn't hold a charge very well, it seriously sucks up energy (it's gone from 84% charge during the time that I've written this to 60%). 3 hours tops if watching movies straight thru so I don't know if mine is just lemon but I'm not going to hold it against them too much since I can ways get one of those lil portable chargers and I don't imagine it's made to hold a longer charge. I love Amazon, they as a general rule make my life easier and I'm inclined to purchase their products over others because of that but I don't love these fires (i do like them tho). I had two of the earlier fire versions along with the original Kindle reader ones and liked them quite a bit but that was before I had an iPad. I think for the price you get a solid, useable tablet and it'll work best for people who aren't sophisticated with tech, children for whom one doesn't want to shell out hundreds more or as a cheapie tablet for traveling or running about. I can't imagine getting any serious work done on this thing due to the size even tho 16 gb is decent enough memory, it's lack of charge time and it's generally a lil slower than nicer tablets. I love that it's so easy to purchase anything, the separation of family members ( or that my husband and my credit card info can be stored jointly) and that the parental controls are so customizable and that I can prevent my child from not only doing certain activities but also control exactly when and how his time is used. I haven't been an Amazon Prime member since they last raised the price but I would assume that works great in addition to this tablet. Let's face it, a Kindle Fire is essentially a giant Amazon store which is great for anyone who uses Amazon a lot, it makes everything easy. I've been using Amazon since the early 2000's as a college student, thru my early career and now as a sahm in my mid-30's so I've built up a huge collection of books, music, games and movies in cloud that now my son can access as they become appropriate to his age (I doubt he's gonna be reading Proust any time soon but he enjoys my puzzles) but this essentially gives him a decent sized library to choose from as he grows and I've been able to add age appropriate materials to the selection for now. This along with the ease of use and purchasing power makes me inclined to continue with Fires for him as he gets older and I think for most kids these tablets would be acceptable up until college provided they had a secondary device for homework. Let's face it, for the price tag you can't really beat this model but as someone whose used fancier tablets it doesn't quite compare. Now I haven't tried the next step up on the fires given that for the price one can get an iPad mini and I do think for most people if Amazon wants to capture the market they need to consider why anyone would buy a fire for $300 or more when they can get something faster, sleeker and more useful for a similar pricetag elsewhere but if the tech improves and the price adjusts then the next step up of fires might be a better choice for school age children but this one will do for now. I'm so relieved that this product turned out so well after the last disappointment with the kids fire and some other minor Amazon frustrations, I don't know what I would do without Amazon in my families life lol. Fyi, the advertisements are barely noticeable so I couldn't imagine paying for one without, they just run on the screen when it's locked, not during active use. Oh but I find the keyboard kind of awkward, the way it's laid out and moves doesn't work well for my small hands but that could just be me. In any case my son loves his "pad" and it's a great educational tool as well as babysitting device when mommy's running errands or on the phone, just make sure you have enough things physically downloaded for use out and about or you could have a frustrated kiddo on your hands.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Great Product!! IF you don't have to replace it!!!
review_body: To say I love this product is an understatement!!  My husband has an I Pad and used it extensively while we were traveling overseas last year; I wanted a tablet for traveling myself. I already own a Kindle Paper White and felt the Kindle Fire has nearly all the same features at less than half the price.  Other family members have Kindle Fires which they are very happy with.  I highly recommend this!!  AMENDMENT 03-17-15:  I HOPE YOU DO NOT HAVE TO RETURN YOUR KINDLE BECAUSE IT IS DEFECTIVE!!  A REPLACEMENT WAS SENT BUT IT IS A REFURBISHED MODEL RATHER THAN THE NEW ONE I PAID FOR.  NOTE I SPOKE WITH AMAZON REPS WELL WITHIN THE 30-DAY RETURN LIMIT BUT THEY STILL INSISTED I WAS ENTITLED ONLY TO A REFUBISHED MODEL BECAUSE "IT'S JUST AS GOOD AS A NEW ONE, NO ONE HAS USED IT, ETC"  AFTER GOING THROUGH NUMEROUS CHATS AND PHONE CALLS I FINALLY REACHED SOMEONE WHO AGREED TO HAVE ME RETURN THIS FOR A NEW ONE BUT I HAD TO RETURN THE ENTIRE ORDER TO INCLUDE THE STYLUS AND COVER BECAUSE "WE DON'T HAVE COBALT BLUE IN STOCK AND CAN'T SEND YOU ANOTHER COLOR".  Instead, I have to wait for them to receive the return and I can then order a new one.  I have returned a few items in the past to Amazon and have always gotten a credit the day I contacted them with mailing labels and instructions to return the item within 30 days, enabling me to immediately reorder the product.  This is a great product, IF you get one that is not defective.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Very disappointed with this Kindle Fire 7. I have the Kindle Fire 6 and thought the 7 would just naturally be better than the six, even though I love the 6. I was so surprised that it isn't. Everything I like about the 6, takes at least one step more to accomplish on the 7. I dislike the Wiki dictionary, preferred the x-ray of the 6. The print in the dictionary is so faint I can barely see it. To view the book in the store takes one step more than it did in 6.The home screen does not show the books all of the time like my 6 does, there is a screen that say's "noting listed here" or something to that effect. You then have to click on books to see them but it takes a while. I find that I use my 6 until the charge is low and then will use the 7 while the 6 is charging. Sorry I wasted my money.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Why doesn't it come with an operators manual that is convenient and easily understood. Each time I run into a problem ...
review_body: I'm still trying to figure out how to operate the different features on this device. Why doesn't it come with an operators manual that is convenient and easily understood. Each time I run into a problem involving using a function on my Kindle Fire HD 7' I either have to hunt down one of my  children or grandchildren or call customer service. Either of these choices is frustrating, times consuming, and embarrassing.  Not being able to privately control how I learn to interact with this device takes all of the fun out of owning it. I'm starting to wonder \\"Why did I buy it?\\".

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I have to say that when I bought my Kindle Fire, it wasn't at all what I had hoped for. Apps don't always load when I want them to, updates don't install automatically (and I don't always get the option to install them), and since I can't read with the backlight on my Kindle Fire, I'm out of luck when it comes to reading on the device. Its use as a tablet is mostly restricted to allowing my seven-year-old to read children's books in full color, and as an e-reader, it does nothing for me at all. Since I purchased my Kindle Fire some time ago, it doesn't allow me to move books into collections (unless I'm looking in the wrong place for them) and it was significantly more expensive (even refurbished) than the current prices.

On the other hand, my best friend loves her Kindle Fire that I purchased her for her birthday, and as a handheld internet-connection device, it does the job beautifully. We all have different needs!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Kindle Fire not booting up, loss of battery life - and HORRIBLE Amazon Kindle customer service.
review_body:
PROBLEM: I bought my Kindle Fire HD 7 in June of 2013. In the summer of 2014 I started having trouble with it booting up and keeping its battery life. Because it was "out of the warranty" time frame (1 year) I had to put up with it hoping it would get better. I took the few apps I had on it (Facebook, Twitter, and Flipboard) off the Kindle. I also disconnected my email and reset it. I hardly ever turned on the wi-fi because of loss of battery. My Kindle Fire would not get past the start up kindlefire logo screen.

REVIEW: Amazon Kindle has the WORST customer service. I have had grace, patience and mercy for over one year as I have time and time again called customer service to work out the issue with my ????indleFire??HD 7. Their solution is to buy another one (50% off). I could understand that if the problem was because of my error (like dropping it, water, etc). But it is a manufacturers error.

Any time I called their customer service they treated me like I was stupid and repeated the same steps each time - even though they can track my customer service calls. I would patiently explain that they had done what they were asking me to do each time I called and it did not fix/change the situation. They scheduled for their supervisor to call me - and they never did. They did reach out by email THREE weeks later to see if the situation changed. The customer service reps (in a foreign country) were following a prescribed list of questions and did not actually listen to the customer.
I highly doubt that I will EVER buy one of their products again. If they had good customer service I would stick with them. But with a bad product and bad customer service - they have lost me.

My personal review - Go with Apple and then get the kindle app if you want to purchase kindle ebooks. Apple Store has THE BEST customer service and I have learned from this long and painful experience that their price is worth it - even for their customer service alone.er service alone.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I wouldn't trade this for any other tablet!
review_body:
I've had a few other tablets before, one was a 10" viewsonic, the other a 7 inch Samsung Galaxy Tab. I enjoyed them all but something was always missing. I didn't know what it was. I'm not too sure what it is about the Kindle Fire that I love so much. Is it the Free borrowing from the Kindle Book Library? the fact that I can watch all my favorite TV shows and latest movies from Amazon Prime Instant (by the way the sound is AMAZING for being such a small device - I am very impressed!). Oh and lets not forget the Amazon Prime Music!

Not only did I get a fantastic tablet but also I'm saving money by no longer needing Netflix or Spotify!

It's not for everyone though (especially if you dont like Movies and Music and READING). Its primary function is for reading which it excels at.

If you love to read, catch a movie with awesome sound or listen to your favorite playlists then this is for you.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Amazon does not stand by this product.
review_body: I bought this for my mom about 18 months ago.  For that time she loved it, but it has mysteriously stopped working all of a sudden.  She had a case on it, never dropped it and kept it safe, but now the device will not power up.  When speaking with Amazon they are not sure what is wrong with it, but refuse to replace it.  Really?  The lifespan of this device is 18 months?  There are plenty of other more reliable options out there for about the same price and I would recommend one of these.

review_body:
I purchased my Fire HD 7 from Staples and am unaware of any special offers.
I have had various Kindle's for years. The first one was a black and white e-reader, then my husband purchased me the Kindle Fire, I have now graduated up to the Fire HD 7. In all cases I have been satisfied with the Kindle's I have owned. The only issue I had was with the Kindle Fire and the length of time it lasted. My e-reader which is about four years old is still going strong. The Fire gave out right at two years. This was rather disappointing but overall I am happy with the product.
I do wish that there was a reference booklet enclosed with the newest enhancements.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I was impressed with the quality and speed. I had a regular kindle touch which I loved because it was comfortable on my eyes when reading. My eyes tend to hurt when I'm reading from a computer and reading my kindle books on the Fire HD is just like reading from a bring computer. Can't turn the light off. I've gotten used to it by now, but deep down I feel like I'm hurting my eyes by reading from the screen.

The tablet does come with very impressive speakers, though.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Accessibility not as easy as the older model, but it does what I need it to do.
review_body: Love it, of course. This is my second Kindle (passed the 'old' one to a family member). Text-to-speech is same as the old one, but was harder to figure out how to turn it on. Some of the 'accessibility' features are more frustrating than helpful, especially since my fingers don't always register when I touch the screen (not Kindle's fault; my phone has the same problem). I do love the beautiful graphics and speed. Not sure why the new one doesn't 'see' my Bluetooth headset the previous Kindle used just fine. It does communicate with the one I use for my phone, so I'm not sure if this is Kindle's problem. Doesn't matter really. I'm using it; I'm loving it; I'm a happy reader of more novels.

I know Amazon has a great Technical Department and plan on calling them to get help in getting used to the new systems.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Amazon Will Not Back This Unreliable Product
review_body: Completely unreliable product and one Amazon will not fully back up! In December 2013 we bought the Kindle fire HD, March 2014 it had to be replaced and now, less than a year later we began to have issues with it connecting to the wi-fi. After over 2 hours with tech support no one can figure out what is going on with it. Come to find out, our replacement Kindle Fire did not include a 1 year warranty (way to back an unreliable product Amazon) so the high level Tech support graciously offered us a discount on a returned/repackage kindle for.....wait for it.....$15 off! Yes! $15 off the price of what I could get a new kindle for - WHOA! Thanks so much! Oh and to top it off, to get that awesome $15 deal (which you could get more of a deal when the Kindle Fire "deal of the day" is ran) you have to send the other Kindle back - Really?! So in all there would be between a $250 - $300 investment for only one Kindle Fire! I knew the kindle fires 7" were not reliable as Amazon had to replace our first Kindle Fire (non-hd) twice due to glitches - but at the time Amazon had done a great job of backing their product - now? Not so much! Will no longer be recommending this product to anyone!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
Three years ago I purchased an iPad for my mother for her 79th birthday. She hated it. It was too heavy, too confusing, the screen was too bright or too dim, and so it sat gathering dust for 2 years.
As soon as the Fire 7 HD arrived, my mother loved it. Not too heavy, easy on the eyes, and most of all it seems intuitive to her. She's been using it daily for 2 weeks now and hasn't asked anyone to help her navigate the home screen or find her favorite apps or load her Kindle library.
Amazon has won the respect of this Apple devotee. Recommended for anyone who doesn't have a resident tech (AKA a teenager).

A big drawback for me is that there are not as many apps available for the Kindle marketplace whereas there are hundreds of thousands for the iOS software. This tablet is a great starter tablet, or for users are want just basic use. Don't get me wrong, it's a wonderful product, but if I were going to make a purchase, I would stick with Apple.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I would love to write a good review about the Kindle Fire
review_body:
I would love to write a good review about the Kindle Fire, but I can't. It's an amazing piece of technology, until it stops working, which coincidentally happened soon after the 1 year warrant expired. Now it's a piece of junk. It rarely starts when you hit the power button, and when it does start (about 1 of out 5 tries) it often just shuts down or freezes up. I am very, very disappointed in this product. Amazon usually stands by the things it sells, and this is their product, and they won't stand by it. Once the warranty is up, you're out of luck.

Bottom line is this: If you want a table that will work for one year, it's great. If you expect your electronics to last longer than that, don't waste your money on the Kindle Fire.

review_body: Don't waste your money! Have had non-stop charging issues with the Kindle Fire 8.9 unit. Sure, Amazon did some troubleshooting several times but now of course just after 1 year old (as the warranty expired) and the unit will not turn on at all. No fixes for it after no luck with all the troubleshooter's suggestions. Next step, the unit goes in the garbage. Bought an iPad to replace and have had \\"ZERO\\" issues. Don't waste your $. Oh, but Amazon offered me a discounted price on a new or refurbished unit. Not a chance would I waste my money twice. Buyer Beware!!!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: ... to say that the kindle is bay far a better choice. The main reason that I did get ...
review_body:
I had an older Toshiba tablet before this and I have to say that the kindle is bay far a better choice.
The main reason that I did get the Kindle Fire is I wanted to sign up for Amazon Prime and with my old Toshiba tablet I could not watch movies or get books from my Amazon prime account? But I could get music? For certain stuff the Toshiba was not a supported device. So I felt it was time to upgrade.

So far I have not ran into any issues with the Kindle Fire HD. Watching movies and reading books on it is great. I feel that the 7" size is a good balance between small enough to take with you and not get in the way and big enough to still be pleasant to watch movies on and read books.
The audio sounds really good even though I use earphones most of the time.

review_headline: So good I don't use my computer as much.
review_body: I also had the kindle fire and when my DH found he loved reading on the kindle I got this one for me.  Very easy to use, great apps.  It stays charged when I use it for about five hours of games and surfing, or eight hours when reading.  I could lower the brightness to converse energy but find it works for me.  I can also charge it while we are driving or camping with the car plug.  I would recommend this to everyone.  The camera is not as good as on my phone but the photos on the screen are very clear.  The wifi is great and downloading books is easy.  Its like taking a whole library with you where ever you go.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Give me interface or set it on FIRE
review_body: Item came as promised, which was a good price and a bit ahead of the backlog that was originally forecasted. I do like the reading interface, not as annoyingly digitized and fluorescent as most pads, laptops, phones. I am not finding the Kindle as user friendly as I would have liked. I feel the OS probably has a lot more to offer but is laid out in a proprietary manner to push sales. The user info was extremely basic, how  to set up log on accounts for multi family members etc.- but no real info or overview on utilizing the device itself. Great - I can connect and receive dead end GUIs for Amazon products I don't want or other applets  I can PURCHASE; its loaded with more commercials and sales pitch than a Super Bowl Sunday! I bought it for a user friendly interface for tween, teen, myself- instead of using our phones- a bit more screen, reading, interface options. So far that hasn't happened. I will pursue some online avenues on my laptop to see if we can make this a bit more user friendly for all, but that's already wading into the "don't bother" area for most people. I did purchase the extended warranty since it was bought with tween/teens in mind, I received an email weeks before the item was delivered that I now have a "warranty" from the third party company. Not getting warm fuzzies on that front either- more work to chase down how to, when to, who to, list the item serial number with...etc. At this point I feel I probably should have purchased a mini laptop for the teen and let the tween have my old one. That or updated to the larger screen smartphone; just not big on that auto tracking mechanism in the phones, but the ads on the Kindle have geo-tracking all over them!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
This particular version does not keep a charge. at all. I will charge it to %100, and leave it in 'sleeping mode' and the next thing I know (Within a 12 hour period) I would have to charge it again. If you dont shut it completely off, the battery will drain to the point it will need to be on a charger for at least 3-4 hours before it will turn on again.

this is our second Kindle fire. the first one we have is the verision from 2012. that runs like a top! Still does. Never had a problem with the battery. That one could last at least three days without having to re-charge it.

Needless to say, I am very dissappointed. I rave to my Ipad owner friends on how great the Kindle is, but this one falls short.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: There is nothing I don't like about this Kindle Fire HD 7
review_body: There is nothing I don't like about this Kindle Fire HD 7. I already have a Nook and I love that, too. But, I bought the Kindle Fire primarily because it has a camera. The good thing I have found with the camera is that it reacts much faster than the camera on my phone, so I don't miss as many shots because of lag. A pleasant surprise for me is that the Kindle is easier for me to read on for long periods of time than my Nook. I have no idea why that is, but it is true. I am very happy with this purchase. I still use my Nook for playing games and reading some books that are already loaded on it. That being said, the price for the Kindle was excellent, delivery was right on time on time. I love it!

review_headline: were used to an older I pad and the kindle is nice but it is hard to get used to after ...
review_body: I got kindles for my kids for Christmas, were used to an older I pad and the kindle is nice but it is hard to get used to after being an I pad user. Also I was a bit disappointed after downloading various game apps for my son and than being notified that the storage is about full, mind you this was just with multiple apps no pictures, books, music or anything else. The old IPad we have had pages and pages of apps and 1000s of pictures and still has lots more storage. If you are planning on getting a kindle and you are an app user and want storage for other things, I would recommend getting the kindle with 16gb of storage rather than 8. Other than the storage issue and the difficulty in navigating at first everything has been good. I like the kindle and my kids do as well.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I ordered this for myself on sale as I'd never had an e-reader before. Generally I like it very much; pretty easy to navigate and it's a convenient size that can fit in my purse. My only down sides are: 1) The camera isn't the best. I don't really use mine for photos anyway but it doesn't seem to take as high quality of pictures as my phone, and 2) I wish it were a little more customizable. I'd like to be able to pick what's on the lock screen and select a background and as far as I know there isn't a way to do those things.

Other than that it's a great little reader, I like that I can download books directly from Amazon, and my social apps seem to work well on here too. For the price, I think it was my best option for a tablet.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Makes a horrible door stop, as the door glides right over it due to its thin profile. Seriously though, the thing stopped working after 2 weeks. I had it fully charged and when I got home to turn it on...nothing. Wouldn't charge either. Just dead. Read some support websites including Amazon and tried numerous times to "reboot" it by holding down the button for 20 seconds, then 30 seconds, then 3 minutes (seriously, someone suggested this). Nothing worked. To be honest, even if it had turned on after a reboot, my confidence in the product would have been shattered anyhow and I would've returned it. A product shouldn't have to be raised from the dead after two weeks of ownership. I should've known from the price, but I wanted to give it a chance. Returned it today and promptly ordered an iPad Air. Costs twice as much, but my wife's is still going strong, even after it was dropped and the glass shattered. I'm bummed out because I would've loved to have been proven wrong about my gut feeling.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Not as good as the Android tablets, but cheap.
review_body:
I just received this but being an avid android user I thought I would love this, and Its good - for the price but it takes tweaking that the normal user will not know how to do.

First off - the launcher is absolutely terrible. So I downloaded Nova Launcher and I'm hit with the fact that you can't set Nova as the default, every time you hit the home button it asks which launcher to use - so I blocked the home launcher. Most people wouldn't know how to do this, but its the only way to make the launcher good.

Second - No youtube - ok, so there is no youtube app that works out of the box, the website is difficult to use, especially because I bought this mainly for my four year old son. He likes going on there and watching Tayo the little bus, katy perry and whatever else four year olds are into, so I had to sideload the apk - still didn't work - I then had to jump through hoops and adb to get it to work. Now he is happy.

Third - the app store is pretty bad and apps don't get updated fast if at all. I knew this about amazon when I bought the item, but like I said this is for my four year old and I didn't want to spend $500 for a better tablet so this gets the job done, if you know what you're doing.

Problem: random books from my cloud show up on the carousel.  When deleted, others show up. Problem: battery use length is nowhere close to the claims.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: NOT FOR KIDS to READ WITH.  BUY SOMETHING ELSE!!!!
review_body: PARENTS BEWARE!!! I bought the 7 HD for my grandson so he could effortlessly read books. I handed it to him, not realizing that parental control had to be installed at the outset and if he set it up, I would have to erase the entire system to re-do it.  Then he began playing games. The device was on my account (do they tell you to set up a separate account?  no) he charged $900 on game enhancements, an Amazon gimmick.  It took more or less an hour to wrestle Amazon to rescind the charges, and I was warned never again would they credit me back. I did not want another game device to monitor.  I did not want him on MY account.  I did not want his device reviewing MY books ordered.  I did not want to have to actively monitor his use.  Today, with an hour or more invested talking to Ms Bangladesh, I was able to get most of this reset, maybe??  If you want your kid to read, DO NOT BUY THIS.  Buy a simple paperwhite or something like it.  This is just a badly designed, clumsy, distracting, money sucking game device.  I think I MAY have gotten this da@#$ed thing under control, but WHY make it so hard?  And do not count on Amazon to give you decent parental control options up front (or even later without lots of questions and patience).  Most kids have too much gaming access.  This is not one you will want to buy to make it maddeningly worse.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: After I played with it awhile...:)
review_body: After I have played with this device for awhile, I will have to amend my review and say that I have really enjoyed it. This device can do a lot of things-- even download free videos from you tube, just don't bother with the advertised utilities. Just go up to the URL while the video is playing and put "ss" in front of the y on YouTube. It will bring up the "Save from net" screen. Your video will be downloaded and placed in "photos". No muss, no fuss. You can do practically anything with this device, you just have to be creative at times because Amazon doesn't want you to leave the yard. You will find certain limits on some sights, because they see you as a "mobile device". The sound is really great(!!!!) and it readily pairs with Bluetooth headsets. I imagine, given enough time, I'll find ways around these other limits. Hints: don't use Silk Browser; it's useless. Download Google Chrome and use the upper right corner to pin it to your bookmarks. I now take this everywhere. Go to Caseables and have a custom case made with whatever images you want!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I have already bought 9 Kindles and Fires. However ...
review_body:
I have already bought 9 Kindles and Fires. However, beginning with the purchase of the Fire 8.9 I intended to be able to play Scrabble, the EA, real Scrabble game BUT CANNOT do that. We play the game on the original Fire, now four years old, and it is dying a slow death and not holding a charge. I got the big one 8.9" pre-ordered and NO Scrabble capability. I called and was told it should be coming to the Fire HDX 8.9. However, it has not shown up since October and I check every other day.
I finally decided to break down and buy a 7" Fire, but guess what NO SCRABBLE on this one either. Amazon made them so fancy... there is no Scrabble game purchasable for them. If you are a Scrabble player this stinks...we cannot play the electronic game. I am returning this 3rd 7" one.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
My feelings are a bit mixed on the HD 7. I bought this as an upgrade from my Gen 2, which after nearly three years of use was starting to feel it's age a bit. Right away I was thrilled with the bright and beautiful picture quality. It was when I started trying to use my apps that I became a bit disappointed. Facebook was, and still is, very slow to load and sometimes crashes. I keep getting logged out of Words with Friends and have to constantly reconnect. It just seems like it runs much, much slower and a bit clunkier than my Gen 2 did.

It's still a great tablet, for a really great price, but I have taken to using this as my back up and use my Gen2 as my main.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Good product beware of the advestisements
review_body: Great product! Reasonable priced! Very pleased so far..... Except the advertisements on the lock screen! Do you really have to pay to have them removed? Regardless of the $15 charge or whatever it may be that is absolutely ridiculous!!! Once I figured that out I was basically going to return it. What a joke! Gotta have that advertising and I'm sure your banking on it as well! You should at least let your customers know before you purchase or give the option to buy with it already removed. Personally I don't feel like wasting my time calling your customer service line and complaining. Unless you decide to remove mine for free it's really going to have an effect on how I use or recommend any of your services.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Amazon has no respect for your Dollar--Buy another type pf pad and get real customer service
review_body: I have not doubt that it performs as stated in all of these reviews. My dislike comes for the lack of respect and customer service when the tablet beaks down. At the time that I purchased this for my elderly mother, this tablet was the best one out. In less than a year it no longer works, May 2014 and it is now January 2015. I called to see what could be done, my mom likes it and wanted her fixed, Amazon responded by saying they were out of my tablet but would send a NEW replacement. Once I received the package, it was a Refurbished tablet; not what I was promised. I asked my mother, she wanted to know why they can?? just fix hers; Amazon refused. I took it back to Best Buy, with my receipt they refused to give me back my money, stating that this company only guarantees their product in store for 30 days. Again, I called Amazon; I can only get satisfaction if I take someone else's previously damaged tablet. What made matters worse is that the phone representative tried to convince me that it was not refurbished by saying, they ran out of boxes and had to put the refurbish taping on the new tablets. I own an Apple Ipad and Samsung tablet; I wasted my money, trying to make my mother happy. Amazon has no respect for your dollar-buy an Ipad mini instead and let them download the app. You will be satisfied with the customer service and the product. Most apps that they have you can find on Apple, I bought both of my children Ipad minis. Don?? waste your money, if they don't stand behind their products it not worth your risk. I am a single mom with no money to give away.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
Before I begin I must say I bought this tablet for someone else for Christmas. They did not want it so I decided to keep it for myself. This is my honest take on the device.

Overall the tablet does an ok job for reading books, playing games, and watching movies. The biggest problem is that the battery is rather faulty. The tablet can be charged at 100% with the screen brightness turned all the way down; no music or video playing and yet within an hour the battery level is at 89%. All I've done within that hour was read articles on the internet and checked my mail, that's it. Watch a video or play a game, obviously the battery will suffer a lot more. I fount myself charging this thing twice a day. Maybe its just my tablet but overall the battery is bad. I will request another tablet to see if it really is just my device.

Second, the build quality is decent. The back of the tablet however feels really cheap. So cheap that if you were to put a little pressure on it by just holding it up it would give off a plastic squeaky sound. The tablet is also slightly heavy compared to other 7\\" tablets on the market. Nothing that will make your arm tired but you'll definitely notice a difference if you've played with other small tablets before.

Lastly, the OS at times is frustrating to use and the Amazon App store is lacking a lot of quality apps. I say the OS is frustrating because even though it does a good job of making things simple, there is no way for you to customize the interface to your liking. The tablet is too simple for its own good! You can't even change the wallpaper. It's also frustrating when an app has a Youtube video ready for you to view and it fails to load every time (also the Youtube app just directs you to the mobile youtube website. You wont get the same youtube app experience as the one on Android phones or tablets).

A couple of positives though. The Sound coming from this tablet is fantastic. Really good quality. Second, if you are a Prime member you will most likely enjoy the tablet a lot more with \\"free\\" movies, books, and music. Without Prime I'd honestly say that this would be a paperweight, meaning nothing special. Prime helps this tablet out a lot!

With all of this said the tablet in my opinion hasn't been worth the price I paid for over a month ago. Although I never intended to use it to begin with,I wanted to see what all the hype was about and I just don't feel the tablet does a good job at competing with other tablets out there. The battery is really a killer and for a tablet I shouldn't have to charge it twice a day nowadays.ber you will most likely enjoy the tablet a lot more with \\"free\\" movies, books, and music. Without Prime I'd honestly say that this would be a paperweight, meaning nothing special. Prime helps this tablet out a lot! With all of this said the tablet in my opinion hasn't been worth the price I paid for over a month ago. Although I never intended to use it to begin with,I wanted to see what all the hype was about and I just don't feel the tablet does a good job at competing with other tablets out there. The battery is really a killer and for a tablet I shouldn't have to charge it twice a day nowadays.

review_body:
The Fire offers beautiful color and some excellent new search features. Unfortunately, it is overly demanding of attention, converting an easy-reading environment into a 3-ring circus screaming, "Buy me, buy me" well beyond the point of distraction.
When might the innovators of technology learn to back off and give the human customer a chance to decide rather than being constantly pushed.

review_headline: buy anything else. any savings are not worth the disappointment
review_body: Worst tablet out there. Ads everywhere. Your background, your lock screen, the margins around your Netflix screen. You can't change it. Wanna play music? Here, buy our songs on Amazon! Mildly slow, and it shows ads for a loading screen. Quick little subliminal flashes. I've learned to close my eyes every time I click a button on this thing. I almost just factory reset it to regift it, but I don't hate anyone that much. I'd say it was a waste of money, but I won this for free as a prize, so I'll just say it was a waste of my time. I would rather have won the toaster.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: JUNK When It Comes To Internet Connectivity!
review_body: Have had nothing but problems keeping it connected to the internet.  Amazon says it's a problem with my internet provider, however, the Kindle has issues everywhere with connecting to the internet.  I have 13 other devices in my home connecting to the internet just fine, this Kindle is junk and Amazon's cure it to call others, replace routers (which I have done without it fixing the issue).  Amazon won't refund due to having the device over 30 days (52 days to be exact) and now their giving me a run around for a replacement.  They've pulled logs and going to have their developers look at it before making a determination to replace the unit.  Needless to say, I no longer recommend the Kindle.  I have an RCA that I paid $29.00 for that works like a charm!

review_headline: My problems are with the vendor - not the unit.
review_body: The trend not to include a printed User's Manual with the device actually began in the Electronics industry only a few years ago. I object to that and will automatically take off one star for any product that does that. I was given Kindle 7 HD shortly after they came out in 1012. The unit that I have now is version 4. The old cover does not fit so a new one had to be purchased. I take off another star for offering 4 different versions in two years and having to purchase the cover for my series model separately. It should be included in the price. It was virtually impossible to use the camera feature with the first one and just a bit better on #4 with the rear shutter. Color and picture quality are suprisingly good for movies and books  .

review_headline: I like almost everything about this new KF except - and ...
review_body: I purchased this new Kindle Fire when my first Kindle Fire just failed to charge anymore.  I like almost everything about this new KF except - and this is the reason for only 4 stars..........  If you are using the device to watch Netflix the volume control is easily accessible.  If you are on FB for example, and you want to listen to a posted video, you have to swipe down from the top, go to Settings, then to Display and Sounds just to get to the volume control.  It would make more sense if you could adjust the volume when you swipe down. You can adjust the brightness when you swipe down or when you go to settings.  You should be able to adjust the volume the same way.    Updated 2/16: My son just showed me that there is a volume control on the side of the KF (that was hidden in the fold of the cover).  That makes things much easier.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Great device, but app store needs work
review_body: The screen definition is excellent and the device is heavy enough but not too heavy  Recommend a case and screen protector, as the screen collects fingerprints and dust, and is very reflective.  The protector cuts down on the glare.  It does a great job as a Kindle reader for books and it is wonderful to read a book, see another book mentioned, look it up on Amazon and then download it.  Books, apps and website bookmarks pop up very quickly.  The interface for apps and web bookmarks is very good, making it easy to switch between apps or from an app to a bookmark and back.  The Silk web browser works very well.  My only complaint, and others have complained about it as well, is that many apps are not available that are on either an Apple or Android device.  Maybe Amazon sells Kindles at a loss and can't devote money to developing apps, or does not want people to spend time using apps so they will spend more time shopping for books, apparel, etc.  Apple refuses to enter any arrangement with Adobe for Flash Player, which allows the user to see videos and hear audio streams, but this device also does not have Flash Player capability and there are other (e.g., Warp Radio) audio streaming sites it is not compatible with.  If Amazon focused on its app store, they could charge more for the tablets and bring in more Amazon shoppers.  Feb. 14, 2015

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I am the proud owner of a Kindle Paperwhite, an iPad 2, and now my Kindle Fire HD7.  I use each for different purposes.  My Paperwhite has the built in wifi, and I take it with me everywhere.  I keep my current reading on it and it's great in doctors offices and anywhere else I have a desire to read.  My iPad is great too, but I do fear that one day it will die, and I use it primarily for emails, web browsing, and a couple of games.  My Fire HD7 is the first step for my buying a flat screen tv, and fire stick as I live in a situation where I can only stream shows from Netflix and Hulu.  My reasoning at the time was that the fire was going to be the easiest way to stream on to a tv using the fire stick.  I am probably a couple months away from that, but in the meantime, I have absolutely fallen in love with the fire.  The screen is so clear and the built in speakers are awesome.  I now consider this one of my favorite possessions, I take the Paperwhite where I can read for longer periods of time as the battery life is longer than the Fire.  If I knew how much I would fall in love with the fire, I might not have purchased the PaperWhite at all.  I am an Amazon Prime member as well as a kindle unlimited member, so I have decided that my unlimited books - those I only keep long enough to read - are only read on my Fire while my purchased books are on my PaperWhite.  Since I am on a relatively limited income, the payment plan for the Fire has made it extremely affordable.  Prior to my PaperWhite, I had owned several different kindles - the kindle keyboard and the basic kindle.  With the severe arthritis in my hands, I cannot hold large books any more and the kindle allows me to easily hold a book and read it.  My iPad is too heavy for me to easily read with while holding it in one hand.  This year I am facing numerous surgeries and reading is my sanity while I'm in recovery mode.  I cannot say enough good things about the Kindle line of products and I do not regret any of my purchases.

review_body: Awful. Disregard the tacky ads they include as part of the "Special Offers" scheme--the tablet is simply incompatible with the numerous apps and functionalities you become used to as an android phone user (google apps, dropbox, etc.). The hardware appears very capable, but the software is designed to keep you from making full use of it. For instance, I can't download files from the web, but rather I must email them to a conjured up Kindle device email address? And even then it's a pain that involves altering Amazon account settings through a separate desktop / laptop computer? Certainly not intuitive. This tablet may suffice for a toddler, but a professional will have no use for it. Way to go, Amazon.

review_headline: Great product, glad I was able to purchase it ...
review_body:
I first called about my Kindle, it wouldnt charge so I was sent free of charge a charger, but no my Kindle was dead! I tried to send back the charger because it wasnt the charger but my Kindle, but they wouldnt let me.
Great product, glad I was able to purchase it with a great discount! My Kindle simply died so when I started looking in stores I didnt see anything that compared to this offer. The lady I spoke with was excelllent & when she found out that my other Kindle had died she gave me a great offer.
The only thing that I have not been happy about is the cases for my Kindle Fire HD 7. I have ordered 2 & they did not work with my Kindle, the first was opened from the right side & the second one covered up the place to charge the Kindle & neither one had a place for my rear camera. I wish I had some help picking out a case before I had to pay shipping & handling on the last case. If I had had this case with my order for my Kindle then I wouldnt have had to pay shipping & handling, but at least I didnt have to pay to return them so I'm fine with that!
Thanks,
Linda H. Reynolds

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Not as much storage space as you expect
review_body: I bought two of these for my kids for Christmas.  I thought the 8 GB storage would be perfect for my 9 and 7 year old.  In six weeks of use, both of my kids have used 90% of available storage.  They don't have any videos or pictures on there.  They don't use the internet.  They read books and play games through apps.  I looked in settings, and only 1.3 GB is taken up with games.  The rest is the operating system and other minor things.  There really isn't as much storage as I expected.  We're going to have to start deleting apps or books and that makes me sad.  I didn't realize so much would be taken up by the OS or I would have ordered the 16 GB.  Be aware of that before you purchase one for yourself or your kids.  It is a great tablet and I would give a 5 star review if they really had some decent storage on them.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
This is my first small e-device. I don't know if it's a lemon or not. First, the HD quality is amazing. I also like to read the Washington Post in the morning. For challenges:
1) I had difficulty adding books to the device - had to call for help. The device (in use about a week) had to be reset - by holding down the start button for 40 seconds. That worked.
2) I tried to download photos from my computer to the device. Two of our computers either didn't recognize the device or told me I needed to download software to access it. Called again for help and once again was told to hold the start button for 40 seconds. Worked that time, but not later (several times!) on my own. I still haven't added those photos so will again be calling Amazon for help. I expect to be calling Amazon a lot. How bad does it have to be to send it back?

review_body: Heavier than it looks, and the back feels/looks like Fisher Price tough plastic. I'm a nook lover, but with new models releasing so often and technology advances, it's hard to keep up. And as a single mom, it's impossible to justify $250+ every other year. Problem solved. I've fallen in love. The software is so easy to use for me and the easy functions and omg : ) and was able to get the nook app on (somewhat sneakily). Battery life is great (I'm running on day 3 or 4 since my last charge). Can't wait to try out cloud. Basic Excel and Word files are invaluable. I think Amazon may win over nook (tho I am a few generations behind on the nook). But again, LOVE IT!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I knew it was inexpensive, but I didn't realize how cheap it was.
review_body:
Edited February 15th/2015

I first wrote the following in early February, and gave it 3 stars. Then, downgraded my rating to 2 stars, because *when* the device works, I enjoyed it, despite some of its huge flaws. That was before it stopped working altogether. For over two days I was unable to get this thing out of the "boot loop". After spending two hours talking to FIVE different Amazon customer service representatives, they told me they wouldn't ship me a replacement at my current destination, which is in Peru. So I'd stuck with an expensive paper weight. I was bitterly disappointed to have wasted my money on this, because like I said in my original review below, I mostly bought it due to the price. I should have known to save a little more for an ACTUAL tablet, and not just a "reading tablet". Never going to make this mistake with Amazon again.

I checked and researched before going to customer service this time just in case there's some trouble-shooting tip I would feel like an idiot for not having tried, and to no surprise, it's quite easy to find a lot of people who are just as disappointed in the same problem with this device. But according to the last individual I talked to at Amazon, supposedly it's a fluke that mine is behaving this way and there's a low probability that my replacement will have the same problems.

Then, it finally randomly powered itself back on while talking to him, so I went ahead and did a factory reset while I finally had it working just in case it powered off again before I could. Couldn't hurt, right? I thought maybe something is all screwy in my settings or I downloaded a bad app that deleting it might fix. Once I got my tablet to reboot and re-installed all my apps, the INSTANT I went ahead and touched one (it was Netflix, incidentally), it froze, shut itself off and went through the exact same routine all over again.

Since they can't/won't replace it for me (they would if I were in the USA), I'm basically out of luck. I've been SO HAPPY with all the other Amazon devices I'd bought in the past (they should basically pay me a commission for alI the persuasive advertising I've done for them!) I never even imagined it was possible to have a problem, but sure enough, mine won't work properly. I give up on it, and the next time I buy a tablet it will be real one.

Original product review below:
----------------------------------

First, it needs to be noted I've been a huge Amazon fan for about four years, and had never been disappointed previously with any of their products I've purchased over the years. I have gone through three Kindles (I'm currently on a Kindle Paperwhite), and I read voraciously, and about a year ago bought my wife a Samsung Galaxy tablet for more than double what the Kindle Fire HD7 cost.

I finally decided **based on the price alone** to take the jump and get a Kindle Fire. I had accumulated enough money on my gift card balance from sharing affiliate links on Facebook to buy one, and this last Black Friday I ordered one without any real loss to my bank account.

First, the good:
-As far as price goes, you are hard pressed to find a tablet of this quality, this inexpensive. So I am taking that into consideration when giving this device the rating I'm giving it. However, see below.
-I have been using it for all sorts of things, specifically surfing the web, using a few apps that are just easier to use on a tablet than a phone, and really enjoy using this device. I am now a huge Evernote fan thanks to having my own tablet and find it much easier to write on my laptop and sync my notes to the Fire tablet.
-Great customer service when I had a problem with the device turning itself off and not coming back on, and getting stuck in a perpetual "boot loop" while charging. But that says more about Amazon than the device, per se.

Overall it needs tobe admitted that all these "good" qualities are not exclusive to the Kindle Fire tablet, but can be obtained on any tablet, per se.

The bad:
-When it came, I showed it to my wife, who has been using an Samsung Galaxy tablet for the past year, and she said to me "it looks old". This thing is *thick* and clunky looking, or at least that's the expectation I've gotten used to after having a slick Android tablet.
-The brightness. Seriously? I can't even LOOK at the screen if I'm trying to read in the dark! Even on the *lowest* screen setting. I had to download a blue light filter app, and it works like a charm, BUT if you open the Silk browser (another point of frustration) the filter turns off and you're stuck with an incredibly bright screen again. I don't know whether the app is to blame (which I shouldn't need in the first place if this had a reasonable level of low-brightness) or the tablet's manufacturer design.
-The Silk browser is just garbage. Absolute garbage. Nevermind that Amazon makes it incredibly difficult to load other browser apps and you need to side load anything from Google Play, which also seems to cause problems with the tablet's functionality if you do. OK, so I get that Amazon and Google are competition and don't play nice. However, whenever I click on a link from inside any of the apps, whether it be email (native), or third-party social media app, Silk opens, and then... nothing happens. I wait like twenty seconds or however long one needs in order to realize the link ain't opening. One out of three times a tab will open and provide the link I had clicked on, but the other two times nothing.
-While writing this review, my tablet has turned itself off twice while trying to download a podcast mp3 I was hoping to listen to (which needed to be done using Silk, incidentally). Since I have never yet successfully download a large file from the internet onto the tablet directly, I always have to do it on my laptop, and then plug in my device via USB to move the files over. I don't understand why I have to even do this, instead of skipping this unnecessary step and downloading it directly using the tablet? This problem has sort of solved itself when I downloaded Podcast Addict and can sometimes successfully download mp3s using that app.
-It frequently turns itself off and won't come back on. Thankfully customer service was really helpful when it wouldn't turn back on for a prolonged amount of time (like a day or two), as I mentioned in the "good" section above.
-Scratch what I just a bullet point ago. I stopped trying to download the mp3, and went straight to Spotify and after two songs, the device shut off again and won't turn on unless I plug it in. Sometimes a window pops up asking if I am sure I want to power it down, and I hit cancel. Other times it just goes ahead and turns itself off. Is there a reason for this?
-When listening to music, whether the native music player app, Spotify, Podcast Addict, or any streaming service, it just randomly shuts off the app for no apparent reason. Strange Brew? If I wanted to randomly turn my music off, I would do it myself since, um, I'm listening to it because I want to.
-Sometimes it takes forever to charge the tablet, other times it randomly charges super fast. Is there a reason it can't just charge in few hours on a consistent basis or must I really wait like 10 hours some days before I can unplug and um, USE it?
-And the REAL bugger: you don't actually get 8GB of hard drive space like they advertise! I have more space on my outdated Samsung phone than I do on this tablet, which truly only comes with LESS than 4GB of HD space. Why Amazon? This part is probably the most inexcusable because it's not even a design flaw, but misleading advertising. Although I didn't intend on loading it up with videos or photos or a lot of music files, I couldn't anyway if I wanted to! In fact, I don't have anover abundance of apps loaded on this thing, but I'm constantly getting a notification that I need to free up space or that I'm 90% full. What a major disappointment.

So yeah, beware: you get your money's worth if you buy one of these things. Put aside a few more coins in the bank and get yourself a real tablet if you need one.

Maybe I shouldn't write a review for a product WHILE I'm trying to use it unsuccessfully and with frustration, but that's precisely why I'm going ahead and posting this. While I can't rate this one star since it has many features I like (when the device is actually working properly) I likewise cannot in good conscience or as a satisfied customer give this thing a 5 star rating either as this is much more mediocre of a product than I was expecting from Amazon. They had made a good impression on me with with their dedicated reading devices (I really LOVE my Paperwhite), but this is truly disappointing.

All in all, I'm surprised to find an Amazon product is this mediocre. I'd come to expect good quality from them.

Edit: I decided to change my review to 2 stars after posting it yesterday. Three was too generous. I have spent MORE time trying to get this tablet to work correctly than I have simply USING it. I was browsing Silk, and three times in 10 minutes it randomly turned off, and then finally wouldn't turn back on. This is the SECOND time in less than a month this has happened.

I realize these are cheap tablets, but it would be nice to be able to actually get at least what I "paid" for....s unnecessary step and downloading it directly using the tablet? Having said all of that the return process has been really smooth and I'm planning on buying another one as soon as the return is finalized.

review_headline: Defective Kindle Poorly Manufactured - Shame on you, Amazon
review_body:
Defective Product - Shame on you, Amazon

Purchased Kindle Fire HD 7 for my mother-in-law (senior citizen) for Christmas. The Kindle's screen kept turning black and power had to be continually pressed. Returned to Amazon only to be replaced by a REFURBISHED product. According to Amazon you only have 30 days to return the product to be replaced with a new one. Otherwise it would be replaced with refurbished. The issue was I purchased this on Nov 28 and gave it as a Christmas gift (on Dec 25) and it started malfunctioning in January! Amazon did NOT disclose this return policy before I bought this product. REALLY, REALLY DISAPPOINTED WITH AMAZON. :( :( :( (I should have given my mother-in-law an iPad mini just like what I have)

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I did something I never do; I bought something without extensively researching it. Result: I returned it.

I bought the Kindle Fire HD 7 to be able to watch TV and movies on the go. Unfortunately, since it's not true Android - neither are the (limited) apps - it wouldn't work for me. When I attempted to sideload other apps, the device would tell me it was installed, but the app was nowhere to be found. I even found simply using the browser was clunky. Since I already have a Paperwhite - and I love it - I didn't have much use for this otherwise. I ended up buying a Galaxy Tab Pro, like I should have done in the first place.

review_headline: I got this a gift from my 75 year old ...
review_body:
I got this a gift from my 75 year old mother. She got it on "sale" at $15 off. What she didn't know was that the "sale" was because they added some adware to the device. I then had to pay the $15 to get the adware removed. When I turned on the device 10 minutes later to read a book, there is an ad.
It also will not let me use any android apps, only the ones you sell.
So, tell me, how am I supposed to tell my mom that the over $100 she spent on this thing is worth less than nothing and actually cost me money?

PS Yes I do have the courage to use my real name, do you?

That was NOT going to happen -My computer is less than 2 years old and I have an anti-virus, but the next thing that happened after our conversation my computer got so that I had to strip to bare bones and buy a disk and reload Windows 8.1.  I am still not able to access what I basically got the FIRE for. My computer was working perfectly before I was directed to your REPRESENTATIVE in India or whoever you use to represent AMAZON.    Now that my computer is where it was when all this began I would appreciate instructions on how to operate my FIRE!!!!!!
