product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I don't think I'll get another one.
review_body: I suggested, and was given, a Fire HDX 7\\" for Christmas. I loved it, but it started giving me trouble after less than a year. What went wrong was: the touch screen no longer responded to touch. Dead. Fortunately, it was under warranty, so it was replaced quickly, but with a refurbished unit. Within 6 months, that one went belly-up as well-the battery wouldn't charge. The only thing on the screen was the words \\"Kindle Fire\\". Couldn't be fixed, so dead again. This time, however, I discovered that the original warranty passed to the replacement, meaning that my year of coverage still started with the purchase of the original Kindle Fire, rather than restarting with the replacement, which meant that, since a full year was now past, I was  SOL. If I wanted a Kindle as such I was going to have to buy a new one. They offered me a deal on a refurbished KF, consisting of $10 off the usual refurb price. Such a deal! Too bad they aren't better-constructed. I may invest in another iPad. Kindle Fire has lost some of its allure.

I don't like always being disconnected from my in-home wi-fi and having to sign back in. The battery life also seems a little short.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Keep your Kindle if you're thinking of buying this as a upgrade.
review_body:
I had to give this an "OK" just because I'm sure someone would like this tablet (I returned it). However, having had the 3 g Kindle first I didn't care for this tablet for two reasons. Number one: I only had Wifi and no 3g which means I can only buy and download a movie or book when I am at home or where there is free Wifi. With my Kindle, I was in Europe and could download wherever I wanted. I did not want to spend the extra money for the 4g and then have to have a designated line (pay for it).
Number two: It kept knocking me off my e-mail on my laptop which was aggravating having to keep signing in on my laptop e-mail.
Also, too confusing since I have been using Apple products which are so user friendly.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: ... and I was excited to get it at a good price. Was annoyed that it came with ads ...
review_body: Bought this for my daughter and I was excited to get it at a good price. Was annoyed that it came with ads which I had to pay to be removed. When I bought this, it did not say anywhere that I was getting a lower price due to ads (especially ones I wouldn't want her to see)...I simply thought I was getting the sale price since I ordered around black Friday. I wouldn't have a problem with that tactic if they would be more transparent about it and if I didn't have to search through my acct menu just to find a way to pay and disable. Be more up front about that and don't make finding the solution a pain in the butt or some fine print burried with other text. If you go from using an iPad to this, then you might find it frustrating- I don't think it's nearly as user friendly. Wish the kindle had more customization and another way to get to profile switch and home screen. Seems like a home button added to the device would make it a lot easier to use instead of sliding across screen...especially when reading a book. I have to remember that I can only slide in from one side and then have to back out through the book menu just to exit to home. I'm still figuring the kindle out so maybe it will get easier. Size of device is nice and offers enough apps. Not sure if I would buy again unless they change menu accessibility/ user friendliness

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I am one of those people that always had a book, and was sure I would never want to read it on a small screen. Boy was I wrong. I am loving my Fire HD7. I play games, check into Facebook and email, and download some great deals.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Imagine my delight, when the day I decided to order
review_body:
I am not a gadget person, and am technically challenged. I've been using Amazon Kindle for many years and have been through a few generations.

I received an Amazon gift card a few months ago, for my birthday, and finally decided to use it toward a Fire HD 6. Imagine my delight, when the day I decided to order, the Fires were on sale! I had planned to add $50.00 to my gift card in order to purchase the $99.00 item, but for a mere $14.00 more, I was able to purchase the HD 7.

The tablet is very user friendly, so even the most technically challenged person can use it. The graphics are crisp and clear, stereo speakers so it doesn't sound like a tin can. I've been using it for everything I would normally use a computer for. I recently purchased a new printer for my home, and am able to print wirelessly from the tablet.

I love that there is a variety of color choices, and best of all, after placing my order on a Tuesday evening, I received a conformation informing me of a delivery date for the following Monday, and was quite surprised and pleased when it was delivered on a Sunday

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: CONFESSION I'M IN LINE WITH MY TABLET.
review_body:
I love my kindle fire hd I have had many tablets. Now I would never brands. I love Amazon and it makes doing shopping so convenient for me because I'm disabled it gives me full access to my Amazon account with a press of a button. I get so many perks having prime and the fire kindle. 2 free bestseller books a month. Also 1000s of books for free that would usually cost money and UNLIMITED cloud for photos music movies ETC.. plus it had everything a normal tablet does. Silk is the server which it's fast. The kindle offers you loads of apps. Yes Android properly had more put seriously most of them are usless and are games and who really used all those apps. Yes I do have apps and kindle had all the main ones, and all the disk media ones that everyone likes. I'm glad I got the 7 inch and not the 6 inch I think that might of been a little bit to small. Its perfect to pop into your purse and it's so light. I just can't believe for the price what a good tablet and it's so amazing. I got tablet got for my daughter at Wal-Mart a couple of months before they released the kindle, and it was 50 dollars more. The screen is so fuzzy and it's really slow. She loves my kindle. So I think that will be her birthday present this year. The only thing about it is sometimes it lags on the keyboard when swiping that's a little annoying but it's not all the time and it doesn't effect your swiping. If you type them it won't effect you.
I love it and if your thinking about getting a tablet for the price I promise you it's worth way more for what you will pay. I received my kindle then end of November I wanted to wait to do the review, so if there where any problems I could write them in, but so far so good.
I will update if anything arises.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I am so happy with this product, I would give it a ten if I could. It is exactly what I have wanted for a long time. I have a huge need to  read and live in a rural area. The nearest library is 25 miles away. Now the nearest library is on my coffee table. Being able to choose the brightness and the font size is wonderful. I have added some games which load so fast and now I can play or read on the couch and keep my dog and husband company, rather than be across the room, parked in front of my computer, on  the cold side of the house. I know the Kindle does many wonderful things and I will access them soon. As soon as I finish the book I'm reading.

review_headline: ... for my 7 & 9 year olds & they love this thing
review_body: Bought this for my 7 & 9 year olds & they love this thing!  I love that I have controls on settings & it has everything they need, including a rear & front camera.  1/2 the price of an iPad yet it's so user friendly & has all the apps they want. I do recommend a good case as I had it in my tote bag & the screen cracked :-( I was devastated as I'd only had it a month.  To my surprise, it was still under warranty & Amazon is sending a new one at no cost without hassle!  I did a lot of research on tablets before this purchase & am very happy we chose this!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Not all books compatible with new Kindle for text-to-speech
review_body: Overall, happy with purchase for most books that I have, but finding that the last several books that I have purchased have not yet updated to the new Kindle for text-to-speech, but have the capabilities for the older versions.  I would think that every book would be updated for the new Kindle.  Why release and advertise something that has capabilities that can't be used?  That is very annoying for me, since the reason I bought this device is for the text-to-speech option for many of my books, which helps me remember the information for studying.  I have called Kindle customer service on this and they have supposedly contacted the publishers on the books that have not updated but no response from publishers or update showing in my Kindle yet.  So, think about why you are purchasing the Kindle and take a look at the books you are wanting to purchase and if they are compatible with this device.  I am thinking for most people it would work great, since it is fast and I have not had any crashing.  Once Amazon gets this resolved, I would give this device 5 stars.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I love this Kindle Fire! I have always used an iPad mini so I have had a some challenges adjusting to it but in general I am pretty impressed. It is fast and the HD screen is nice and clear. If you purchase one you really need to have Wi-Fi unless you plan to just use it for a reader. The only complaint I have is that it didn't come with any "directions" and I am old-school, so I haven't really done anything to set it up, so to speak. I have just been using it to read and get on the internet. I'm sure there are some nifty things I can do with it. Hey, maybe I will have my kids set it up for me because of course they know much more about all of this stuff than I do. I feel so old, and (really) I'm not THAT old. Sigh. Love it!
Sample provided for evaluation and review.

review_body: The HD display is fantastic! Very fast and consistent wi-fi...i get 60 mbps on my PC and 40 or better on my Fire. I use it with my Fire TV and it works flawlessly all the time. I would recommend it to anyone, but would advise having Prime and Prime TV to completely enjoy this tablet.

review_body: Love this kindle. Purchased for my daughter and downloaded amazon kids free time. Works amazing!! Put a protective case on it and it's held up great with my 4 year old. And I use it as well-we each have a profile set up. It's fast and has lots of memory for storag!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: We bought two of these for each of our daughters for Christmas.  One is 4 yrs old and the other is 9 yrs old.  We were able to set up the Fire's for each child according to their age.  The 4 yr old's Fire is set up for her and icons are made a little bigger for her.  I can limit each of their Fire's to the amount of time they are allowed to be on them.  Example:  At 8:00pm each night the WiFi is set to turn off so they can't watch movies anymore.  For the 9 yr old, we can set it up so that she has to do a certain amount of book reading before the Fire lets her watch movies.  The Fire also lets us limit the websites that each child it allowed to view and what apps they are allowed to have on them.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: This is from just trying to access news sites like CNN. Also
review_body: I've purchased 6 Kindles now (2 as gifts), so I can claim to have some experience with Kindle products.  Just doesn't seem to work as well as my original Kindle -(which pooped-out due to the faulty charging connector issue).  I can handle the advertising, but the Silk browser often fails for no reason and suddenly quits.  This is from just trying to access news sites like CNN.  Also, the body doesn't feel as solid as prior Kindles, with the backing actually flexing and making noises during use.  Let's see how long this one lasts, but I doubt I'll buy Kindle #7 if this one dies soon.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I can see why many people have found themselves happy with this device, it is very responsive, allows you to do most things you can do with any other tablet, and is clearly made of quality parts.

Though there are few downsides, they were significant enough for me to warrant 2 stars. At this point, I simply find the device disappointing. My issues are as follows:
1) There is so little content. Seriously, aside from the kindle reading app and adobe, I doubt I've spent more than an hour (in total) on any available app.
2) Most recently I learned that pdf files cannot be downloaded from EPUB. I'm a graduates student who frequently uses research databases for multiple purposes. This is seriously the issue that sent me over the edge with this device. It's usefulness has since reduced to simply reading pdf files that I've downloaded on separate devices.

For not much more you can purchase a quality device that can accomplish much of what the Kindle fire can, and more.

I have been a loyal customer of Amazon's and I truly hope they give me a reason to keep this device before I can manage to upgrade to something better.

review_headline: Please. have the common apps at your appstore.

What I like the most with Kindle is the audiobooks. Whenever I'm traveling, since I get dizzy when reading I would just put my headphones on and listen away. This baby is also fast with multiple apps running in the background and it's gaming abilities are pretty sleek too.
However, it lacks with the common apps you need on a daily basis such as uber, viber and some apps you have to sideload with mobile1 which you aren't sure whether it is safe for this device or not.

I also hate the alarm clock! My phone died and this is what I used as a substitute which went as a huge disaster. I went to work late because I didn't even hear it rang. Or it's volume was too bad even if you crank it up to max. Seriously do something about that please.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Kindle Free Time is Great--But Use Teen Setting for Older Kids
review_body: We got two Fire HD 7 tablets for our twin sons' 8th birthday and they are going to be blown away.  My customer review has to do with Kindle Free Time for kids and some advice to other parents...the kid's version is described as great for kids 8 and under, while the teen version is described as great for kids 9 and up.  I initially set it to the kid's version because of the age recommendation, but quickly realized 8 years old is plenty old enough for the teen version as it looks exactly like the adult version but with the same parental controls.  Bottom line, an 8-year-old is going to think the kid's version of Free Time is for "little kids" and I know mine will love being in the teen version.  I recommend Amazon change the age recommendations to literacy-based: if your kid can't read yet, use Free Time, if he can read (K or 1st grade and up) then use the teen setting. Either way, both options are fabulous!

review_headline: Initiall experienced frequent screen freezing issues, problem seems to be resolved

The second Kindle Fire I received worked fine for a few days but then the Kindle would freeze up for several minutes mostly on web pages. It then started freezing up as soon as I would open a web page and then would even freeze up while I was just reading a book. Amazon sent me a few troubleshooting ideas for this problem. After several shutdowns the Kindle is working properly now. I have not had a freeze up problem in several weeks.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Buyer Beware!!  My daughters were given a Kindle Fire HD last year (2013) as a Christmas, and up until a month and a half ago enjoyed the product.  However towards the end of December 2014 the Kindle stopped taking a charge.  I did not get around to calling Amazon about the defective product until this February 2015, two months after the one year warranty expired at which point wonderful Amazon did their best to upsell me to a new Kindle fire at a cost of $100, or if I felt like splurging, $150 for an upgraded model, sleazy marketing  I told Amazon that I had no desire to purchase a product but simply have my current product fixed, a simple battery replacement.  I even offered to pay for the battery if Amazon would pay for the labor to replace the battery.  Amazon said the battery could not be replaced and that I would have to purchase a new Kindle if I wanted an operating device.  WHAT A SCAM!!!!!  Instead of giving the client a low-cost option of battery replacement conniving Amazon forces the customer to purchase a new product.  I have both Apple and Samsung tablets that have lasted much longer than a year and would highly suggest those products over the Amazon Kindle.  Based on the poor quality of product and horrendous customer service, I would NOT  recommend purchasing a Kindle fire, spend your hard earned money on the higher quality Samsung or Apple product.

Much larger kindle that I had ordered at Christmas through a great , great deal from QVC and to my shock and surprise started acting up in just under 3 weeks.When I sent it , in plenty of time for an exchange they no longer had any in  stock. So I waited until I could afford this kindle. :-(  which I'm happy to have.  But not at all what I wanted as far as kindled go. It too , "acts up" but will put up with it unless it goes down hill considerably  all the while hoping and praying that it does not as I can't afford the higher priced but much better kindle. Wish kindle or American had lay away or an easy pay type of plan. But alas credit cards or your bank etc all at once pymt.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: After reading reviews for this product, I was pretty confident that it was right for me.  I ordered the 16g storage, because I had enjoyed that on my older kindle. I'm not sure why there is even an option for 8g.  It's true that the plastic back is flimsy, but I ordered a sturdy case with it, so I'm having no trouble there.  The battery drains fast, but it also charges fast, so again, not a big deal.  In general, for the few not-awesome aspects, this is a nice affordable tablet!  It runs smoothly, has a sleek display, and I so enjoy having a camera that faces both ways....my old one only had a front facing one, and it was almost impossible to take photos of my kids.  I also like that the notifications show way more details than my old kindle, and that video playback is displayed on pause up there as well.  I get why a password is required to unlock the screen, but that is pretty inconvenient in some cases.  But still,  I'm not sorry I bought it!

The speakers are all on one side and makes it seem like the sound is unbalanced. It is lighter but I don't like that it feels like it will break the second it touches the ground. The actual tablet and reader function is fine but there isn't any amazing upgrades to these functions that I can rave about. My advice is to wait until a better model comes out. Not a horrible product though. I would definitely prefer it over an Apple product (I've had lots of experience with Apple products).

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Not one, but TWO bad Kindle Fires
review_body: So I got a Kindle Fire 7 (4th generation) HD and used it for about 2 days when the table decided to go blank, like it was turned off. Several attempts to get it back on failed. I looked at videos telling me to hold the power button and it would come back on but that was unsuccessful. Finally we contacted Amazon and they told us they would replace it and we should package the broken one up and send it back. Amazingly, Amazon sent out a new tablet (same brand and model) within two days. Opened it up immediately and started the setup procedure. Then while using it for 3 hours, it crashed. THREE HOURS! Same problem as the first. I am requesting for my money back and will never buy a kindle product again.

review_body: Happy purchase.  Arrived on time, and in great condition.

review_body:
i love my hd 7, works well, i am reading all night. recommend it to anyone who is considering the purchase. I love that i can highlight my own text.
Happy Reading

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I was very upset that the Kindle did not support ...
review_body: I was very upset that the Kindle did not support the Disney Junior app.  That was one of the main reasons why I bought it.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I wanted an Android tablet that could run Google Play apps, link effortlessly to Wi-Fi networks and link to other Bluetooth devices... This device is made to sell Amazon products and transfer files to other Amazon products (Bluetooth). No Dropbox, no Instagram, no Glide and I couldn't even get the Amazon Cloud Drive to work properly (couldn't use the Amazon app on my computer. Instead, had to email everything to the kindle). I'm sending it back and saving up for a tablet that fits my needs.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I purchased my Fire only because my previous one got knocked off the table and into a full bucket of mop water. But it seems it is a blessing in disguise. It is improved from my older one. The picture and sound are wonderful. It has newer features I am excited to learn about. I really don't know how I got along without a Kindle and my new Fire fits me to a T. Loved my old one and this one is even better. Highly recommend for book and music lovers but there are so many more things you can with it!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Better than the two refurbished I bought and had to return.  Also bought one for my granddaughter - great thing for a kid....with parental controls of course !  Awesome that you can now get colors !  I love my kindles !  Have had one for years......

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I am still learning how to use my Fire. Have some difficulty with getting back to where I was.  Also I ordered a 16 GB, but I think mine only has 8. I do think it would be helpful if Amazon would put together a basic users guide to help new users to be able to maneuver and include that in the package. Other than that I have no complaints. The apps are easy to use and getting on Prime is great. The sound and picture quality is really good. I may have more to say after I learn it more!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I'm disappointed that the plug outlet is on the top
review_body: I'm disappointed that the plug outlet is on the top. It's in the way if you are reading while it is being charged. But, all in all I love my Kindle.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Easy to use, easy to navigate. I use it for accessing the Internet and playing games on. I haven't purchased any books yet but I definitely plan to. The screen is big enough to see everything clearly and the clarity of the graphics is great. I love it!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Very nice item given as a gift to my wife! She absolutely loves it. Can't wait to get the tempered glass screen protector. She doesn't want the screen to get scratched up. I recommend to anyone who is buying any type of tablet to get the glass screen protector. You just line them up and they adhere themselves to the screen with no bubbles. I will say that they should only be used once. After the first time they don't go on right. But, the Fire 7 was a great buy with all that came with it. You get the stand cover combo. Of course you have to pay for the perks, but it says it comes with a screen protector, it doesn't. So expect to pay a little more for the item to keep it looking nice.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I absolutely love my new fourth generation! I had an older version and loved that, but this is fantastic! I love having built in emoticons on the keyboard! Everything about it is great!
The sound is great as well as the color, videos are crisp and clear, easy downloading. I'm very satisfied and very happy with my new Fire HD 7! It's much better than expected! ??

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I love the device, I bought it replace my galaxy tablet. But beware amazon will charge you 15 dollars to remove the "special offers". Basically they put advertising on your lock screen when ever you turn it on. They did not explain this in the description of special offers. I saw the special offer tab in the main screen and I didn't mind that. I did mind the advertising on the lock screen. I called amazon and they told me they couldn't remove the advertising unless I paid. I did not like this option.  I told the person I wanted to keep the tablet but I would return it if they couldn't remove the advertising, because they did not explain that in the description of the special offers,  after a couple min they came back on the line and removed the special offers for free.  I did not mind the offer tab I disliked the advertising. Thank you for the help amazon but explain what the special offers are for people.

review_body: I love my new Kindle 7! I had an older Kindle for the last 4 years that finally died so needed another tablet. I own an iPhone so considered a mini I pad but didn't love the size or price. I own a laptop and use my tablet for reading and browsing and shopping so the Amazon connection is a super plus...the clearer picture of this Kindle is awesome plus I like the lighter weight as well. I also love the festive citron color - cheers me up.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Ok as a reading device, not recommended as a pad device.
review_body:
We have iPad and iPod at home. IPad is a bit too big for book reading and iPod is bit too small. I don't want to pay $400 for a IPad mini just for reading, so decided to give Fire a try. Once I turned on the device, several free-trial services, such as kindle unlimited, audible, popped up for my attention. Out of curiosity, I tried a few, but didn't find much usefulness. The cancellation interface was no where near as convenient as the sign-up ones. I ended up got charged one-month service.
The reading experience was mediocre. The battery lasted about 8-hours, shorter than what I expected as a reliable reading source.
The few apps that I tried were also buggy. My son had to reboot the device when he tried to go back to the home menu. To be fair, some other apps did work well, such as netflix, madden-mobile.

But I've gotten used to that and I'm enjoying learning about different apps from Amazon. I really like reading books on it and I've found a lot of free books. Greet gift from my husband.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I have nothing but good things to say about the Fire HD
review_body: Having previously been an iPad user, I have nothing but good things to say about the Fire HD.  The size of this particular tablet is ideal-- it's easy to hang on to and type.  This product offers easy access to apps, kindle and internet at an efficient speed and high screen quality.  My daughter (and I) love the "freetime" option which gives her an individual account with access to kids books, apps and tv shows (for a low monthly fee).  This tablet also seems to be incredibly durable-- this one has taken a few cringe-worthy tumbles with seemingly no damage.  I highly recommend this tablet.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I found it to be well made and a good value. I added a Bear Motion genuine leather ...
review_body: This is the first tablet I have owned.  I did extensive research and decided it offered everything I needed for the money I was willing to spend.  The October, 2014 model has improvements over previous models which make it all the more enjoyable to use.  I found it to be well made and a good value.  I added a Bear Motion genuine leather case and the Armor Suit Military Shield screen protector immediately to give the Fire as much protection as possible.  These were inexpensive add-on's that I would also recommend to those purchasing the HD-7.  One thing to keep in mind.  Customers need to make sure they specify the HD-7 October, 2014 release when they order the Bear Motion case.  This wasn't clear when I ordered the first one and it had to be returned because the "cut-outs" for speakers, camera, etc didn't match up with the Fire.  Amazon credited my account immediately for the returned item and Bear Motion replaced it with the correct model case.  This case is outstanding and a perfect complement to the Fire.  The screen protector also performs exactly as advertised.  You just need to follow the instructions; watching the video on YouTube is also helpful.

review_body: It really is more than I had expected; I cab read all my books and I have found out that the folders that I had created on my Keyboard Kindle are also available in my new Kindle Fire HD through The Cloud. I really like the Read-To-Me feature also. Watching video clips is really awesome, the pictures look great, although I have not really have gotten into testing the cameras. The battery seems to last longer than my old Kindle too and I have downloaded a few apps and games and everything works great! I am very glad I did not pay heed to the people who gave it two or less stars. My Kindle Fire works great and I am truly delighted.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I got my Fire7" used from Amazon and I couldn't be happier! It's so much better than my Kindle Paperwhite. There is SO much you can do on it.

As an Amazon Prime customer, I get to watch free movies and TV shows, and I love the free music I can play as well. The screen has a clear and ample display, and the speakers are surprisingly good for a tiny tablet. Warning: Very Addictive! am hooked!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Good Budget Tablet, but Still has a lot of Kinks to Work Out.
review_body: First of all, I just want to say that I love my Fire HD 7. I'm glad that I went with the 7\\" because it's the perfect size, any smaller for me would be too small. I love that it comes in a variety of colors, namely pink. I think that is a great way to customize and personalize the Kindle for the user's specific tastes.  It's a very durable little tablet. The back of the Kindle is a harder plastic, which acts as a case in my opinion. I have yet to scratch the screen and think that it too is pretty durable. The Kindle Fire HD 7 is definitely a budget tablet. Don't expect to be getting iPad quality here guys. It's not the same OS and it will not perform the same way, trust me. I have an iPad as well. There aren't nearly as many well-tested apps for the Kindle Fire, so there are many issues with bugs and apps. If you aren't careful with browsing the web, your cache is going to build up and really slow this thing down. I clear mine out regularly, and clear my history regularly too, so speed has not been as much of a problem now as when I first got it. Overall, I think it's a decent budget tablet, but still has a lot of kinks to work out.

review_body: This is my second Fire because the first one I received only lasted 2 days as the battery/charger just died. The battery life isn't great on the new one, and it takes awhile to fully charge. Also, the screen tends to freeze randomly. I'm a little disappointed with how many apps aren't supported by this product. On the plus side, the screen has great quality and I haven't had any trouble reading books, which is the main reason I bought the Fire

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: the HD7 does an excellent job in terms of speed and easy navigation
review_body:
I decided to buy this tablet for school so I would have something I could quickly check emails and documents on. In this context, the HD7 does an excellent job in terms of speed and easy navigation.

The screen is large enough to allow for typing on the touch keyboard without any problems and the keys on the keyboard are large enough to prevent hitting the wrong key when typing. You can shift from vertical to horizontal display as well which offers some freedom to change perspective for viewing as needed. The resolution is also high quality (I watched a few actions movies and was pleased with the quality).

Programs for viewing and editing microsoft word and excel docs are available for purchase in the apps marketplace - $10 is a little steep for a mobile app but it helps with school and could be easily applied to a work scenario where viewing word docs or spreadsheets is required. There are also apps for quickly checking emails and youtube or podcasts. Ebooks for school are also available which can cut the cost of books in half if you like that sort of thing.

Internet access is good on campus and I haven't had any connectivity issues yet. The streaming speed is great. So far all the sites I use for school can be viewed on the tablet without any issues.

Overall, the HD7 does an excellent job at providing quick access to content required for my education: word processing, spreadsheets, videos, websites, etc are all available. The device is also much easier to carry around than a laptop. Other than these features, the HD7 can also run popular games without much lag so if you need a distraction every once in a while this will do a fine job there as well.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: The perfect tablet, with some hair line faults
review_body:
Pro:
- Seamless great addition to amazon prime video and music.
- Read aloud and ebook display customization is really great to use at the gym or the couch.
- Screen is very durable, probably could survive without a screen protector.
- Apps like wolfram alpha, calculator pro, one note are great aids to studying
- Reading PDFs and documents is also very nice
- Netflix, amazon video run fantastically
- 7 inch screen size is just right
- pairs up well to my library's ebook/magazine loan program

Cons:
- back of the tablet is too plastically, feels cheap but doesn't look it
- there is no physical "home" button, gotta swipe to the right of the screen to expose it.
- 8GB is not enough since you can download amazon video/prime content for off line viewing

As you can tell I can not give a review as I have not been able to use it.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: They are awesome. The picture quality and ease of use is ...
review_body: I bought 5 Kindle Fire HD's for my grandchildren's Christmas.  They are awesome.  The picture quality and ease of use is everything that Amazon promised.  They absolutely love them and use them daily.  The parental controls are useful to keep young ones out of areas you don't want them to be.  My grandchildren range from 11 years old to 4 years old.  I do however recommend that you buy protective covers for them as I did.  I ordered the Poetic Fire cases (Turtle Skin series) from this site.  They fit perfectly and have SAVED their Kindle Fire's many times from drops.  Don't let negative reviews prevent you from ordering.......I did not purchase the "kid" versions of the Kindle's due to many bad reviews.

It seems to take a while to charge.  I was very disappointed to discover that it does not support Hoopla which would have allowed me to borrow from my public library.  Amazon really needs to fix that feature.

review_headline: ... a Christmas present from my parents and I absolutely love it. I was using an older version that ...
review_body:
I received this as a Christmas present from my parents and I absolutely love it. I was using an older version that was a few years old and it was starting to malfunction, so when my parents asked what I wanted for Christmas, this was at the top of my list. Great display and easy to navigate through and find what I'm looking for. I will say I wish it had the older version of the Favorites. I don't particularly like all those items on my home screen. I really love that it connects through Goodreads since I use that site all the time.

I would recommend purchasing the 5 ft USB charging cable. Mine came with a 3 ft cable, which definitely isn't long enough.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Great for the price, but not quite Apple-caliber
review_body:
I would prefer to have an Apple iPad, as we have a Macbook Pro and two iPhones in the family already. I bought this because it seemed to be spec'd quite well for the price. The display is wonderful. The interface is OK, but not quite Apple-caliber. It locks up and crashes much more than an Apple though. Not enough that I want to give up on it, just don't buy this thinking it is going to do everything fluidly. For example, I tried to go to YouTube on the built-in web browser, and that was a flippin' disaster. It either crashed or locked up 100% of the time. I looked and saw they have a YouTube app; so I installed that, and it works great. Would I buy it again? I think so. Samsung and Apple devices are much higher in price, so high that I couldn't justify buying one and letting kids use it. Probably not myself either, as a laptop is still loads more capable and an iPhone is still loads more portable. But this is 1/3 the price of an equivalent iPad, which even though it is not as GOOD as an iPad, it is still a good buy. It is like comparing a well-equipped Camry Hybrid at $35k (iPad) to an entry level Kia Rios at $12k. They both get the job done, and the Camry (iPad) is certainly nicer, but nice enough that it is worth triple the price? I guess that depends on your budget. For me? This will do nicely.

In addition to my 2 year old daughter playing Starfall, my 11 year old son plays Minecraft on it. This constitutes about 95% of the use it gets. It is great for reading in bed. No lights to keep on that will disturb my wife's sleep. I choose the white text on black background, as this draws the least power and also bombards the eyes with the least light. It was almost as pleasant as reading an e-ink Kindle in daylight.

This device is also great for checking email.

The most limiting factor at this time is the amount of apps available to its Kindle-proprietary operating system. For example, I would have loved to install WeChat and QQ Chat for my wife to chat with her Chinese friends. Those apps are easily available on Droid or iOS. I like the TapaTalk app for browsing internet fora, but it isn't yet available here. I'm sure Amazon will get them eventually. I think the result will be that it is not quite as "open source" as Droid, so it'll have fewer virus and malware issues, but also not iOS, so they can keep the price down.

The colored plastic case provides a little bit of scratch and impact protection, and is more easy to hold than Apple's smooth and rounded aluminum. Still, I went ahead and grabbed my ankles and bought the FreeTime kid-proof case for it. (not necessary unless you're clumsy or have kids)r my wife to chat with her Chinese friends. Those apps are easily available on Droid or iOS. I like the TapaTalk app for browsing internet fora, but it isn't yet available here. I'm sure Amazon will get them eventually. I think the result will be that it is not quite as "open source" as Droid, so it'll have fewer virus and malware issues, but also not iOS, so they can keep the price down.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: She absolutely loves it and has it with her pretty much 24/7
review_body:
Bought this for my wife since I was hogging the ipad. She absolutely loves it and has it with her pretty much 24/7. After playing with it for a bit, I'd kind of like to swap the iPad for one myself. The Fire is a better size and weight for holding -- you can comfortably hold and operate it with one hand. If you've ever tried reading for any prolonged period of time on an iPad, you know that it's not ideal for that. The Fire has great speakers. The iPad we always plug into external speakers or headphones if we're trying to watch something. The Fire has better settings for reading so you don't get the eye fatigue you do on the iPad (yes, you can invert the display on an iPad to give you light text on a dark background but it also inverts pictures). The pros to the iPad are the ability to have multiple apps open at once and hop between them, and, if you're an Apple user generally, the tight integration with other Apple devices (like Airplay to stream to an Apple TV). But bang for the buck there's no beating the Fire, especially if you're a Prime subscriber which gets you access to tons of movies, original shows, music and more. Definitely recommended.

One extra star to Amazon for their amazing customer service. I originally bought it in yellow because they were sold out of just about every other color at the time. We sent it back to exchange for a black one. The return box was mailed out on a Monday morning. That night I got an email at 11:30 pm saying it had been received, processed and my card had been credited back the purchase price!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Software needs to be updated to make these units compatable with other models
review_body:
I bought this particular model for for my wife Christmas as an upgrade to her first generation Kindle Fire. We were highly disappointed that we could not connect it to the tv by HMDI cable to maximize the use of her Amazon Prime membership. While the new unit can be connected by Netgear push2TV adapter, I have not been able to find one in stock and have been told they are being phased out and will be unavailable.
While the new HDX has a great feature of sharing books with family, my Kindle HD, which is only a little older than hers, is not capable of sharing books. You really need to make these things backwards compatable. How about updating the software to make them compatable?
It was good to see that the camera in the new HDX is capable of taking photos from either side, a feature that I do not have on mine. These things should be thought out a bit more before a new release instead of having the customers be the guinea pigs. My $29 phone has a better camera than my Kindle.

I couldn't afford an iPad and really don't need one now. I have two laptops. It's a great alternative to an iPad if you don't want to spend all the money. Also I like supporting Amazon. product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Not the improvement I was expecting
review_body:
First of all, I have to say I owned the previous generation of Kindle Fire 7", and I loved it so much, I didn't think for a second when this generation came out to upgrade. What I loved the most about the previous gen was the stability and performance, I mostly use it for gaming, reading, surfing the web and that sort of things.
Well stability is no longer a feature on Kindle. So far, in the 3 weeks I've been using it, I've had to restart it by 5 pressing the on button for about 40 seconds, like 5 times, something I never had to do with the old one. Design has improved, Is more attractive, and performance kind of improve too. But I hate the fact that it lost its stability. I use it, then lock the screen, and then when I wake it up, it doesn't response (as I said, 5 times that happened)
The other thing I hate is the new charging cable. Its half the previous one, this is a major downgrade, and I trully hope they correct it in later iterations of this gen, or in the future ones.
I still love the Kindle, I'm used to it, and that's why I expect much more.
I'm giving it 3 stars until my problem is solved.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I purchase the Kindle Fire HD 7" in April 2014. I really liked it (this was my 2nd Kindle). In January 2015 the Kindle was unable to connect to Wifi.  I called customer service and after confirming that there was no problem with my internet provider, tried 2 factory resets. Neither worked. When I asked to have the warranty honored and the device replaced, I was told that they need to perform a software check. I didn't understand what that was for but I was told I had no choice and someone would contact me. When I heard nothing after 5 days I called back and again asked for the device to be replaced, I was told that could not be done. When I asked to speak to a supervisor, I was disconnected. On my 3rd call, Amazon finally agreed to honor the warranty. It should have been done immediately.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Holy crap amazon.... I recently purchased a kindle fire 7" HD 16GB (4th gen) I plugged it up to my pc to put stuff on it and BAM bad drivers... so I spent like 3 hours researching how to get this working as conventional methods would yield no results (update driver in the normal fashion or get drivers directly off manufacturers site) and figured out how to unlock the developers mode (this part took like 10 minutes to figure) finally I went and used SDK manager to put the driver I got from a place that is arguably trustworthy (android forums) in and updated it and it worked. I had to use developers tools to use a "user friendly " device in such a way that it was intended to be used. If I wasn't semi android savvy I would have sent the darn thing back and got a 3rd gen. This apparently is a semi common issue that isn't well addressed at this point in time by amazon. I am just appalled that you would release a kindle fire that is one of their big selling E-readers and have such an issue and not put a patch on the device to make it more plugNplay friendly. I however like it now that i have fixed this issue and its not a bad budget tablet once you get past the "can not Xfer data through a usb cable" problem. It would have 5 stars if this issue was not present

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: The Most User Friendly Tablet Available!
review_body: I have to admit - when the Kindle first came out, I was totally uninterested. I wanted 'real' books. But then I decided to put my purist values in the background and try one out. I am now on my fourth Kindle. I guess you could say I'm hooked. For those of you who feel the way that I felt, let me encourage you to give the Kindle a try. You can still get paperback books, but with the Kindle, you'll have access to tons of FREE books, so you're never without something to read. I love the fact that the Kindle is so 'synced' with Amazon. Having a problem? There's always help with a real live person. Not only does the Kindle allow you to download books, but you will also have access to the internet because it functions as a tablet. It has a front and rear camera, and you can even listen to audiobooks on it! (Audible.com is an Amazon company, so everything's already set up for you!). The colors are brilliant and this little device is super user friendly and easy to use, even for those who are not technologically advanced.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: It's a nice tablet for the price yet leaves a lot to be desired
review_body:
I like this tablet. It's fast operating, looks good, has good touchscreen precision, and easy to figure out navigation. Also seems to be safe from hacking or prying eyes. The sound volume and quality is nice.

The downsides:
- "Special Offers", I have found no way to remove these offers that are always on my lockscreen. It makes me feel this tablet was designed exclusively for shopping on Amazon. (I do love Amazon btw)
- Amazon App Store, has very limited app selections. And it requires a credit card to download free apps. That doesn't sit well with me.
- No customizations: backgrounds, lockscreens, tones cannot be changed... or so I haven't been able to do so.

It's a nice tablet for the price yet leaves a lot to be desired. I am content with this tablet and just purchased a case for it.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Not worth it even at low price
review_body: For a hundred bucks it still is not worth it.  It's basically just a regular kindle that you can check your email on...really...but not as good as an e reader as the regular kindle.  There are no apps that I want, it seems they only have games.  Silk browser is not great, links don't open from emails just come up as blank window.  Lots of buggy stuff goes on with apps shutting down willy nilly, books not syncing across my devices.  Camera is not good, pictures are always fuzzy.  Slow moving when typing and auto correct is really annoying therefore I only read emails and don't respond to them from the kindle.  I still use my first regular old kindle e reader more than this thing.  This really was not a good purchase and I don't recommend it.  Customer service was not great either.  I called because I had problems with it and no one really was able to help so I just stopped calling.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: What a waste of my time to have to return this tablet
review_body:
I bought the new Kindle HD 7 Fire.
Kindle should not be selling this tablet when they are very aware that it has a glitch with the pdf files in the documents folder just disappearing from the view. When I plugged the kindle to the computer via USB, I could see all my pdf books and documents, but I could not see them on the Kindle tablet view. Kindle should FIX this glitch before they try to sell this tablet to customers. What a waste of my time to have to return this tablet. of course I am not going to keep something defective. I am sure now, Amazon will try to sell the tablet I return "refurbish".
I am very disappointed. I am buying an Ipad 2 mini. I no longer trust on Amazon kindle.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
There are so many great, detailed reviews of the Fire HD 7 - I'm just going to add my voice and try to distill it into a small bite:

I'm extremely pleased with my Fire HD 7. I purchased it to replace my Fire HDX - which I gave to my mother because she has a lot more free time and loves playing games and watching Prime video in bed on her tablet (she also loves using the X-Ray capabilities while she's watching shows on the big screen with her Fire TV).

Back to the HD 7 - it does everything I could want, and at a great price. I use my Fire HD 7 mostly for video - Prime movies and TV, Amazon original content, HBO Go and Xfinity Apps. My internet connection is strong and fast, and I often listen on my Bluetooth stereo headset (the same one I use with my phone). It's perfect for trips (downloaded content), private viewing when others are sleeping or reading or using the TV for games. It's great for watching something on break or in a waiting room or waiting in a car (wifi or download). It's fast, sharp and the speakers provide good sound.

It's far more capable than I expected! As for the other functions - reading is great, and the games are everything you would expect from a more expensive tablet. Facebook and Goodreads integrate perfectly, along with other social media. For entertainment - this is perfect, and it "does the web" just fine too! If you don't need "the biggest, fastest so & so device" - this will be perfect for you too!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: (My Wife & I both like to read
review_body:
I'm not "Tablet" savvy at least not enough to write a blank overall Review. I can tell you this is the second one in the Family, (My Wife & I both like to read.) I have had a stroke and reading line by line in a book or newspaper is out of the question for me. I opted for the audible books and was pleasantly surprised when the word being read was highlighted seamlessly on the page! Made reading and following along a joy again.
Now I have found out I can control the spaces between lines and of course the size of the text. With this feature I can turn the narration on and off at will. When my stroke problems start to act up I simply touch the sound bar and go right back into narration where I Left off.

After 8 years I can finally read once more!
I love technology!
Ed (DV) Combs

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Wish we would have puchased ipads
review_body:
Kinda disappointed in this device. Purchased 2 for my kids Xmas presents. Was excited about the parental controls. They both previously had iPads and I wanted a device with parental controls to lock out at specific times and well content/Internet monitoring. The iPads have no such controls. With the kindle fire you can schedule access times and block all/most Internet usage, but must subscribe to freetime to truly be able to filter video content and enable filtered Internet access. Maybe I'm cheap, but the monthly freetime fee is a bit high for me so my kids pretty much only have access to apps, no videos, music, books....
Also, compared to an iPad the menus on this thing are herindous. The simplest setting change requires clicking through multiple menus which don't always seem to make sense. Also, why can't we set custom lock screen and background images??????

review_headline: This is a great alternative to more expensive tablets
review_body: This is a great alternative to more expensive tablets.  I have my textbooks loaded so that I don't have to carry many heavy books.  Additionally I added OfficeSuite so that I can download files and do homework assignments right from my Kindle.  I still cannot download to this directly from Blackboard,, so I download the documents on a laptop and then email to myself, which works beautifully.  The processor is fast (for my purposes), and the screen resolution is great.  I now need only one device for most of what I do -- homework, email, social networking, and books -- including audiobooks.  All for just over $100.

review_headline: Broken Screen Issues on NEWER Kindles!
review_body: My Kindle Fire from 3 years ago still works but these new ones are CRAP.  I had broken screens on the newer ones multiple times.  Amazon replaced it the first time but refused the 2nd time when it happen a month later.  I guess you get what you pay for as they get cheaper and cheaper costwise & the manufacturing must be cheaper & cheaper.  Only positive to having Kindles over Ipads is that I can buy 3 Kindles for every 1 Ipad.  Well now that Amazon wont provide warranty coverage, MAYBE I will switch to Microsoft Surface or even the Ipad.  Amazon always surprises me as their Customer service is good about 50% of time & just AWFUL 50% of time.  You would think that I have spent enough money through their PRIME over the past 5 years to get good Customer Service - NOPE!  (tens of Thousands of dollars for personal & work-related items)

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: But set up is easy!! The only thing I found hard was ...
review_body:
Being my first Kindle Tablet it look sometime getting around on it. But set up is easy!! The only thing I found hard was knowing what they were talking about. It was hard for me to find apps. I think it would be nice if they would offer a cheat sheet to show you how to get around instead of just saying go here and there. Also the tablet has nothing on the screen when you get it. Not even the film that comes on electronics faces that you peal off. They need to suggest that you also order the screen proctor or offer it at an extra cost . It would be well worth paying more for it. So if you get one I highly suggest buying the proctor and put it on before you use it. Any dirt or dust will show throw the screen proctor, so it has to CLEAN.
Other than that I LOVE my Kindle an I would suggest it to anyone who ask about it. Closing I also need to say there is so much on there I have no clue about so I might write another review after I get to know my product better

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I had previously given the Kindle 4 stars, but I'm changing that down to three due to quality issues.  My new Kindle simply stopped working after just 5 months; after sitting for a day and a half it refused to turn on, even plugged in.  It wasn't dropped, handled roughly, or anything. Amazon replaced it with a refurbished one, but that one had a malfunctioning screen right out of the box.  I'm going to be asking for another (new) replacement, but my faith in the quality is in doubt.  There are only two function (rather than quality) annoyances I've noticed - the ads on the lock screen are a little annoying (I got it as a gift so I shouldn't complain, but if it were me I'd have paid a little more for no ads), and the device occasionally freezes with certain apps ("Bonza" word puzzle).    However, other than those two small annoyances, I love the Kindle (when it's actually working).  It's a far better size for web surfing than my iPhone, and I can actually print to my wireless printer from the Kindle (revolutionary I know...).  I had initially snubbed e-readers in favor of paper books, but after giving it a try, I'm definitely a convert.  Anyone who says paper books are better should have to lug two 800 page novels around through airport security and spend two seven hour flights holding them.  On top of that, with the ease of borrowing library e-books right from the device, I'm already reading far more than I would otherwise, without the expense and clutter of paper books, or having to run back and forth from the library.  Definitely one of the best gifts I've gotten, and would be completely worth the cost if it hadn't been a gift.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Poor battery. No after sales support.
review_body: I am utterly dissatisfied with the product There was a problem with the audible app. The books i purchased didn't download. and the app refuses to shut. It continues to run in the background and there has been no solution to the problem. As a result the device battery dwindles to zero as soon as it is removed from charging. The customer service tried to blame it on me not using the designated charger, which was not the case. Further, there is no support for Audible in India which makes it difficult to communicate with them. I have a tablet that refuses to stay awake and therefore denies me a pleasure reading let alone a good multimedia experience. The Customer service is slack and there is no sense of follow up. This even as I continue to pay installments for the device. This was one sorry investment for me. And I recommend that those in India refrain from investing in this tablet.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
We are very happy with the Kindle Fire and enjoy the ability to surf the internet as well as to read books. The color is pretty and the device is really easy to use. The product deserves a five-star rating, however...

* One important tip: ORDER EARLY and particularly don't order in the month of December and expect to get it in time for Christmas! Last December we ordered a Kindle and the device never came (it got stuck in Kentucky and Amazon refunded my money without even thinking of sending us a new one). This year the holidays delayed our order by about a month because we wanted the particular color and model. We ordered in the first few days of December, and it wasn't even manufactured until Dec. 24. Then we had to wait for them to fulfill the back orders. We got the device long after Christmas.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I loved my old Kindle Fire
review_body: This is going to be a short review because I think if I think to much about it, it will be a negative review.  I loved my old Kindle Fire, loved, loved it.  I do not love this Kindle.  It looks pretty, sleek and is light.  The resolution, and the display are beautiful.  The "special offers" - they suck. They drain your battery, they totally make me not want to use this product.  I paid decent money for a unit to have to look at "your" commercials to use.  I already paid for your product.  This will be my last kindle fire purchase, as I will gravitate towards the Samsung products.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Freezes Up or Closes Out In Multiple Apps
review_body: Quite often, it spontaneously closes out of apps.  Every 15 to 20 minutes, it freezes.  The only way I've managed to resume without shutting down completely: hit the power button (putting it to sleep), wait a few seconds & hit the button again.  Wait for it to come back up, but when it does, don't slide (if you do, it just goes to the screen it locked on & locks again), then use the tool bar to launch the camera.  Once the camera is closed, I can relaunch the app.  What a pain!    Now, the power cord only charges if it's held or wedged in a certain direction. As it charges, it gets very warm.    Had the 1st gen Kindle, loved it, but wanted something faster.  Ordered the 16GB/Citron/No Ads on Sept 24, 2014, received Oct 20th.  Really wish I'd opted for a different tablet.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I liked it just fine until I needed a new battery. I ordered a  Kindle replacement battery from an Amazon after market supplier which much to my dismay does not match the original battery. My kindle has a battery that is unlike any other kindle I can find.  The battery is attached to a plastic chassis which must be removed  with the battery.  I feel cheated because I was sold a Kindle that has no available replacement parts.  Amazon is no help since they do not support replacement parts. The $95.00 Kindle replacement " deal " is no deal at all. What assurance do I have that the  replacement does not have the same problem? l will pass on the Kindle and look for another brand.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I like my Kindle to read and watch movies. The sound is amazing!  But I've had it less than a month and suddenly the amazon prime video app  won't work. I have been on the phone for an hour with 3 different representatives I could barely understand and and they are at a loss. They said they would submit a ticket to engineering and someone would get back to me in 48 hours.  I'm really disappointed and ready to send it back and get a Samsung.  I got the 7 to watch prime on because my 1st generation fire (which is still going strong) can't play prime movies. So basically I just got another kindle to watch Netflix in better sound and color. Love amazon. But this will be my last kindle. I'm gonna get an android tablet next time. Smh >>>UPDATE>>>> Talked to a technician instead of customer service and he had it fixed in like 3 minutes. Brava!!! Now I am a happy Kindle girl once again. I really didn't want to break my love affair with the Kindle brand. All is well in the world ;)

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Terrible battery life. Save a little more and get a Nexus 7.
review_body:
I bought this as a replacement for my 2013 Nexus 7 that I managed to break. My first impressions were pretty good. The Amazon app store had a good amount (but not all) of the apps I used to have, the screen was good, and the sound was great.

After 2 days of use, however, I'm realizing the battery is absolute crap. This device probably gets half the battery life that I used to get under similar use, and that's being generous. It takes FOREVER to charge back up again as well. It takes 6 hours to charge for maybe 3 or 4 hours of use at best. IT WENT FROM 60% TO 15% WHILE I SLEPT! It's too heavy to hold comfortably for long periods, but with this battery life you really wouldn't have to hold it for long anyway!

Just pony up the extra cash and get a Nexus. There's a Kindle app for that anyway.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I received my kindle as a Christmas gift. Truthfully I wasn't sure if I really wanted or not. However, I have come to love my kindle. I used to think my laptop was convenient. But my kindle is THE definition of convenient. If I want to Google something real quick, shop on Amazon, oh and thing is made for Amazon prime; I take advantage of my prime membership way more now than I used to. I have watched movies on here and the picture is so crisp. I wasn't expecting such HD quality. I can lay in bed at night and read a book without the bedside lamp on so it doesn't bother my husband. I can adjust the brightness of the screen so it's not so bright. You have the option to change the background color while reading a book. I changed my background to black and the words are written in white so it's much easier on my eyes. I figured out that when your typing out, like writing a review, you don't even have to lift your finger off the screen. All you have to do is move your finger across the screen to all the letters and it knows what you're trying to type out. My kindle has made it very easy to keep up with Facebook. And I have become obsessed with pinterest. There are fun games you can download and play. Some of my favorites are the slots. You can download all kinds of apps and books and keep them in your cloud instead of on your kindle so it doesn't slow down your device. The only reason I didn't give my kindle a five star rating it's because sometimes it freezes up. I have a feeling this my have more to do with some of the apps rather than the performance of the kindle but I'm not sure. Now that I have a kindle I'm not sure what I would do without it. I'm so glad I got this as a gift and I highly recommend everybody have one, especially if you have Amazon prime.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I debated about getting a Kindle Fire HD or a Nexus 7 to replace my failing four year old Samsung Galaxy Tab 7 Plus.  My wife got me this for Christmas.  I thought I might find the carousel a bit backward after the Samsung.  I also have a Samsung phone and love using folders on the home screen.    I found the carousel very easy to get used to.  It is an easy interface.  I also like the speed and love the screen resolution.  The screen is slightly wider than the Samsung or Nexus.  This way out-performs my wife's 2012 vintage Nexus 7.  The sound is much stronger than any tablet I have used.  It is clear and its volume will fill a room.  The screen has a type of glass on it that wipes off easily.  It does not collect finger marks.    This is built for video and reading.  It streams well throughout the house whereas we have problems with the Nexus.  It does well with Netflix, YouTube (via the browser) and other video on the internet.  I downloaded the Spirit Clips app and side-loaded the Vudu app.  All work well.    Not all the apps in the Amazon App store are available on the Fire HD.  Some are not compatible.  I downloaded an APK extractor app and got the Vudu and some other apps off my old tablet.  I was disappointed that SwiftKey is not compatible.  I got it loaded but it took up too much screen.  I found another keyboard I am just as happy with.    I read and heard negative information on the browser.  I have found it to be as good as any other tablet browser.    Overall, this is a really good product.  We will get one for my wife when her Nexus wears out.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I am on my second kindle.  The first one stopped charging the battery, so I paid about $130 to upgrade and received my second kindle.  Now this one will charge, but will turn itself off intermittently.  I will not buy another kindle.  For the amount paid, and to get a tablet that works well, I should have invested in an IPad originally.  If you google the problems, you will find that lots of kindle owners experience the same.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: False Advertisement-8GB is really under 4.5GB Free Space
review_body: I'm on the phone with Amazon as I write this.  I bought two of these for my children at Christmas. My son has been getting low storage errors since he started using it, and he only loads simple apps as a 7-year-old. I finally looked at the storage to find that the device only had a little over 4GB of storage.  The second one I bought has the same problem.  I just factory reset one device and ran through some tap here, tap there, force stop this, force stop that with tech support.  The device says 0.92GB used and 4.11GB free.  It's supposed to have 8GB of storage according to the product description.  Tech just got back on the phone with me and said that the pre-installed apps (that I can't delete) take up over 4GB, and this kindle really only has 4.5GB of free space.  I'm sorry Amazon, but you failed on this one.  It really feels like false advertisement when I'm getting half of what you claimed I would get.  I own an original Kindle Fire and 3 other Kindle readers, and I've been happy until now.  I have a Prime account and do a lot of shopping with Amazon, so more than anything, I am just truly disappointed in an inferior product.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Pretty good for reading or watching netflix. Not as a laptop replacement.
review_body:
This is a great little table for reading books or watching netflix. It is also powerful enough to play most of the current popular apps.
The main downside is the firmware and app store. The firmware prevents you from using other app stores and keeps reminding you that this is an amazon branded tablet. Most of the popular apps in the Google play store are available, but others like the youtube app are missing.

I'm enjoying having it as it's a fairly priced pretty good tablet I can use for simple entertainment. For games or work I have another computer.

review_headline: Amazon Tablet SUCKS and its a piece of JUNK!!!!!!!!!!
review_body:
I hate this tablet. This is a piece of junk tablet.

I have this tablet little more than 2years and always used in a gentle manner without mishandling or using to its full extend. After 2 years, everything in this tablet decided to quit working (apps, browsers, etc) and no one in customer service could help me to resolve the issue. I called customer service more than 7 times and finally gave up because of poor response and their lack of knowledge.
The software (IT) team is of no help and I think they have no idea how to solve the problem. I will not recommend this tablet even to my enemy, such a waste of money.

I am a longtime amazon customer but the product they make sucks!!!!!!!!!!!!! I will never buy an other amazon product in my life. Thank god I came to know about the bad quality now, as I was about to buy amazon setup box for my TV, now I will NOT buy it. I will rather spend extra bucks and buy better product.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Not an iPad/tablet replacement, but great device for Amazon content and web browsing/Facebook
review_body:
The screen seems to scratch pretty easily, but I love the function of this device. The screen is vivid. The only thing I don't love is the resolution of text in the Kindle app--it's not great. I assume that's an app problem, but on my regular Kindle, the text looks like paper. Not so with this at all. I can see lines through the letters. There aren't a lot of apps, but the Amazon apps are great. And the apps I have work very well. I can open PDF documents, Word documents, etc. and read them, which is great.
I wish there was a Dropbox app so I could access my content for school rather than having to go online and download it, but I'm hopeful that'll come in time.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I didn't buy the Kindle Paperwhite because I didn't like the screen
review_body: I bought the Fire HD 7 for myself for Christmas to use exclusively for reading books. I didn't buy the Kindle Paperwhite because I didn't like the screen. I do like the screen on the Fire much better, but the battery life is VERY disappointing. Everything I was told and read said that I should get about eight hours of reading time on one charge, but I get about 2-3 hours is all. I do a lot of reading, so it's annoying to have to keep recharging it.

review_body: Love my new fire!!!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Excellent device.  Easy to use out of the box.  Some of the features in this device that aren't mentioned in the device descriptions were a huge positive for me including voice to text and swype built in.  I use it for reading, movies, Facebook, web browsing without any problems.  Additionally I use for work-  I use a web based billing and documentation program for health care.  This is where the kindle shines because the program requires point and click to choose certain options (where a touchscreen works great).  You also have to add narrative in several places (where swype or voice to text works great). This is the only device in this price range that I found that  can do all of these things an works seamlessly with Amazon for all the content there.  I use this device constantly and it is fantastic.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Love my new Kindle Fire.  It takes photos and video. I have 3 kindles now. A Paper white that I use 90% of the time for reading and an earlier Fire. I can hardly wait to get the new Kindle Voyage for reading and I will give my Paperwhite to my daughter.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I just updated to Kindle Fire HD 7and find it easier to handle than the 8.9 that I was using.  Also, several of the apps updated to a newer version when I got them reloaded to the new Kindle.  I did have a problem registering this Kindle, but called Amazon and the person on call helped me get both Kindles back on track in a very short amount of time.  Whenever you have a problem, call them and they are very friendly and helpful.  Thank you, Amazon, for another great Kindle Fire!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Kindle Fire looks great for about a year and a half, then goes kapoot!!!
review_body: I am very disappointed to find out how temporary Amazon builds these units to be.  This is my second Kindle in four years and unless you pay for the added coverage, they really do not intend for you to have the devise for more than 2 years.  My first kindle lasted 1.5 yrs before the screen broke, mind you with lack of contact ( It was kept in a case by my bed), in such a way that I could not read on  the equipment.  I reached out and was told because I did not have extended coverage, I would need to buy a new unit.  So I stupidly did, and this one has stopped charging in about the same amount of time.  It shows me the front page of Kindle Fire and never rolls over to where I can access my books and games.  After a day with the help team, I was told that I would have to buy another unit because I did not have coverage.  If you are going to buy this unit, prepare for the eventual quick demise of it by getting an extended warranty.  I am going to spend my money on another product that actually backs it work.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Great tablet, great price. Highly recommend
review_body:
This is a great device. Bought it as a x-mas present for my 4yr old. We chose this regular version rather than the model specifically for children because it is more customizable. This is our first Kindle device. My favorite feature is how you can download the kindle app on other Android or iPhone devices, and read any book downloaded on the Kindle. The parental controls and user profile settings are great. The main Admin profile has full control over each user profile settings. I have restricted all app purchases under my son's account, so I never have to worry about any unauthorized purchases. Any application I download can either be shared or restricted from user on any other selected profiles.
The speed and processing of the device are great, and rival other tablets at much higher price points. Battery life and picture is great as well.
The only bad part about Kindle is that the "wake-up screen" shows advertisements. I'm not sure how or if you are able to remove these. Its just a little annoying, but doesn't take away from usability.
This tablet is definitely worth what we paid.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I bought this so my kids would have a tablet to use that was less expensive than my Surface.  They love it, and the selection for apps is really good from Amazon.  I like the parental controls and it has been easy for my kids (5 & 3) to learn the pin & navigate to what they want to use on the tablet themselves.  The graphics are good, but I do notice they aren't quite as high quality as my Surface.  However, if I didn't have that to compare it to, I would probably not even notice.  My biggest gripe is battery life... we have to charge the Fire every day at a minimum even if it isn't getting heavy use, where the Surface only needs to be charged every 2-3 days.  Overall, it is a great, inexpensive choice of a tablet, and I like the wide variety of apps that are available for it from Amazon.  I would definitely recommend giving it a chance if you are looking for a mid-line tablet.

Most of all I take it every where I go. The battery life is really great and it charges fast and I have the unlimited  for 9.99 a month and if u love to read it's a really great deal. review_headline: Terrible customer service for defective Kindle!
review_body: I've only had this a short time and it has stopped working. It gives me WiFi error messages and won't connect to Internet, despite the fact that it shows I am connected with "excellent" signal strength. I have spent literally hours on the phone with customer service getting nowhere. They keep telling me that someone will get back to me in 24-48 hours, but no one does. I've been a loyal Kindle customer and am disgusted by the lack of customer service for an obviously defective device.
