product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Pretty Little Tablet: Great for Reading & Listening to Audiobooks
review_body: I've been an iPad user for a few years, but I am also a loyal Kindle e-ink reader. I have had almost every e-ink model, but I had also always wanted to try a Kindle Fire as well. I chose this one, because the price was low, but it still had room for some books and apps. It's not an iPad (which I use mostly for productivity stuff and web surfing), but it's lovely for reading or listening to audiobooks. The speaker is pretty good for listening, but it sounds better when I connect it to my bluetooth speaker for a louder volume. The book covers look so pretty on the screen, audiobooks are easy to find, and I can play games on it as well. It's very nice for reading. I don't intend to give up my e-ink Kindles or my iPad, but this is a really nice tablet. It's not entirely intuitive, but once you get used to it and figure a few things out, it's very easy to use.  Even though I put a cover on it, I chose the blue one and it's very pretty.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: A bit different from my original Kindle Fire.  Very touchy playing Words with Friends....blanks out letters, so I have to wait 'til it clears to make a play.  A tad larger than my original, too.....so, of course, it doesn't fit in the holder I had for the original.  However, holds a charge a lot longer, which is very good.  I only replaced my original as it would no longer take a charge....:-(

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Love it so much! It was a Christmas gift for our son and we all love it! I even asked my husband if I can get one and I will let him use my laptop! We were going to buy him a laptop but I love that this tablet is versatile and the Netflix is a lifestyle changer! No more redbox fees!!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I am so glad I bought this. Two years ago, I bought a different brand and it has turned out to be the biggest waste of money and a big disappointment. I had to get the Kindle app and it deleted books and put books I had already read back on the carrousel. I started out with just the Kindle, and I went back to Amazon and bought the Kindle Fire. So glad I did. It feels good to come home. It's the same size and thickness as most other tablets.  Plus with the cover it handles just like a book, which is what I really like.  I got the color on the back because, frankly I cannot see anything black in my purse. This way it stands out, I can see it at a glance. The pictures and the book print are so sharp. I can really see a difference and I just love it. I haven;t taken any pictures yet, don't know if I will, but I would imagine pictures would also be just as sharp.

review_headline: dissappointed/not what i was looking for
review_body:
pros: good sound for music. if u have prime u have access to all your music books movies and its pretty cool with the xray feature. facebook and pinterest apps work well. silk browser works pretty good.
cons: akward size, bulky and there is no decent cover (ive bought 3) that lets you use both camera withou taking it out of the case. without the case I`m always afraid i`m going to drop it.
not enough onboard storage and no way to expand so unless u r totally using the cloud or all your stuff dont get this one. A far as apps go? dont believe that this is recognized as an android tablet like i expected at the google play store. they don`t recognize it you can only get apps from the amazon app store and most of them dont seem to work

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I bought this item for my wife to replace her Nook. Very disappointed in this Kindle. So disappointed that we returned it. It was difficult to turn on and once you got it turned on it would turn itself off. She had a great deal of difficulty in getting into my archived books. So much so that she stopped trying. When she called customer service and spoke to the person about returning it and she told him about the problems she was having he advised that they had heard about the same problems from other people.
My question is, why when you know a product is causing problems do you continue to sell it.
Up to this point I have always been very satisfied with Amazon. I own an old Kindle and have no problems with it. I have purchased many, many books and enjoy using my kindle. Very sad that you have ruined such a good reputation with such a poor product.

review_headline: Battery life is better than expected
review_body: The 1st one had to be replaced - defective - it wouldn't power up after a week of use. I've had the 2nd one for a couple of months now. Battery life is better than expected, there are tons of apps available, the speakers are better than expected. My primary reason for getting it was to read Kindle books - I haven't been disappointment. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars, is that it costs me $140+ (I got the one with expanded memory, no ads, & bought the extended warranty). Also I did invest in a cover for it - was worried about dropping it and cracking the screen. I'd certainly recommend it to anyone who reads a lot of e-books.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Great investment, just an oversight on the size ...
review_body:
When I contemplated on whether or not to upgrade my Kindle from a 6" to a 7" I decided that the 1" difference would be okay. I love my new purchase, but I do wish I stayed with the 6" screen. I figured it was more real estate for me to work with when I read, but the convenience of having a bigger size doesn't work for me mobility wise. I found that the 1" made a big difference on how I carry it with me.

Aside from that, which is no fault of Amazon just an oversight on my part, I love the graphics and the connectivity works fine for me. It's a great upgrade for those thinking whether or not to go HD. I say go for HD! Keep in mind, however, that HD works only if your internet connection can handle the traffic. SD works well as back up though.

I enjoy being able to hit a button on our Samsung and iPad to see what is open or move an open app to the background. I am disappointed with this product. product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: MUST READ IF YOU ARE GOING TO BUY A KINDLE, MUST READ!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review_body: Returning this kindle. I bought 2 of these Kindle Fire HD7 8GB and my boys' storage was critically low and wifi automatically kept turning off by the first week. I called Amazon to get clarification on what is taking up so much space, since nothing within the settings for storage came close to even 1G. Then I started questioning why the space was considered 'critically low' when only 4.3G was showing as being used.... what happened to the other 3.8G? Sure, no device actually has the full storage capacity for your own personal use, but WOW almost 1/2 of the entire space of the Kindle Fire HD 7 is used just to run/operate the Kindle? Had I known this I would have just purchased the 16G from the start. When I stated I wanted to do return these 8G kindles and buy 2 new 16G kindles, (but I had initially purchased on sale with $25.00 discount) the Amazon customer service rep told me that she could give me a $25.00 Credit for each kindle to return them and purchase the 16G. I asked a 2nd time to be sure that she was able to apply the $25.00 credit twice (1 for each kindle) and she replied with 'yes, the $25.00 credit will be applied for each Kindle, so $50.00 total.' ... UNFORTUNATELY THIS NEVER HAPPENED! I was told they could only apply the $25.00 credit ONCE after I was just told TWO TIMES that it would be no problem to credit for both. Now mind you, I am known for being a Amazon spokesperson. I am constantly raving about how great Amazon is and I have told hundreds and hundreds of people to sign up for Amazon Prime. I have >6 Amazon devices and spend thousands of dollars with Amazon each year... yet they won't follow through with giving me what they originally told me (twice) which was $25.00 credit to my account for each device. This was escalated to 2 supervisors and the answer was still NO. WOW!!! my mind has vastly changed about you Amazon!!! I would have spent more than the $25.00 by buying 2 more EXPENSIVE kindles. But now I'm about to just return both kindlesand go someplace else for a tablet and after all of this I plan not spend another dime at Amazon.... just another giant conglomerate company who has lost sight of values and how to have good customer service and is only concerned about greed and profiting. Best of luck to you Amazon, you just lost a customer. And remember how many people I talked to about how great you were!!! I'll keep talking, but my comments won't be positive.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I debated between a iPad, Samsung Tablet, and Kindle Fire for a long time. I did a lot of research and decided that I was going to go the economical route of getting a Fire. I needed a tablet to access recipes (tired of lugging my laptop to the kitchen to cook), wanted it to fit in my purse, or easily stowed for traveling, and i love to read so it had to have a reading app. I am very happy with what i got. I initially got the 6HD and a week later the 7HD dropped to the price I paid. Amazon gladly exchanged my device so i upgraded to the 7. I use it all the time in the kitchen, have taken it with me on trips, and use it to read. I also realized that i could use it for music and movies! I am a prime member and it is so awesome to have all of these features. Sometimes I get annoyed because I have to have wifi to utilize a lot of the features, but that would be the same problem if I were to get an iPad or Samsung tablet. I love my kindle and am happy i didn't pay an arm and a leg for it. SILK web browser works great and doesn't glitch as other users have said. I use my kindle more than my laptop but sometimes I do have to use the laptop to access certain sites that format funny on the fire, but it is rare.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I was really happy to see that Amazon changed the port
review_body: The charger port is about as cheap as can be made.  In previous versions of the Fire (we own 5 of them), that's the only part of the device that we've ever had problems with - after about a year, the units wouldn't take a charge because the connector and port were "loose" or needed to be propped up on something else to work.  I was really happy to see that Amazon changed the port...that is until the unit broke after only three weeks of using it due to the cheap port not allowing the connector to fit in it right.  Very disappointed in Amazon as we really liked the initial version of these devices.  We still plan to keep one as we are Amazon prime members but won't be purchasing Fires again.

review_body: I have deleted the previous review.  It wasn't positive at all about the kindle fire.  The reason for the change is out of the blue I got a call from amazon customer support.  I had not requested the call.  I thought I was just stuck with my problem.    They took care of things without me asking them.    The five star rating is not for the kindle itself, but for the customer support.    Amazing in a very, very good way.amazon has been wonderful.  Not this time...this had been a very bad experience and has destroyed my trust in amazon that has built up over the years.  I won't stop shopping there but I also won't take amazon's word on anything anymore.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: this is fine for a toddler but for any child older than ...
review_body:
we bought this for my son (11 years old) mainly because amazon markets the freetime function as a way to control screen time for your kid. well, it can technically do that, problem is that's ALL IT CAN DO. when you set up a child's user profile, you can choose a younger child (8 and under) or older child (9 and over). then you have to select specifically what apps/books/videos the user can access. this is fine for a toddler but for any child older than 9 is a major pain. here's why:
1- the child's profile has no access to the app store. so either you always sit with them to browse the app store or you have to give them full access without any control over what they can see(on ios you can restrict the type of content on the app store to age appropriate only).
2- once you download an app, you have to go into the user profile and select that app to give it access to the child's profile. EVERY TIME.
3- because the kindle is tied to your amazon account, your credit card info is already stored into the kindle. which means if you give them access to the amazon store, they can see what you have been looking at. this was almost disastrous during xmas as he could see everything we were looking at and some of the things were for him.
4- also because the kindle is tied to your amazon account, when my son renamed his device to his name amazon decided to rename my account as well.
the kindle is fine if you are buying for yourself or as a glorified reader. otherwise i found the settings difficult to configure and interface confusing to navigate. could be that i'm just too used to my ipad.
anyway, this device ended up on ebay (where it sold for 30% less) and he's saving up to get an ipad mini.

review_headline: I have to say I am very disappointed and wish I had ordered a Kindle similar to ...
review_body: I purchased this item to replace my orginal Kindle Keyboard.  I have to say I am very disappointed and wish I had ordered a Kindle similar to my original.  The battery is so quickly drained and it just will not be acceptable for traveling.  I take my Kindle with me on long plane trips and this just will not work.  The users manual is not very good either.  I hate not having and acutual paper book.  It is very sketchy and difficult to look up items.  Took forever to find out how to operate text to speech feature and delete items.  I really hate to Cloud/Device feature as well.  It mixes read and unread books and is not user friendly.  I may just try a Paperwhite or similar.  I really irritates me to spend so much money on something so disappointing.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Got it as a Christmas present from my wonderful brother.  Have a traditional laptop, but it's bulky and heavy to carry, and I travel enough that lugging it along is a pain (as much as I like having it with me when I'm away).  This is a perfect for me.  It's lightweight, and you don't have to take it out of your bag with security at the airport like you do with a laptop.  It also takes a lot less room.  Perfect for emailing on the road, reading and surfing the web.  Typing on it is a bit of a learning curve, and you need to read what you have written before you send (big fingers, small keyboard on the screen), but you pick up two-fingered typing quickly.  It suggests words as you type based on what you are writing, which cuts down some of the tapping.  The screen adjusts horizontally or vertically and is sharp and clear.  It even takes nice photos.  And, the charge holds for a good while.  I still love my laptop for everyday use at home, but I also love my Fire.  Also received a case that magnetically closes and puts the device in sleep mode (not sure the proper term here) when the cover is closed, and the back folds so the screen sits upright on hard surfaces like a picture frame...nice touch.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: The Fire design spec is not a good fit for the end user.
review_body:
It was a present for my wife, whose primary use is to lookup words when she is reading books. She finds it disappointing that the device loses its charge, even though she isn't using the device much. She finds it disappointing that when she has it set up for her lookup task and turns it off, it doesn't come back up with the keyboard showing. That may never have been in your design specs, but it is still a disappointment for her use plan. We haven't set up either Prime or Unlimited Kindle, because the former is basically a marketing strategy of Amazon, and the latter because she would rather read paper books than e-books.

For all that, the device is useable for her main task, unlike the cheaper tablets I had purchased to get our toes in the water.

Plus, the home screen ads are not very appreciated, either. I can only conclude that the device while asleep is thinking too much. This is a turn off.

I regret buying the Fire and should have bought a Paper White Kindle, or just went to iBooks on my iPad.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
This is an amazing device. Ok, may not seem that way to an iPhone user, but for someone like me who's never had a "smart phone", this little tablet is really cool! I find myself using the Kindle more than I used to use my laptop PC. Checking email is dead easy, it's easier to read my digital RC magazine on the Kindle than it is on the laptop, and typing on the Kindle is really easy thanks to the on-screen keyboard. The "word suggestions" that are displayed across the top of the "keyboard" are context sensitive, and it makes typing even easier. I can lay the tablet on my knees, in landscape mode, and type almost as easily as I can on the laptop. The learning curve on this device is pretty easy.

What was really surprising was that I found all the CDs I've bought from Amazon over the last few years IN THE "CLOUD". As long as I have a WiFi connection, I have access to all these CDs! Woah! WiFi sensitivity is very good, better than my laptop. It's essentially a smart phone without the phone, AND WITHOUT THE MONTHLY CHARGES OF A SMARTPHONE. (We'd looked into getting a smart phone so my wife could use an iSquare card reader at some art shows she participates in, and the cheapest plan was $60/mo.) Of course, having access to Amazon on the Kindle and being able to buy anything at the drop of a hat is another story. 8^) I have to watch myself. But I DID find a couple CDs I've been looking for for like twenty years!

So, now I feel like I'm truly in the 21st Century, I have a "smart device" like most other people in the world now, but on MY terms, no monthly charges, and it's, like, totally Star Trek-cool!!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Sound quality great, but screen too bright to read books
review_body:
Pluses and minuses. Glad I bought it but I will also continue to use the original Kindle Fire that came out in 2011 for reading books because the screen is easier on the eyes (with the tan screen that I call up). When I call up the tan screen on the Fire HD 7, the screen is still too bright for comfort - at least to my eyes. The dual speakers give a better sound quality to the Fire HD 7 so I can listen to audiobooks and streamed films without turning off the nearby fan, which I have to do with the original Kindle Fire where you have to turn off the fan or any other distraction to be able to hear the films.

About audiobooks, another drawback to the Fire HD 7 is the fact there's so much EXTRA stuff on it, that it stops downloading audiobooks from Audiobooks.com and gives you a message that it can't download due to too much content on your device.

And when it does download, it takes a half hour to download (as with my most recent download of a book that wasn't overly long). On the original Kindle Fire, the downloads are much faster and I've never been told there's too much content on my device. I didn't think I had too much content on the Fire HD 7, just all the items packed on the device plus a few extra things I downloaded to the Carousel (a few magazines, books, a one-minute video taken by the Fire HD 7 camera). So to get my audiobook to open, I had to delete other additions to the Carousel.

If my message seems convoluted, I apologize, but what I've been talking about is a big deal to me and I don't like being annoyed by having so much crap on the Fire HD 7 from programs I have no intention of using. In short, I have to retain the three year old original Kindle Fire in conjunction with the new Fire HD 7 to get all my entertainment needs met. Still, the Fire HD 7 is much faster in downloads for Facebook posts and opening Yahoo email and in browsing news sites than the original Kindle Fire. How could the developers of the Fire HD 7 make it more difficult to use in some ways and better in others? In short, don't throw away the old device, it's still good for many things.use in some ways and better in others? In short, don't throw away the old device, it's still good for many things.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
My kids who are 7 and 9 got these this past Christmas. My husband and I looked at so many different kinds of tablets because as you probably know there are 100's to choose from. We finally decided on the Kindle Fire HD....why you ask.....My husband and I try to really pay attention to what are kids see and do and with getting a tablet we were concerned with internet (and all that can pop up) and too much use of the tablet. We decided out of all the tablets that we saw that the parental controls (which included setting time limits for books, apps, and videos and you can even set it to where they can't do anything else but read until there reading is finished) were one of the best we had seen (without getting a kiddy tablet). We also looked at the fact that amazon still has a great deal of choices as far as the books, apps, and videos. Some tablets don't have a very good selection.
We have now had the tablets for about a month and the kids love them and we love them!!! They have their set time to play and they play and get off. The tablets hold a good charge. I did get cases for them before the kids were allowed to use them for protection but other than that you take the tablet out and it's pretty much really to download stuff and be used!!!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: and resolution to my dilemma was amazing, and I received my new Kindle within the ...
review_body: I ordered this item just before the holidays, and it was unfortunately stolen by a neighbor, according to UPS.  After trying to figure out what to do, to no avail (UPS was not exactly helpful which I found surprising), I talked with a customer service representative from Amazon (Zari you ROCK!) and not only was she on the phone with UPS without much luck as well, she sent me a replacement Kindle within that same phone call.  Her prompt response, and resolution to my dilemma was amazing, and I received my new Kindle within the next two days!  Being in customer service as well, I was truly impressed with her kindness, speedy response, and acceptable resolution.  As far as the product goes, I just LOVE this Kindle, and I am still enjoying discovering how it functions differently from the older model I upgraded from, and will  probably be doing so in the following years to come. Thank you Amazon!

review_body: I am so glad that I got this tablet for Christmas. It does everything I wanted it to do and more. My favorite is the Audio books. I can crochet and listen to my books at the same time. Finally an app that I can't live without! ha! There is enough memory for many many books. I got a free month of PRIME for purchasing the tablet. I wasn't a big fan of the Carousel at first. But now I really do like it, it's easier to launch from. A big seller for me was both FRONT and BACK camera's. And all your pictures store on the cloud, you have unlimited space for pictures. You can skype easily using this tablet. There are Thousands of free books to choose from, a lending library, movies and music. You can also buy movies, music and books! ha! They say you can also FLING your movies from your tablet to your Big Screen TV. I'm not that advanced yet.  And if you like to express yourself there are 5 or 6 colors to choose from! I love this tablet!!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
This is my 3rd Kindle and I love it. I had the original Kindle, which I carried in my purse and the 2nd generation Fire, which I kept on my nightstand. My original finally died, last year and I started carrying my Fire, which I found to be too heavy. So, I got the new Fire and it is so much lighter. I have various tablets and electronics, but the Kindle Fire is by far my favorite.

Each of my Kindles have been gifts, as my family knows how much I love to read and play mobile games. The fact that they can sync and I can litterally leave one at work, upstairs and in my purse is great. Not to mention allowing the grandbabies to watch movies on them, while the adults watch the full sized television.

The only thing I do NOT like is the new design of the ports. They go in at a slant and it is difficult to identify if you are putting it in correctly or not. Personally, I think that this will result in a damaged port on many devices and Amazon will go back to the old design.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Stay away from Fire. Very disappointed about the way Amazon deals with a faulty device. Worst purchase ever.
review_body:
I'm very disappointed with the Fire. I've already went through three different devices and all have the same problems: after some weeks it is very difficult to charge them. At some point, I just stop using them. I have never had this problem with Apple products, including the IPAD, no matter how old they are.
I've been an Amazon client for 15 years, I have Prime and consume a lot of its content. After contacting customer support to see if there was some way to solve the annoying problems to charge the battery, they recognized that the Fire has this known problem but since it seems that they do not have a solution or the device cannot be fixed they offered to sell me a DISCONTINUED REFURBISHED model at a small discount from the price offered online. I'm now more disappointed about the whole experience. You can judge by yourself, this is a copy of the chat I had with customer support (btw, to add insult to injury, Amazon never sent me the copy of the chat as they should and it is confirmed in the chat, I took the precaution of copying it, I obviously changed the names):

Me: I have several problems to charge my kindle fire. This has been going for longer than I can remember. First, two kindle chargers went dead, so I'm done using those. Then it is almost impossible to charge with other usb chargers, I have to turn on, turn off, play with the connection after maybe 30 mins i get lucky and then I have to hope that nothing is moved for the next 4 hs. This ritual goes on every night. Is there some way to solve this (I have the latest software already installed, I have seen all your tutorials, etc). thanks
Support: My name is Support and I am from Amazon Kindle support. You??e reached the right place and I will be happy to assist you today.
Are you referring to "Customer's Fire"?
Me: yes
Support: Are you unable to turn on your kindle device?
Me: yes, when it is charged...the problem is to charge it. But sometimes it takesa lot of time (5 mins or more) to turn on, in the meantime I see the "fire" message
i mean, I'm able to turn it on when it is charged
Support: How long did you charged the kindle device previously?
Me: I do not know i leave it at night, some hours I guess
but this is not once in a time occurrence
this has been going for several months, in fact, I'm almost not using this device because of the charging issues
Support:Have you tried charging the device using a power fast charger?
Me: I've tried with all types of chargers
the latest amazon power fast charger did not last more than a couple of months
Support:I'm sorry about that, Customer?
Are you unable to use the kindle device properly now?
Me: now i'm charging it, after 40 mins of fighting with it, I was able to get the "red" light
Support:It looks like there is a problem with your kindle device.
I'm sorry, In this case, replacing the Kindle device is the best option.
Me: but i guess this is a common issue with this device, right?
Support: Yes, Customer.
It looks like the one-year limited warranty for your Kindle device has been expired. Normally, we'll create replacement for the out of warranty Kindle at a reduced price. In this case I can provide the options of the devices which we are offering at a reduced price and if you are not interested in any of these offers and if you prefer to purchase anew device I can offer a special discount on your new purchase.
Me: ok, let me see, but I'm giving up with the fire
Support: Here are the available Kindle Model at the reduced price:
--Certified Refurbished Kindle Fire HD 7", HD Display, Wi-Fi, 16 GB - Includes Special Offers costs $129.00 and we are offering at $98.00.
--Certified Refurbished Kindle Fire HD 7", HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB - Includes Special Offers costs $99.00 and we are offering at $79.00.
Me:r efurbished??
Support: Every Certified Refurbished Kindle device includes the same One-Year Limited Warranty you receive with a new Kindle device, and is subject to the same return policy as any new Kindle device.
Me: I have had so far two "new" devices, one worst than the other, I can only imagine how a refurbished one may work
Support: A Certified Refurbished Kindle is a pre-owned Kindle that has been tested and certified to look and work like new.
In this case if you prefer to purchase anew kindle device I can offer $25.00 discount on your new purchase now.
Me: I do not think I can give you more money for these failed devices, I already spend a lot on your site/devices/content, as you can check I've been a good customer for 15 years, but I've been really disappointed with the Fire
but I see you agree with me, you are basically offering Usd20-25 for my device
Support: I'm sorry about that, Customer.
Me: device
that is probably what it is worth
Support: In this case if there is a problem with these devices once it is replaced, you can return the device for a full refund.
Me: what is the year of making of these refurbished devices?
Support: I'm sorry. I don't have an exact year of making of these refurbished devices.
Are we still connected?
Me: yes
but it is the latest version or a previous one?
Support: Are you referring to a software version?
Me: the software I guess can be updated, right? I refer to the device, is it the same model I can buy new now?
Support: Currently the same model kindle device is not available in our website.
We have more options which we are offering at a reduced price.
Me: so, is it an old one?
please be specific
Support: No, Customer.
Me: i understand it is a refurbished one, that is fine. but I want to understand of which model, could you tell me what is the processor?
Support: Unless otherwise noted on the product detail page, a Certified RefurbishedKindle is eligible for the optional two-year Extended Warranty offered by our third party partners.
I can also offer you the latest model devices at a reduced price now.
--Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB - Includes Special Offers, Black costs $139.00 and we are offering at $125.00.
Me: jajajajaj
so basically you take off a 10%
I'm sorry I laugh
but at this point I cannot do otherwise
Support: If you prefer to purchase any new kindle device I can offer $25.00 discount for your order now.
Me: so the refurbished one you are offering correspond to an old/discontinued model? please tell me if this is not correct
Support:Yes, Customer.
Me: ja, ja, so basically you want to dump on me something that you are not going to sell anyway
refurbished for 100 bucks!!!
I was disappointed before, now I'm beyond disappointed
I guess you are sending a copy of this chat to my email as I asked
this goes exactly as it is to your reviews of the fire
Support: Yes, you will get a copy of this caht to your e-mail.
chat*
Me: ok, I guess you do not have anything to offer me that makes sense. After sending me, not one, but two defective devices, you still want to make money from me selling me an old, refurbished version, that obviously it was also defective from the start. way to go.
Support: In this case it is better to assist you in phone directly.
May I have your phone number please?
I can connect a call right away.
Me: are you going to say something different on the phone? I do not have time. I already lost a lot of it already, and I prefer to have things in written to avoid confusion/miscommunication.
thanks anyway. You helped to make my mind about staying away from the fire. I'm sorry Amazon failed so badly on this one
Support: I'm sorry about that, Customer.
Me: you should, but it does not show. thanks

review_body: I have one of the old kindles with the keyboard and I really love it I got the kindle fire for Christmas I've been wanting one ever since they came out and I am a little disappointed with the way the fire handles thing is I haven't used it a lot online or anything else but it's just weird how I keep taking things off the carousel that I don't want and everytime i download a new book it pops up back on the carousel and other books that I've taken off pop up again so I have to take them off then the loading issue since I received the wifi version not the other version it doesn't work as rapidly I can't get to the book when I first turn on a Kindle Fire as fast as I can get on with my regular Kindle all in all I like the fact that it's in color I like the fact that I can store a lot more books on there and I guess it's just a matter of me getting used to how to do things on the new system vs the old

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: By far the Kindle is one of my favorite pieces of technology. I have had several versions of the 7in and this one was on sale as a 7in HD not the HDX but it had both front facing and rear facing camera but it did lack the ability to have a data plan. Upon receiving the Kindle it was immediately apparent that the materials used in the making of the Kindle were far subpar with other devices I have used. THe back is a cheap plastic material. The other thing I loved about my kindle was the operating system and the silk browser. Other devices had a lag time and I never had to wait for anything. I clicked on a book and BAM..there is was. Using the key board is also a pain in the you know what. It is like it has a stuttering problem. I feel like banging my head on the wall when I try to type anything because of the lag. You can touch a key and it can take up to thirty seconds for it to light up and show up on the screen. Why oh why is this happening?? I am not rich enough to buy one of the newer HDX's but if they are anything like this one , I am not sure what to do. The silk browser even hiccups all the time. One the plus side the speakers are louder than I have ever herd them. I hate the fact that I have to dump on my kindle because Amazon and their products and company profile have me wishing I could be apart of this company.  I am in the process of trying to review every product but more importantly to review books. I have over six hundred in my kindle library but that does not even come close to the real number. I have thousands of things to review, and I hope that Amazon understands that all I want is for them to succeed. I love the power that Amazon has brought to writers and hope one day I will be using their services as well.Amazon needs to do themselves a favor and not sell this product anymore ...its quality is beneath them. And dont get me started on the shipping problems we have been having. This product came three days late as well as other products. When I called to complain they said they would put ten dollars on my account for me to use anyway I want....guess what no money. My husband is about to male me boycott Amazon. I could barely afford this Kindle after I tragically let it on top of the car after a football game. Never saw it again. I have my own web site and I will soon be linking and posting book reviews to the site. I also  to be an affiliate partner, but I will not sell this cheapened down version of the Kindle. I may never be able to afford the 8.9 hdx but I hope that it does not preform like this.alled to complain they said they would put ten dollars on my account for me to use anyway I want....guess what no money. My husband is about to male me boycott Amazon. I could barely afford this Kindle after I tragically let it on top of the car after a football game. Never saw it again. I have my own web site and I will soon be linking and posting book reviews to the site. I also  to be an affiliate partner, but I will not sell this cheapened down version of the Kindle. I may never be able to afford the 8.9 hdx but I hope that it does not preform like this.

review_headline: I Am SO Glad I Broke Down & Got A Kindle!
review_body: I have never had a hand held device other than my cell phone and I really wasn't all that excited about a Kindle until I decided to ask for one for Christmas.  I am SO glad I have this thing.  I can take it upstairs and leave my laptop downstairs if I want to research on the net or shop or...  It has taken the place of my Sudoku books that I take to appointments, restaurants or anyplace I might have to sit and wait.  It takes very clear photos and also videos.  I've been able to figure out the solution to any problems I have had; which is saying a lot because I'm a 60 year old nerd grandmother.  If I can handle it, I would think almost anyone can.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
For only a $114.00 this is a steal. I did not know it could do so many things. It?? really like a mini-tablet. You can surf the internet, write emails or check them. I watch Netflix movies with it, NO buffering, unless I have poor wifi signal.
I have a Star Mapping app that is really cool to use outdoors. No glitches or freezes.

You know the rest from other reviewers.
My only complaint is the BATTERY LIFE!!! Mine goes dead after two or three days of use.
I called Amazon about this and they said about 8 hours is all I can expect. Really??

The Amazon Rep told me they use the same battery in the smaller Fire. Kind of acknowledged in an oblique way
that it IS an issue with MANY users. Other than that, I am so glad I purchased it.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Extremely disappointed.  I eagerly awaited the arrival of this device and followed the instructions to the letter.  After charging I turned it on, followed a few easy instructions and began enjoying.  I put it away on day 3 and it sat turned off for 2 days.  The next day I took it out tried to turn it on, nothing.  Thought perhaps it needed charging so I tried that, nothing........would not charge.  I tried charging it on my laptop to see if the light would come on, nothing.........I tried hooking it up using another USB cable, nothing........  I went to the troubleshooting guide and depressed the start button for 20 seconds, then 40 seconds, nothing.  I have now returned it to Amazon as defective.  Guess it was just a lemon.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
This is a well appreciated Christmas gift to me, so I am only 5 weeks into using my FIRE HD 7. I use it for its ability to READ books to me WITH QUALITY VOICES while I am exercising. The books to which I listen are the FREE classics (I have Amazon PRIME) which of which I heard, but never attacked. Eventually I will use it for watching movies. I am still experimenting with what this FIRE HD WILL and will NOT do.
POSITIVE: I like its light weight. I like its easy ON/OFF for both power and sound. Headphones are not needed, but they help with noisy exercise machines running. Color is a nice addition over my Kindle. The voices reading the books are REAL voices with inFLECtions, and with FEELings!!
NEGATIVE: For viewing I wish it were a larger screen. And I must pay for the recent TV programs I want (this is my one real complaint) and PAYING is a BUMMER! Perhaps were AMAZON PRIME to cover ALL TV costs then I would give my FIRE HD7 5 stars.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: A great tablet if you know what to expect.
review_body:
I have to say that overall it is a solid tablet. BUT know what you are getting and what you are getting in to. I like the tablet,even knowing full well that it was going to be somewhat limited in comparison to a Galaxy Tab or a Nexus Tablet. There are some apps that are unavailable and some apps that are just behind the main android release version. With that expectations set, here is my 2 cents.

The Good:
The tablet feels really solidly made.
The Fire fits in my hand easily and is easy to hold on to.
The screen quality and responsiveness is great.
The speakers are REALLY GOOD all things considered.
The ability to set up a child profile is great. Especially since I can control what my kids see.
The Amazon instant video and Prime music work really well on this.
It integrates perfectly with the Fire TV stick for watching something cast to my TV or if I wanted to start on tablet and then lay down and watch on TV.

The NOT great:
I feel the battery life is not very good. My wife's iPad EASILY outlasts this thing 4x as long. Even my phone doing the same things would be 2x as long.
The limited app store feels lackluster in comparison to the Google Play Store.
Amazon Instant video selection is unclear what is free and what you have to buy in some of the menus.
Pushing an app to the device from the Amazon website, while usually works well, sometimes is clunky and delayed for no apparent reason. (Thereby forcing a refresh of purchased apps from my settings menu.)

I think the tablet itself is OUTSTANDING for the price, but I knew what to expect going in. A solid tablet that can carry out fairly basic functions and while limited, has an integrated app store.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
so far I love it! I do wish Id gotten the one with more room in it though.. kicking myself for that. I didnt realize teh OS took u as muhc room as it does but at least we can put things in the cloud. I was used ot having 600 book on my kindle so was surprised when I coudnt put lots of things on here liek music adn games.. I had one movie, 4 books and 5 games and a few magazines nad was running out of room so I ahd to delete most of them. Fomr now on I'll be putting one book at a time since its so eay to go thru all of my book on my account . I do love that! I can see the covers nad when I open a book It has a little box with a explanation of what the book is about and page count and all that.. on my kindle all I got was the name and author! not even the book cover unless I opened it and went back to the cover( they open to the first page in the chapter)
I havent really figured out hte games yet as I jsut havent had time. I dont have a smart phone so havent played any of these kinds of games nad I ahvent played a compuyter game in years so this will be fun! but Im not sure how many I can have on it at one time.. can I save a game in the cloud? I dont knwo how that works yet. I also love the music and I will be getting a speaker for this.. not that the speakers are that bad for listening if your holding it but if your across the room its just not loud enough. I still havn had time ot ck out a lot of how it works and all the things you can do but I have found it does a heck of a lot mroe than I ahd thought it did! I also didn't think Id like to watch a movie on such a small screen but it swasnt bad at all! surprised me actually so I may be keeping the prime account ( you get it free for a month) I had no idea you could watch movies for free and also didn't know you could download music for free too! that right there is worth it! I got it to replace my kindle which was locking up more often and I didnt leik I couldnt find out what the book was about becuse they have no descriptions on my old one.. so this was a really good surprise! well with the cost! but if you want to do alot with it.. get the larger spaced one with 16 GBs. I wish you coudl add on more but maybe htey will figure out how to make them expandable someday. Oh and you will want a cover so you can hold it and prop it up while reading or watching it though I ordered a bundle so I get a buch of things with it.

review_headline: Well this one is almost as bad. I have to charge it every day so ...
review_body:
Buying the first fire hd 7 the battery kept going dead so fast. I called into support went through some steps with the CSR. She stated that something was wrong, so she helped me get another one ordered. Well this one is almost as bad. I have to charge it every day so I can use it at nights. Not happy about the battery thing wish I had my very first one back \ the one that was not a fire 7 it was called when I bought it the touch. It was great, yes I could not do on it what I can do on this one but still, the battery thing needs to be address by the company. Thanks again for everything.

Karla Morris

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: If this wasn't a gift I'd return it
review_body:
For a tablet "Designed for entertainment" I find myself only using it for just books, as it lacks the qualities and features to be used for any other entertaining purposes.

Reasons why
-Amazon app store; Its extremely lacking in good apps and its the only store you can use to download apps officially, sure you can side load apps but a lot of .apk are hard to find. There is no Youtube app, because it like a lot of other app is associated with Google. which is a big grievance of mine. If Apple and Android has it so should Amazon. I have counted 12 apps that I have one my android phone, as well as my mothers Ipad that can't even be downloaded and installed on this "tablet"

-Sound Quality: There is one speaker and it quieter than my smart phone.
-Immersion reading with Audible- It really suck, I enjoyed it a lot on my phone and really looked forward to it on my kindle,but I will not be using it. The one speaker that comes with this kindle plays the audible books at such a very low level it has to be close to my face to hear making it hard to read. I talked with both Amazon and Audible about this and they said nothing can be done because the kindle is made that way.

-Lack of customization: You can not change the background or lock screen at all. I know it's petty but with the price I pay for this I should be able to do such a simple thing like that. If the knock off brands of tablets and phones can do it I expect a name brand product like one from a company as big as Amazon to be able to do it as well.

I don't know what is to blame for that, but it does cut down on my enjoyment (and I'm kicking myself for giving the old one away).  Also, advertising--especially in the games--is much more aggressive and hard to skip, compared to the older version.  I almost wish I would have opted for one without advertising, although it is more expensive.

review_headline: I so not care if I have the latest and greatest technology and don't care about the coolness
review_body:
I had been looking for a relatively inexpensive small tablet and a tech friend suggested the Fire HD 7. I so not care if I have the latest and greatest technology and don't care about the coolness.factor. the Fire works well and has all of the features that I wanted. I use it mainly for email, e-books and videos while I am working out. The screen is bright with excellent resolution and the download speeds are good. The biggest negative is navigation. At times I get "locked" into a screen and need to power down to get out. I am sure that I will eventually figure.it out but now it is frustrating. The only other negative is that ads pop up every time the Fire awakes.
I bought a great case for the tablet. It is the made by MoKo.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
Awesome product thus far! I purchased this for my stepson for Christmas and he absolutely loves it!
Pros: Everything was pretty easy to set up, added my kid's preferences and apps fairly easy. I am not as pleased with free time as I thought I would be, but the functions that only allow your child on during certain times and only allow them to play for certain amounts of time are great :)

Cons: The biggest ding I see is the fact that in Freetime there is no option to have books read aloud! This is the biggest reason for 4 stars vs 5. I can do it in the regular (non-freetime) portion of Kindle, but this is lacking in FreeTime. I found a book or two that will do this, however, there is no way of knowing until you have waited the ridiculous amount of time for it to download. My stepson is 5, so he can only read very easy level 1 books, but he loves Ninja Turtles and other books that are far above his reading level, so not being able to listen in FreeTime is a big bummer. Also, we download ALOT of library books, and not only will it not read them to him in Freetime, but everytime we get new books from library I have to go into apps for Free Time and add the books. Honestly, I purchased this product over an ipad mini because of the "free time" portion for kids. However, it is not as amazing as I would like it to be. The "learning apps" are pretty mediocre at best. I found much better ones in the app store. Also, apps and books take forever to download vs app store apps for some reason. Also, for some reason audiobooks I have downloaded in Overdrive App do not show up in free time, but this could just be a precaution so kids aren't reading inappropriate material, so technically a pro.

Overall, the tablet is WONDERFUL!! I would definitely recommend this over the kid's version tablet that is all in Free Time.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: What I have liked: I already had an Amazon account
review_body:
I have had my Kindle Fire HD 7 for almost a month.

What I have liked: I already had an Amazon account. So the integration between my Kindle and my Amazon account was seamless.

What I have not liked: I think I was expecting more than the Kindle could provide. I thought the Kindle would be more powerful and useful than a smartphone and less powerful than a laptop. In all honesty, the Kindle is basically a larger version of my Samsung Galaxy but with fewer features. I can not change the background on the log in screen. So whenever I log onto my Kindle, I see a advertisement for something Kindle, or one of their vendors, is trying to sell. This Kindle has a small amount of memory. I think my phone (which is 2 years old) has more memory. Why sell a new device that is already behind current technology?

Overall, I think the Kindle is fair. If you have a good lap top and great smart phone with a large screen, good sound, a nice camera, tons of storage and good speed you really don't need a Kindle. If you just like to have a new toy, for the price, it's okay.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I have mixed feeling about this version. I have the 2nd Kindle Fire and it's so much better, and built sturdier. I thought this would be a great upgrade, not so. It's not all bad, though. I love the sidebar slider when reading a book that gives you the table of contents and book details, such as description, etc. I do love the fact that I get my book Collections now on this device. Old Fire didn't have that feature (which I have on my iPad Kindle app). The bookmarks/notes access is better and I love that. I edit my own books on it, and it's easier to get to my notes and bookmarks. I love the Prime Music app...so far it works flawless. The screen resolution is great. The email app is equivalent. No complaints there and works well for my Yahoo and Gmail accounts. I haven't yet used it for video. The speakers are decent for a small device.

The bad:
The browser is just as slow as my old 3 year old Fire. I was hoping to get a faster browser. Nope. If I'm in my Facebook app and I click on a link, I'll be lucky to get anything on the browser page, half the time it's just a blank page.

Battery: worst ever. My old Fire hasn't been charged in 2 weeks and its in standby mode and still has a 75% charge. This thing barely lasts 4 days in standby mode. It'll last a little longer in airplane mode, but not much. Just reading a couple hours on the device and occasionally checking Facebook and email, I have to charge it every other day. And it takes over 4 hours for a full charge from about 10%...way longer than the old Fire.

Books don't always download properly, i.e. I click and click on it and it doesn't do anything. When I delete a book, I sometimes have to power off completely for the book to remove itself from the device.

And why do random app icons keep showing up on my home page slider? I like to keep my slider clean with only the apps I'm using. But every day, there are random Kindle and funny little screen apps showing up. I delete them and they come right back. So irritating.

review_headline: I should have just sprung for the iPad to begin with
review_body: I bought this for my 55 year old mother. She's pretty tech savy but this ended up being really bad purchase. She has an iPhone, and hoped it would be as user friendly as that. When she called customer service for help they gave her so many steps she had to go through to get something she got confused and gave up. On top of that after 2 weeks it stopped working entirely, wouldn't even turn on and never had any sound. When I called customer service and they ran me through the tests proving it was indeed faulty, they promised to send a new one, but instead sent me a refurbished one even though by warranty I should have gotten a new one. When I called again, they customer service representative was rude and very unhelpful, and then, after all of this, I was so frustrated with their lack of help I returned the whole thing and I'm waiting for a refund so I can buy my mom the more expensive but more user friendly iPad.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Great device but a step backward in software
review_body:
I love my new Fire--mechanically, anyway. I?? amazed at how great the sound is. I?? a heavy Kindle user with over 2,000 books, and the Fire HD 7 replaces a Fire HD (3rd gen). Most of my irritations stem from the most recent software update:

1. Many of the things I often do on my Kindle Fire now take two or three clicks instead of one click. Really unhappy about this--why would Amazon make the Fire LESS convenient to use?

2. Since I use my Kindle mostly as a reader, it's a big problem when books won't open. Some books take longer to open or start to open then close again multiple times. This never happened before the latest upgrade.

3. Another annoyance within the Kindle app is the new response when text is selected. Wikipedia/Translation/Dictionary seems to be the same, but the line of symbols above the selected text has been changed: "Search in Book" and "Search the Web" have been buried in a dot pile. Perhaps I'm an anomaly, but I use both of those a lot, so it's an extra click each time--not a lot of extra work, but annoying just the same when it takes two clicks to do what you're used to doing with one click.

Something I wish the program had is a sound for battery-low and battery-charged. I use it primarily as a reader, although I look up a lot of info online as well. When I'm reading, the battery icon doesn't show, so I have to leave the story to find out whether the battery level is low. Since it now dings when it starts or stops charging, how about adding sounds that will really help readers keep using the product without interruptions? When my phone battery gets to 5%, I get a noise to remind me to charge the phone; when the battery gets to 100%, the phone makes a little rumble so I know it's time to unplug it. I wish the Kindle did something similar.

The biggest annoyance is actually on the Amazon site: The floating menu on "Manage My Content and Devices" floats down so low,hardly any of the list can be seen on a Kindle held horizontally. And it jumps in fits and starts which makes it even harder to see what's there or to click on an item. I use my Kindle horizontally most of the time, and this page looks like it really wasn't designed with the user in mind. Somebody wanted to do something slick, but it doesn't work for the consumer; the dropdown takes half the screen but sadly contributes almost nothing to page utility since it's mostly unused space. This really should be better.

I??e written to Customer Service about these issues and get a response that indicated either they didn?? really read what I wrote or they didn?? understand the words I used. If Amazon really wants to be ??arth's Most Customer-Centric Company,??Customer Service needs to do a better job.

review_headline: This fire is great, as was my old one
review_body: I lost my old Kindle Fire on a recent trip and replaced it with the new generation device.  This fire is great, as was my old one. I had to return the first replacement because it wouldn't "fire" up but Amazon made that process very easy and readily replaced it with another.  I love the ease of retrieving my books and also using netflix and games.  My grandkids also love the toddler games and the privacy settings when they are using it are great.  Also, I travel a lot and my fire fits easily in my purse.  I wouldn't leave home without it!

review_headline: Goodbye Hipstreet Flare 2, Hello Fire HD
review_body:
I had a crappy Hipstreet Flare 2 I got for free after buying furniture from Ashley Furniture. That died, was slow, screen didn't flip in all directions, battery life was horrible.

This Fire HD's battery lasts really long (in my opinion and based on my limited experience with tablets), loads fast, doesn't have network issues (like Hipstreet did), and overall easy to use. I enjoy it very much.

review_headline: beware - no virus protection on this tablet
review_body: Warning for all not computer literate individuals - even though it says "System Requirements Fire HD 7 is ready to use right out of the box??o setup, no software to install, no computer required to download content," IT IS NOT!!!!  It does not come with a virus protection.  All my computers I purchased, always came with Norton or other virus protection.  This one does not, and in one month, my tablet is infected.  Now I have to spend more money just to be able to save it.  Other than that, it is a nice little  gadget.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I love this new Fire, but sure wish it came with WIFI connect on the device as it did with my former Kindle (it had a keyboard). I really liked the ease with which I could buy books.  Now I have to hunt our portable MIFI from Verizon to access anything. This is very frustrating. There are many times when I see or hear of a book I want to read and if I am not close to WIFI, I have to wait to do so. I am a very impatient person who does not like to wait.  Please add this features to your next edition. I love the Fire, but yet a little disappointed.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Overall I'm very happy with my new HD 7
review_body:
Overall I'm very happy with my new HD 7. My only complaint is the battery life. I have a first generation Fire and the battery still lasts almost a full week between charges with heavy use. I didn't really want to stop using it, but there were increasingly fewer new apps that could be used with it and the ones that would run tend to cause it to crash.
I had noticed the battery issue with my kids' HD's, but I had written that off to being a refurbish product, and you take the good with the cheap. Evidently, the newer batteries haven't kept up with the new chips.
Please don't take this as a real negative review, I am very happy with the HD 7. I recommend it to anyone who asks. (Free time feature needs work. There are reading and math apps that don't count toward their "read first" requirement but will count against their allotted minutes for the day. I want to encourage them to use those apps and put the restrictions on the true game apps.)
Overall, very happy. Battery only negative for me.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Not worth the money,  terrible product.
review_body: I got my kindle as a gift that I suggested.  I have used mostly Apple products, don't like when where they are going and wanted to branch out. I though "amazon probably puts out a good product."  I was wrong. The kindle is so frustrating. First off the the touch screen is very poor. While searching the web I will tap a link over and over before it accepts it. Often times I just give up and use my phone. Also it is terrible slow on multiple web browsers. Silk, firefox, and opera are the ones I have used and they are all terrible. Just trying to click into the address bar to start navigating is a struggle then it takes forever to open the key board and once the keyboard is open you have to wait before it will accept what you are typing. I usually have to retype my first 1or2 words. Granted the only other tablet I have used is my wife's iPad,but there is a reason it was $300 more...it works. There is no point in spending less money on something that doesn't work. Don't waste your money. Try a different product or just use your phone or computer. If you want an e-reader just get a regular kindle. I have one of those and love it.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Fell far short of what I expected.....
review_body:
I am hoping to come back and have a change of heart. I asked for the Fire Tablet as a Christmas present since I have the Fire TV and the Fire Stick and both are wonderful. I figured this would work out great. I was sorely mistaken.

I will first talk about what I do like about the tablet. It is small, easy to use, and works well with Prime. It also makes a great remote for both the Fire TV and Fire Stick. The picture on it is pretty decent. I have been able to load and play music and videos that I love to use. The camera works pretty good - better than my phone for sure. Lightweight, and not a whole lot to it... as I said before, easy to use.

Now for the problems. First, there needs to be some updates. I thought at first that it just wasn't updating, but as it turns out it had, and was up to date. And with that I mean most of the apps that I use, for instance gmail. This is a common and popular app that should be updated. Yes, I realize that the app maker is the one who has to release an update, but if they don't feel like it is worth their time, then they wont. It still doesn't change the fact that the app is out of date and it is better to use my phone, computer, Ipad, or other Tablet in the house instead. One of the biggest issues is the battery life. I am not sure if there is just something wrong with my battery, but it doesn't last for anything. I get about 4 hours at best-and I don't mean with a constant video playing either. I bought for my kids - 2 Sero tablets, and a half Defunct Vizio tablet. All three of them have a battery life of about 6-8 hours. I thought maybe I was overdoing the tiny tablet, so I charged it all night, it said a 100%, I left for work after putting it to sleep, I came home and it said 10%. Not sure why it would drain all day while in sleep/standby mode. I have looked up multiple answers and none of them work.

Now, one of the greatest things about the Fire Tablet is the remote control... only it really takes some getting use to. It is very touchy and finicky. I have since purchased 1 random episode of Sponge Bob Square pants that I did not want. Also, when I use the Fire TV remote app on the tablet, for some reason the screen will revert to the small upper corner preview video while in Netflix. At first I didn't thing that was possible, it had to be with the TV. However, trying to diagnose how and why that happens, I could definitively say that it only happens when I use the Tablet as a remote.

When I contacted technical support, I got simple answers - yes, that is normal. Or, no, we haven't heard of that, I will get back to you and I was not contacted back. I have never had to deal with support since everything else I have gotten was awesome. Not really sure if I want to bother.

These issues make this a very hard sell. I am glad it was a present and I didn't spend the money on it. It is definitely over priced for what you get. Compared to all the other tablets I have (minus the Ipad because it's on a different tier with price and hardware) that have a comparable price, I would not purchase this again, nor would I recommend it to any of my family or friends.

Amazon really missed the mark. I was so happy with everything else I have gotten from then, I just didn't think this could be that far off. Not to mention, when my brother ordered it, it was supposed to be here by Christmas, but I didn't get it until after.

At time of purchase, was supposed to be here December 17. Then was back ordered to January 17. Came in early January, but was shipped to my brother's address instead of mine. Yes we double checked that my address was on the where it was supposed to go address. We freaked out because he called me and let me know that it was left on my porch. But it wasn't on my porch. He looked up on Amazon and it was supposed to go to my address, but then on the UPS it showed Amazon had hisaddress. We thought it was stolen, but was sitting on his porch (he parks and enters his place through his garage).

The whole ordeal was not one I would want anyone to go through. I would wait and see if they are going to make any changes that will improve multiple issues, and some common place issues that you would think customers would want taken care of from the get go.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Great value for the price... but
review_body: Battery life is good, screen quality is nice, and it plays games pretty well.  Overall it's probably a fantastic value.  However, I'm really not a fan of the UI, specifically the carousel home screen and I'd be fine with that if I could choose favorite apps or books but showing me front and center ten things I took a peek at in passing isn't really a time saver.  Now if Amazon would unlock the bootloader this would be an amazing amount of bang for your buck with great longevity, but maybe that's the problem.  The Amazon store side integration isn't bad especially the store search in the app menu but I keep opening the main Amazon app when I'm looking for books or apps because there's nothing to distinguish them aside from context.  Unlock the bootloader and this would probably be the best value tablet on the market, those that would take advantage of it are probably few and it would make them very content.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
When compared to a first-generation Kindle Fire, this has horrible WiFi reception. The recipient of both gifts, the 2011 Fire and this 2014 Fire, uses them mainly for streaming Hulu, Amazon and Netflix. In identical locations with multiple WiFi networks (home, the gym, friends' home), the 2011 version streams reliably, while this version buffers constantly (too much to tolerate) and or refuses to play. This occurs at the edges of WiFi coverage, far from the router, but it is in areas where computers, cell phones and, again, the 2011 Kindle Fire work just fine.

The WiFi is bad enough that we are returning it. If there is a solution, I would love to try it again, because this is otherwise is a great update to a two-year-old device -- and at a great price.

review_headline: Super easy to use and for parents to set up ...
review_body: I bought my children tablets as I wanted one they can both download books on as well as use for minor bouts of recreation. This has even surprised me as I was able to put control of both tablets under my account and have notifications of what they have downloaded to read and/ or play. So far the tablets have survived the use of two boys without failure. Super easy to use for them as well as for parents to set up for parental controls. A nice crisp screen which doesn't have the same pixilation as the HDX but the kids love it while playing games or watching shows  during trips. The overall use of the tablet has been easy for them to learn as well. In comparison to the HDX, I found this one to be more bang for the dollar when I knew it would be used by my children. I still get a thank you from them on almost a daily occurrence due to these tablets.  I would definitely recommend this to others.

review_body:
My Kindle has Malfunctioned after 1 year and 9 months. I think this is disgusting for a product from a business such as Amazon. As you only get 1 year warranty, all Amazon will do is offer you a 10-20 Dollar discount on another Kindle. I am so frustrated and I have looked online and see that this happens quite frequently. So if you are prepared to pay the price using the Kindle for 1 year then go for it, if not I strongly recommend buying another Tablet which does not Malfunction so frequently.

I hope this prevents someone else making the same mistake! I am extremely disappointed in this product and Business.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: but I really love that it has parental controls where I can set ...
review_body: We got this for our daughter for Christmas.  I am a die-hard Apple fan, but just didn't want to spend the money to get her an iPad.  It took me a little bit to adjust to how to use it, but I really love that it has parental controls where I can set up "goals" that require her to read for a specified time (we make her read for 45 minutes) prior to her being allowed to play any games or watch any movies.  I also appreciate how I can set up "sleep" time where she cannot get onto the device during certain hours (I can over-ride this if needed by putting in a password).  So, I can ensure she isn't playing on it at bedtime or before homework is done.  Definitely recommend this device and think the features mentioned above make it better than an iPad...at least from a parent's perspective!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Seems it is very common and the 30 second press on the start button reboot is recommended. That hasn't worked very well
review_body: I bought this as a birthday gift for a relative.  The problem is that it shuts off randomly and all that is displayed is the logo.  This happens a lot.  I did some searching on the internet for troubleshooting this problem.  Seems it is very common and the 30 second press on the start button reboot is recommended.  That hasn't worked very well.  You would think since this problem is very common that there is a better solution.  It's a real pain to have to pack it up and send it back and then wait for another one to be mailed out.  At this point, I would say - save your money and don't buy this one!!  I purchased another one as a gift back in June 2014 and after just a few months this same problem began happening to that one as well.  So, I've purchased 3 and 2 of them shut off randomly.

I don't care for the ads that come up every time it's started up, but apparently that's part of the deal, so we deal with it. It's compact, so isn't difficult to lug around. The Fire is the Mama Bear of our tablets...the iPad is Papa Bear, my iPhone is baby bear, and we're Goldilocks!  : )

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
To be a brand new device I found it freezing way too often. I constantly had to hold the power button for 20-30 seconds to reset it or plug it back up to the charger to unfreeze a screen. The 16gb size holds very little and I was quickly out of storage (I also had a 32gb Fire HDX device and found that it too held very little). I found navigating through the device to be somewhat cumbersome. I have an older Ipad and a Nexus 7, both seem much easier to use. I also had issues with the account set up and parental controls. Just a whole lot of little things that made it seem like more hassle than it was worth.
The resolution is great and the touch screen responds beautifully. Having had experience with other tablets, however, I just didn't feel this was a good fit for my family and I sent it back.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I bought for my wife, she has an older ...
review_body: I bought for my wife, she has an older one that she uses about six hours a day. Now she uses them both. I have used it for e-mail and other things on the internet and was pleasantly surprised at how fast it was. It was quicker than my laptop.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Bought this as a Christmas present for my wife. She now has 2, last years Kindle Fire, and this years Kindle Fire. And, she loves both and uses both. The new Kindle Fire HD 7 is a better buy when you consider the upgraded hardware that goes with it. In fact, I got this years Fire HD 7 w/16gb of storage for less the the cost of last years Kindle Fire 7 w/8gb of storage.

review_body: Its awesome

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Feelin' the Love for My Fire
review_body: After watching my husband enjoy the Kindle Fire I gave him for his birthday I realized that I wanted one too.  This was my favorite Christmas present this year. It enables me to keep up on current events, discover the correct pronunciation of unknown words (using the dictionary app), send and receive e-correspondence, download books from libraries, and lastly play a variety of free games.  It is light weight and fits easily into my handbag.  Our daughter was visiting this Christmas and she commented on the fact that the visual display screen of the Fire provided more vivid pictures than her iPad.  Way to go, Amazon!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: If you haven't yet, this is the time
review_body: I had delayed going to a tablet but this is terrific for a very, very modest price. I use it for travel and for streaming music to my stereo. App availability is very good including a wonderful version of the Washington Post (which they own of course). Integration with Amazon for books and music is, of course, very good which for me is a strong positive. It also is a quite good reader.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: So far quite impressed with the Fire HD
review_body: I probably have not utilized all that the Fire HD can do yet, but so far am impressed with its capabilities..  Not sure what the cost was-received it as a gift.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I love it! I have been purchasing Kindles since their inception. This is my 5th kindle. I currently use the Kindle 7\\" HD, the Kindle 4th Gen., and the Fire Tablet, which I just bought. I don't know which I favor most, but my new tablet does everything I need. I particularly like the Goodreads connection. I already received one update. You will win with any Fire product. It was the best gift I ever received.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Perfect size for reading and browsing the web on the go. Super easy to import and sync all my Amazon media. Speaker sound is pretty impressive. Not a ton of bass obviously but I rarely listen to anything without earbuds anyway. Only complaint is you can't remove books directly from the device. You have to login to Amazon and manage books from the site. A bit annoying but not worth removing a star for.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: The other annoying this is the ads on the main screen
review_body: It works great- but my main problem is that the battery gets drained FAST. I don't know if I charged it wrong the first time or what, but I have to keep it turned off with the wifi off. The other annoying this is the ads on the main screen. It's not a deal breaker for me though. Everything else is wonderful.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Great basic tablet. Only problem is that Amazon has it programmed to only use their stuff, Apps have to be designed specifically for this device. Can't get any old Android app. Some apps can only be installed on the HDX. Too limited.

review_headline: I love the fire and the magenta color is bright and ...
review_body: I love the fire and the magenta color is bright and pretty.  It is also easy for me to spot across the room as I have vision problems. I like that it was ready to start using so I didn't have to mess around getting it ready to use. I would recommend it to someone like me who doesn't know much about  how these things work.  I don't need to either I can just use it when I want to. I'm also still learning about it since its my first tablet
