product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Great Display and easy to use
review_body: Display is very clear. Sound works since it has two speakers for stereo sound. The kindle automatically added to my account and all of my music and apps were on the device almost instantly. My son uses it on a daily basis. Don't know if that's a good thing or bad thing.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: So far it's okay...I don't over use it.  Mainly for more reading books, checking email, playing a game, searching the web. I had a problem with it freezing up, repeatedly, when I first got it (the very first day).  I called Amazon's cust svc and they said to give it a day or two and the person said she'd call me back the next day (or two days later-can't recall exactly), during the day, and she didn't call back until the day after she was supposed to call and I missed her call. She left a vm saying she'd call back again but never did.  I've had glitches with my Words w/Friends and Web closing down still and still never heard back from the amazon cust. svc. person.  For now it's under warranty but I'm leery of the Kindle in general because the last one I had to replace THREE times and all were within the year warranty. Not exactly sure the quality is there.  And I think I'm getting sent refurbished Kindles as well.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: This is my second Kindle and it's awesome.  No trouble so far.  Hopefully they fixed the problem with the charger plug that caused my first generation Kindle to stop being used.  Otherwise, nothing is wrong with my first Kindle. Love the front camera feature and larger screen.  I use it primarily for reading so I wish they would have made the screen reflection free.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Love, love, love it.  Have it set up for myself and all three grandkids.  Can also share books and apps with my husband's.  Testimonials and apps time limits are fantastic.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: A Written User's Manual Is Needed
review_body: A lot to learn and know to properly navigate this device.  An accompanying comprehensive print user's manual would have been nice.  This device drains its battery much faster than my older Kindle.  I plan to still use the older one to read books, and the Fire for surfing the web and for photos.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: This is my second Kindle.  My first was the first generation and it served me well over the years.  But it was time for an upgrade and I am very happy with this 4th generation.  I was a bit concerned with the \\"ads\\" but it turns out they are not a problem at all; in fact, some are even fun to research.  I'm looking forward to many happy years with this Kindle.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: This was a gift to myself - I love it!

review_body:
Had to return it to you...no email among oter issues and spent HOURS talking to your phone help...so frustrating.
And since this replaced my Kindle that died after 2+ years now I have nothing.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: big waste of money and time
review_body: This product sucks. It takes 4 hours to charge the battery, the wifi connection rarely works (even when I can get wifi clear as a bell on my iPhone at the same time), the word processing program freezes up for several minutes at a time, the bluetooth keyboard connection sometimes won't activate, or won't deactivate.  If you're even thinking about a different e-reader device, get it.  I don't recommend this whatsoever.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I love my new kindle.  My only complaint us that it occasionally turns off when using the internet.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: works great for videos but not so great for your only ...
review_body: very proprietary...i know, I know.  It's Amazon.  works great for videos but not so great for your only tablet, you would be missing a lot.  I got this to work with my Fire TV and for that, it works great.  Easy to find videos to play and fling em to my TV

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I've had mine for about 3 months now and I love it. I don't have any problems with the apps or watching on Netflix. I do wish they have the multitask option to listen to music and go on Facebook. It seems like you can only choose one or the other. Other than that it works great. I used to have an ipad but i like how small this is and it fits in my purse.

UPDATE:
I have had issues with it randomly turning off and freezing. I even tried to reset it and that doesnt work. When my spouse was deployed, it would turn off during skype dates. It was very frustrating, I would rather have a Samsung.

review_body: I like it, but there is so little memory that you can't download more than a show or 2 at a time.  Not great if you want stuff for a long trip.  May try to upgrade to the 16. (I may be too late)

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: i am unable to exit the games i am playing without turning my system off and waiting around 15 minutes to turn my fire back on and go to another book or app. the tech support person who answered my email states that the fire did not have a way of reading nook books so there was no way to transfer my books, but he did send the request up the line am still awaiting that response. I had to go to Barnes and Noble to get that information. When I tried to download three games apps, the down loads would not take and my fire froze so that I had to do a hard start. The hidden objects screen, even on full screen, is to hard for the visually challenged to see, please how do i delete this game? All in all it is not much different than my nook was in the beginning. I am hoping that in two years my fire does not start flipping pages and zooming in and out of focus

I don't know if that's from the ads on the kindle shows messing it up or what, but it's very frustrating when it happens. Especially since I don't have much on it taking up space to cause the slowness or freezing. Otherwise it's a great product that let's you read, check Facebook, surf the Internet, etc.

We just received our replacement Fire HD and looking forward to the flawless enjoyment and service previous Kindle products we have ordered and used.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Packaging is so NOT Amazon . . . .What a Disappointment!!
review_body:
My daughter wants an updated Fire for her birthday. I went to the trouble of ordering a 16GB version in Blue. It was delivered it its cute Kindle box in a PADDED envelope. I have received makeup brushes in better Amazon packaging.

Tell me, AMAZON leadership, how do you justify sending your signature kindle product with such sloppy presentation. You really should have a special Kindle box for Kindles shipped from Amazon.

I will probably now buy the kindle at Target and hope my debit card is not breached. :(

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I love my kindle

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Great price point, but ruined by its softwate limitations.
review_body: Great value, but I am just very disappointed that Amazon has chosen to go the same way as Apple in that they lock you into their branding.  You are only able to download apps from amazon (google play has way way more apps and is also android based, but the fire won't allow you to download from it without hacking your own device and rendering the warranty worthless).  You are also forced to use thier web browser.  I am a strong amazon advocate and am sad to see them going down this path.  My money always goes to those who promote consumer choice.  I am not the type to support anything in which you take choice away from the customer.  On a positive note, amazon's customer service was amazing when returning the device...

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: It's not bad.  I would have given it 5 stars but when I found out that it didn't come with a longer USB cord and from reading other reviews other people said theirs did, I was disappointed. The one that "came" with the item was so short that when it was plugged in I really couldn't use it. I ended up purchasing one separately and am much happier now that I have some wiggle room. The other reason for the 3 not 5 star rating is, it has no sd slot. In "my opinion" I think a product of this caliber should have one. I wanted to upgrade and get one with more space but that is a deal breaker for me. Also, it doesn't take great pictures. I guess it really isn't meant to! LOL

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Kids accounts can't access the Internet. That's half the point.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: This was a gift for a 4 year old. Works well, but the storage fills up quickly when using Amazon Free Time. Also setting up the profiles was confusing and the help center was not knowledgeable. This will take longer to set-up than other samsung/apple/nook tablets we have. It takes patience and research. I would not recommend if you can find a comparable Samsung tablet.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: HATE IT! First it is SLOW
review_body:
HATE IT!
First it is SLOW... I mean so slow you could go make a sandwich and come back and the app still hasn't loaded. I bought this for my mom thinking it would be a nice alternative to a more pricey Surface since all she wants it for is to to play games and watch movies. This THING just sits in her room now. She is still using my Surface. Facebook on this thing is a joke..as mentioned before IF I could load it I would be able to review.
I downloaded a few apps for my son from Prime.. and they all have ads. Please note again.. he has yet to even play since the ads seems to load faster than the freakin app. Oh and I did buy the ad free one ( I know that is for the screensaver but wanted to toss that out there) Total cost for me for case , Fire HD 7 and add free about $200. I should of gotten my mom an older version Surface since I can still access prime from that.

Wish I could return this crap but I believe I've past the date.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Nice Tablet, the only bad thing is that for some reason it did not bring the wall charger!

review_body: Works fine.  Slow to boot up.  Should have come with a user guide.  I didn't know it had voice recognition.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
It sounds nice, and the screen looks great. Netflix works really well. I don't like being limited to the Amazon market place.
But for an android device it seems way too locked down. Forget about downloading a Google app gmail / calender, sure there are third party apps to cover the gap, but they are inferior.

Even though this is thicker then a Nexus 7, I'd rate it higher, but it's too closed off app wise.

I would not buy again.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
We have had three kindles, 2 Fire HD's and 1 Fire HDX. We loved them, unfortunately, they were stolen. I purchased this new kindle because it was on sale before Christmas. I was guaranteed 2 day shipping and it was supposed to arrive before Christmas. It did not. I received a message two days after purchase saying that it would not arrive until after January 16. I called customer service to complain because online it did not say that the kindle was on back order or out of stock. The kindle arrived on January 6.
The screen looks smaller than 7". After downloading our apps from the cloud, the kindle is at capacity. It will not let us go online, take pictures or use certain apps. Overall, my kids and I are very disappointed with this Kindle. I will eventually purchase another Fire HDX. I hope that I will have a better experience with it.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I LOVED my other Kindle Fire and used it non stop - this one is SO SLOW I cannot do anything with it and I am so disappointed.  I would take my old one back in a heart beat but I wore the poor thing out from using it so much for 2 straight years.

Has anyone else had this problem? My old kindle is still working fine after a few years; I just wanted one with the front and back camera. Is there something I can try before I send it back?

review_body: Will randomly disconnect from our WiFi. All other devices are connected including an older generation kindle. We've found the only way to fix the issue and reconnect is to forget our network, change our WiFi password and reconnect to the network. This makes using the kindle a complete pain and requires us to reset every other device on the network to the new password.

Can't read a book very well when that happens!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Ordered a new one but received a used one that had inappropriate pictures.
review_body: I ordered this as a brand new item for my eight year old (for Xmas) straight from Amazon Digital Services, Inc.  The Item came on time and looked new.  However, my daughter found someone else's pictures saved on the device.  No Lie.  They were inappropriate pictures of a young teenager boy.  No way was this product new.  I emailed Amazon to complain and all they offered was an apology, 30 percent discount if I keep it \\"as is\\".  Or they would give me a full refund or a full return.  My question is?  How would I of ever known it was used had those pictures \\"not been\\" deleted before being shipped to me.  Did other people get used ones but paid for a new one?  How is this not fraud?  I heard nothing back on their investigation of the matter.

It's really cheap compared to other tablets on the market, so I guess you get what you pay for. I think next time I'll just save up and get an ipad.

review_headline: I puchased my iPad a year before the kindle and it still works perfectly fine! BUYER BEWARE
review_body: Don't purchase a Kindle Fire unless you plan on purchasing a new kindle every year. I contacted Customer Service about my first gen Kindle because it abruptly stopped charging. After confirming the charger was working, the representative told me because my Kindle was out of it's ONE YEAR warranty, the only thing they could do is replace my Kindle for $20 less than the cost of a new one. Please review the warranty information before you purchase because if you have a problem one day past the warranty, you'll have to buy a new one. In contrast, I puchased my iPad a year before the kindle and it still works perfectly fine! BUYER BEWARE!!

I have to get past an add every time I turn it on; I paid for this and pay for my WiFi, to get pestered by adds. Bad choice on my part.
Should have believed the reviews that said that this is primarily a selling platform for Amazon.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Bad first impression of kindle device
review_body: Bought as a Christmas present for my son. Have had problems from day one. Might have had 10 small game apps downloaded (no music, videos, pictures, or books) and the storage would say it was full and would not even let me turn Wi-Fi on. Contacted customer service and was promised a replacement. It arrived early, but was the wrong edition. From there I had to contact customer service 3 more times with many issues and never could get my issue resolved. Ended up having to do a full return and repurchase. Still waiting on the new device. Not impressed.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Sad to say it is not up to Amazon quality I expect
review_body: First of all, I am a huge Amazon fan, so it pains me to write this.  We have three kindle readers in our home (starting with a 2nd gen that still works great up to a current touch screen version), as well as a Fire TV, and we have had a prime account for years, so I thought having a Kindle Fire would be an excellent addition to our selection.  It has an excellent picture, decent sound and is user friendly.  However, I cannot give it more than 3 stars (its just OK) because it locks up on a regular basis.  There is no rhyme nor reason as to when or why it will happen.  Sometimes it locks up immediately when I open it, sometimes right in the middle of reading a book, or browsing Amazon.  Sometimes it won't turn on at all.  Anyway, I have to give it a hard boot (press and hold down the power) to reset it all the time.  Its quite annoying.  I haven't put many apps on it at all.  I probably wont add any more for fear it will make it even more unstable.  I hope this is not a sign that Amazon is moving in the wrong direction quality-wise.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: It has been working fine. But today it hung up and will not ...
review_body: It has been working fine. But today it hung up and will not work at all. I am writing this on my old Kendall Fire.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB

I have already had to do a factory reset and it still is not functioning very well. My BlackBerry Playbook is a much better device - I just cannot access as many applications. Still looking for a good tablet that delivers on promises and has a good range of options.By the way; I called customer service when the unit would not respond to "power on" and had to go through multiple associates, ultimately being disconnected without resolution of the issue. I just muddled my way through by myself.

When I press a label like "Books" it takes forever to change screens, or doesn't change at all, no matter how firmly I press. If I want to look at what's on my device, I get a black screen instead of seeing the contents. If I download something, I am unable to tell if it's downloaded. This seems to be an energy hog, too, so I don't want the wireless on constantly because then I have to charge it again. I tried to download a couple of books an hour and they are still not downloaded. Maybe I didn't press the cover hard enough or often enough. Frustrating.

I have to click on something more then once to open it and when I do it freezes and takes about about five minutes to open. Another problem I've had is the screen will randomly go black and it will also turn itself off while I'm using it. I will defiantly not recommend this to anyone! I would rather have my cracked iPad then this piece of junk! I will be selling it as soon as possible and will be buying an iPad mini.

review_headline: both of which I love to do
review_body: I give it a three star rating because I have not yet figured out how to use it to its full potential.  This was a present for Christmas.  I am not tech saavy and the only things that were explained to me is that I could play sudoku and read books, both of which I love to do.  A book was purchased for me to see how it was done.  I have since attempted to buy without success.  It says I need to have a hotspot open, or something like that, but do not know what that means.  So, for now, until I can figure out how the rest of it works, i can't give you much of a rating.  Although, and to be fair, I would like to say that I have enjoyed reading the book very much.  The quality is outstanding!  I like the fact that I can adjust the font size and brightness, and there is no glare to speak of.  Best of all I do not have to have the light on.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Nice product, but Amazon still has work to do when it comes to Apps they provide
review_body: The Kindle Fire HD 7" is a nice tablet and for the price it somewhat forces you into trying it out.  Unfortunately there are just too many issues to give it more of a rating than 3 stars.  Dont get me wrong, its a well built, nice feeling tablet.  The OS is pretty nice and fairly user friendly but so are many other options out there.  One issue with this is that you don't get Amazon's incredible service unless you buy the HDX version. They really should provide this with all of their newer devices.  My biggest issue is that not all software works on a Kindle. My phone can run several well put together applications designed for the Android OS that Amazon doesn't even provide, even though they work flawlessly on several other Android devices. But why not Kindle?  Even if i look past that and shop for the Apps that Amazon does allow and deem compatible for Kindle, literally half of what I've downloaded for my kindle from Amazon wont work. Why? You'd think if they go through some crazy process to allow only certain products on the Kindle that they'd make sure those products actually work with their Kindles.  Crazy how that is.  Several apps crash and freeze the tablet to the point where you have to hard power off the device just so you can use it.  Crazy!  Lastly, the profiles are a very nice feature except that they still have a lot of work.  Its very time consuming to have the Admin download and install software then make it usable for each profile but understandable. But some things only work under the main admin account, not under profiles.  I want my son to be able to watch Amazon Prime when he's on it but in his profile it isnt available.  I can download movies we've purchased and make only the downloaded movies available to him but not the streaming Prime movies or shows.  Its pretty crazy... maybe I'm missing something but I've looked all over for a setting and nothing can be found... this points back to my first issue too, it would be better if Amazon's service would help me out without buying the HDX.  Anyway, we are keeping it and will use it for now but we most likely won't be buying another kindle in the future.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: This product was awesome for the first two and a half years I ...
review_body: This product was awesome for the first two and a half years I owned it.  I have been trying to resolve an issue where the computer does not recognize the device.  This has gone on for more than 2 weeks.  I have reset it to factory settings, chatted, called, and to no avail it is not fixed.  I connected another Kindle to the computer and it immediately recognized that device, and I have also changed cables.  It is the Kindle.  I received an email that someone would call me back with a solution after the manufacturer was contacted and provided a response.  This was due to a software update.  I have replied to that email requesting an update and called.  Two times another person replied to emails with a request for me to contact them again via chat.  I am joining team iPad before the weekend it out because I cannot load my non-Amazon CDs through the computer or Cloud.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Good, not great. When it works.
review_body:
Had my Kindle Fire for a few weeks, then it died. Completely black screen no matter how long I charged it, and resetting it didn't work either.

Called Amazon Customer Service, and they're sending out a replacement. Which is good, but I'm a bit worried about sending back my dead Kindle with all my info on it, even after deregistering it online.

Giving a 3-star rating since I wasn't super-pleased with the Kindle, even before it died. Battery life was dismal, at best, and OS is clunky (not all controls are intuitive and the messaging is a bit robotic). And the hardware feels a bit unsubstantial.

Maybe I'll just stick with Apple products from now on. More expensive, for sure--but wow, no comparison in performance and look & feel.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: ... 7 for a few weeks now and overall I like it. Its the first tablet I've ever owned
review_body: I've had this Fire HD 7 for a few weeks now and overall I like it.  Its the first tablet I've ever owned, so I don't have anything to compare it to in that sense.  I had a 2nd generation Kindle for years and years and got this as an upgrade.  Pros:  Its a reader and a tablet with lots of good features, apps available, etc.  Cons:  It's heavy!  Compared to my old Kindle, it's very heavy and I can't see myself holding it with one hand while I lounge in a beach chair as I used to.  The screen requires an anti-glare screen cover that you have to buy separately.  My old Kindle had an anti-glare glass screen so I didn't have to buy something extra.  You have to be sure to read all the special settings that you must put in place to help keep the battery from dying quickly.  So far I've had to charge it almost every day when only using it for 1-2 hours a day.  Compared to my old Kindle that I didn't have to charge for weeks at a time.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: So far it is has not impressed me at all. Apps run slow and sketchy. I don't think the favorites and collections are very user friendly. The battery runs out within about 4 hours hours. If you turn off the wi-fi to save on the battery you can't use the web or any of the apps so that's kind of pointless for what I intended to use it for. So I have to leave it plugged in if I'm going to use it, which is an inconvenience because I had intended it to come with me wherever I go so I can get stuff done in the car without having to type emails or messages on my phone. The cord is about 3 ft long. It doesn't even reach from the closest plug-in to my bed, so I can't really even use it at home. Not for what I intended anyway. If I hadn't gotten it as a present I would send it back. I don't think this one is worth what it costs. My family has owned other kindle products and really likes them but particular Kindle IS NOT worth it.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Not what I expected from Fire he. There is no google shop, I can't put different backgrounds on it and some apps can't be gotten. I sent a message about it and was told they were working on it. Is this true?

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Still Getting to Know the Fire
review_body:
I purchased two of these for my children intending initially to use Free Time to control their access. I quickly discovered some limitations. First, I chose the fire over the e Ink because I wanted the whispersync technology for my son, but then I learned that Free Time will not allow whispersync to work, which meant he had to access my account, which pretty much defeated the purpose of Free Time, which, let's face it, was really too juvenile for him anyway.

I should add, however, that Free Time is a great option for my daughter who prefers to read rather than listen. We tried out a month of free Unlimited, but we calculated that the small number of apps she enjoyed would be cheaper to purchase.

Most disturbing, however, is the frequency of "freezing" on my daughter's fire. My son's works fine, but my daughter's kindle freezes daily, and we have to power it down and start it up again before the touch screen will work.

I still have high hopes for the devices once I learn to use them more effectively, but my favorite kindle is still the old e-ink kindle I have from years ago.

review_body:
My daughter likes the Kindle Fire HD, but there are too many issues with it such as a very short battery life. It can be fully charged at bedtime, and when she wakes up it is almost dead. Also, the Freetime is a pain to figure out and does not allow her to listen to music without workarounds which I have not been able to figure out. All in all, it is too much work to mess with.

Other than those issues, it is responsive and works well.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I bought this kindle as a gift for my mom for her birthday. Thought I would spring for the gift wrap so that she had a present to open. I think because of the gift wrap the present was super late, it was scheduled to arrive 1 day after her birthday evening though I ordered it 10 days in advance of her birthday, but the next day is not too bad, so I was fine with that. It actually arrived 3 days late, the estimated delivery / tracking information was never updated and the card that was attached to the package and the packing list had been mixed up with someone else's. What a MESS!

I really don't have a problem with the actual product. I have one and really enjoy it. I just would NEVER recommend bothering to use their gift wrap service. It is a total waste of time/money and delays the shipping significantly. I would have been FURIOUS if I had been the other family who ordered their kindle on 12/23 and it didn't arrive until 1/14.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: NO IN APP PURCHASES ON KIDS PROFILES
review_body:
NO IN APP PURCHASES ON KIDS PROFILES. It doesn't tell you that. Your child's profile will be on "FreeTime" which is great, because they get lots of free content, BUT... if you want to buy in-app purchases, you can't. Even with a grown up's password. You just can't. Google it. So now my older child is upset that he built up all this stuff and can't use his own money to upgrade weapons or whatever because he's permanently not allowed. You are allowed to buy apps as a whole, though, which makes it more confusing.

As for me, I love using the Kindle, the HD screen is nice, I read magazines, newspapers, etc. It's way too bright to read books in a dark room though, even on the lowest brightness setting. It has also never froze on me.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Piece of pooh--Fire and Amazon customer service both
review_body: Lightly used for just over a year, and it is now a paperweight.  No, I did not drop it or get it wet or any of the other things Amazon wants to use as an excuse for their crappy product.  And even though I am a \\"valued\\" Prime customer, their best offer is to sell me another one with the advertising package for a few pennies less than they would sell it to anyone.    So here's my response to Amazon:  I will not buy products from Amazon for the next three months...then see if I miss them and my Kindle.  If I don't, adios.    May be time for an iPad.  Yes, they are more expensive, but I have had Mac products for years, and they're all still going strong.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
For the most part it met my expectation. But in one area, a very important area it failed. My wife bought this for me for Christmas, and our Amazon account is in her name and I am on the account as a guest. So when I went to watch a video through our prime account on my new Fire HD it wanted me to sign up for a new\another Amazon prime account, which we already have one prime account already. I tried to sign as her on my Fire HD, but since it setup for me it will not allow it.
Here's the problem I can go to my computer sign into our account (my wife's sign in) and watch any video through our one account, and this can also be done on any non-Fire HD device, so my question is what advantage is the Fire HD, So be aware that maybe another device would be more advantageous if you already have a Amazon Prime Account, the Fire may not be as versatile as Amazon would have you believe. If I am missing something here please let me know.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: My daughter got this as a Christmas gift. She loves it. But I am completely frustrated with it. I have to set it up under my name because the amazon is in my name. And then my daughter either plays under my name, or create an account on the device just for her.  Parent controls are great, navigating around is very confusing. The user manual, only found on the kindle itself, is vague. Any kind of help is hard to find, or to get an answer to. Set up is confusing. My daughter plays the games, but can't get to certain games she likes to play via internet. There is no adobe flash to run them. I am sure there is more she can do, more I can get through Amazon prime, but can't figure it all out.I registered it from the device to my amazon account, yet it doesnt show up on amazon under my devices, and I cant find any answers to help me with this.  I am no expert, but I do pretty well with tech stuff. I am not happy at all with the way it works. Navigating around is confusing. For the price, its great, and my daughter is happy, though she still asks for my laptop to play certain other games.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I purchased this as a gift for our daughter who is 4 years old and I love the Amazon Free Time aspect of it
review_body: Mixed feelings about the Fire HD 7 especially from someone who is an Apple lover.  I purchased this as a gift for our daughter who is 4 years old and I love the Amazon Free Time aspect of it.  The device is the perfect size for her hands and she enjoys using it however there are a few things that can really bother you.  For instance there is no Google Play store which means you are stuck with the Kindle Apps.  Had I known this (should have done better research) I most likely would have passed on it.  Especially finding out that some of the most popular apps such as Disney Movies Anywhere and Disney Junior are not available/compatible with the Kinds Fire 7 HD!!!  Reading books can become very frustrating not only for a little one but as an adult since you have to use certain gestures to exit the book that are comparable to turning the page.  It takes a few very frustrating try's to get the device back to the home screen.  The Amazon Free time is very useful to monitor what she is using and playing with and the content that you can download is ok.  I really think this device has a huge opportunity to become a leader but without having access to more apps as well as compatible apps in my opinion its just ok.  If Amazon can resolve these issues the Kindle Fire HD can be successful tablet.  Most likely because of those reasons I would have returned it for another product but since the box was thrown away we are using it for the time being.

I have had so many problems with this particular one its not even funny.  I read a lot and that seems to be fine.  I also play games on my Kindle.  At least once a day my kindle freezes up.  I have to shut it down to get it to start again.  I can't really say I've been happy with this particular one. Don't think I would puchase again

I have to use the web to get to the site.  I got the Fire as a gift.  Hopefully Sell on Etsy App will be come available on the Fire HD.  I don't have time to read books or watch movies on the Fire , so I don't use those features.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Quirky Device or User Error?  Either way...this is not a user friendly device!
review_body:
There seem to be so many quirks with this device. The screen was constantly going partially black the first week and my kids were getting very frustrated. I think I figured out what was going on. A couple of the apps had not fully loaded so I removed them and reload them onto the device. It seems to be running a little better but is still running pretty slow.

I set the tablet up so that the kids would each have their own profile and I would have my own profile as the main account. It was laborious setting it up. Once I loaded all the apps onto the tablet through my account, I then had to approve which child could play with each app. That was not a problem and relatively easy to do. But, when they go on the first time to use them it then has to load those same apps into their profiles. The app is already on the device. Why does it need to load that app into 4 different profiles??? Does that mean it is taking up 4x the space?

I also decided to take advantage of the free month of Amazon Free Time for the kids. Free time changes their profile screen and adds all the items they can load from Free Time based on their age. It is overwhelming for them. Their home page should only have the items that they have currently loaded on their profile. Maybe it is user error and I'm just not doing it right. Not sure.

I cannot load a lot of the apps that my kids like because they are not in the Amazon Store. I didn't realize that was going to be the case. There are even some apps that I use that I cannot get. Very frustrating.

I am seriously considering returning the device because I feel like there is some internal glitch in it that causing it to run slow and for apps to sit in limbo and not load. Any advice from other Fire HD owners would be welcome in comments under this post. I am gonna give it another week. If it is user error I would love to figure out the quirks of this device. I think I am used to the user friendly Apple products so this one is throwing me for a loop ;)

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Good for kids and adults seeking leisure
review_body:
This is an extremely simple tablet. It does what I want it to do (watch movies/shows, e-mail, check accounts, read articles) and really doesn't go beyond that.
Pros:
- Very straightforward
- Fun color options
- Easy to access Amazon (I use it every day)
- You don't HAVE to buy a stylus to draw/paint/write. Your finger works just fine!
- Doesn't give me a headache or eye strain
- Biggest bang for your buck
Cons:
- I've had some issues with the search engine- I'll type in what I want, press 'done' or 'enter,' and then it opens up a blank page.
- It takes a while to charge. I had it on airplane mode and it took about 7 hours to charge from 0-100%
- Can't download google apps (Drive is the most frustrating)
- There's no official Word app

I would recommend this for older people and children. For those that are trying to sync business and pleasure in one tablet, this is not for you.

I'm connected through my partner's account, so all of those features were not available to me.

First of all, I originally Kindle 7HD with a blue case 10 days before Christmas as a present for my 11 year old daughter. I was then informed it would be arriving on the 27th. Then I was informed it would be here no later than Jan 28th. But, I could order a plain - black cased Kindle 7HD in exchange. I was informed that it would arrive later that week on a Fri. It actually arrived the following Monday. Not that I am a bad sport, but several other items that I ordered on the 15th of Dec arrived before or on the day specified.

That being said, I am more than pleased with the Kindle 7HD and more importantly so is my daughter. Had it arrived in time for Christmas I would have rated it 5-stars.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Warranty doesn't outweigh all the bad...
review_body: Our family purchased two of these for our 5 & 6 year old children.  I read through some of the very well written reviews and from everything I read, the price point and the 2 year warranty, we were happy with our decision.  That's until we've had the chance to use these on a daily basis since Christmas.    Everyday, yes, everyday the wifi is turned off (an automatic feature) because there isn't enough space.  Daily, I have to go through & delete everything so the wifi can be turned back on and the kids can play. How many apps could my kids download that would cause this daily?  That's a great question since they aren't able to download apps, they are just playing the already available games on it. Is it pictures by chance?  Not necessarily.  However, if they do have a selfie session as kids love to do, you'll be having a storage issue multiple times during their daily allotted time.  Why wouldn't my kids be able to play without wifi?  I can still play games and access things on my iPad w/out wifi. Zoodles (an app similar to \\"FreeTime\\") will still work w/out wifi, of course some apps won't play but, many still will.  Well, FreeTime, (the app that keeps them locked into the \\"safe\\" area) will not work without wifi at all, AT ALL!!!! so my children initially kept getting frustrated thinking they had broken it or it had gone bad and I have to fix the storage AGAIN and turn the wifi back on AGAIN.    Also, I didn't realize how much I would want to \\"push\\" certain apps into the educational category.  Of course it makes good business sense to only have \\"book\\" (good call Kindle/Amazon.  Good call. I bet your stockholders are happy with that one.) apps count as education however, we are working on phonics, writing, math, letter recognition all of which I should be able to indicate that I want these apps to be accessed during the \\"education only\\" time allotment.  My six year old needs beginner base level reading books, her age selection evidently puts her at more advanced booksand education time only lets her read.... She quickly gets bored and frustrated and wants to do something else.    We also had the first Kindle freeze w/in a few hours and after two TS calls (the first promised a return call & never called back!) discovered it was a system hardware issue and TS refused to comment if this was a high occurring issue (integrity issue/red flag!).  Of course they issued a replacement Kindle however, whether or not it's new or a refurbished, I can't be sure, I haven't researched that.    We've had these for nineteen days so far and the android \\"lag\\" is already evident and showing.  Also, many popular apps aren't Kindle friendly.  Google Play also isn't an option.  Play nice Amazon, nobody likes haters.    The positives: that warranty.  However, with the frustrations make it totally not worth it, IMO.    Lesson: Returning these for a full refund and paying an extra $79 for iPad minis plus the cost of a case because the fluidity, the memory, the camera, high selection of quality kid apps loaded to apple platform first just make it a better choice for me and my family.  Plus OSMO is only available with iPads, my kids LOVE that app.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Amazon's insistence upon denying me of my own device and its capabilities
review_body: I got a Kindle Fire HD as a gift. It was affordable, fairly fast, and of fairly high quality. However, my personal freedoms outweigh Amazon's obsession with their walled-garden Appstore service that has none of the applications that actually serveany purpose to me. With the recent update, Amazon appears to have done nothing but unroot my device, delete most of my applications and important data, and give me some free music, presumably in an attempt to satiate my undoubted rage that whenceforth ensued. I understand that rooting your device is against Amazon's Terms of Service involving the device, but going out of one's way to take away the customer's rights involving their own piece of hardware, and in turn taking away one of the most important traits of any Linux system: freedom, is simply and undeniably horrible business practice. I am one whose philosophies involving software are that above all else, the ability to have the freedom to do whatever one must to achieve their goals is absolutely essential. This is why I use Linux. It has become clear to me that Amazon does not care for the only reasons Android exists, through managing to not make their system open, and also managing to make the software you install on it locked as well. I will cease using Amazon products completely once I procure enough money to buy a new tablet. In the meantime, I will attempt to order a factory cable from which to load CyanogenMod onto my device, an action I was going to do anyways, but seems to have been rushed in Amazon's removal of my personal digital liberties. I hope this serves as a warning to those few who realize the importance of these types of things that I, for one, cannot stand for any longer.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Device itself is great, freetime has never worked properly
review_body: My kids got kindle fires last Christmas (2013) from their grandparents. We try to limit our kids exposure to electronics and thought this was the perfect choice as freetime would allow us to set times and would automatically turn off. Boy were we wrong. Freetime has been a complete joke. It never keeps time properly, sometimes will pass 15 mins in about 2 and their time is up. Sometimes I will turn the time on or off and it will go back to how it was before. So, I may have set a time limit and I turn around and the kids are still playing because the time limits have turned themselves off. One kid may end up playing and the time goes off too quick and the other doesn't so they don't understand why one gets more time than the other. That was the entire purpose of choosing this particular device. If I wanted them to have free reign I would've bought something else. Freetime does seem to at least adhere to the app so that they can't get out of it and onto the Internet or whatever else but it is still super annoying that the app rarely works properly with the timing. It will also not allow any "bundles" to be added onto games which my kids were bummed about. I spent probably 5 hours total on the phone with people at Amazon trying to get things to work and they never have so I finally gave up. I even emailed in the logs from the device and they told me I shouldnt have any more timing issues but they continue. The only thing I know to do is completely delete the freetime app and load it again. I haven't tried that yet.....

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: We purchased two of these for Christmas for our Son and Daughter, and purchased an Apple iPod and iPad for our older son and daughter at the same time.  This has given me the chance to have all 4 devices in use for the past 4 weeks.  I\\"m on the verge of returning the kindles at this point and swapping them out.  My main complaint is how limited a \\"child\\" or \\"teen\\" profile is.  Out of the box the only thing that works for a child or teen is the camera.  Kid wants to use the calculator for homework?  Sorry.  Want to have an email account.  No go.  I called Amazon tech support and the only way around this is to buy a 3rd party app for the calculator or email, as you can't get the default Kindle apps to work in the child / teen profiles.  The other alternative was to create an adult profile for the kids, but that requires me to create separate Amazon accounts for them.  Another complaint is the time limit settings per day.  The time limits differentiate between reading, video and apps.  Unfortunately, all apps are the same so even if they're using a \\"good\\" app like a math program, that uses their time.  Once they run out of time there's no way for me to add say another 30 minutes for the day.  My only option is to either increase their time allowance overall, or disable it altogether.  I called Amazon tech support and shared these concerns with them, but there was very little they could do other than share my feedback (understandably).  Maybe we just have unique use cases, but for us, these devices don't work, and I think it's time to swap out for a more functional but albeit more expensive idevice.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Cheap, but not worth it.  Software is confusing but doesn't give you any actual control.
review_body:
We bought these for our kids for Christmas because they had nexus 7's before from relatives, and they were great. These however are horrible. The hardware seems sufficient, but the software is a mess. Their lauded child management option "freetime" is of course subscription based, but even if you have the subscription managing what the kids do and do not have access to is a nightmare.

You have to log into your adult profile, turn off parental controls (which requires two password entries, one to get to the screen, and another to turn it off), then you buy the app and install it, but the install only goes to your adult profile, you then need to associate it to the child profile, turn the parental controls back on (two more password entries), log out of the adult profile, log into the child profile, then go to the apps tab, and install it all over again on the child profile.

Only after all of that can your kid play the game, app, whatever.

My wife and I use this little tablet games as reward for chores, and they can also save up money to buy in game stuff, but with the Fire tablet you CANNOT make any ingame purchases with a child profile. There is no way around this, no setting to type in your parent password twice to let them make the purchase.

I saw that amazon had this Amazon coins that could be used for in game purchases. I thought great, this must be the way to allow your kids to buy stuff in apps, assign some coins to their profile, and they cant' ever spend more than you give them. Perfect.

NOPE, can't do that either, child profiles cannot make any purchase whatsoever. I just spent 15 minutes walking my wife through trying to add a spelling game to my daughters tablet, it's ridiculous.

Google's ecosystem and tablets were much easier to manage, and gave me full control of what my kids could and couldn't do.

The amazon Fire is a mess. I definitely won't be buying one again.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I gave this Kindles Fire several chances to change my mind about giving this one-star review. The reason for the one-star is not for it's actual performance -- which, unfortunately, I never really was able to enjoy -- but instead is for the fact this Kindle Fire is just a dud. Perhaps that's the reason they were practically given away this past holiday season.

The battery never fully charges (and there was also no way to know if it WAS charging -- it certainly never popped up stating it WAS fully charged. But I have no way of knowing if that is even something this Kindle does, because there is not a user guide)

After charging, the Kindle would operate for less than one day. It would then take TWO days to re-charge!! TWO days! Was it the charger?
Hmmm... the charger was generic in nature, no way to tell if was OEM. It wasn't wrapped in the package. I tried different charger. A message would pop up with each charger stating charger was "low flow" and indicating the Kindle couldn't be used while attached to the charger. Not sure how much longer a "low flow" charger would take than the Kindle charger because I didn't want to take a chance it would harm the device.

I am sorry to say this but, I am pretty sure this was re-conditioned and not new. The box was NOT sealed. There were no directions, user guide or anything accompanying the item but it's unwrapped, unsealed charger.

My bad, I threw out the packaging. It is doubtful there would be a successful return because of this. Did I even try. No. First to admit, I didn't even make the effort. Why: Lately, my returns w/ Amazon have been less than satisfactory, and my contribution to the return of this item will most likely cost me more time than I am willing to give.

So that's my review. Doubtful I will ever buy another Amazon electronic.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: At least hate the one I got. Received as Christmas gift to replace a Kindle that had "died" November 2014 after  few years of use. Missed the device greatly as I am an avid reader, both of Kindle fare and hard copy material.  Received the Fire HD7 as a Christmas gift but delayed getting it up an running as ill with flu, then pneumonia. Finally got all set up, transferred my library, started reading  a new book....and it died.  Working fine, put on charger at bedtime as usual, awoke next day to find frozen....unfortunately in off/signed out mode.  Company sending replacement but think less than two weeks use of any electronic device before becoming inoperable is outrageous and inexcusable.  Also, I have to return the faulty device but since frozen in off position, have no way to access and clear information I put on the device before returning.  My advice? Don't buy. If anything scratch the Kindle and get a simple reader.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: DO NOT BUY A KINDLE! I bought a Kindle device to download a txt book and when I tried to purchase it, I was only allowed to download it to either my Android or Mac device (via a Kindle reading app). When I contacted an Amazon customer support rep (Ryan) to find out why, I was told that each Kindle device has limited access to only the Kindle materials which each publisher allows. I was outraged! This is false advertising on the part of Amazon's marketing team, which suggests to buyers that by making a purchase, they will have complete access to the wide assortment of Kindle compatible materials and do not overtly forewarn of the device's limitations. So buyer beware: if you buy a Kindle product, you may or may not have access to the Kindle material you want to purchase digitally. You're better off just downloading the free app to an alternate device and saving your money.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: This is my third Kindle.  I have an original black and white Kindle that is an original book only version, and a first generation Kindle Fire.  I purchased the Fire HD 7 because I thought that not only would I have the latest and greatest video ability, but everything including my apps from my previous Kindle Fire would transfer over to the new HD.  That was a mistake.  Not only did it not transfer some of my books, but the primary program that I use to store all of my photos on my Kindle and my iphone was incompatable with the Kindle Fire HD, and you know what that program was, the AMAZON CLOUD DRIVE.  So now, instead of having one Kindle to take with me for videos, books, and photo storage, I have to carry two everywhere I go.  What sense does that make??  And, how could Amazon, the company that makes this device, have its own Cloud Drive unable to access it???  How dumb does it sound that I have the Amazon Cloud Drive on my iphone and on every other phone, laptop and desktop available, but IT IS NOT COMPATABLE with its own brand?????  If I had know that in the beginning I would have never purchased this device until it was able to do what its previous model could do.  Maybe when Amazon reviews this information, someone will go back and update their cloud drive app.  Right now this is a disaster and a waste of money as far as I am concerned

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
The 4th generation kindle fire hd7 is a great tablet, plenty fast, and browses the internet with ease. However, the way Amazon has made their OS, does not allow for much customization and only most 3rd party applications will work in this tablet.

My 2nd gripe is that I would not like to use a credit card and it appears the the only way to download an app through Amazon's app store is to have a credit card number (even for free apps), once again, Google play for example will let you download any app and only the apps that cost money they will accept credit cards or gift cards...

There are ways around this, I can connect the kindle to a PC and load apps and music and books, etc. Onto my device, but that defeats the whole purpose of having tablet if I have to rely on the computer constantly to load media onto it.

Unfortunately for the latest kindle, there are no means of rooting your device, so Google play is not an option to have directly on your kindle fire tablet.

One last thing. The "special offers" are entirely not appreciated and are a bit of a nuisance to see on my lock screen, yes I know you can pay Amazon $15 to take the adds off, still don't like how Amazon does that.

So to wrap things up I like the hardware of the tablet, its a pretty slick thing, I just don't like software loaded on the device, which for another $50 I can find an equal competitors tablet running the latest version of android, featuring equally performing hardware and overall is more capable of a tablet

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Amazon could do a better job - usability and stability issues.
review_body:
As a book reader, it does it job for most part, and it serves purpose as occasional entertainment device,

Pros: price, display, audio

Cons: the looks are somewhat flimsy, but comparing price with other devices it's steal. Amazon is trying to provide good options, but they are confusing e.g., I can't figure out what's part for FreeTime subscription vs Prime. Even Prime time content is hard to explore. Skill browser crashes at times and slow to load content at other times. Camera is very low resolution, so even though you get unlimited storage, you can get better quality with smart phones.
I have run into few challenges with usage and support is unable to help. E.g, I created a word doc, spent and week of hard work, and by accidental swipe, doc vanished. Tech support mentioned point blank - you lost it, no way to recover, next time back it up to cloud. On asking how to backup a doc to cloud, answer was feature does not exist, so email every time you update a doc. Second option given was to restore from backup, on going to backup/restore page, there was no restore option. I was told the feature is not implemented yet, so best way is to reset Fire to factory default. So using it to create docs/excels is a no no, unless you figure out easy backup option. Other unfriendly thing is switching user profiles - you need to hit power button, and then back again and then choose different user profile.
Also you would expect Fire would make shipping on Amazon easier, but that's not quite easy as said.
Overall, I guess we are spoiled by higher standards set by iPhone/iPads.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I bought this tablet for my wife. It was very quick and had a lot of great features. Being an Android device I wanted the ability to download from the Android apps I had already bought. So the night I got this home before wrapping it for Christmas, I was going to load up a few books I had bought previously that my wife hadn't hat the time to read yet. That's where the problem started. If you want books or apps on this thing they have to be bought through Amazon.com. Being previous android user i wasn't use to being limited, at all. Previous apps i had bought on the Google play store, one NCLEX app for nursing school that my wife spent an ungodly amount of money on, no dice. I tried to get around the amazon requirement, even thought about rooting it. Then I realized I'm working way to hard to unchain myself from this brand new devices limitations. So I took it back and bought the $150 Samsung tab 7. I would rather pay a little more money for less restrictions. Loaded up Aldiko reader, which isn't offered on the amazon store. Loaded the books and apps from the Google play store and was done in no time. Wife loved it and was glad i didn't keep the fire. I gave the Fire HD 7 three stars because the hardware is great but the software needs some of the limitations and ads removed. I realize you can pay more for no ads but you can't fix the limitations without rooting.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Better Battery life would be nice. but let's compare....
review_body:
I am a long time Apple user - and happy to be one. But I constantly get asked how to fix something on a Kindle Fire and got tired of saying "I don't know" so I decided to buy this model. I have to admit, I wanted to see if it matched up to all the hype I hear - and I have to admit, it's got some nice features. In fact, it can do almost the same things as my iPad, even with it's funky navigation.

Once I got used to the Carousel, and after observing several children while using the Kindle Fire 7, I'm not as mad about the Carousel as I was at first. Overall the Kindle Fire 7 is nice, and once you know how to find what you want, it's not so frustrating on the surface. I do have minor complaints, , such as, having no physical Home button, which I find almost necessary, especially for a young child old who can't manipulate the screen well enough to get the home button to appear.

My main complaint though, is the battery life - and as I said, I have things to compare to: I have 3 other Kindles, plus two iPads for starters. Not one of those units - not even my older iPad 2 nor my Kindle 2, has such a poor battery as this unit does. I can play on my (year old) iPad mini all day long and still have half the battery left. And I use such taxing games as School of Dragons or Rise of Berk as well as keep my email running all the time on the iPad. Yes, these games require sound and motion. When I play these games on the Kindle I'm lucky to get 3 hours on the unit before that icon turns red - and I do not even run any email on my Kindle at all. I charge it over night, and the next day by noon it's already drained. I do the same thing with my iPad mini and use it with the same programs for the same amount of time and I can go 3 or more DAYS without a charge.

My settings on the Kindle and iPad mini are the same; brightness set at about 40%: Wifi on. NO headphones. I start the day with a full charge. One game is open at a time (the exception here is that I do use email on my iPad). The games I play require both Wifi and sound and I prefer not to use headphones - never have used them on my iPad and don't want to start now just because I'm using a Kindle.

Video and audio is why I wanted this unit - and when I read suggestions on how to "improve battery life by using headphones instead of the speakers" or "turn off the wifi" I can't help think -- WHAT!!? that's why people buy this thing! Many of our games require sound and I do not recommend headphones for children. And what if I'm streaming a movie from Amazon Prime? I have to use Wifi for that. and if more than one person is watching the movie, what does Amazon want me to do, plug it in? Tether it? then I lose the portability of the thing.

Overall it's a decent tool, and as a second (or third) multi-media device, it's suitable. I do like that it can play so many of the same games and apps available for the iPad (too bad there's no Homer). But I could not depend on this Kindle all day if I use it out in the field, if I'm doing a demo or even just as an electronic organizer, it would be dead by lunch. That just seems lame to me. If the battery were better, I'd give this 4.5 stars and might even consider buying a few more. I still don't like the Carousel or the lack of a physical Home button, but I could live with those things really. With all the other units on the market that have better batteries, I'm just not convinced that the Kindle Fire HD 7 is the one I would suggest when people ask me which Tablet is the one they should get. I guess I'd have to say, if they don't mind charging it several times a day, then it's definitely a decent purchase.here is that I do use email on my iPad). The games I play require both Wifi and sound and I prefer not to use headphones - never have used them on my iPad and don't want to start now just because I'm using a Kindle.

Video and audio is why I wanted this unit - and when I read suggestions on how to "improve battery life by using headphones instead of the speakers" or "turn off the wifi" I can't help think -- WHAT!!? that's why people buy this thing! Many of our games require sound and I do not recommend headphones for children. And what if I'm streaming a movie from Amazon Prime? I have to use Wifi for that. and if more than one person is watching the movie, what does Amazon want me to do, plug it in? Tether it? then I lose the portability of the thing.

Overall it's a decent tool, and as a second (or third) multi-media device, it's suitable. I do like that it can play so many of the same games and apps available for the iPad (too bad there's no Homer). But I could not depend on this Kindle all day if I use it out in the field, if I'm doing a demo or even just as an electronic organizer, it would be dead by lunch. That just seems lame to me. If the battery were better, I'd give this 4.5 stars and might even consider buying a few more. I still don't like the Carousel or the lack of a physical Home button, but I could live with those things really. With all the other units on the market that have better batteries, I'm just not convinced that the Kindle Fire HD 7 is the one I would suggest when people ask me which Tablet is the one they should get. I guess I'd have to say, if they don't mind charging it several times a day, then it's definitely a decent purchase.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Instructions too complicated for internet novices
review_body: Had many problems because instructions on internet are too comoplicated for beginners. I all ready have a Paperwhite Kindle where I read many books and enjoy it after I finally learned how to use it ALL BY MYSELF. My daughter bought me a Fire HD 7 as a gift from Amazon. My bank account has been monthly debited .99 for the Paperwhite for many months and I don't want my account debited again for the Kindle Fire HD 7. I can't find instructions on this issue. I am so frustrated because I've printed out your Fire instructions and looked all over your website and  the internet to no avail. Also, I don't get any response from your company. I'm unable to contact a human to answer my question. Please send me SIMPLE instructions to get this issue resolved.  The main problem with the Kindle products is that they are too complicated for beginners who are not internet savy as the nerds who write the instructions. I'm extremely upset and will not buy another Kindle product whatsoever. To enjoy the FIRE HD 7 as I do the Paperwhite, please  - please - please assist me!  Carol Tokas (email: carol.bonnie1@yahoo.com)

Calling amazon today. Likes great display easy to use, price. Dislikes beyond the fact that it doesn't work  properly.  It is thick, and heavy vo m p are to competition.

Unfortunately Amazon and the Google play store do not play well together, which means I could not use the apps I have on my android phone on the tablet. To make matters worse, it not only requires you to have an amazon account to use this table but enroll a debit or credit card before you can even download games and apps...even if they're marked "FREE" in the amazon app store. Very dissatisfied with this product. Bought four for every family member and everyone is returning theirs and spending the extra fifty for a better tablet.

review_headline: CRAPPY SERVICE WHICH DOES NOT Care
review_body: This is more of a re view of the help techs and there scrappy service than the tablet. We own two HDX Fires and have been very happy with them for over a year. So, this Christmas we bought two HD7's for our two foster sons and they have been great and we bought them mostly due to the fact that the OS was believed to be unable to get malware or spyware. Well that is a bunch of scrap. Our younger foster sons is now as of three hours ago locked up by a piece of sh+#= maleware software which basically is demanding $300.00 to be paid to enable use of the tablet. When I contacted Amazon for help I was told that the email acct which I used to set the tablet up is a bogus acct. Then I was repeatedly told that a Kindle could not get maleware or spyware. Well, I guess that kind of puts Amazon in the same class as AT&T and their customer service department, which considers customers as throw away.

review_headline: Works ??but they don't make'em like the used to.
review_body: Overall works, but is lighter and the build quality seems lower than the original Fire's.  The originals had a real nice rubber coating on the backs for grip, and an LED light to signal that the Kindle was charging/full.  Both are gone in this model.  Also, really dislike the home screen ads, and that you have to "PAY" to have them removed.  Seems like a money grab, as Amazon is no doubt being paid to post those ads.  Stuff like that sets a bad trend in the industry.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
For the amount of money this cost I was pretty disappointed. The charge is terrible. The battery life is just as bad if not worse. The camera is terrible. The apps aren't that great unless you purchase them.Then the lock screen and background is all Amazon advertisements. Which you CAN NOT chnage.
I would recommend going else where to purchase this. Wasn't worth the amount it cost to me. I also looked at this same item in stores and it was much better.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: My husband bought this for me for Christmas, and I like it, but it's not as great as my Nook Color. (Why didn't I just stay with my Nook? Well, it was pretty old, and for whatever reason I could never get it to connect to my wi-fi. It would connect everywhere else, just not to mine. So I thought it was time for an upgrade.) I would have given the Kindle Fire HD 7 5 stars, but I can't customize it the way I want; I can't change the background or lockscreen images on it, and I think it's pretty sad that you have to pay extra to get it without the advertisements on it. Also, the camera is pretty terrible on it. I didn't want this for the camera as I've got a pretty nice camera already, but still. It's pretty bad. If you ever had the original Motorola Razor Phone and took pictures with it, that's about how bad the camera on this is. So, if you're wanting an e-reader that you can customize, change background and lock screen images, NOT have to pay extra to not have advertisements on it, and have a decent camera then this is NOT for you. But, if you want an e-reader that allows you to surf the internet, download certain apps, and listen to music on without all those other things and you don't care if it has ads on it, then I'd get this one as long as it's on sale. Otherwise, you can find e-readers of the same quality WITHOUT ads that you can customize for less money.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Don't Buy If On Limited Data Plan!!
review_body: I received the Kindle Fire from my husband for Christmas. Just what I wanted! Then, I fired it up. Now, we are on limited WiFi data plan due to traveling a lot. That Kindle Fire used 3 days worth in the first 2-3 hours with a huge update, a bunch of apps working in the background that I wasn't aware of and a couple big apps downloaded on me that I did not ask for.  When We called Amazon tech help to see if we could get rid of all those apps and behind the scene processes not needed, we got customer service in the Philippines that had heavy accents and apparently did not understand what "limited data usage" meant. They kept saying "so, your Kindle is not working correctly?" Anyway, no one could help us, so I had to send the Kindle Fire back. I loved the touch screen and the vibrant colors but I mostly read and occasionally play a game while traveling or get online for directions so all those apps and extras they load onto the tablet before they ship it out is just too much.

If I go to website to get some of the same free games as is on my old kindle, it tells me I've already purchased it, and it will not show up on the new kindle.  I guess you are supposed to know how to use the newer models without instruction booklets.  It's ok, but I do really wish I had not purchased the Fire.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Fire HD or HD Kids 6"/7" 8GB is not for Children.
review_body:
Intro:
We originally bought these for our 3 (5, 6, & 8yrs) boys instead of the Kindle Kids. Kindle Kids are just a pre-packaged Kindle Fire HD 6 or 7" 8GB device with 2 year warranty, kindle case and 1 year free time. At the time we bought this the HD 7" they were $79 after some discounts ($237 for all 3). With the 6.99 Family Free time, 3 Kindle kids case (74.97), 3 2 yr Kindle HD 7 warranty (89.97) it was about $40 dollars cheaper than the Kids HD 6 and $158 cheaper for the Kids HD 7".

Con: (TLTR)
My biggest gripe about the whole thing is the storage capacity. I should have realized the 8GB probably would not be sufficient and on top I had forgotten that Kindle devices stated storage size is actually less. 8 GB (4.5 GB available to user) or 16 GB (11.6 GB available to user) of internal storage http://www.amazon.com/dp/B00IKPYKWG/ref=nav_shopall_k_hd7#tech
Additionally, If the device reaches around 10-15% it gets laggy, games freeze up.

Con: (Detailed)
So after loading up the initial profile (w/out downloading content) and then loading up a child's Free time account already starts taking up space. You have 2 accounts now with default data. So after about 3-4 hrs of my kids playing with their new devices I already had to remove content to re-enable Wifi access (yes once device reaches a certain amount it disables Wifi). Childs free time storage is not accessible from the parents account side or thru the child's account unless its reached a limit/WiFi was disabled. When limit is reached it prompts to clear storage or enabling WiFi prompts to clear. Don't make the mistake I did and exited out of it after deleting one thing because you cannot go back in. I have had these for almost 2 weeks and every day I have had to clear storage at least once and re-enable WiFi 2-3 times. After looking through storage It was clear that 8 GB is not enough (well 4.5). They says 4.5 for user storage but I noticed that even some of that still had System related items and the Amazon Appstore would take up anywhere from 500-1.5GB itself if not careful. My one son had downloaded Logo Batman (1.4GB~) and a few of their Kids book that will read to them (each takes about 100-300mb). There was also a Nuance app that was not being used that I could tell that kept re-populating with 50mb. Some of the regular apps can take up to 50mb each. These things can add up.

Pro:
If you were to use this device solely for watching Netflix, Amazon Videos, anything that streams or reading standard ebooks it is a great device. The pro but not really related to the device but Kids Free time does allow for allot of parental control. Time of day it can be accessed, how long it can be accessed during that time, and they must do certain things first before using it for more entertainment purposes.

Summary
So for any device developer to think an 8GB tablet (not including e-readers) should be in the product line needs to think again or more clear upfront of its limitations not all the way down at the bottom in the technical notes which only geeks typically read. For users I honestly cannot see how Kindle HD/Kids HD 6"/7" 8GB is suitable by anyone unless it is strictly for streaming or reading standard books.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Almost beside myself how bad this is
review_body: Only had this for maybe 3 weeks now.  Device can experience incredible latency of unresponsiveness.  By incredible I mean it's been 2hrs and counting.  My device won't turn on, can't turn on.  Fully charged.  Started off normal, took it in the car, watched some online videos.  Then, jerky graphics.  Like dropping frames per second exponentially until ... frozen and unresponsive screen.  Power button turned it off, but not back on.  Sometime during the next two hours the screen did come up, and I was presented with a dialog asking if I wanted to shut down my Kindle (all those button presses must have queued up).  Press Cancel, Press Yes.  No response.  Press Power.  No response.  Then .... after several tens of seconds, screen goes dark.  Won't turn on.  Repeat.  Wow.  I left Android years ago because of this kind of experience, and I mean years ago (as in original Sprint HTC EVO w/ Wimax).  Figured with quad core and newest Android this has definitely improved and changed.  Guess not!  I'm returning it, and not even sure I can factory reset the device in this condition before I package it!

review_headline: Long time Kindle lover now Very Disappointed
review_body: I received this as a present and it has never worked properly - kept freezing, wouldn't turn the pages of a book, long lag time, etc. After having the Kindle Keyboard and Kindle Touch I had high hopes for the Fire as my tablet. Since I only had the Fire for 1 week, Customer Service said they would replace my Fire. Too bad it was with a refurbished product. Why would I want a refurbished Kindle to replace a brand new Kindle Fire that never worked properly. Customer Services solution return it and buy it again since I wanted a brand new product. Too bad they can't tell me when they will be in stock again. Returning the original and the replacement, guess I will look into other tablet options.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: My review of my Fire HD 7 Tablet on Jan. 5, 2015 has greatly changed. Don't get me wrong I love Kindle for allowing me to always have a book on hand BUT after a year the battery is not keeping a full charge. Even if it's not in use and I leave it unplugged at home for the day the battery will deplete itself.  So I'm shopping around and trying to decide what is the best e-reader with the best battery life. It's a huge disappointment that this is a problem with a device that's only a year old. So it was a 5 star item and now it's only a 1 star item.    I've just received my Fire HD7 for Christmas so I can't give an overall in depth review as I'm still learning all its capabilities. However, at this second week of ownership I can say I'm in love! The size of the screen, the clarity, the ease of shopping, reading and browsing are amazing. I am an avid reader and that was the main purpose for requesting the Fire HD7 and it's perfect. I hope to learn all the great qualities this device as to offer in the next few months. Awesome Christmas gift, one that's sure to keep on giving for years. I do wish there was more selection in cases.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: NEW GENERATION K INDLE FIRE HD 7 IS NOT AN UPGRADE....NO HDMI CONNECTION OUTLET, NO WAY TO CONNECT.
review_body: I asked for the Kindle Fire HD 7 for Christmas .... I loved my previous generation version and thought the enhanced video and sound capabilities would constitute an \\"upgrade.\\"  Well, they're nice, but not nearly nice enough to compensate for the fact that my favorite  passtime with my previous Kindle was to connect it to an HD tv and watch Netflix and (sometimes) Amazon Prime videos.  What they don't tell you in all the gushy PR for this new model is that THIS KINDLE DOES NOT HAVE AN HDMI PLUG SO IT CANNOT BE CONNECTED TO WATCH VIDEOS ON A TV SCREEN.  \\"Second Screen\\" does not make up for this as it appears (so far) to do only Amazon Prime videos.  I am so disappointed in Amazon for not making this known before I received it.  I find it quite deceptive.  I had already given away my old Kindle.  This is my third Kindle, and most likely, my last.
