product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: It's very annoying and I intend to contact customer service
review_body: I've had my Kindle Fire HD 7 since Christmas. After approx. 2 weeks of use there's now a persistent problem. If the unit sits for more than a couple of hours, it needs to be reset before use.  The only procedure that works consisterly is to hold the power button down for 20 seconds, then plug in the charger and turn on the device.  It's very annoying and I intend to contact customer service. Other than that I am very pleased with it.    1/7/15 Update:  I did contact Amazon customer service the same day the original review was posted. Their support staff contacted me within minutes of my submitting a request. The service representative logged my complaint and walked me through a reset to factory default (within settings). So far I have not had any problem starting the device.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I would not recommend this device to anyone
review_body:
Within 2 days of receiving our Fire HD 7, it ran out of storage space. We had not downloaded anything and had only subscribed to the FreeTime Unlimited. I called their support line and spoke to a representative who was extremely helpful. He walked me through the process of reseting it to its factory settings and took a lot of time answering my questions. He called me back 24 hours later to check on the device and it was working properly. He told me that if the problem happened again, they would replace it because it could be a problem with the device. It happened again 2 weeks later, again after no downloads. We still only have the FreeTime Unlimited subscription and the storage space is so critically low, we cannot connect to WiFi. We also don't have pictures or videos on the device.I called customer support again and was told to reset to factory settings again. This technician said that low storage problems would not be a valid reason to replace the device because it is not broken and that I was given misinformation the first time I called regarding reasons to replace a device.
I am hopeful that we will work this out one way or the other, but for now, I would not recommend this device to anyone. It should not need to be reset twice within the first few weeks of ownership especially since we haven't downloaded anything!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
The user interface is good: simple, intuitive, easy to learn for a new Fire user. The quality of image and video is also good.
A few downsides though: Silk seems to have an issue with launching pages from links in Facebook or other media. In the first attempt a new tab is opened but nothing comes up, so I have to go back and click on the link again and only then the page downloads. Another gap is the lack of some apps that are already popular for iPhone/iPad users e.g Instagram, Whatsapp. I'm surprised not having found these guys in the Fire app store. Overall, I like my Fire HD 7, it's light, versatile, and brings the traditional Kindle book experience in an elevated way.

review_body:
I love my new Kindle. A great improvement over prior purchase. However this unit failed and had to be replaced. Screen froze and could not be fixed using your "chat" service.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: It ain't an iPad, that's for sure.  I find this to be slow to respond to touch.  I find the operating system to be quirky.  For example, when you go between the Freetime app for kids and the main screen for adults....it sometimes stalls, or reverts back to the kids' home screen.  It is frustrating.  I also don't like how I have to log in with my pass code for the kids to get in.  I have already set screen time limits, so why not allow them to access their profile with their own code and otherwise block mine?  Oh, the other thing I don't care for is the time it takes to load apps.  When I load an app from Apple to our iPhones it is quick.  When I load one on here, it seems to take an eternity.  Sometimes it even seems to get bogged down or locked.  I guess for the money difference, and the fact that the kids use it it is fine.  I have less worry about the $100 replacement vs $500 of an iPad.  Tough call....would I buy it again.  I guess so.  However, if you are used to using Apple.....don't expect the same performance out of this gizmo.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
While Christmas shopping on Amazon, I noticed that the new HD7 Fire was only $99 so I decided to upgrade my old hd fire to the newer version. I loved my hd fire and I was eager to play with the new one. However, I was really disappointed with the new one. While I like the interface better than the old one, I find the new one very slow with loading apps and books. Copying to the new device is also slow. Even while reading a book, sometimes you see a busy cursor when you are trying to change pages.

Running the new and old side by side, you can see the noticeably slow new kindle versus the speedy old kindle. I was expecting the reverse. I am not sure how Amazon managed to move backwards with product usability but I feel like that is what they accomplished with the newer version. I bought a kids kindle for Christmas too and it appears to be the new HD7 fire problem, since that is also slow too.

I am hoping that they can fix this with a software update and that it doesn't require a hardware change to make the improvements.

review_headline: Junk. Don't waste your free time on "FreeTime" it's bloatware and annoying (with NO CONTROL - despite what they market)
review_body:
I hate this tablet. Only 8GB and no external memory card slot?
But my biggest issue with it is that when I use Amazon FreeTime for the kids, I expect to have control of what they can play with and see. These idiots built in the ability for ANY CHILD to simply click on ANY APP or VIDEO and download it.

Yes, you can remove icons - FROM THE CAROUSEL ONLY! When they click on "apps," or "videos" there is a plethora of things for them to click on to initiate a download. You CANNOT remove these! My son (who is 2) kept clicking a great big Transformers icon in the apps section, which each time I would remove it from being installed, simply allowed him to click on it again to download it. The icon cannot be removed to prevent future downloading.

Amazon your tablet sucks. This thing is NOT worth the $100. Just spend another $80-$100 additional and get a real tablet.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Whatever you do dont buy this Model!!! I had 2 different kindles of this model (notice the use of had) and they lasted the first 14 months the second 13 months both were bought within 2 months of each other.  The Problem so sort of obscure battery issue that prevents them from being charged.  Called amazon customer service (which btw the reps amazon hire are at least  awesome at their jobs and seem genuine in their willingness to help) and after two calls including a call back they determined there was nothing too be done.  Now i am not ignorant i understand 1 year warranties but their replacement offer either 30 dollars off an older similar and used model or 10  dollars off the brand new model was in my opinion insulting.  Now i know they are cheaper than most tablets of similar size and power and if this had happened with just one i would have wrote it off as stuff happens.  However, with both failing like they did this tells me the kindle is truly a get what you pay for device and i highly recommend anyone considering buying one first look at other tablets by other manufacturers that while they might be more expensive at least last longer.  Now i would never say i will never use amazon again because i will however unless buying something cheap that if my kids break it won't matter this will be the last fire i ever buy.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: This device has it's good points and it's bad. It completely keeps my child occupied. It is easy to navigate as well. The apps are entertaining but fail to enclose all details with each download.  For example, a game will display ads all throughout the game and some will be right in the center of the screen.  Even though I tried to opt out of the ads, they return!!  We have only had the device two weeks and I have already had to call customer support over this issue.  One game we had to permanently delete because it was trying to track my child's kindle fire geographically, track all of the uploaded apps, and locate all of the internal MEIN identification #'s etc. I tried to opt out of this as well but it would not let the app open without consent of this.  The parental controls on this are the poorest I have seen. Because of this I have to watch every little thing!!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: The Kindle Fire HD 7 is replacing my Nexus 7 (2012) that died on me. Going from the Nexus to this is definitely a step backwards. What they send is they way it stays...absolutely no customizing the Fire. Apps, such as Verizon Messaging, which was one of my most used apps, doesn't work. Try to open it and it goes directly to the Fire settings page. The lack of apps available from Google is frustrating. When I click on a link, it opens a new blank tab..no link. So I go back, click a second time and it will open. Keeping multiple apps open is also impossible. There's no way to scroll down and see what is currently open. It's heavier than my Nexus also. I knew some of this when I bought the Fire. It was well over $100 less than my Nexus which was the main reason for purchasing the Fire over Nexus. If this is your first tablet, you'll love it! But going to the Fire after a more advanced tablet, you'll miss some of the features.

I have several google apps which i intended to use on the kindle which i can not access the most important one being disney movies anywhere.  I was shocked to call your support system and find out no one i spoke to knew about this app and/or understood what it did.  i finally got confirmation that i would not be able to view my digital copies of disney dvds i had bought so the kindle is in the process of being returned.  i hate to return it but it does not currently meet my needs.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I've never had a device like this before, so I figured I'd start with the Kindle, since my mother uses one and loves it quite a bit. I didn't really know what to really look out for when it came to these devices, but I primarily wanted to use it to read books and occasionally watch videos on, and for both of those purposes, the device works absolutely wonderfully. If that's all you want from a tablet, then go for this, since it's a fairly cheap device, and it works quickly, I never had to wait for it to load anything.

However, there are a few downsides that really bring down the overall product rating for me. Personally, I LOVE to customize my computer and phone - I like to use my own wallpapers, sound effects, and so on, and astonishingly the Kindle doesn't allow any sort of customization whatsoever. I thought using your own wallpaper was a pretty standard thing in the industry, so imagine my surprise when I upload the pictures I want to use as my wallpaper and I'm incapable of using them in that way. It's only after I went online to try and figure out where the options were that I learned that it wasn't possible. It's not only wallpapers though, the fact that I can't customize the main menu in any way, and I can'r choose which tabs I want available at the top are all little things that I like to do to personalize the product, and I just can'r understand why even the most basic form of customization is unavailable for use.

My second issue is with the ads. In addition to being unable to customize the wallpapers, occasionally an ad will show up instead. If I want to remove this, it costs fifteen dollars. I find this to be a deplorable practice, since I wasn't given any options to buy a model that didn't come with ads in the first place, so in addition to the 150~ I paid for the Kindle, I ended up paying an additional 15 dollars just to remove the annoying ads. Granted, they don't interfere when you're reading (otherwise I would be marking this at one star), but I just hate how the device had an entire section of it exclusive to ads.

The final thing I'm disappointed about is that there no way to use an SD card to add more space. If you want more space for these, you either have to buy a model that contains more, or buy a wireless USB card that can hold the data, which aren't cheap. It makes no sense not to have something that - again - I thought was standard for most devices nowadays. The only reason I can think of as to why they don't include it is greed, since I suppose without SD card support, some people may be more inclined to pay more for a version with more internal memory.

Overall, for a first tablet, it works fine, but from now on, I'll be sure to really put forth an attempt at actual research into these things when I want to buy a new one. A lot of things I had assumed to be standard are apparently not, and I can say with certainty that - while the Kindle works fine and does its intended purposes well enough - I will not being buying another Kindle in the future due to the drawbacks listed above.

review_body:
I purchase this for my brother in Canada, so we can keep in touch via skype. I haven't see him for over 10 yrs!
Come to find out, AFTER I purchase it that ( in small print) this doesn't work outside the USA. To be able to download to have to be physically in the USA and have a US address. He could only use whatever I download for him before I send it. Useless to me and to him.
I when to best but and purchase another one APEX SOLO, upgradable to 36gb and very similar to my iPad in size. For less money and better everything. So there, here my review. I don't like AMAZON tablet. I'm not paying 100.00 @ year to upgrade to prime either, so don't hold your breath.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Spent approximately 4 hours 2 different days on phone with Tech Support trying to get my email to sync with my computer/phone. Repeatedly told each person I talked to that I had Yahoo mail with a Verizon.net address. Each of them said it was impossible to do & finally sent me directions on trying to import my contacts which didn't work. When my daughter asked how I liked the Kindle, which she gave me, I was a bit lukewarm because of the wasted time with email support. My son-in-law immediately downloaded the Yahoo app, at which time I was able to access all my mail, contacts & folders. Cannot believe it took him 5 minutes to do something not one of your customer support team was able to do.

review_headline: It is a cool tablet, and good for my kids
review_body: I should have done more research on this product. It is a cool tablet, and good for my kids, but it does not do a lot of the things that they could do on their android tablet. Amazon has commercialized everything. The adds SUCK! No youtube app, and many, many apps that we had on our other tablet are not compatible with the Fire. That really limits you on what you can do, especially when it come to my kids. While there are apps that they can do, being limited to your selection really sucks. The app store is hard to navigate for a child, and is not near as user friendly as the play store from google. Games that I paid for are not available on the Fire, and I have had to buy them again, or find something else because they are not compatible. If I had it to do over again, I would have went with something else. But, it wasnt bad for the price, which is why it gets 3 stars instead of less.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I received this as a gift.  I'm glad to have it but I'm disappointed that you can't customize it.  You can't set a background/wallpaper - which really bothers me.  You can't set a lock screen wallpaper.  You can't organize tabs/icons.  You can't even set what comes up on the carousel for everyone who picks it up to see (you can delete items, if you think of it, but not say just don't show \\"x\\").  You are limited to Kindle; no Google play.  You can't set an adult Guest profile & are only allowed two adult log ins - both parties needing to have Amazon log ins.  (Why only two!?)  The battery life is disappointing & not intuitive to extend.  It really has terrible glare in daylight (nearly unusable) - much worse than my smartphone & it shows finger prints the second you touch it. Basically, I think I would be happier with an android tablet.    It's also so new that the selection of cases is very limited & apparently the front camera is new so many old edition cases say they won't work & most screen protectors look like they'd cover the front camera.    Still, despite the frustrations, I'm happy to have it & enjoy the apps I do have on it.  I appreciate the large viewing area for the e-reader functions.  I'm relieved that it defaults to a finger-swipe keyboard.  I love reading kindle books & local pubic library books on it (indoors).  It's a good size for watching Netflix with subtitles (indoors).  I like the short cut to the Amazon wish list. The built in child lock app seems decent & the built in parental controls are nicely customizable. The ads don't bother me - I get that that is why it was cheaper & they aren't that intrusive.  Plus, I've read I can get rid of them for $20 if I'm so inclined which is nice to know.    All in all, I like it; I'm having fun with it.  For the price it's great, but I'm not planning to get another Kindle when the time comes to replace it.    Update: On the plus side: keeping the kindle in airplane mode & the brightness turned low really extends the battery life.  On the downside, the built-in kids lock app requires active wi-fi.  Also, while I found a case I like, I'm still having trouble finding screen protectors that accommodate the new front facing camera.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Says 8 GB, but is actually only about 4 GB
review_body: I was very excited to get this for my daughter for Christmas this year.  It was a good price for what seemed like a good product.  Don't get me wrong the thing works fine and she is enjoying it.  PROBLEM with it is that it has 8 GB of memory, almost 4.5 GB of which is the Operating System and the extra little things that are on it and you can't delete.  That is ridiculous!!  I bought this item so that my daughter could get on YouTube and play music, and mainly for pictures and the video option.  She loves using that.  She downloaded a total of 6 apps and had 2 videos on there and the memory was full.  (The videos were 5 or 6 minutes each, but still)  If I had known that this only had about 4 GB of actual memory I would have never bought it.  Unfortunately, the store I bought it from does not return electronics once they are opened.  I tried to contact Amazon about upgrading to something better, but they will not take it either.  They need to put that information on the box or have a better return/exchange policy.  I feel like I got ripped off.  Yes, she can still use it for other things, but not for the MAIN reason I bought it.

So you have these companies paying you  millions to bombard my lock screen with ads and then you have everyone who can't stand the ads pay you 15 bucks to have them removed. So you guys can be known as the hustlers of the tablet world. You know, when someone hustles you in Flinttown, we don't tell everyone, be careful when you mess with them, they will hustle you, we say stay away from them, they're nothing but a hustler. You guys should start making your kindles her in Flint, be with your peeps...

review_body: I'm finding I still am confused and reach for lap-top.  I wanted to order some additional products, but keep running into the words "4th generation".  Don't know if that's what I have, but don't think so.  I was initially thinking of returning it, but decided if it would work for GPS I would keep it.  After husband died, I moved to Boise and am constantly getting lost so I need one.  Now I'm thinking it won't work for that, but maybe too late to return.  Can anyone tell me if it works when I'm out running around in my car.  I really want to like it as am fascinated with tech.  Old dogs can learn new tricks, but sure takes a lot of time.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: ... general and I have to say I very much dislike the Kindle Fire
review_body:
I am an avid user of Android devices and technology in general and I have to say I very much dislike the Kindle Fire. It was purchased for my 3 children to share. It does have built in parental controls which is nice, but I think they are implemented in a very clunky and ineffective manor. If you have one child then they may be useable but with multiple profiles you have to manage them all individually. For example you cannot add an application and make it available to everyone, you have to individually manage and allow that app for each individual profile.

From a hardware perspective the Kindle Fire is a very capable device, especially considering the price. I love Amazon, but I believe their Android implementation needs a lot work.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Performs as expected, battery life pathetic
review_body: I previously had the Fire HD 6, and completely of my own doing, it was broken. I thought this would be the time to get the larger screen. I could not be more wrong. I admittedly haven't done my research to see if greatly decreased battery time is a natural fault of this model, but if Amazon has produced this product knowing the battery time is nowhere comparable without stamping a warning on the box I'd be disappointed. It is so poor I'd be shocked if I'm not suffering some sort of manufacturer error, in which case I would still feel justified in giving this product one star for it not being properly inspected in the quality control department. Either way, in this reviewers opinion go with the smaller screen and continue to enjoy your books/movies/media for a reasonable amount of time without searching for an outlet.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: We bought this for our 6 year old daughter for Christmas. We got the FreeTime Unlimited subscription for her so she would have access to all of the children's games. The lack of memory is very frustrating. She is only able to download a few games/books at a time. She gets very upset because there are several that she enjoys and does not want to delete, but in order to try others, she has to delete them first in order to have enough memory. As a family, we also have an IPad mini, and she is use to being able to have plenty of games. We got this so she would have her own, but due to the frustration with having to continuously delete items and the wifi cutting off due to lack of memory, she is not wanting to use it and still wants the iPad mini. I'm beginning to wish we would have spent the little bit extra and gotten her a mini instead. I guess we are spoiled by Apple.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I enjoy using the Fire HD 7
review_body: I enjoy using the Fire HD 7. I got it as a Christmas gift after I dropped and broke my old classic Kindle. I only ever used it as an Ereader. so many of the Fire's abilities are above me. It will surf the web fine on our WiFi. I have not tried to watch a movie or listen to music. I am not impressed with the battery life. I have got in the habit of shutting it down when I don't plan on using it for awhile, that makes it take a lot longer to start up and open a book. I like the back light.  My old kindle had none so I needed an external light which caused my Wife to complain during TV time. I suppose I could have gone to another room to read but after 46 years together getting on each others nerves is just another way to say I love you. Back to the Fire, as I said I never would have bought it for myself but since she gave it to me I wouldn't trade it for the world.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Extremely limited compared to other tablets.
review_body: I like having a screen bigger than my phone to read or play games on. It's a great tablet, but there are a few things that have been getting on my nerves. One, there's no easy shortcut to close recently used apps. Two, when I tap the home or back buttons there's always a delay, it's hard not to hit the button again, but if I do, I usually end up opening a new app since the buttons disappear on the home screen. Third, if I leave my house with it and come back, every time, I have to turn off the WiFi and turn it back on to us the Internet. Fourth, there are A LOT of apps that aren't on the Amazon app store, or they have an Amazon version of the app that doesn't work at all. Fifth, there's no flash for the camera. Sixth, games won't connect to Facebook, you can choose to connect to Facebook, but it never actually does it.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Great product, but still prefer others.
review_body:
This product suits me fine. I've been an apple user for a long time and like the diversity the iPad has always had. The Kindle Fire HD7 isn't as versatile as I'd expected. Nonetheless, it is great for kids and for shopping easily on Amazon.

The only 3 negative things I discovered were the AD removals having to be $15 (which I understand), the lack of support for a lot of great apps, (YouTube for one) and the inability to store PDF E-Books in my "Books" folder, rather than them be in the "Docs" folder.

Three things I love are the sound! Has a very audible range from somewhere in the low 40hz to a good range in the 12-15khz, which blows my mind. The other being able to shop easily on Amazon! Who doesn't love that. Last is the size and build of this thing, which is great for kids to watch Netflix and some apps.

I called today to see what we could do and because it was out of warranty (10 days) the only thing they offered me was a $10 credit for our current Kindle and about a $10 credit if I wanted to buy him a brand new one. Are they kidding???? Amazon......I won't be buying any more Kindles. For the price they should last longer than a year.....and trade in to them is only $10???? They just lost a very good customer.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: not Google app friendly, Amazon lock in
review_body:
Why am I giving this tablet such low marks? Amazon store lock in its the dominant reason. There are apps I use daily on my Android phone and my computer that I have NO access to from this device. Come on Amazon, competition side, Android IS a Google product! Denying access to Google play store is beyond hypocritical and worse crops an otherwise useful little tablet. Hell's bells I can't even opt out for a different browser, and I'm sorry to say this guy but Silk just doesn't cut it! If I could at least import all of my bookmarks it would help a little! I don't want to have to pick and choose just a few of my bookmarks I want all of my bookmarks. I want the bookmarks I set on this thing to be available on ALL of my things! Amazon, you're taking a huge step backwards with your closed off attitude.

I know it's going to break my warranty and there's a good chance it'll brick this thing but I'll be flashing it with Android, proper Android. Guess what. I'll still be able to use your store and your apps. I'll have real choices. I'll have the apps I need and require for the day to day things I do. If it bricks? Lesson learned right? The lesson is never buy an Amazon fire. Unless of course you intend to settle for a device that is limited because hard headed greedy corporate shills feel it's necessary to have only what they offer even though they are locking out the very backbone of what their product was built on!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Nothing really special here, Kindle fire hd from 2 years ago shines as a better product then this. The original fire hd 7 inch  had an hdmi port nice build quality to it and a awesome leather case to boot. I am aware the internals in this new version is better however you would never know it when using them side by side, the two year old device is actually faster in almost every way. Don't get me wrong this tablet performs it's job well and would be great for a child, but in two generations of improvements to the device you would hope for some kind of improvement not a couple of steps backward...

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I bought this for my husband who had a stroke. I thought he might benefit from playing games on it. Only his speech & comprehension was affected so using his hands was ok. He seems to enjoy the games & using his mind to make moves is proving to be beneficial. Since I have my own Kindle I can help him when he's stuck! I really am a Kindle fan & would recommend it to anyone asking.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I originally had a Kindle Fire HD (2013) running Fire OS 3 and then it upgraded to OS 4. Then I got this thing as a Christmas gift. I used it mire than my old one but for $150 at the time, I'd say it worth less. Originally, you were stuck with their ugly home screen where you spin the carousel to find an app. You were also stuck with their app store, which is far more worse than Windows store. The camera quality is 2MP but it could do better. The front facing camera has more quality than the rear. I got 16GB since my last has 8 but Amazon has lots of bloatware. Even with 16GB, I had like 10 left.   When the tablet updated to Fire OS 5, I was happy the carousel was gone but the nee home screen has double the ads then it did before. You can't side load another home screen since the default launcher would reject it. You'd have to root the thing to disable the Fire Launcher, which voids warranty. The one good thing was having Google Play and services without root. I also liked how they tried to stick to Android looks by having the original back, home and recent button. I'm glad they added the recent apps though to clear out some RAM. Over all, for those who like Android, just get an Android tablet.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I guess I'm just used to Apple products. However, simple things like looking at email and touching the link should be able to take me to the internet browser and open up that link. It did that about half of the time at first and now much less. I have had this device for about a week and a half.
The app selection is severely lacking! Apps that Apple and Android use are not here, at least not very many. Sure, there are some alternatives, but if you use certain apps that have your data and settings, starting over with so many apps is a real inconvenience.
There are some things with the kindle that I do find nice, maybe that is because I came from a generation 3 iPod touch and things were severely outdated on that device.
Honestly, I wish I had saved up for something better. Maybe I just need to figure this out and it will get better with time, I don't know. I have my doubts.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I'm pretty disappointed in this tablet. I received this as a Christmas gift and was pretty excited to have a tablet of my own (I have an Iphone that my kids have pretty much taken control over lol!). What a disappointment it turned out to be :( The screen is nice and clear and colorful. It is easy to use. I was able to watch shows on it very nicely using the "shop amazon" app. But sadly, that is all the positive I can say about it. The camera is horrible. The audio is fair. My first complaint was that the app selection was really lame. Coming from Apple, I was disappointed to see that many of my favorite apps/games were not available for the Fire. Next disappointment was that the apps that were available on both Apple and Amazon were double the price than they are on Apple. The biggest disappointment of all, no memory. I received the 8GB and within 5 days, my memory is completely full. I downloaded Facebook, Messenger, Netflix, Pandora, and about 4-5 games (low end games that don't eat up memory) for myself and kids. Since none of the games I enjoy are available in the Amazon Appstore, I was going to pass this down to my kids. I then made the mistaken of signing up for the free trial of Amazon Freetime (a service for kids that allows unlimited access to ALL children's apps for one flat monthly fee) and downloaded 3, THREE games there. I then got the message that my memory was full. I was shocked. I have about 8 games on this thing and the memory is already full? I have NO pictures, NO video, NO music on it and cannot add any because the memory is gone. When I checked to see what was eating up all the memory (since I hardly downloaded anything!), I was shocked to see that about 40% of the memory was already used by the system's own applications. Things that I cannot delete or else the tablet will not work properly. I deleted Facebook messenger, and canceled all the games I was trying to download for my kids via the Freetime (which is completely worthless if your Fire tablet has no memory to support it!). Another problem I'm having is that there is no password required to download games from Freetime, so my kids are constantly trying to download games and there is no room for them on the Fire. So it's jamming up everything. I'm not able to run apps smoothly because they are constantly locking up and freezing. I'm assuming it's because there isn't enough memory to run them and the downloading is interrupting as well. I have to keep switching to their profile and cancel all the downloads, which is frustrating because sometimes even when you try to cancel the downloads, it doesn't work. I'm going to have to remove Freetime completely which will be disappointing for my daughter.

So bottom line, I would recommend spending a little bit more and getting an Apple. MUCH more selection from the Appstore, cheaper apps, and much more memory. What's the point of having a tablet or device if you can't do much on it? I'm not sure what to do with this now. I guess I can use it to check Facebook and do the occasional internet shopping. It's useless for my kids, so I can't give it to them. Again, I'm really disappointed. Amazon could do better than this.our Fire tablet has no memory to support it!). Another problem I'm having is that there is no password required to download games from Freetime, so my kids are constantly trying to download games and there is no room for them on the Fire. So it's jamming up everything. I'm not able to run apps smoothly because they are constantly locking up and freezing. I'm assuming it's because there isn't enough memory to run them and the downloading is interrupting as well. I have to keep switching to their profile and cancel all the downloads, which is frustrating because sometimes even when you try to cancel the downloads, it doesn't work. I'm going to have to remove Freetime completely which will be disappointing for my daughter.

So bottom line, I would recommend spending a little bit more and getting an Apple. MUCH more selection from the Appstore, cheaper apps, and much more memory. What's the point of having a tablet or device if you can't do much on it? I'm not sure what to do with this now. I guess I can use it to check Facebook and do the occasional internet shopping. It's useless for my kids, so I can't give it to them. Again, I'm really disappointed. Amazon could do better than this.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I want to love it. I really do, but the Fire lacks many features for no particular reason.
review_body:
Why can't I change the background? It can't be done. Search the web... it just can't be done.

Also, there are so many apps missing from the Amazon App store. Why no Snapchat? Why no Instagram? After all, Fire is just the Android operating system re-branded (since Android is open source, Amazon, and anyone else, is allowed to use and rename it). Android apps would work on the Fire if they could be downloaded.

I feel like the people that designed the Fire don't use the Fire. If they did, these simple, yet incredibly annoying, fixes would be implemented.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I bought 2 of these for my children, ages 10 & 8, thinking the FreeTime would be good. I'm not so impressed.

The physical Kindle HD 7: The actual Kindle I love for them. It's just the right size and it's just right for them. I have the Kindle HDX 7" and I love it (except they have one more camera than I do. boo! lol) so I knew they would love theirs. And they do. They even received a $15 Amazon gift card each from my brother to buy books and apps. They were so excited.

Kindle FreeTime: I HATE IT. It works, don't get me wrong, but there is NO way around some things. For example, my 8 yr old found the "Escape the Titanic" game. It's just a bunch of puzzles you have to figure out to escape the different levels. Well, it was free so I downloaded it for him. He got through the first few puzzles really fast, but to continue you had to buy it. Well, ANY app purchases in FreeTime are restricted. Ok, I can see why. I don't want them buying things all willy nilly anyway. So I went in, purchased the game thinking he could play it. NOPE! ***ALL IN APP PURCHASES ARE BLOCKED IN FREETIME.*** There is NO WAY around this. I found this out after 2 calls and almost an hour later with Kindle support. HOWEVER, if an app originally cost $, but it's free in the app store, it counts as the full version and they can play the whole thing. A lot of free games aren't the full version. But this also applies to games like Candy Crush or whatever. They can play the whole game, but no in app purchases.

Now, Kindles have Parental Controls. But, in order to use PC's they have to have their own Amazon account? I'm still confused on this, because the PC's don't override FT. There are 2 different types of child profiles in FT. One for 8 an under and one for 9 and older. So when my kid is 16 she STILL wouldn't be able to do any in app purchases even if I give her permission if she is still under a FT profile. But then what's the point of PC's? Also, I've beenhaving trouble getting the reading/educational goals to work on their FT profiles, so I have to hover over them anyway.

Overall I love the Kindle Fire tablets. The HD7s were just right for the kids and I LOVE my HDX. I'm on it all the time. I do, however, think that Kindle FreeTime and the Parental Controls need to be rethought. I love that I can control their content and screen time, but I figured I'd have a little more say in everything else too. Even the guy I talked to at the app store support agreed with me. If I want him to be able to make an in app purchase, I should be able to do that through FreeTime. I certainly wouldn't buy anything in an app THEY are playing. And if you do and they use all your power ups or whatever, then you're stupid.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
First things first: I only got this as a deal-sweetener being paired with the Rosetta Stone pack.

This device is meant strictly for those who want to consume Amazon's media. The games were slow compared to other Android-based devices. However, the content works swell.

For those of you who want to enjoy your Amazon Prime Membership, this is your tablet. For those of you who want a functional tablet, try Google, Samsung, or Apple.

Pros:
Widescreen format
100% Compatibility with all things Amazon (obviously)
Shared Profiles

Cons:
Poor standby battery life (compared to other well-known tablets)
A little on the heavy side
Low storage capacity makes it difficult to use as a main device

review_headline: New Kindle Fire HD not compatible with APPS
review_body:
We purchased a Kindle Fire HD a couple years ago, which is no longer functional, so we replaced it with the latest version, which appeared to be fundamentally the same device. Our granddaughter (3 years old) loved a lot of the APPS that we had downloaded for the original Kindle, so we were trying to load the same APPS on the new Kindle.

Much to our dismay, we find that the new Kindle Fire HD 7 is not compatible with a number of the APPS that we had on the original version. This would seem to be bad execution for the new device, to make it so that the replacement of a very similar device would not be backwards compatible with existing software.

If we had known about this shortcoming, we would probably have searched around for the older model instead of upgrading!

review_body: I got this same kindle as a gift recently and was disappointed that someone spent there hard earned money on something as shotty as this. After seeing how much this product cost I was blown away. This thing feels like a 50 dollar tablet yet thay charge 3 times that. The thing has so many bugs. I've had this thing for a couple of days and have grow more irritated with each use. There have been so many things going wrong with it I can't begin to explain. The space bar on the keypad dosnt even work half the time. You can't hardly navigate through it because countless features don't even function properly. Plus this thing does way fewer things than the smart phone I already have . The touch screen is constantly falling out of sync making it impossible to do much at all. If your planing on getting this for reading don't, get the kindle paper white (or something) instead, the screen won't damage your eyes like this one and it's much better at its job.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Stick to the ipad unless u just can't afford it.
review_body: I like the size. I love the high definition but I hate the fact that there are many apps with IOS you don't have with amazon. I also have noticed volume issues when playing netflix and youtube. Sound muffles and i have to close program out and restart it. If you want a cheap immatation of the ipad go for it. If not stick with the ipad. Spend the extra money. Its worth it.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: To tell you the truth I'm disappointed with it. I read all the reviews & was excited to buy a tablet that wasn't an Apple product.  I've had several iphones and everyone I know owns apple products. I expected a little difficulty adjusting to a new operating system, but the browser is slow even with a very strong signal.  Some web sites never loaded.  I needed the navigation app to find a store last week.  I waited & waited.  I finally gave up & used my iphone google maps. The next day I tried it again, just to be fair, it loaded, but there was no voice navigation, only a map.  Not so great when driving. There are several other disappointments. I didn't buy it to read books or play games, I mainly wanted another way of accessing the internet without using my phone. I  would really like  to return it.  I barely use it.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: It stopped working after 2 weeks. We are returning it.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Can't expand memory (no slot) so must rely on cloud.  When out of WiFi range, can't access cloud obviously.  So, not so great if you want to use it, for ex, a on the road, or a vacation with limited or no wifi, and you want to load up on books and music, you are very limited with storage.  I returned it and got a Samsung tablet that has a slot for a 32G card.  Cost about the same.  I loaded the Kindle app.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Got the Kids Kindle for Christmas. The very first ...
review_body: Got the Kids Kindle for Christmas. The very first time playing with it the battery life ran out. Alright, but then It gave me problems with charging. It was not connecting with the internal and so I hope to get a new one replaced instead of a refurbished. If the one that is being sent to me gives me a slight issue with charging, I am going to return it in a heartbeat!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Have to pay extra to remove inappropriate ads
review_body: The kindle is great but I am disappointed that it came with advertisements that show up every time you turn it on. This was a gift for an 8 year old and an ad for "into the woods" and "fifty shades of grey" are not appropriate. The only way to disable these ads is to pay an additional $15. Amazon needs to review it's ads and make them appropriate if they are not able to be easily removed. "Into the woods" had the child crying...

Also I don't care for how the keyboard is arranged.  It's hard for someone with joint diseases that affect their hands to use as smoothly as the previous kindle.

review_body: Heavy, and somewhat unresponsive. Amazon app store seems limited and wrong on some undefinable level. Returned, and purchased Nexus 7.

You have to get all of these off brand apps they don't even work, and it really pisses me off. It is a good tablet, but I don't see why Amazon doesn't want to have these apps.

review_body: I got this as a prize from a contest at my optometrist's office. It's a lovely piece of technology but in order to get rid of the on-screen advertisements it cost me $17.10. The usability is alright. As someone with an iPad I find transitioning to reading on a kindle difficult, despite the fact that it's originally made just for reading. The display is gorgeous as to be expected and I do like that it fits easily in my purse.

review_body: I had a HDX 7, but I dropped it and smashed it.  I miss it a lot.  The HD 7 is adaquate, but I liked the HDX 7, 16GB much better.

review_body: too damn many advertisements which when i first went to purchase my kindle there was an option to buy without ads, then credit snafu then when i was able to purchase could no longer find 'WITHOUT ADS\\" options, emails with customer support MASSIVE fail no one knows anything.  While newer this kindle is HD, has some better features than my old kindle.  In some ways not as good for example i have to be careful how i'm holding while playing a game or it resets my play, turns off the game or kindle itself.  SICK AND TIRED OF THE XMAS MASTERCARD AD, 15 SECONDS BETWEEN EACH TURN OF WHATEVER GAME, ARRRRG!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I purchased my 1st Kindle Fire 7 the summer of 2014. I was so excited to get it.  It worked at 1st. But then I started having a problem with no sound when I played any videos. I called Amazon and they were finally able to get it back. But it kept on happening. I tried everything they told me to do the 1st time and nothing worked. I called Amazon-they did replace it . But the 2nd one is doing the same thing. I wanted people to know about this problem. I love the kindle-so much fun-but not fun when I can't watch my videos. And not fun to keep calling customer service- I doubt they will replace it again. And frankly I don't know what to do. Even if I get another one- I suspect I will have the same problem. I am not one to write reviews, but again I want the buyer to be aware. Maybe I just got 2 bad ones-but what are the odds of that?

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB

Also, the Prime free music downloads do not appear to be free when attempting to download; stars out at $0.00 but shows a price when moving through the process.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
Since I have a Kindle Paperwhite I thought this would be a good addition, and the price was reduced for the holidays. After about a month of using it I could say it's "okay". I have a "hand-me-down" iPad mini and I find it a better system, for me.

The reasons I think the Fire is just okay is its low battery life and weight compared to the iPad mini. I would play a game on the Fire for about 15 minutes at 98% battery life and after the 15 minutes the battery life would be at 80%. I would do the same on the iPad mini and the battery life is still around 90%. I also tried out the audio books. I would have it play for about 6 hours and on the Fire the battery percentage went down around 15%; whereas for the same time and book on the iPad mini it only went down 5%.

And for the weight, the Fire is about 1lb. 1oz. (17oz.) and the iPad mini is 13oz. I know that doesn't sound like much of a difference but when you're holding it up for awhile it slowly does make a difference. And surprisingly you can feel the difference when you pick them up.

Overall it's a decent tablet for the price.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Product was already daged when I got not going to ...
review_body: Product was already daged when I got not going to return it as I have already retuned one before this cause was damaged. Inferior products!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: i had it for three days and really liked it.
review_body: i had it for three days and really liked it .. after the third day i picked it up to check email it would not turn on .. thinking it was just dead i plugged it up to charge it checked it later still did not work.. went through the replacement directions to find out that i could have it replaced but i was receiving a used refurbished one not a new one as a replacement..i was not happy about receiving a refurbished product to replace a product that i barely had for four days but the associate i chatted with said there was nothing they could do about it... even if i wanted to wait for a the new ones to be in stock again i could not i would have to get the refurbished one sent to me and if that one had issues i could return it for yet another refurbished one..  a new product with defects is worth a new product to replace it not a use one that has also had defects and has been refurbished... this does not make me happy and since it is the first time i have had a problem with anything from amazon i am surprised that this is how it was handled... especially since i am someone that works in retail so i never complain lol and i know that most people i deal with on a daily basis would not accept this

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Brand NEW Kindle Fire Won't Start, owned less than 1 week.
review_body: Was unable to turn device on today.  Received it 12/23 and by 1/1 it stopped working.  I don't understand why I spent good money on this.  Tried all of the restarts listed in the Amazon forums.  No luck.  You can have it back.  As I did some more research, it is noted that this is not a new problem.  So what has Amazon been doing to fix this issue???

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Parental Controls - don't bother unless you have a very young child and maybe not then either
review_body: I'm so disappointed with this Fire HD  7.  The one MAJOR selling point was the parental controls that sounded too good to be true and absolutely was to good to be true.  I registered the devices and was adding child teen accounts to both (I purchased two for my kids), adding in the time limits for reading, gaming watching videos etc... and when done I realized once I had logged into the child's account the there was absolutely nothing on the screen it was blank no content what so ever.  I expected to see the basic tablet apps such as calculators, maps, timers and calendars etc. I didn't see anything.  I wanted to hand over to my kids as a present a working tablet of their own to use.  I have a nexus 10 that I've been sharing with them which has child accounts but lacks the activity time limits and was looking forward to them having there own device.    I researched for 2-3 hours how to set up kids accounts and I opened up everything that I could via parental controls all the while thinking how could this been so hard and surely I'm doing something wrong but alas nothing worked and was forced to create adult accounts them.  So disappointed!    The Child Teen accounts are so limiting in that it's all or nothing... I wanted and thought I'd be getting a working tablet that I could set video, gaming and application limits but still have all the power of a tablet.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
Unusable. Controls are hidden and scattered about at random. The only media accessible if from Amazon.
Next to impossible;lt to import your own material or add a non amazon applications.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Extremely sluggish. Freezes up and crashes. Spend a ...
review_body: Extremely sluggish.  Freezes up and crashes.  Spend a lot of time waiting for it to process what you want it to do.  I bought this for my toddler to play on freetime and it is ok for a 1 year old, but if you are wanting a tablet for any kind of actual work, go somewhere else.  I was really surprised at how slow this tablet processes information.  We just leave it in freetime.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Apps not available for this generation!
review_body: My daughter loves it however Amazon is WAY behind on app availability. Because the gen 3 doesn't have a microphone, apps that require one such as furby boom can not be downloaded even though this gen 4 has one. It has been out since October and since Amazon is so concerned with forcing people to get apps only from them, my daughter can not use this kindle for the reason we got it. GREED has prevailed and ruined an otherwise great device. Customer service tells me I'm SOL. You might want to wait to buy this until Amazon has updated its App Store to include the gen 4.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I bought this for my kids on christmas, we had the 2nd generation kindle fire hd 8.9 they both shared and used we have kindle free time so they love that of course but who gets to use it started turning into fights so we got the fire hd 7 from staples at a great price. It's a great tablet for kids I just wish there was some sort of volume control my little guy puts the volume to the max, anyway the bad part about this is battery life on this is so HORRIBLE our last kindle only had to be charged once a day my ipad mini maybe once every other day great battery life on that, the fire hd 7 no joke at least twice a day depending how they are using it, plus the charger it comes with is so slow to charge we bought another fast charge plug that charges in less than half the time. hopefully they can do some kind of upgrade to help the battery life a little. Also one of the tablets broke after a few days it froze with a blue screen a few times so waiting on our new one.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Documents do not back up to Amazon's cloud
review_body: I would have given a higher rating, like the size, the screen, the performance. However, my office documents  are not syncing to the cloud. To make matters when I click on a document I have created to edit it, it deletes. Since the documents are not backed up to the cloud, there is no way toes cover it. After 1 month and four calls to customer service Amazon has been unable to fix the issue. I will be requesting a refund. Shame because all other aspects of the device worked well.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: This is one of Kindle's better products.  My wife likes it and is amazed at what she can do with it.  The only problem we are having is getting to view it on my HD Television.  It is a Samsung 65 inch plasma screen with HDMI connections.  I bought the adapter and wiring to make the connection except when I turn it on it keeps going on and off and it does not follow the Fire HD.  I'm also using Amazon Prime (free trial) but so far the movies I acquired need to be shown on my computer.  I miss the 65 inch screen as my computer is only 1/3 the size.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I am impressed at the easy navagation.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: A little let down, but still reading.
review_body: Bummed. Didn't realize this was a hassle free packed product, maybe that's why mine had a scratch near the volume keys that my husband noticed when he was looking at it, that I now notice every time I turn it on. The back fills cheap compared to my old Kindle Fire. I haven't tried all the features yet. I'd like to return it or another one but not sure if that would void the warranty to purchased and having brought Prime I don't want to have another expense on my personal Xmas gift. Plus I brought Prime since it said I'd get my Kindle on the 27th but I ended up getting it on the 29th.  On a positive note the graphics are beautiful and vivid.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Great size & picture but sluggish and slow
review_body: Great size but really sluggish & slow. Takes a long time get through the lock screen and launching apps is super slow. The screen picture is great

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
Really not impressed. Lot of hype that ended up to be a flop for me. There ability lacks the talk Amazon gives their tablets.

First, Amazon get with the program. No official YouTube app? Really? Even Google can offer that. That is just one of the many frustrations in my app search.

Second, you guys talk about speed. This is slow. My wife iPad mini is much faster at processing than the Fire HD. really thought the ability to watch videos quickly would be a plus but I see no difference.

Third, the camera is horrible. I mean I think my old flip phone has a better camera on it. If that wasn't enough you click the button and have to hold it still? That's just unacceptable.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Kindle Fire has less Prime shopping and video functionality than other tablets
review_body:
Totally bummed out with my first Amazon tablet experience! The incredible irony is to get the functionality I want, I need to buy a 3rd party tablet with Amazon apps (iPad, or Android) and won't be able to use Amazon's own ecosystem. I was very excited to test out my fist Kindle Fire, I spend a lot with Amazon Prime both personally and at the office and was concerned this could make things too easy. It won't. Surely I'll never get into the Vine program now... but I've got to be honest and vent my frustrations with this Amazon Fire tablet I bought my wife for Christmas.

Hear me out; my beef comes down to essentially this - my wife cannot use her own "private" Amazon account to shop and gift privately with her credit cards etc AND also watch the baked-in Prime Instant Video or listen to music from my household account... because I am the primary account holder sharing my $99 a year Prime with her... which only gets you the 2-day shipping.

To use this Kindle Fires video and music capabilities, and enjoy a private shopping/ gifting experience, it forces us into a position where we pay another $99 a year for another primary "Prime User" for her. It's too bad the solution is two apps via iPad, phones, other Android devices - one for shopping, one for video - all because there is no other ways to configure the Fire OS.

One star for the hassle of configuring then returning the Fire tablet just to go back to using two+ Amazon apps on a device made by someone else. (Don't worry Amazon, you'll get that sale too) It's a bummer the house branded Fire tablet has to go back, the thing even has an option for two adult profiles, but it seems no consideration has gone into private shopping or gifting and this very issue. I know they'd love another $99 a year subscriber, but no thanks we're a household and that doesn't seem fair. A different tablet with two apps it is.

I just had to put all the parental controls on and they use my profile for the immersion reading feature.  A little annoying, but not horrible.

review_body: Not as good as my older one from 2012. Won't fit the expensive case I had (power button hidden under the elastic band. And I've yet to get it to return to "full screen". The  2012  model was much more user friendly.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Do Not Buy. Save your money
review_body: 1 year 1 month and 1 week later. BROKEN. Use my kindle here and there. Maybe an hour or two a week. Had it fully charged and used it. After 5 minutes it timed out and went into sleep mode and now it won't turn on or charge. Wish I would have bought something better. 1 yr warranty.      3 days later I did a manual reboot by holding the power button down for 40 seconds. Now it works. Not sure why or how this happened

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: My conversation with the "service" section was at best maddening, and yielded zero information other than "well
review_body: I am not finding the tech portion of customer service particularly helpful or knowledgeable.  I am switching from an iPad environment to this - and only want to take my books purchased through iTunes.  Given that there are iPad apps that allow for kindle book viewing, I thought the reverse would be true.  My conversation with the "service" section was at best maddening, and yielded zero information other than "well, you could look for an app" -- as an answer to a question that I assume is fairly common.  Still looking, not a happy camper.  This may end up in a drawer if I can't use it as my reader.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I had an old original Kindle without a light and use the Kindle ap on my tablet. I was somewhat disappointed with the screen and glare on the Fire plus I don't appreciate the special offers. I needed something that would fit in my purse that had a light for night reading so I picked the Fire HD 7.
I would have been better getting there newest reader. I absolutely love reading the Kindle books and use the Unlimited all of the time.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Disapointed many Android Apps Don't Run on Fire 7 HD
review_body: Very disappointed. Bought 2 Fire HD 7 tablets for great grand children for Christmas after checking to see that certain apps were available for Android. Little did I know that many Android apps will not run on Fire tablets. Most disappointing was the Disney Jr app does not run on Fire HD 7. The kids love playing with our iPad tablets. Not so much with the Kindle Fire. To bad Amazon has shot itself in the foot. Tablet itself is nice, but of little value without the apps you want or need. I think in the future we will just bite the bullet and buy iPads. We've learned our lesson.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Not bad for a $100 tablet but only if this is not your primary one!
review_body: Bought this during Thanksgiving but it stopped working in less than a month - the tablet wouldn't turn on! I was able to get a replacement as it was still under warranty. The small screen might not be suitable for everyone, would encourage one to try it out in person before buying. It feels heavy for the a small tablet. The photo quality is sub-par when compared to an iPad so is the response time - for instance using the front or back camera while Skype-ing there is a slight lag (again compared to the iPad - I have the one w/ Retina display, of course its not an apples to apple comparison). I primarily use the Fire to read newspaper, magazines & books. The battery lasts almost a day before needing a recharge. Due to the size and photo quality I can't use this as my primary device.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I purchased 2 kindles for my sons; only one ended up working! Contacted customer service and they are going to send a replacement in March - are you kidding me? I now have one son with a kindle and other does not! I expect a replacement by next week. I will keep you posted on how quickly this issue is resolved. As a side note we also have 2 iPads in our house and have had zero issues. If you are looking to have a tablet that works (no issues) I suggest you spend the extra $ on an ipad. Had I known this would have occurred, I would have done so.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
Not much of a step up from the previous years offering. The cameras are very low resolution so don't expect to be wowed by the images you'll snap. My 14 year old canon point and shoot has the same pixel count, sadly it takes a better picture due to pixel spacing.

And considering the camera and quad core processor are the only big advances, I have to say no.

Changing the layout of the buttons sucks too. I have to buy all new cases. What's up with that?!

review_headline: Not compatible with play store. Had to put parental ...

review_body: My mother ordered me the Kindle Fire as a Christmas present. When it arrived and I opened it and turned the Kindle on, the screen was damaged. Like someone or something had mashed down on the screen and damaged it. So I called Amazon customer service and after getting the run around got sent a new one that appeared to be refurbished because it came in a box that wasn't meant for a Kindle and it came with the charge cord but no charger port. The Kindle Fire I love after getting the right one and everything. It was just annoying to have to go through all of that.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I purchased the Fire HD 7 at Thanksgiving and activated it on 12/9. I have been using it since then mostly for reading and playing on the internet at most a few hours a day. This afternoon I went to turn it on and nothing happened. I tried charging it and nothing happened. I called Amazon customer support and they acknowledged there was an error and advised me to hold power button for 40 seconds. It ended up working to reset it. While I am glad it was able to be reset, I am not happy that there is already an error and Ive been using the device for less than a month. I requested a new one since I have been using the device for less than 30 days and was told that is not possible at this time. Hopefully there will not be any more issues, but I think it is important for others looking at this device to know what they are possibly in for.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: TERRIBLE NONWORKING JUNK. TRULY AWFUL REFUND POLICY.
review_body:
WARNING: TERRIBLE REPLACEMENT POLICY.
I have purchased many Kindle products before including previous generations of Kindle Fire and HD.

This unit rates ZERO STARS. Amazon's policies rate MINUS-5.

My wife bought me the the latest Kindle 7 HD as a xmas present.

Out of the box it failed to connect to 3 of my wifi routers. I spent a long time with tech support on xmas only to end up with Amazon sending a replacement. Later in the day it did connect intermittently to our 4th router that I hadn't tried earlier. But problems persisted: no email setups worked, etc.

The replacement arrived four days later. It had other problems.
1. It would not setup without creating a fake child to get past the Freetime setup screen.
2. It rebooted every hour or two as a new unit, taking about 25 minutes to do a full setup and to reload from backup (about 15 minutes of that time with a 30 mb/s very strong wifi signal).
3. Impossible to set up any emails.
Never got past this stage.

More calls to Amazon. No solutions other than the fake kid hack again.

The nice lady (3rd techie) told me I could either get a refund or a replacement. I asked if I could try it for another day to make up my mind. She cheerily approved my suggestion.

Another hour had been wasted, but hopes were high.

In the next 5 hours there were several more problems and 3 crash/reboots.

I called Amazon again after 9:00 pm. The second person, Andy, then advised that Amazon's policy only allows a replacement for a NEW unit, NOT FOR A REPLACEMENT. My replacement was just in the process of being ser up when it couldn't get past the Freetime screen at all. I told him about my conversation a few hours ago.

After being on hold a long time while he supposedly spoke with supervisors, he said that Amazon would make A ONE-TIME EXCEPTION TO ITS POLICY and allow a refund. I asked him again if he was seriousinasmuch as the first unit NEVER WORKED EVEN FOR EVEN A MINUTE and the replacement would not even set up properly without crashing. He confirmed Amazon's policy and my one-time exception.

That is shameful and disgusting.

He also confirmed that these units are full of problems.

BEWARE OF PROBLEMS WITH THESE UNITS. THEY ARE A WASTE OF MONEY AND TIME.

MORE IMPORTANTLY, BEWARE OF AMAZON'S REFUND POLICIES WHEN YOU BUY AMAZON KINDLE JUNK.

You could spend weeks getting endless replacements and live in total frustration with constant spontaneous crashes, reboots, and 25 minute waits for backups to download only to find that if you get a replacement, you will be screwed when that piece of junk fails.

I was told that the long download times related to my extensive book collection. Surprise: Isn't that what Kindles are for?

I will find a Samsung Galaxy Pro III 12.2 tomorrow (not thru Amazon) and never waste another moment with Kindle products.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: BEWARE!!!! PLEASE READ BEFORE YOU PURCHASE THIS DEVICE!!!!!
review_body: BEWARE!!!! PLEASE READ BEFORE PURCHASING!!!!! WHen you buy this you are signing up for free advertising. Everytime you open your Kindle you will be greeted by an advertisement. It annoyed me so I researched to see if I could turn the advertisments off. You can only if you pay $15 dollars plus tax. $17.10 total. THis seams really wrong and dihonest to me. THey make it sound like they are doping something for you by offering "Special Offers' What they are really doing is charging you to advertised since they claim that they charge you $15 dollars less for the device if you recieve special offers. This should have been made clear in the purchasing afreement. I woon't be suprised if some lawyer out there gets screwed like this and decides to sue or start a class action lawsuit. I paid the $17.10 on both my devices to remove the advertisement. Sadly, I love my kindle and have been Giving Amazon FREE advertisment by encourage my friends and coworker to purchase one. Now all they are going to get is bad advertisment from me.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: These have been quite a disappointment and a waste of money
review_body: I got my kids Fire HD 7's for Christmas.  To ensure online safety I loaded up the Kids FreeTime service.  Within 3 hours of playing with the tablets, they were automatically turning off the WiFi with a message that the memory was full.  I looked and the kids only had loaded about 20 games, and a couple of books.  No videos, nothing else.  Yet the tablet memory was full.  They claim to have 8 GB but in the storage manager screen they seem to have less than 6GB usable memory, and that seems to get filled up quickly by the FreeTime app/content.  These tablets have been very disappointing and I keep having to spend time trying in vain to clear off enough things from them to make them usable and stay connected to WiFi.  They also don't have external storage slots, so forget adding storage.  These have been quite a disappointment and a waste of money.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Just a bulky tablet with eReader tendencies and no customization options.
review_body:
I wanted this to read on. Nothing more. I have no intention of it being my go-to tablet, using the apps, watching TV...none of it.

I'm a book blogger who needs it to review eGalleys and read her books. Having the Fire HD7 would fix many of the issues I had with my recently retired Kobo Aura, but sadly what I have found since using this, is that it's a jump back in time. The core might be faster, but it's heavy, bulky and THICK! And it's not an eReader any more, it's a tablet posing as one trying to make everything BUT actual books the forefront of it's abilities.

- You can't make your books, or the bookstore the main focus of your reader unless you manually add the books to the home screen, one by one. This is supposed to be an eReader...right?

- The carousel is annoying, removing something from it is a 4 step process. Still unsure if what's in it is just a reminder of what I have looked at lately or what's currently running in the background. If the latter, the fact it's so frustratingly complicated to remove things from, it is even worse.

- You can not customize it AT ALL, which I find in 2014 on an item I paid $140 for to be just ludicrous. As best I can tell, it doesn't even come with background options to change it too that are Amazon approved. Why can't I have a picture of my kids at Disney as my background Amazon? Why?

You can see my full review here: http://www.memyshelfandi.com/2014/12/product-review-kindle-fire-hd7so-far-so.html

Basically, spend the additional $100 and get an iPad mini. All the same features, but lighter, sleeker, better camera and the ability to customize. It has the Kindle app which is the same as the Kindle itself...this being the newest item from Kindle should have been the best and the brightest and instead I get something that can't do half of what my 1st generation Nook Color could when I got it in 2010. Disappointing to say the very least.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Ordered 2 for my grand kids for Christmas. Should ...
review_body:
Ordered 2 for my grand kids for Christmas. Should have inspected long before Christmas as one would not work, very upseting to see look on grand childs face. Customer service handled properly by authorizing a replacement. However, the indication over the phone was that the replacemnt would be shipped out the next day via overnight shipping which was relayed to my grand child. We were out of town and did not get to read the e-mail confirmation until today. The e-mail confirm indiced one day shipping but stated est delivery date of Feb 10, 2015. Needless to say, I do not look forward to telling my grand child this.

The one that works seems to work very well. But a 50% success rate for any transaction is not acceptable. Will not purchase electronic items via Amazon or any other web seller in the future.

review_headline: Junk, don't waste your money on this.
review_body: I bought one of these at the end of June 2014, now 6 months later as soon as the battery get around 67% it powers off and acts like it has a dead battery.  If I plug it into the wall it will boot fine, but once it gets back to 67% or so battery life, it acts like no charge at all.    UPDATE: Thanks to the 1 year warranty they're sending me out a new one.  Hopefully it lasts longer than 6 months.  UPDATE:  1/2/15 Called in to tech support about a dozen times, just to be hung up on, told it would cost $50 a minute for tech support, told it would cost $100 a minute for tech support, people answered the phone acting like I was calling a Hospital, private number as well as being hung up on on EVERY call.  UPDATE: 1/5/15  The refurbished Kindle sent to me to replace the defective one will not stay connected to the internet, even though every other wireless device works just fine.  Amazon replaced a defective Kinde, with another defective unit....

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: It's not bad. Has nowhere near the battery life of my ...
review_body: It's not bad.  Has nowhere near the battery life of my old Kindle Fire which is a huge inconvenience.  The display is nice, but it seems like the coloring is off.  My phone has more vibrant coloring than this kindle.  It is nice, though, that I can open up and edit word documents.  That feature really comes in handy when I have to edit peer papers.  Do I think it's worth the price?  Not at all.  I'm glad I decided to try this instead of shelling out the money for they newest 8.9 Kindle but all-in-all, it basically does everything I need it to do.

I've always had Android phones, 6 of them since the G1, so I thought I'd like a kindle better than an iPad. Now I wish I'd shelled out a few hundred extra bucks for an Android tablet . This is almost a worse device than the crappy lapdock I bought for my bionic. Its one redeeming feature is that the keyboard is slightly superior to the nearly useless keyboard on the galaxy s5. I give it two stars because it mostly works the way I expect, but sadly it is a very unimpressive device so far.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Not a Fan of Kindle Fire HD - 2 years into ownership
review_body:
The good news is that the Kindle Fire HD is a relatively cheap tablet and reader. It has clear graphics.

The bad news is that it locks you into Amazon. You cannot use Google Play. The available apps are limited and often do not work as well as Android apps available on Google Play. The Kindle Fire HD will also not work with free books sites. Amazon uses this platform as a slave to its content.

Bottom line for me is that when the Kindle dies, I will replace it with a tablet from another company.

review_headline: I received this as a gift on 12-27-2014 & it ...
review_body: I received this as a gift on 12-27-2014 & it won't turn on today 12-31-2014. I have barely had a chance to look at it. I have tried to charge it but it still will not come on. I went to a help center & their advice did not work either. I had expected this Fire HD 7 to work for more than 4 days. I loved it for the 4 days it worked but since it has quit I can not in good conscience recommend this for anyone else to buy. I do not know if the one I have is defective or what. Of course I realize that no one cares & I am sure I will not get a replacement.

review_headline: Not a small full featured tablet... Very limited
review_body: I was looking for. Smaller version of the HDX.. Something like the iPad/iPad mini, and this isn't the case. The tablet has a very cheap feel to it. This model doesn't appear to have a way to get video to a tv (doesn't work with fire tv, doesn't have a micro hdmi port in this years version).  The Amazon store is very limiting, only was able to find half the apps I use on my android tablet. The ui/launcher is frustratingly basic. I can see it being ok if you only use a small handful of apps or primarily use it for reading. I am used to being able to customize android and this is locked down, you can't do anything with it.
