review_body: Actually, I returned the Kindle. I do not like the proprietary operating system and the incessant Amazon ads.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Much more bulky than Kindle paper white and Samsung tablets. It's okay for the price but feels cheap.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I also own one of the first kindle paperwhites so my review is largely a comparison to that.  The paperwhites battery life is incredible so the drastic difference with the Kindle fire is very disappointing.  The battery lasts about 3 days with what I'd consider light usage,  A little reading before bed and brief internet searches.  The tablet itself is very user-friendly and seems to have a great interface, however I feel like some of the apps still have quirks that need to be worked out including the Amazon app.  Overall for the price it's a nice addition however I am a little disappointed and expected so much more.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: not happy at all with new kindle fire hd
review_body:
Very disappointed, loved my 2013 kindle fire hd. This one first of all has a short charging cord, not convenient, and you need it because the battery doesn't last long at all!!! I play a slot app and the kindle freezes after three spins and I have to power it off and black on. Sometimes turning it on it will go to blank screen after typing my code
in which is a whole other issue, the code thing. Haven't had thirty days yet but considering calling amazon to send it back.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
If anyone (like for example my 4-year old girl) enters an incorrect PIN 5 times in a row, the Kindle will automatically reset to factor defaults! This is unacceptable in my opinion! It is true, once you re-register it, all of your content comes back. But, you lose bookmarks, progress in games, and anything else that is custom.

And this makes it a great target for thieves! All they have to do it enter a bogus PIN, reset it, voila! Brand new Kindle with no record of who the real owner is.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Slow speed compared to an iPad. Quite glitchy as ...
review_body: Slow speed compared to an iPad. Quite glitchy as well. Apps seem to hang up or reload for no reason. If you've used an iPad before and go to this, it's a huge step backward.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Perhaps my expectations are too high, but I wish devices like these performed better. Specifically the tablet occasionally chokes while opening apps and has difficulty with websites. I've noticed several times the device choking while opening popular apps like Facebook. It can take 30+ seconds or more to open that app while I get a little spinning circle or the device becomes completely unresponsive. I've had the device completely crash while trying to read an article from the Washington Post app. I wanted to read an article from si.com but couldn't because the web browser was choking so badly with the website (granted the website is flash heavy). That is really annoying. I also REALLY detest the fact I can't load basic Google Apps like Gmail and Google Voice. Perhaps this is a similar experience with tablets this device competes with, and my expectations are just too high. But in the end the problems are real and I was hoping for better performance from this tablet. On the plus sides the device performance (other than my complaints) is decent, it's got a nice screen resolution, and the speakers are better than average.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Should have dug deeper and found out how limited the Amazon apps were for this device.  My Mistake
review_body: Although this unit is fast and very clear, I made the mistake of going Amazon Fire, and not being able to obtain other apps available to true Android units.  Hopefully they will modify the software and allow all android apps to the device or add the most common apps to their store.  Made a mistake with this purchase.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Nice tablet, good wifi card for streaming
review_body: Nice tablet, good wifi card for streaming, and excellent transfer speeds. However my only gripe is the inability to un clutter the home screen easily. Every time you open a app it adds itself to the carousel on the home screen and must be manually removed one by one. It may just be my ocd, but after the little one gets a hold  of it for a few hours I go crazy trying to un clutter the damn thing. Knowing what I know now, would have bought another paper white.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I love my Kindle reader (the older one with the external keyboard) and was excited when Amazon came out with a tablet. I was finally able to afford one and purchased the HD7. I got it home, got it all set up, and immediately set it back to factory settings and returned it. Found out you can't customize it like you can other tablets and the crazy scrolling thing at the top is very confusing. Not user friendly at all!! I could create folders for my books but what was the point, it didn't remove them from the scrolling thing which just kept getting longer and longer as I added books, etc. Also, the placement in the scroll seems to be random so you have to go searching to find an unread book, etc. Their app for computers and other tablets are setup the same way which again is annoying but at least you can control things on the tablet outside the Kindle stuff better.

Being bombarded with the special offers every time I turn on the tablet was very annoying, too. I guess Amazon allows you to remove them for a price. I like to look at special offers but not every time I turn on the tablet! Why not create an icon that the user can select to browse the special offers.

I am a big Amazon fan but holy cow, they missed it on their tablets!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: It was delivered promptly. Unable to charge. Don't know if it is the charger or the tablet itself. I returned it and bought the Samsung tab 4  8.0 inches with excellent performance.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Purchased as a Christmas gift, received two days after ordering with standard shipping. Unable to register the new kindle to any Amazon account. Emailed Amazon multiple times and have not heard back, called and was put on hold. Never ordering a kindle online again.

And while researching I find that Amazon has locked down the os so that the screen saver cannot be changed? Why?.
So I am off to but a REAL android tablet probably for less money and without Amazon trying to control it after the purchase. Shame on you Amazon. Shades of Apple.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: It's not the product it's the service. I ordered ...
review_body: It's not the product it's the service. I ordered the Fire HD 7 on Dec 11, 2014 at a price of $114 at which time it was in stock. While doing a tracking of it on Dec 17 it showed me estimated delivery date was Jan 23, 2015.  I called Amazon.com (one will not find the number to easily) and told them that they are showing the same one in stock for $129.  Customer rep had me cancel my order and reorder the $129 one which she said she would credit to $114 but while I ordered the $129 the final check-out came out to be $114 w/o rep doing anything and still got an estimated date of Dec 26.  Why couldn't Amazon.com just shipped me one of the $129 one that was in stock.  THERE"RE THE SAME ITEM

review_body: wish I would have gotten higher than 8 GB now, as it doesn't take long before I have to make more room for this one.  It's small and convenient though, so that helps.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I ordered this item on Dec. 11, 2014 for my grandsons Christmas gift.  We have been ardent Amazon shoppers for years and many boxes have been arriving for Christmas and I assumed it was here. One week before Christmas and we start wrapping gifts and a few of the boxes that I thought it was in, turned out to be something else. I went online to check the order status only to discover that it won't be delivered until Feb. 10! There had been no email or anything to inform me of this! I called customer service and after a lengthy wait, I was told there was nothing they could do, but if I ordered it in black, I could have it by the 22nd. so of course I agree. I complete the order and it states that it won't ship for 2-3 weeks! I tell this to the customer service rep. and she says, "Oh really? I didn't see that on my end. I am sorry." There was a total lack of empathy regarding the fact that I now do not have the gift  my 5 year old grandson wanted above all else. My trust and admiration for Amazon has gone way down. I am VERY disappointed in how this was handled.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I can't write a review yet since I haven't received my Kindle Fire7HD. But I am already very unhappy, I have been charged for the device already, order says shipped on the 3rd it is now the 18th and the status on amazon just says in transit. The estimated delivery was 12/8, but here I am 10 days later with no answer from amazon and when you buy from amazon, there is no contact the seller feature.
Amazon has lost a long time customer.

review_body: Disappointed in this product. Battery runs down quickly. WiFi connects in other places, but has a little x join the corner of it and doesn't allow me to get online when not at home. When watching movies or videos on YouTube, it doesn't got full screen when turned sideways. Took a few days to sync with certain games, after trying multiple times. Could've just kept regular Kindle and continues playing games and going online with my phone. Also, the camera is carp. It's all grainy and photos come out almost blurry. And I don't like the fact that I can't use my own wallpaper. Very disappointed with this product.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Cyber Monday came with an amazing deal on this seemingly awesome e-reader/tablet
review_body:
Cyber Monday came with an amazing deal on this seemingly awesome e-reader/tablet, that I could not pass up. Unfortunately the one i first looked at ( 8GB) had an estimated shipping date of 2-4 months. I was getting this as a Christmas gift so that wouldn't do. So I started to look at different options. The 16GB had a one week wait, which being the 1st of December was plenty of time.
Well I ordered everything and I got an estimated delivery date of Dec 15-16, okay a little later than i wanted but still okay plenty of time.
The 12th rolls around and i check the estimate again because nothing had been shipped yet. Still ot says 15th-16.
The 13th i get a notice that the items have just been shipped (Everything except the Kindle) and the delivery date has been pushed til the 22nd. Not really okay. So I call and I express my agitation. What is the hold up? What happened? Can you guarentee I will have my order before xmas? Oh yes yes they said. And the Kindle has a delivery date of the 18th-23rd they told me. Well fine. I guess that has to be okay.
December 17th. I get an email saying that the Kindle was back ordered and i would not recieve it til January. What? I JUST called to bitch about time sensitivity and now I have to wait longer??

I am sure the Kindle itself will be fantastic (if i ever get it) but Amazon has pretty much screwed me over for the last time. Don't waste your time. Spend the extra 20 and buy it somewhere who has the product right there for you to see.
Amazon: Don't include time frame eatimates if you can not stick to them.

review_body: This is the first of all the kindled that I have bought that has disappointed me. It freezes up often. I have to wait for long periods of time waiting to open programs and then it freezes up again.  I love my other Kindles, using them everyday.

review_body: My collections are not always there.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: We really wish the Fire did better than this as far a battery goes
review_body: It surprised us how quickly it loses its charge. When we close the Amazon cover it turns off, but it seems to be losing about 5% charge every hour. So if we close it when it is about 50% charged, there is nothing left for battery about 10 hours later when we want to read it. I have an iPad and it loses virtually no charge with the cover is closed. We really wish the Fire did better than this as far a battery goes.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Am I missing something? Camera is bad, slow and NOT better than the original
review_body: I have mixed feelings about the new kindle. Have had 3. The first, the second HD fire and now this one. I do like it being a lighter weight and it comes in colors. The sound is better. But it seems like it's cheaply made. Also, it takes longer to download, access, everything! (Unless I'm doing something wrong). As a seller on EBAY and other sites, I was really looking forward to the camera facing both ways. But on a scale from 1 being bad to 10 being excellent, it's a 2! Absolutely terrible pictures. No zoom or flash. If they can fit a good camera in a $69 LG smart phone that can only hold 2 apps or even an IPad that costs a lot more, why couldn't they make the camera good? Everything from social media, pictures for sales to capturing pictures or videos that are shown on the news or placed on you tube... ARE TAKEN ON PICTURES OR VIDEOS. I thought this would be an upgrade but it foes not seem to be. If I didn't need a spare tablet I would have returned it. 3 stars for some famili

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Is cool.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: NOT SURE ILL BUY ONE AGAIN, MALFUNCTION AFTER 14 MONTHS!!
review_body: I purchased my 7" kindle Fire in 2013, and really enjoyed the experience. Easy downloads, good reads, lots of HD games for the kids. You can imagine my dissapointment when my Kindle did not want to start up this morning!! The screen stayed frozen on the colour 'Kindle Fire' page. The customer service staff was really helpfull trying to reboot it by holding the on/off button. When this did not work, I was told that my Kindle could not be fixed and that I will have to replace it at my own cost. I am really not happy about this, as you can understand. How can they not fix this when it seems like a software problem!! My kindle is otherwise spotless and in great condition. I have heard about their great service replacing units free of charge even if someone broke the screen by sitting on it! How can they not replace or fix my unit when it was clearly not my doing? What is to say if I replace mine by purchasing a new one that I wont have to replace it again in 14 months time?

review_headline: Loved my kindle fire hd until things stopped working
review_body: Loved my kindle fire hd until things stopped working.  First my volume would re-adjust itself at random times.  Then the volume buttons stopped working.  Next was the "safe mode" warnings that hi-jacked my kindle.  I couldn't use any apps just the silk browser. Then I wasn't able to turn it off, or put it in sleep mode.  This drained the battery faster than I could charge it.  I contacted Amazon and they asked me to do a reset.  All that served to do was wipe out my content and saved passwords.  Would love to love it but the durability is just so-so.

Last time i purchase anything Kindle related from Amazon's actual website.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I am so disappointed. I love my Kindle Fire
review_body:
I am so disappointed. I love my Kindle Fire, but since the recent software updates and previous, that automatically happened it is falling way short. I now have hardly any volume to hear. I stream Hulu Plus and Netflix and it constantly buffers. I have high speed internet more then capable of handling it. I am asked to pick a lower quality video, so I have to play the game and it is apt to stop buffering (why have High Def.) When I woke up this morning it was still buffering. So, it was on all night. It just rebooted itself and I lost all the shows I watch on Hulu and had to log into my Amazon Membership twice. I was recently sent a replacement (refurbished) Kindle Fire 3rd Generation. It acted no better so I just returned it. What's up with the R&D guys? Are they catering to gamers and not taking into consideration all the available apps one can use? The last update in May I had to contact technical help for all the same reasons, but still had volume. Seems to me Amazon is pushing their products without thoroughly testing all apps before launching new updates. I love Amazon, but...................

I asked for a new tablet for Christmas, but not sure what I am getting knowing what my Kindle Fire is doing. I ordered one for my daughter and I am tempted to send it back. I regret giving my Kindle HD to someone when I bought the Fire. It worked great.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB

I do not intend to make any new purchases from Amazon until they honor my request.  I have not used the new Kindle as I am not able to read the books I want on the new device.  I am still using my old first generation kindle.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I was very disappointed to learn yesterday (Dec.16,2014) that my Kindle Fire 2nd generation cannot not be used to cast Netflix via Chromecast onto my 2008 Samsung television.  It seems that Amazon has "updated" my Kindle so that this is impossible to do anymore.  In effect, they have "DUMBED" it down so that it will only work with Amazon Videos.  I like my Kindle for all of the other features it offers me, but I am very disappointed that Amazon took this action.  I am seriously considering cancelling my "Prime Account".

review_headline: Sharp video and better speakers. Interface with with some video feeds is ...
review_body: Slight improvements from the 1st model.  Sharp video and better speakers.  Interface with with some video feeds is not possible, Adobe type video won't play.  Special apps to get AT&T u verse to play is worthless and needs significant improvement.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I am disappointed In this product
review_body:
I am disappointed In this product. I had expected to have a kindle reader similar to what I've had in the past but with the added benefit of a Tablet. Although there are benefits of a tablet it is very difficult to use any apps outside of Kindle apps. For example, if I want to use apps from Google play store I have to be a little bit of a computer tech to be able to figure out how to do it and it is a bit of work.
Additionally I wanted to use this mostly for reading as I did my kindle E reader, however, the battery life is very very short. This device sucks battery in about two hours from 100 percent to dead unlike the E readers which offered days of reading. There is no way I will be able to travel with this device on planes and transportation and be able to read books.
All in all I would've been better off of the regular tablet that I could've just downloaded the Kindle E reader app onto Or even just thinking from my android phone.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB

review_body:
I don't intend to be mean with this product because it feels amazing, works great and looks like a top of the line tablet. I just would like to tell you that this DOES NOT HAVE GOOGLE APPS, please see if this works for you because Amazon App Store doesn't have all the apps and games of the google play store, hence if you use that a lot, you better look for another tablet with stock android.

For user with no need for google play store and if you don't care about extra storage space, this will be an amazing tablet for you. Just be careful and look for what you really need.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: the Fire's a nice little tablet
review_body:
Received as a gift, the Fire's a nice little tablet. Good video resolution - the test was loading the app for NHK World and viewing subtitled content.

Only gripe is the Silk interface - web browsing is slow.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Decent for the price; satisfaction dropped after update crashed device.
review_body:
I loved this product, until the recent update made my use of Netflix impossible.
It is not an iPad, it isn't a fast computer in tablet form. The Gmail app is difficult to scroll through.
The original kindle was an amazing eReader (zero eye strain), this Fire device blurs the lines between eReader and tablet; except it's really not great at either one. I would improve my review if they would either allow the user to roll back the update driver, fix these problems in a patch, or send a replacement device. The customer service rep only recommended a factory restore, which did not resolve the problems. Can't say for sure if they crashed Netflix intentionally to nudge people toward Amazon Prime media, but it is not appreciated. I cannot recommend this product in this state.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Good price, disappointed didn't have access to google play store.
review_body: I have had an android OS tablet before as well as an android phone.  This is running a version of android so I thought it wouldn't be much different.  It wasn't what I expected.  I have to admit for the price it's quite a bit of product but not having access to the google play store was a deal breaker for me.

review_body: No app for my Credit Union, hope they will get Fire app.  Would give a Five if I could do my Banking.

review_body: Its to fragile. I love the Fire, I really enjoy all my books on it BUT it breaks to easy. I woke up this morning with my screen cracked and I have no idea why. This is my third Kindle and all 3 have broken. I'm tired of wasting money on such a fragile piece of tech. I am going to start shopping for something else.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Would return it if I could....
review_body:
Haven't really gotten into using this all that much yet; was nice to use on a plane to watch a movie.

Disappointed in it as a reader. I find it too heavy to hold comfortably in one hand for very long. So trying to read a book requires a lot of hand shifting or laying it down on a flat surface. I usually give up and go find a paperback.

I personally find there is too much glare and reflection.

I've also discovered that it takes forever to charge; unless I got a bad unit? For example, I had an empty battery and at 5 hours of charging, it was still only at 59%.

I won't know how much I really like it until I get one that works.  I hope this is a freak thing because I ordered several others to use as gifts.

The display is nice, the sound is good. But I can't enjoy either of those things since its always crashing.

review_body: Not the quality I expected from Amazon.  The shell is a cheap plastic so I needed to buy a case for it.  Also some of the apps that I had from my previous Kindle will not work on this one.  I thought I would try this one because my old Kindle HD Fire 8.9 got stuck on the Kindle Fire logo and there seems to be nothing that Amazon can do except to offer me a refurbished one being my warranty expired a few months prior.  This also keeps kicking me out of my apps.  Will probably replace this with an Ipad.  My Daughter and her family all have Ipads for 3 years and no issues.  Pay the price and get the quality you deserve!

review_headline: Don't like the charging and off/on on top of Kindle
review_body: Preferred 1st generation Kindle fire! Don't like the charging and off/on on top of Kindle. Next purchase will be an android tablet that has access to Google Play Store and the Google applications, ie.Gmail, Chrome, etc.. Have had several problems with this in that Silk will stop working and sometimes my apps and books are grayed out. A reboot fixes the books but only a system reset fixes Silk, had to do this several times. Other than that I like it, I would give the 1st generation four stars.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: The only things I don't like are there is no "charging light" and the ads ...
review_body: The only things I don't like are there is no "charging light" and the ads that show up when I open my Kindle.  I thought I paid extra for no ads?

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
Just bought this for myself and here are some thoughts.
1. I liked my wife's 2013 HDX but feel the lower cores speeds of the 2014 HD7(it has 2 @ 1.5 and 2@ 1.2) leave the speed lacking sometimes.
2. Some apps that are on the Amazon app store are not compatible with this device. Most notably is the Disney Jr. App that works fine on the HDX but not the 4th Gen Kindle 7.
3. Display and audio do a nice job with videos. No problems with Netflix or HBOGO. Camera is not useful or sharp.
4. The main reason I chose a Kindle is the Amazon apps for cloud use (books, Pics, videos, mp3s, file backup).
Got CyberMonday pricing and think this is a nice gift for myself (lower than similar tablets) at the price but think the app and cpu limitations could be fixed.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: The "upgraded" operating system removes three stars.
review_body: The "upgrades" to the operating system have turned this from something great and user friendly to something barely adequate and cumbersome. For instance, to remove a downloaded movie from the device you can no longer just press the movie's icon and select delete from the menu, instead you must go to a browser, sign into Amazon dot com, go to "your account", go to kindle, go to "manage my devises", go to that kindle in the devise list, and finally you can start looking for the downloaded movies so you can find the ones you want to delete. Spare time, anyone?

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB

review_body: I am very disappointed by the advertisments on my new Kindle.  I did not pay good money so I could see advertisements every time I turn on my Kindle.  This will be the last Kindle I will purchase!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: This was a disaster. I ended up returning it ...
review_body: This was a disaster.  I ended up returning it.  I don't know if I just had a faulty Fire, or what.  I've had several Kindles, and my old Fire was dying a slow death.  I thought I'd just get a new one.  Caveat emptor, not only was it defective, I felt hosed by the "special offers."  Every time I turned it on, I had to look at another advertisement.  This is the reason I don't watch TV, I certainly don't want to deal with commercials when I'm reading.  Mr. Bezos needs to understand, he is going to end up alienating his long-time customers with this sort of nonsense.

review_body: Don't buy it! I loved the previous Fires,  but this one is defective.  It will not connect to my home network.  I have tried with no avail to get help from Amazon.  Nothing! In spite of promises to send all my info to the developers and get back to me,  they never have!  They sent me a new fire, but same problem.  Then i read on the reviews that they have had this problem since 2013!  I've been waiting for the developers to get back to me for 2 months.  They have known about this problem for over a year, but haven't fixed it. Obviously they are going to do Nothing! ! Don't buy this product!! Amazon used to be so responsive and really cared about their customers.  Not anymore!

This one sucks, won't hold a charge for very long & will shut off multiple times in the course is under 5 minutes. Some times I have to rest it before it will turn back on. Other times I get a blank screen & have to reset it yet again. This has become an every day occurance

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Graphics are great. Sound is phenomenal. Ran into software issues within 5 days of owning the first one, but Amazon promptly replaced it with a new one. No native Youtube app - Boo on that. Still exploring. Just discovered that Kindle offers free downloaded samples of books before you buy.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: At first would keep shutting off. Now I can't do everything I thought I could.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: parental control time restriction has issues
review_body: Parental control is not user friendly. Time restriction has issues.  Customer service not have much knowledge about the product.  They transferred my call 4 times for not having capabilities to solve my issue.  Tablet hang OR Struck lot especially with youtube. Clarity excellent.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: This was to replace my 2011 Kindle Fire that would not take a charge.  I mainly use it to read books, check Facebook and emails.  The new Fire HD takes considerably longer to charge and does not last nearly as long.  I was very dissappointed when setting up Facebook that I would have to agree that Amazon could use my Facebook account to make posts to my page and pages of my friends.  Since when is this O.K.  I liked my first Kindle Fire and this was being sold at an even better price.  I've had it for  3 weeks and it has "frozen up" 3 times, making me a little nervous of things to come.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Still trying to figure it out!
review_body: From the get go, the packaging was no piece of cake, no clear way to open the box, finally had to use a knife to open it. The positive side is the picture is clear, but other than what the different features are and where located, there was no additional information like a guide, had to go online to get answers. Then when I go to turn it off I get a message asking do I want to power down, or cancel. I get this if I hold the button down for a moment or, for a longer time, so I just leave it to let it turn off by itself. I also own a Nook, which is so much easier to operate. I am a Grandmother, but consider myself somewhat electronic savy. I couldn't afford to pay the extra money to get it commercial free, went for the warranty instead, so I'm not enjoying the commercial ads when I open it. But that was my choice, wondering why Kindle Fire has them and the Nook does not. It's early days, hopefully my opinion will change with time.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I really to love my new Kindle Fire HD
review_body:
I really to love my new Kindle Fire HD. I had a 1 st generation for several years and it served me well and when it quit working I got a new one right away. The video quality is great and it was a snap to set up and start to use. I am a little disappointed in the quality of the houseing it seems a little cheap as compared to my old one. I also was disappointed they had not improved the power port for the earlier model, it is still not sturdy and I fear that I am breaking it every time I plug it in. The on/off switch is also a little small and hard to find. Over all it is a good little machine that I enjoy a lot.

Update- I was right to be disappointed in the quality of the case on this new model. It has already broke and it is not even month old. My old one was 3 yrs old and the case and glass were in perfect shape. Tossing it in the drawer , what a waste of money.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Do not like the special offers
review_body: Do not like the special offers. But so far I like most everything else. Miss the light that showed if fully charged. If I had purchased it for myself instead of getting it as a gift no special offers would be on it.

review_headline: I would like it better if I had some instructions on how ...
review_body: I would like it better if I had some instructions on how to use it. unless a person is very tech minded, it is not much fun to use.  In fact, I'm sorry I bought it.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Beware if you are buying this for your kids -- the parental control design is lousy. If you set up a FreeTime profile for your child, they can access Apps, Books and Video ONLY. They CANNOT access music. We have children's music and audio books purchased on Amazon that my children will not be able to access under their own profiles. Apparently I am supposed to log them out and sign in under my own profile every time they want to listen to music or an audio book? Unfortunately, setting them up under an adult profile does not seem to be a workable option. I can restrict web access and purchases that way, but there is no way to restrict particular books so they would then have access to every kindle book I've ever purchased. Why on earth does Amazon not provide a way for parents to provide selected music/audio for the children the same way they can for books, apps and videos? We had been looking forward to giving these as Christmas gifts but are deeply disappointed.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Buyer beware! Limited (and hidden) app store compatibility with favorite games
review_body: I ordered this for my daughter for Christmas and found many games LISTED ON THE AMAZON APP STORE cannot run on the Kindle Fire HD 7.  It's obviously a huge disappointment. No information on Amazon's site lists which devices are compatible and which are not.  One of the games, Minion Rush, is even listed on the product page enticing you to buy the device.  Badly done Amazon.  I expected better.  I will check into making a return on this and buy a iPad instead.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: ... this out of the box and the back felt like it wasn't attached properly
review_body:
My suspicions were aroused the moment I picked this out of the box and the back felt like it wasn't attached properly. Then I couldn't get it to connect to our wi-fi, then when I did it turned out that although my wife and I both have Amazon Prime shared memebership, because she is the primary holder I couldn't watch my TV shows unless I was logged in as her.

I took it to work to try to watch a show in my lunch hour, and it refused to connect to the internet. It turned out that my wife had put on a child losk, which couldn't be removed unless the unit was connected to the internet, and the lock was preventing connection to the internet.

Thoroughly disgusted by now I returned the unit within 24 hours of receiving it and bought a proper tablet.

In fairness, my wife got the 6" version and has kept it as her back-up device when she isn't using her tablet or regular kindle. She has more patience than I have with poorly executed technology.

I expected WIFI to be turned on only as needed and turned off when not needed.  The only truly significant difference that I liked is the second camera.  All the other specs looked good on paper but were not very apparent when these devices are compared side by side.  As a new purchaser I should be delighted but the addition of another camera was not enough for me to make the change.

review_body: I would have given it 4 stars, but my 16gb Fire HD 7 has been slow at times and apps have crashed. I've had it for about 2 weeks now, and I've only downloaded 4-5 apps and one book so there is plenty of space. Restarting the Kindle did help. I haven't used it a whole lot yet, so my review may improve if I find that reading books, movie viewing, etc. on it impresses me and/or the lags and app crashing stops. I am very excited to own this tablet, so hopefully the lag and app crashing doesn't become an issue or so cumbersome that I regret this purchase.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Decent bang for buck but disappointed Prime is only one month.
review_body:
Last year I gave my wife the same Kindle Fire. Her's has a cleaner build to it.and an SD slot for more room. This one had more of a cheaper plastic nature about it. Last year the tablet purchase came with Amazon Prime, which made it a no brainer. This one is just one measly month. That's a big letdown from last year.

It's still a excellent tablet for the price. The OS is responsive and it browses and streams online with no problems. It runs games just fine and it's easier to download media content (like episodes and movies from prime) easy enough. The assorted colors are decent as well. Get a protective case for it that can prop up to make watching movies easier.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: some good improvements some not so good, battery life still is awful
review_body:
I purchased a kindle two years ago and wanted to upgrade, ok that being said, the really nice upgrades are the built in rear facing camera and the great resolution......now the worst of iit is once again the awful battery life it is non existent, worse than my previous kindle and that one was also horrible battery life wise.....the other thing that is annoying on this new one is when you open it they now have ads!!!!!
So opening it to use is a two step process. Also make sure if you purchase the extended warranty that you get the correct one Not the one that is shown with this model which is incorrect and twice as expensive!!!, Also be aware that this kindle comes with a wall charger so you do not need to purchase one separate. The last downside is it is quite heavy and is a pain to hold for long periods of time. I purchased a cover that has a stand and that helps. It does have upgraded features and ease of use in email, apps etc, the sound quality is good as well and the photo quality from the rear facing camera is also good...

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Not as great as it looks.
review_body: I really enjoy the Kindle for the simple face that it is simple. I bought one for my six year old daughter and one for myself but it was not was I was expecting. I have the original kindle fire and I don't see many differences. I love the sound on the new kindle and the fact that it comes in colors. Other than that there is no real difference in them. Also, I purchased my Kindles Fire's on November 27th, 2014 they arrived in a quickly matter and then 2 weeks later it stopped working. As I called customer service they told me there as to be something wrong with my Wi-Fi. I explained to the rep that she was incorrect because I have other devices connected to my Wi-Fi and I also tried to connect my Kindle to a different network, still nothing. After troubleshooting I was told that I could not get a replacement until the end of January 2015! After being told this I asked why, the rep told me because they had to fulfill other orders first and the replacements would not be available until after that. Seeing as this was not fair to me, I asked for a supervisor. The supervisor was incredibly nice and efficient to get me the replacement Kindle, that I received only 3 days after the call. All in all, the Kindle is great if you are looking for a simple tablet to read and watch videos on.

review_body: Bought this on a Black Friday Special. I purchased it to have handy to just look things up instead of using my laptop.Have noticed it stalls a lot. I have only one game loaded on it. It stalls after playing the game for about 15 minutes straight. Some apps you can't get at all. Other apps are ones I've never even heard of. Hate that there is no option to set wallpaper. It's ads instead of wallpaper. Get tired of looking at them every time I get on it. For the money,to use just for a quick google search or to look at Amazon to order,it's not bad. If you're needing a real tablet with capabilities,I wouldn't order.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Good, but only fair after the recent system upgrade.
review_body:
I was very happy with the HD until the last upgrade. I never liked the carousel, because every app I used pushed my books off the screen. But using mobile desktop or an alternate interface allowed me to run apps in one place, and keep the books in the carousel. Since the Kindle is a modified android, it won't load all the Android apps. But I was able to get most of the apps I wanted, especially with side-loading. I would have given the HD 4 stars, 5 considering it's price. But since the upgrade, every app that is run anywhere always shows up in the carousel. I can live with that, by ignoring the carousel, and using the app and book entries on the top bar. But not all the apps show up in the app list. And the new Kindle system software takes up more storage space, so I had to remove half my books, or I could not update any of the applications. If I knew this would happen, I would have spent the extra money for a real tablet.
The Kindle HD is a great reading device; you can read ePubs and Nook, magazines, and Kindle books. I don't watch video or listen to music with the HD, so I can't comment on those features.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Very upset with Amazon's supposed price match policy on the Kindle Fire HD 7". Bought 2 less than a month ago and the price has reduced by $25 each since the original date of purchase. I was denied the price match being told that it must have been delivered within the last 7 days to qualify. In order to take advantage of the adjusted price I would have to send my two items back and reorder to qualify for the new price. The colors I bought are now on backorder until January 2015. I would have to choose either black or white if I want them by Christmas but not a guarantee they will arrive in time....Hmmm wonder where the ones I return will go? Have been searching all over to find the supposed "Price Match Policy" in writing on the website along with documentation from my original purchase. None to be found that is clearly stating this policy, other than being told by the customer service rep that typically a price match is honored within the 30 day period.  What to do?... Return for a full refund as I am eligible up until January 31, 2015? Very disappointed in Amazon's choice in not honoring a price match.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Overall, I enjoy the Amazon tablet. I have fiddled around with other tablets that my friends and such have and I believe that this one has the capability of the rest.    HOWEVER, I would really like to be able to customize the home screen of the device, much like other Android devices. More options for an internet browser would be nice - at time I am afraid to open it because it has crashed quite a few times on me. While I think the carousel is neat it's tedious to try and scroll through the entire thing to get to an open you opened 10 or 15 processes ago.    A very frustrating issue I've been having is that my device is constantly freezing while I'm using simple processes like taking pictures and opening links in emails. I would like to do work from my tablet but am worried it's going to freeze up on me.    I do really love to combined email though. The ability to sync up all your email accounts in one single place is SUPER convenient. I'm also a huge book/movie lover so the Prime deals are awesome. I've actual;y had a Prime membership for quite some time and never took full advantage of it until I got the Kindle Fire. The keyboard is also really great for typing and I'm a big fan of the swiping type option.    I think Amazon has a lot of potential, and not to mention resources, to make an amazing product, but I'm not sure if this one is it just yet.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I hope customer service reads this... I had high hopes!
review_body:
BUYER BEWARE.... We bought 5 KINDLES... 5! I reviewed the Kindle way back when and told everyone how we loved them... Sorry but I have to rewrite this review. Unfortunately it has to do with the CUSTOMER service one of our Kindles stopped functioning when contacting Amazon in June they were so helpful and replaced it with a refurbished one (the kindle was less than 6 months old). The "new" KINDLE has ceased work AFTER you guessed it little less than 6 months... GUESS WHAT the warranty is from the first one and by 5 days WE GET SCREWED! Yes, 1 yr and 5 days after the original malfunctioned and 5 months and 25 days after the "newly refurbished" one was received.

We attempted to discuss that we have been customers of Amazon for 6 years spent a bunch of our hard earned dollars and we are PRIME members... I guess we are the little guy and they have bigger fish to fry. I now get to tell my 4 year old that his twin and older brother have Kindles but sorry the people at Amazon won't fix his 5 day late warranty!

This won?? be the last review I write ??hopefully someone at AMAZON will read this have a kind heart and give the gift of giving to my 4yr old son!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
It's a good device for the price BUT......
I bought the 16GB to replace my 32GBHDX7 mainly because of the front and back cameras. However, because it's not HDX, the pics come out so grainy and if you happen to be in the back of a group picture, good luck having anyone recognize you. Also(this is my biggest peeve), I turned off the auto-rotate feature because I didn't want the screen to keep moving around while I'm reading and I noticed that when you use the camera(with the auto-rotate feature off), the image is UPSIDE-DOWN! However, when you view your picture after saving, it is of the right orientation. I called customer service and they said they've never heard of any such complaint(REALLY?). But she tried it herself and of course I was telling the truth. She said she'll tell the Engineers about this. I am now contemplating sending it back. I'm somewhat disappointed.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: 1 Year warranty is a Scam!!!  Don't be fooled.  Don't buy. Buy a tablet from a reputable company!!!
review_body: I bought 2 of these units in May of this year.  Supposedly they have a 1 year warranty.  Both units, just a month after I bought them, do nothing but lock up and shut down at random.  When I called customer service, all they want to talk about is maybe it's an app causing the problem.  Their solution was for me to go and buy 2 new kindles and then they would consider giving me a refund on the non working kindles.  What!!!!!!  How does a warranty work when you are told to go out and buy new products?  What is a warranty for anyway??????  Do not be fooled by the one year warranty on this product, it is a scam.  Basically, once you have bought this item, you are gambling that it will work.  If it starts acting up, you are out of luck. I will be contacting an attorney for false advertising on the 1 year warranty.  So, in the end, instead of just taking care of the issue in the first place, it will end up costing them more in legal fees than the cost of the units themselves.

Save your money and buy an Apple device and use their e-reader (and buy your e-books through Apple)- that's what I am going to do.  No more Kindle or Amazon e-books for me, since I've learned that the Kindles are not built to last, and Amazon doesn't value my business.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Device is great. Parental controls miss the mark.
review_body:
The Fire is great. The Kids profiles need a lot of work. Overall, the Fire HD is a good device at this price point.

My first impression, holding it, was that it felt cheap. The back cover feels like cheap plastic over a hollow space, where my Samsung Galaxy Tab 8 has a much more solid feel to it. But, this wasn't a device for me, it was for my 8 year old, so I wasn't hung up about that too much.

Setting up profiles for kids is a pain. You can't do it on the web; you have to do it on the device. That is a headache. I should be able to do it anywhere and have it apply. I should be able to copy profiles from one child to another. I should be able to green light content in categories. I should, for example, be able to green light all G, PG, and TV-PG movies. I shouldn't have to decide each time.

When I purchase a new book, I should be able to say on Amazon's site if my kids' profiles can access this title. I shouldn't have to go to the Kindle, open up the parent view, open up the child settings (for each child separately) and then scroll forever to find the title I just purchased.

I wish I could specify which apps could be used with time limits. There are many apps that would fit my goal of 'educational' apps for 30 minutes, but I can't set that anywhere, so I end up opening up all apps all the time because the settings are poorly implemented.

It is ridiculous that the kids profiles can't access music or movies. At all. No matter what. You can't open that setting to your kids without leaving the protected profile. Bizarre.

Amazon's Free Time application for kids is absolute garbage for any kid over 5 years old. If your kid is under 5, then Free Time is maybe fine for you. However, Free Time is so restrictive that there is absolutely NO way to do any in app purchases, even with a password, even if you already purchased the in app purchase in the adult account tied to the device. If you have a game or whatever and you make an in-app purchase, your kids in Kindle Free Time won't be able to use the purchased content even thought the exact same app on the device in the parent profile has the purchased content.

Free time has two modes: under 8 and over 8. There are exactly two differences: (1) the background color changes. (woo hoo!) and (2) in the 8+ version, they take away a 'characters' filter. So, the 8+ version has FEWER features than the little kid version. They don't add anything else. No options for any kind of web browser or connection. No options for any kind of in-app purchases, even with a parent password. No options for any kind of social connections at all. Nothing.

Amazon's Free Time application is a great idea that is HORRIBLY implemented. It was the main reason I purchased the Fire over competing tablets, and it is so completely lame that it is unusable for any kid over about 5 years old.

The tablet is great. It looks nice, and my kids love using it. I give the tablet itself a 4 star rating. The parental controls are garbage, and I give them 1 star. Terrible job, Amazon, on what could have been a brilliant product.n Kindle Free Time won't be able to use the purchased content even thought the exact same app on the device in the parent profile has the purchased content. Free time has two modes: under 8 and over 8. There are exactly two differences: (1) the background color changes. (woo hoo!) and (2) in the 8+ version, they take away a 'characters' filter. So, the 8+ version has FEWER features than the little kid version. They don't add anything else. No options for any kind of web browser or connection. No options for any kind of in-app purchases, even with a parent password. No options for any kind of social connections at all. Nothing. Amazon's Free Time application is a great idea that is HORRIBLY implemented. It was the main reason I purchased the Fire over competing tablets, and it is so completely lame that it is unusable for any kid over about 5 years old. The tablet is great. It looks nice, and my kids love using it. I give the tablet itself a 4 star rating. The parental controls are garbage, and I give them 1 star. Terrible job, Amazon, on what could have been a brilliant product.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Read the fine print! I just bought 2 Kindle Fire HD 7's for my boys. I went to download a movie to the Kindle for when they travel, and there wasn't enough store (I had literally just pulled it out of the box). I went to my setting to check the available storage and realized I only had 3.85 GB available. I went to amazon.com and pulled up the technical specifications and right there in fine print it says "8 GB (4.5 GB available to user) or 16 GB (11.6 GB available to user) of internal storage." I wish I had realized that before I purchased. The kids will be happy no matter what, but I wish I went with the Samsung.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: ... really really don't understand who thought it was a good idea to replace Android with a way worse custom ...
review_body:
I really really really don't understand who thought it was a good idea to replace Android with a way worse custom version of Android that doesn't support anything that I use Android for. The Amazon app store is terrible and the apps are horrendous. I have an Android phone and I use maybe 10-15 apps regularly (including games). None of these work on the Fire. Literally zero. The Google Authentication and app framework aren't a part of the Fire so even emailing the apps to myself and doing a ghetto installation results in a bad user experience as I can't log in to any of my apps.

They also wrote their own browser. That obviously sucks. Which I'm pretty surprised about because I assume it's just a branded version of the stock Android browser. But it's slower, doesn't cache my tab content when I close the browser, and has weird interface querks that just baffle me. Seriously, let me freaking install Chrome on this thing. Oh wait, Amazon made really poor decisions with this device and I can't.

It functions as well as any other tablet in terms of being an e-reader and I love that I can watch movies on it. But I could do all of those things and more on a non-butchered version of Android. I use it a lot to read with, and I love that I can use it in bed without lights on. But it's heavy and every time I hit the home button and am taken back to a home page that sucks I'm angry that I wasted money on this instead of spending the extra $50 to get a real Android tablet that supports the Kindle app (FYI, all of them do).

Overall, don't buy this. Do yourself a favor and go buy an actual Android tablet, install the Kindle app and the Audible app and rest assured that you'll be much happier than if you had bought this.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: OK at a lot; Not good for much. Unfinished and unstable
review_body: Bought this thinking we'd get a tablet and a Kindle which kids and adults could use. Boy, were we wrong!    The Kindle reader and streaming Amazon/Prime video and audio work, but are actually worse than using Amazon apps on other Android devices due to issues with the device.   Anything else is so frustrating you will lose your sanity cussing at Amazon.  - Wifi tends to be unstable - this despite having the latest FireOS. In areas where other smartphones and tablets work fine, the Fire shows wifi connection with good strength but nothing (including amazon) works - Need to restart the device (or turn wifi off and then back on) almost daily.  - Even when wifi works, it can be slow. For example, when accessing Amazon prime video upstairs (further from my wifi access point/router), I get messages saying the network is not fast enough to stream the content. In the same location and network, a Nexus 7 is able to stream the same content just fine (no, the Nexus 7 is not on a 5GHz wifi network).  - The Silk browser is pathetically slow - if it works at all. If you switch to another app and try to come back, the browser may have crashed in the interim.  - There is no multi-tasking - at least that you can control. You can't be sure if apps you used are still running (whether you want that or not).  - Think you can access Youtube easily? Think again. You can find some apps for this in Amazon's store, but they aren't good.  - Think you can get another browser? It's not going to be easy to find Chrome or Firefox. The Silk browser won't display Firefox's download site and won't allow Google apps.  - Like to watch videos on Comedy Central? You'll see an error saying they only support Chrome on Android. They haven't heard of FireOS.  - Search for other apps? You'll find a ton of junk masquerading as apps you may know/love, including porn apps.  _ Today, the device unregistered itself from Amazon for no apparent reason. So I ended up having to download and reinstall/reconfigure allmy apps & content again.    FreeTime is supported on the Fire - so you can set up a kid-friendly area with daily reading goals etc. But the time doesn't sync across devices, so the time read on a kindle won't count on the Fire.  Also, the Fire lacks some features available on the Kindle Paper White - such as Vocabulary Builder.  The Kindle devices are entirely different in terms of user interface etc - so don't buy a Fire because you happen to love your Kindle.    Amazon's customer service is great in their desire to make things right. But that doesn't mean they have good technical support - desire and ability are different things. They shipped me a replacement device. But it has much the same issues.      Overall, the device promises to be a Kindle reader, a device from which to consume Amazon content and an Androidish tablet. But it fails to live up to expectations as any of those.   If you want an eReader, get a Kindle paper white. This includes FreeTime profiles for kids and Vocabulary builder (which the Fire does not).  If you want a tablet (that can access Amazon content - books, prime video and music), save your sanity and buy yourself a Nexus 7. You can install the Kindle reader, Amazon music and Amazon app for books, music and video respectively, and they work better than the Fire. The one thing you won't get is FreeTime parental controls for apps.

review_headline: Bad Battery, Amazon won't support it!!!!!
review_body: Do not buy a kindle product!  We have had three.  The batteries are substandard and we had issues with all of them.  Amazon will not back up this product.  We called with a battery that wouldn't charge.  They sent us a new charger that helped for a few months.  When the problem resurfaced, they told us that the warranty expired.  Essentially, they ran out the clock on us for the cost of a charger.  Buy something else, anything else!!!!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: The heavily handicapped Fire OS is a pOS that feels more like a glorified e-reader.
review_body: The 4th generation Fire HD (October 2014 release) is severely lacking. The fully functional Android OS has been stripped down to the proprietary Fire pOS that makes the Fire HD feel more like a glorified e-reader than a fully functional tablet. It blocks access to many popular sites such as the Google Play store and apps like the very popular Dolphin browser while simultaneously pushing Amazon \\"special offers\\" and the newly created Amazon Silk browser. The Amazon AppStore is limited in its selection for the Fire HD content and there is no Miracast support, no HDMI port or Micro SD expansion slot. While some of the issues can be overcome with various modifications (that will most likely void the warranty) and/or purchases like a $25.00 HDMI adapter, the latest Fire HD falls short when compared to other tablets within the same price range.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: There is nothing worse than a frustrating tablet that is obviously rushed to ...
review_body: If the previous Kindle Fire HD's are any indication, you are going to regret this purchase.  There is nothing worse than a frustrating tablet that is obviously rushed to market before its flaws are worked out.  The browser closes constantly.  The battery issues are legendary, including the constant loss of power even when the tablet should be shut off but it restarts itself at random.  Features, like sending your own documents to it, DO NOT WORK.  How many features have to fail before Amazon acknowledges they have an inferior product?  Will Amazon ever respect their customer enough to provide a working tablet?  And don't even bother with Amazon Customer Service unless you want to return this purchase which you should do in the first week!  Their Customer Service will stall and try to make you fall behind the return deadline because so many people return these things after just one attempt to use.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Pretty disappointed generally. Had this for a week. Sounds like with the new OS update many people have had problems. Well this is my first experience with an Amazon tablet and what a letdown. I use an iPhone 5 and I didn't think I was spoiled until now. Everything runs slowly and very choppy including the keyboard as I am typing this review. I read some negative reviews and thought people must just be picky but it truly is that bad. I'm starting to wonder if it's this individual tablet...Idk. it seems like it is constantly. crashing or recovering from a crash. Web pages take quite a while to load. If you switch from the web browser to Facebook and back one of the apps will probably crash. I'm just using it for what I consider basic stuff and it can't handle it. I would be ok with it if it was an older model I got at a bargain price, but this just came out in october! How can a brand new model function so badly? I really was looking forward to having this. I like Amazon's service and order a lot from the site. I'm so disappointed.

For my use as a reader with minimal need for anything else such as games and Internet, i really wish I had not invested the extra money to buy this device.  Obviously, however, there would also be the same problem with any other use in bright sunlight such as games, Internet, and email.  A huge disappointment.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Initially great, but less than six months later... dead.
review_body: EDIT: 02/24/2015  The review below is when I originally received my Kindle in December 2014. During the early part of February, my Kindle stopped turning on. I first noticed this after I left it idle for about an hour, off the charger, with the battery at around 54%, so there is no possible way the battery had died. Regardless, I did everything I could to try and get it to work, including Amazon's recommended instructions for those with my issue. I dealt with customer service several times about this incident and was told that I would receive a new one in the mail. Fine - however, I noticed that the one being sent to me was REFURBISHED. Apparently, in the warranty of the Kindle, should anything go wrong, you can be sent either a new or refurbished one. While this may be okay for some, it definitely wasn't for me considering I had originally paid for a new one and had never dropped it, exposed it to liquid or used anything other than the original charger. In addition to this, the refurbished  Kindle was not even sent in a properly packaged box. ONE cardboard box with just ONE plastic insulator inside and with the Kindle and charger just what seems to be thrown in! I am retracting the original 5 stars to 2, as Amazon's customer service was exceptional in doing their best to fix all of this. Though, I think Amazon's policy on *their* product is awful. Perhaps I am just too picky, but I don't think I'll ever purchase a Kindle again.    ORIGINAL REVIEW: 12/02/2014  Very lightweight and reads like a dream. The apps run well without any lag. I'm really glad that I paid extra for 16GB and without the special offers, it's everything I imagined and more!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Flimsy construction/much larger bezel compared to the 6 inch version.
review_body: I originally bought the fire hd 7 inch thinking I would like it just as much as my girlfriends hd 6. I was replacing a nexus 7 so it seemed logical. However upon receiving it I immediately regretted it. Where the 6 is sturdy as a brick with a nice slim bezel, the 7 inch feels almost hollow and even showed signs of pressure issues when tapping on the back (you could start to see the screen get weird). The 7 has a bezel that is almost double the size of its smaller counterparts, making what should be a small compact tablet feel massive in your hands. Where I could comfortably hold the hd 6 or even my nexus 7 with one hand, I often times needed to use 2 with this tablet. If you're at all worried about size, quality of build and one handed use. Definitely skip the 7, get the 6. You won't be disappointed.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I've got to say, having read that this thing uses a (heavily customized) Android OS, I had thought that this would be a lot more like the Nexus 7 than it turned out to be. I am fairly disappointed.

The hardware specs and performance are quite nice, but it's essentially a fancy Kindle. It's a real champ for reading books on a tiny screen, if that's what you want to do. But if you expected to be able to use the Google Play app ecosystem or treat the device like any other Android device, you'll be very frustrated. Amazon has a competing app marketplace, but the offerings are very limited in some areas that are important to me. I think that was very shortsighted of Amazon, and is a missed opportunity in my opinion.

I'm not at all impressed with the Silk browser, and am rather annoyed that I'd have to root the device to use any other browser. At least my Nexus 7 can use Chrome, which is not only a better browser but helps keep all of my devices (except this dressed-up Kindle) synchronized.

And I've just got to say... Amazon requiring you pay extra if you do *not* want the Kindle Fire HD to show advertisements on the lock screen is just cheesy. Wow.

I'm honestly considering sending this back.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Very limited Fire OS, do not buy if you want performance and customization.
review_body:
The tablet build quality is good, but I don't care for the Fire OS and how restricted it is. There is almost zero ways to customize the tablet, and you're locked into the limited amazon App store. You cannot get or use any google apps, so no Gmail, Youtube, or Google Maps!!!

Additionally, while the hardware specs are comperable to most higher end tablets the actual performance or running the OS and using the web browser are quite poor.

The OS is clunky and I even had a software bug to where I was locked out of the tablet completely and the tablet would not reset itself as it should have, and I had to sit on the phone with 4 different amazon techs for ~3-4 hours total until they finally sent me a replacement device.

I would only recommend this for kids or grandparents since it is so restricted. But honestly the Samsung or Google Nexus tables are a way better way to go for anyone.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: At first I loved it. It did everything that I could do ...
review_body: I have 3 of these. One is 32 GB and the other two is 16 GB. The very first one I bought was in October or November of 2012. At first I loved it. It did everything that I could do to it. Then after 6 months, the very first one I bought started giving me problems such as dying while playing or watching a movie even when the battery says that it has 70 plus charge on it. For me to keep watching the movie I have to keep it plugged in the charger. It has been going on this way until last week it finally  completely shut down. It will not charge at all. I thought of keeping it in the charger for a day hoping that it will charge a little bit. That was over a week ago. So the first kindle fire HD 7 I ever bought is now in the shelf. I haven't decide yet whether I'll toss it in the trash or crush it with my hammer. Let's talk about the second one I bought. I bought it 6 months after I bought my first one because of the problems I was having with the first one which I have discussed above. It did the same thing. This one started dying 5 months after I bought it. It usually dies at 60 percent battery charged. So for my daughter to play her game, she has to keep it plugged in the charger. Finally, the third kindle fire HD 7 I have is a 32 GB. This is somewhat better because it keeps playing until the battery charge is gone. I don't know how long this would last but I am hoping it will do better than my first two.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I almost Love this tablet....I would have given it 5 stars if it had a micro SD slot to expand the memory. It says 8GB of memory, but it's really more like 5GB when you factor in the operating system and the pre-loaded apps....and keep in mind, this doesn't include YOUR favorite apps!! When you download a few movies ( or add your personal videos), you're going to run out of memory real quick !!! If Amazon would build this with expandable memory (micro SD card) instead of charging to \\"upgrade\\" to a more expensive model with more memory, these tablets would be flying off the shelf!!

Pros:

HD Display
Fast Processor
Dual Speakers
Can download movies
Can download TV shows
Good camera
Skype Capable

Cons:

Very Limited Memory

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: ... this device for about a week and I really dislike it. The interface is designed more like a ...
review_body:
I have had this device for about a week and I really dislike it. The interface is designed more like a "what can I buy from Amazon today" gui rather than a fully functional tablet. Only a subset of the full catalog of Android apps are available for any of the Fire HD/HDX tablets. The apps are not always up to date with the versions available on the Google Play store either. The last straw for me was when I found out it does not have the ability to mirror the display to my two FireTV's. You have to have the HDX version for that, something that I am sure is just a software imposed limitation to push you to buy the more expensive device. I expected all things "Fire" related, FireTV Fire tablet FireTV stick, to work like Apple products just work together.

If all you want is something to consume Amazon content on then this is an OK device, but I would recommend buying a true Android tablet that have a nice screen. Then you could have access to ALL the Android apps and features and add the Kindle app for Amazon content.

One last thing, it have about a 1/2" bezel going around the full outside of the screen.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Not as good as the first Fire
review_body: This is my 8th Kindle, my 2nd Fire.  I bought this to replace my first generation Fire which I really liked, and because I'm trying to share only a portion of my library with my kids.  It's worse than the first Fire in most respects - battery life, speed to start apps, navigation, the way it feels in my hands.  I often have to touch the device 2-3 times to turn a page.  I can't say whether the screen is better because my first Fire gave up the ghost. It WAS inexpensive, I paid $79 which is a deal no matter how bad the battery is.  But I will stick to iOS devices from now on, even though they are more expensive, they last a lot longer and the way Amazon has the family sharing set up really doesn't work for me.    If you want an inexpensive, throw-away-after-two-years device, this works.  If you would rather have a device that works well and lasts a long time, buy something else.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Don't buy this tablet if you have teenagers.
review_body:
Are you buying this to share? If so you may want to think again. The Multi-User function is VERY RESTRICTIVE. You can have 2 adult accounts only. The 4 other accounts are "child" accounts that are locked and limited. You cannot turn the "child mode" off. They cannot install apps. I couldn't even give them permission to use an Internet Browser App, so no internet either.

Those users can only open the very limited apps you can assign them. My teenagers immediately started freaking out because a bunch of the "standard" apps for them were not available through the Amazon App downloader. You cannot use Google Play.

It worked great, and I was really wanting to love it... but we sent it back the next day when we realized how many limitations and restrictions the tablet has.

If you are not going to share this tablet. If you don't play games. If you only want to use the tablet for Amazon related things, then you may enjoy the Fire.

However if you want to be able to download regular apps like YOUTUBE or INSTAGRAM, then don't buy this.

It takes a really long time holding down the on/off button to get it started again. Once it was active, I checked the battery and it was at least 60% charged. This has happened 4 or 5 times, and I plan on checking with Amazon to see what the problem is.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I like my original Kindle Fire better than the HD model
review_body: Overall, I like my original Kindle Fire better than the HD model. The graphics seem slightly better on the HD, but there are also a number of drawbacks. The on/off button is practically flush with case and difficult to activate.  There is no indicator light on the side of the case to show green when the unit has been fully charged and the unit seems to require charging much more frequently than my Kindle Fire.  There was no dictionary included with the HD, although a free dictionary download was available on the Amazon store. Several games, such as Angry Birds, that I played on my Kindle Fire were not available to play on the HD due to software incompatibility - however,  Amazon came through with a credit to offset the purchase of replacements.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
Update again: Figured out how to block non kid stuff from her kindle but I had to do it through Amazon on the computer...

If you need to do this too: Amazon.com > Your account > Digital Content > Amazon Instant Video Settings > Viewing Restrictions: On > check the device and save

Way to bury it under all those clicks...

Update: Removed a star
Because we decided to boycott "Free Time", we had an incident with rated R shows being accessible on my daughter's Kindle.

Amazon Video + Amazon Kindle = most un family friendly software/device with limited ways to restrict access without paying for it.

I will say that the "Remote Alarm" feature on the tablet worked like a dream... we lost the tablet behind a dresser and was able to find it.

#FRUSTRATED

Old Review: (2 stars)
I bought this tablet during the $30 off special for cyber sale week (after black Friday) for my daughter. I was hoping to be able to set it up so she could easily navigate between netflix, hulu and amazon prime videos.

Apparently even if you have prime you cannot set up the Fire HD 7 to que up prime kids video's without having to navigate through amazon videos > side bar > Kids every time...

They do have "Free Time" which is not free... it's $2.99 a month. THIS IRRITATES ME AS A PRIME MEMBER. I already have access to all of this but if I want my child to access prime kids I have to pay another $2.99 a month?!?

I even tried to download the Amazon Instant Video app but it would not let me since my device does not support it. This way I could have enabled Amazon Instant Video in the "Free Time" area under apps... but no... You have to subscribe to access...

I will not be buying another Kindle/Fire product EVER because of this and will just teach my 6 year old how to navigate this irritating system.

If Amazon supported their prime members and had an easier navigation system for kids I would be much happier with this product. (Even the Hulu app has a way to lock to just kids content)

Overall, the 2 stars are because the display is nice, stream with no lag, and the sound is good. Removed a star because the battery doesn't seem to hold up too well for streaming, storage is not expandable (you cannot use an sd card to expand storage) and the navigation menu is beyond frustrating.app has a way to lock to just kids content) Overall, the 2 stars are because the display is nice, stream with no lag, and the sound is good. Removed a star because the battery doesn't seem to hold up too well for streaming, storage is not expandable (you cannot use an sd card to expand storage) and the navigation menu is beyond frustrating.

review_headline: Buyer beware - limited storage available for use!
review_body: While there are some great things about the Kindle Fire HD7, buyers should beware that they will not have the advertised storage space available.  While the Kindle Fire HD is advertised to come with 8 or 16 GB of storage, you won't have this amount of storage available.  More than 40% is not accessible - for the 8GB, only 4.5GB is actually available to use and for the 16GB, only 11.6GB is actually available to use.  This means that you can't even download one single HD movie on an "8 GB" Kindle Fire HD7, and this is with minimal other apps on the device.  That is pretty pathetic.  Overall, we were pretty disappointed.
