product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: LOVE my Kindle, but lifespan kills it for me. :-(
review_body:
Very frustrated! I LOVE my Kindle, my hubby loves his, & my kids love to use mine. That alone would give them 5 stars in my book - I use it ALL THE TIME. But in the last 2 yrs, I've purchased 2 Kindles. First one began to die weeks before the 1 yr warranty expired. At first it would only work while plugged in, but then it would try to boot up, die, then reboot, die, etc. Continuous cycle. After an unsuccessful hard reboot & factory re-set, Amazon replaced it with a refurbished one. Now the 2nd brand new Kindle we bought has begun doing the exact same thing at just over a year (so past warranty). When I called support I was offered to purchase a refurbished one at a "discount". However, I could have purchased a brand NEW one over the past Black Fri weekend for less than the refurbished discount.

I really like Amazon & have wanted to love my Kindle. In fact I was planning to buy my son the kid's version for Christmas. But I refuse to buy a new one EVERY SINGLE YEAR. That is ridiculous & the technology is obviously sorely lacking with Amazon if that is the average life span. Of course they do now offer an extended warranty up to 3 yrs, but this was either not an option when I purchased mine, or it was not readily offered, because this is the first time I've seen it.

I suppose I will now go look at iPad minis, but I'm very frustrated at all the lost content I've purchased from Amazon. If you don't want Apple to rule the world, you need to step it up & put out a better product. And yes, I know, I can read my books from the Kindle app on my phone & laptop, but seriously, who wants to read a 700+ page book on your phone...or with a big ole' laptop balanced on you? So I will finish reading my unread Kindle books on my laptop, & then Amazon will not be getting anymore digital purchases from me. And I have very little reason to renew my Amazon Prime membership this year (especially now that it has increased to $99).

Way to turn away acompletely loyal, continued repeat customer, Amazon. Guess I've gotta look elsewhere. :-(

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
How do I hate thee? Let me count the ways:

My main complaint is that is has a proprietary browser that doesn't act like any tablet or computer. Being used to using a Samsung tablet and various laptops and computers, I find this thing to be counter-intuitive and hard to figure out where things live (where it downloads things to, where control panels are, where programs are, etc.).

It reminds me of Windows 8, which is maybe where Microsoft got the stupid idea for Windows 8, which is the worst OS I've yet to run across. Maybe even worse than this one.

It's a bit heavier than my Samsung Tab 4 Pro as well even though my Samsung is bigger, has an SD card to expand the memory and I can connect it to my computer to add up to 128gigs of files with a 128gig SD card.

The camera isn't as good as the Samsung, the chip isn't as good, and it doesn't offer as many apps as the Samsung.

You say that's not a fair comparison? Well it's Kindle itself that is making the comparison to a Samsung tablet - it just popped up as I was looking at the specs on the Fire HD 7. It says it's a better deal because the Samsung is $199 and the Fire is now only $139 (I paid $199 for the Fire HD 7, but that was a year ago and the Samsung cost more then as well.

At this time the Samsung Tab 4 Pro 8\\" tablet is $200 and the Fire HD 7 is $139. For the extra $60 you get a lot more (as I mentioned above) with the Samsung. Bigger screen, lighter weight, SD card, ability to add files to via USB, and - Most Importantly - you can use Chrome or IE with it so it acts like a real computer, and also it stores things in a file system very similar to a computer so it's easy to figure out how to use, whereas the Fire HD is easy to use for most purposes but sometimes it's hard to figure out how it is designed, what the architecture is for filing files, programs etc.

So the bottom line for me is I don't like the Fire HD, I do like the Samsung tablets, and I would not recommend anyone buy this Fire HD.

(That said, I DO LOVE MY KINDLE PAPERWHITE as a dedicated ebook reader!) (but it's not a tablet)ets, and I would not recommend anyone buy this Fire HD.

(That said, I DO LOVE MY KINDLE PAPERWHITE as a dedicated ebook reader!) (but it's not a tablet)

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I ordered a new Fire HD 7 for my wife's first tablet and it was delivered defective. Would not come out of sleep mode...the display would only flash black/gray repeatedly. I called Amazon tech support who had me do a reboot. That worked fine, but then I had to reboot every time to get it out of sleep mode. I called back...they sent me a new Fire HD 7. My new one worked for about a week, then whenever I would go to the home screen (swiping to the left out of wallpaper), the display would flash repeatedly....black/gray. I called Amazon AGAIN. They offered to send a THIRD Fire HD 7 which I refused and asked for a refund. I was put on hold and told me they would refund 80% of my purchase price. I stated that was not satisfactory and....after 30 minutes on the phone...the Amazon Customer Service agent hung up on me! I called back....went through this all again....and was told they would make an exception and refund my purchase price.

I'm not only extremely disappointed in my Fire HD 7, but this was by far my worst customer service experience with Amazon yet. I am going to buy my wife another tablet (probably a Nexus), but I'll buy from a local retailer.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I've been a long time kindle user. This is my sixth one. This new one has a lot of great features; unfortunately, I have something better to compare it to - my last kindle.

There were just several moderate to small issues with this new one that led to a comparatively unpleasant user experience. The most irritating of these was screen freezing. Several other users mentioned this in their reviews, which I found today when searching to see if anyone else had the same problem.

For me, it happened 3 times in less than an hour while I was trying to listen to an audio book and play a simple connect three game at the same time. This was never an issue on my old kindle and this is a frequent activity for me.

Then the screen froze again later while I was trying to watch a TV show. Each of these freezes required turning the device completely off, giving it a minute and restarting it. Another review mentioned it freezing while searching the web. Since listening to audio books, playing games and browsing the web are what I primarily use this device for, I'm afraid I just don't trust it to perform.

The other small issues are that the battery seems to drain more rapidly and the download speed of apps and audio books seems a little reduced. On the plus side, my email experience was better and the brief amount of web browsing that I did was much improved with the new HD screen and it did seem a little faster.

Overall, even though I still think this is good tablet, potentially great if they fix the screen freezing, I just prefer my old one. I told my husband I'm taking it back from him, and he gets the new one instead.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Worst Tablet ever! It fails in every respect!
review_body:
Worst Tablet ever! It fails in every respect!

The Tablet looked like a good deal from a Amazon... I assumed it would be good with Amazons name behind it... boy was I wrong! I should have read the fine print! Ignore all the positive reviews, this product is a DUD!

Good: nothing...

Bad: Everything...

Hardware... This tablet is so small that the Samsung cell phone is bigger. It has terrible screen that makes HD look kile 360p

The sound is good, and it has a front and rear camera, but the pics are nothing to write home about. The screen is touch and responsive, but there are many better tablets that are bigger and better screen for this price range.

Software: This is where the Fire HD fails so terribly! I was hoping the OS on this Tablet would be Android, which , after the windows 8 disaster is clearly the best OS for Tablets, well now Windows 8 is the second best OS for tablets because whatever trash is on this tablet its the new king in stupidity! The WHOLE OS is just a big up sell of Amazon prime and other crappy Amazon apps nobody cares about... not even a youtube app... the home screen stinks! Its just a black screen and a lot of Amazon bloat ware. Its literally the worst OS on any tablet... ever!.

Please don't buy this product... the ratings must be from people who don't own tablets and this is their first.. I have 3 tablets and this is literally the worst! Amazon employees bust be writing all these positive reviews... Its the only explanation for all these good reviews for this TINY, tablet with a TERRIBLE OS! There are phones with better specs for hlf the price!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: No Display Mirroring on this Model
review_body: I really like the look, feel and sound of this device. But I primarily bought it for display mirroring, which the amazon site clearly says is available. I looked at all the amazon help sections, read the owner's manual, and have contacted amazon about this \\"missing\\" feature. I feel like this was sort of a \\"bait and switch\\" kind of deal--I got the device during the cyber sales and THOUGHT I was getting a fully-featured device. But it doesn't look like it. Instead it looks like key features are missing. It's not as if I don't know how to set up device mirroring. I've done it effectively with my Kindle Fire HDX and with Apple products. This just appears to promise something it doesn't deliver. However, if the mirroring isn't important, the performance on this device is excellent. Everything loads quickly, even the special offers aren't that annoying. But I really am missing the display mirroring and probably will have to send this back. )-:    UPDATE: The amazon help response was sort of odd. I asked several questions, but only one of those questions was really answered in the first round (what Kindles actually have display mirroring.) However, I did find out that you can \\"hardwire\\" your HD7 to create mirroring display using Amazon HDMI Adapter for Fire Tablets (4th Generation) and an HDMI port--if you have one--on your TV. [Be careful with older Kindles, the adapter doesn't work!] I am still testing to see how using the adapter affects the battery life of the Fire. With the HDX and wireless mirroring, you can have the power cord attached so that you're not running the battery down while mirroring. I'm not sure that an HDMI connection, like a USB connection to a power source with other computer devices, will also power the Kindle. I doubt it, but if the Kindle will run for a decent length of time on battery, this may not be an issue. Amazon could be much more helpful in describing how mirroring works with each device and what accessories are needed for each.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: They run just fine. Three stars for how heavily modified they are
review_body: They run just fine.  Three stars for how heavily modified they are.  The free time is a nice feature for my kids but I feel like I am also being locked down with all of the modifications to the OS.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I really want to love this product. I just can't do it. When it first came, it would shut down one the battery got to 10%. Now the fire shuts down when the battery gets below 50%. If you Google kindle fire randomly shuts down, you'll see this is a common problem. I've had my fire less than a year. I paid $169 for the HD7" and as technology does, the price has come down.

I'm a huge fan of Amazon and they get a lot of my money every year. As much as I want to love this kindle, I just can't and it makes me very sad.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: It's OK but returned for better one

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I wanted it to be more tablet like, but this is more for Amazon than anything ...
review_body: It was ok!! I expected more.  I wanted it to be more tablet like, but this is more for Amazon than anything else.  Very hard to find apps. I just thought it would be better, I am going to give this to my daughter. I think this is more for kids.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I was so excited about getting this tablet because all the great reviews. I read that you could only download apps from the Amazon app store and I was Ok with that. I checked the app store and it had pretty much everything I use on my Iphone. As soon as I received the tablet I tried to download the apps and most of them aren't compatible with my device???!!!??  Amazon needs to change this immediately. I'm a loyal prime member and this is my first Amazon tablet and I'm very disappointed.  I could have gone any other way but I chose to stick with Amazon and this is really frustrating.  Besides this issue the tablet seems really nice.  Don't like the camera too much. But I only take pictures with my phone.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
In a world of Android tablets of infinite configuration, one would ask, why buy a Fire when you know you can't connect to the Google mother-ship? It's all about the Prime. Side loading google apps will solve most peoples problems anyway (search it). If you are a prime member, the Fire enhances your relationship with Amazon in ways you will love and hate. I am not sure about privacy issues and I know you will have little privacy from Amazon but in the end, the perks will distract you from such concerns.
Things I like-
*Access and storage to the cloud. All your Books, Audiobooks movies, music, pictures and documents you care to buy, upload or borrow.
*Glorious sound. For such a little thing, it really gives good audio.
*Decent picture... not the best but not bad.
*Price is awesome
* Not a lot of bloat. I use all installed apps. Nothing not necessary for Amazon interaction and fulfillment.
Things I hate-
*No Google App Store
*No themes/ wallpapers/ Widgets and styling access to the UI
*The controls are simply different to confuse. Not intuitive or even efficient. After 3 other Android tablets, I find this one limited in control features and customization controls. If you don't like the looks too bad.
* Power button trolls me. It only works when I don't mean for it to. Not sure if it's defective or just uber sensitive
* NO EXTERNAL MEMORY ACCESS! no USB or micro SD access limits how much you can do with this unit. This in hind sight is almost a deal breaker.
* Battery Life is 4 hours of intermittent use and 2 hours of continuous use for me. Not even close to published specs.

The bottom line that makes this shopping appliance attractive is the price and free web hosting of pics and movies. Unlimited is just lovely :) This is worth owning just to inter react with Amazon. I will be keeping my Motorola Xoom for everything else but being able to watch Prime anywhere there is WIFI is great. I would buy again. I would add one important thing when considering purchase.... ON BOARD MEMORY!! I can't tell you enough about how much I regret not getting the max memory when ordering. If you can't store much, you had better have good web everywhere you plan to go.onsidering purchase.... ON BOARD MEMORY!! I can't tell you enough about how much I regret not getting the max memory when ordering. If you can't store much, you had better have good web everywhere you plan to go.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Received free with a purchase.  Not impressed with the overall product. Apps are slow, if they run at all. Picture and sound quality is not as expected. I see why they were giving them away. .  I would be returning if I had purchased-- will be finding someone who wants it because I don't. Spend a little more and buy an Ipad mini....

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: All three broke by one year and had to be replaced with a crappy little discount from Amazon
review_body: What a piece of junk. I bought three Kindle Fires.  One for me, one for my husband, and one for my daughter.  All three broke by one year and had to be replaced with a crappy little discount from Amazon.  Then all three of those broke after one year.  All six Kindle Fires had the same problem - the battery wouldn't charge.  This was all documented through Amazon (whose Kindle customer service has become abysmal) and they want me to pay to replace them again.  So 1000 dollars worth of tablets that didn't even last a year.  I should have bought a IPad.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Stopped working after 2 weeks, now I have to go back to the store & return it during the busy holiday season. Very disappointed!

review_body: I have owned different tablets like the nexus 7 which was my favorite. I was ery much excited to get this tablet because Iove amazon and do about 90% of my shopping through them but i was severely disappointed with this tablet. If you are looking for a multi purpose tablet or you love android and google this is not for you. Social media apps are horrible with the exception of facebook. It is not as fast as i hought it would be. The screen clarity and keyboard are very good though. Battery life is ok but my nexus 7 was way better. If you are looking for a tablet just to browse the internet and read than this may be the perfect solution for you especially with the price point.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Updated - Not as good as an iPad
review_body: Purchased one to review to determine if they would be a cost effective alternative opposed to iPads for my school system. The product I received would not set the correct time. I went through Amazon Customer Service online and via phone. They are looking for answers in their engineering department. While it may not be Amazon's fault, who develops a product that cannot allow for the manual input of the time? I'll stick with iPads at least for now.    I gave it one star originally but the time finally reset when I brought the product to my home wireless network. I think the time issue was with the school's wi-fi - that being said, I still do not like the idea of the product lacking simple manual options. I think this is fine for home use (if you are heavily invested in amazon products like audible or amazon prime) otherwise save your money up and get an iPad - just my opinion. We'll stick with iPads at school.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I really enjoy my Fire. I've been using it for a year now and everything was working good. But, just like every other gadget I own, somebody has to make it "better, more enjoyable and easier to operate". Last week the Silk browser was upgraded. Right. I had no problems with the old one. This version seems to think I need to have a magnification window pop up every time I touch something on the screen. Now I have to touch navigation arrows and links twice to make them work, and sometimes the magnification window just turns on and off repeatedly until I figure how to hit the button to get to the next page.

I would rather save my $109 and just get the screen replaced on my older but better Ipad.  Sorry Amazon I had such high hopes, but was very disappointed.

review_headline: It was the worst tablet I've ever owned
review_body: It was the worst tablet I've ever owned!  I ended up returning it. The tablet keep freezing up and unloading my books as I was reading them.  Not worth it to me.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
This is the review for Android users. If you have owned or own any other Android devices and are looking for even a semblance of that usability, this is not the tablet for you.

TL;DR: If you use real Android devices and want that functionality, move along. If want the best access to Amazon entertainment sources give this thing a try.
I'm coming to the Fire line from a Nexus 7 2012 model that my son shattered the screen on. Pointing out the obvious, Fire devices run a heavily skinned "Android" OS that is dubbed Fire OS. Fire OS at its best is clunky and awkward, and lacks any real customizations. In the app store a lot of great apps are omitted to force use of Amazon's proprietary apps. Not that there aren't alternate ways to get certain apps to replace Amazon's but don't expect the tablet to just adapt to your preferences. For example, I got Swiftkey keyboard loaded onto the Fire and was elated when it seemed that it was going to work, only to disappointed later when the my Swiftkey was replaced again by the Fire keyboard after a few minutes of non-use. Oddly enough, the time I had with Swiftkey on this device showed me just how poor the Fire keyboard is. Swiftkey was far more responsive and gave additional customizations, such as my favorite feature of adding a number row to the keyboard. Another poorly done aspect of the Fire line of apps is Silk browser, which does not operate so smoothly as the name may lead you to believe. My biggest gripe with the Silk browser is that it does not open links from outside sources very well. I would have to exit the browser multiple times and re-click links to get the browser to load them. Fortunately, you can get Dolphin browser or another browser to replace Silk browser and it will maintain its default status. Finally, the lack of a recent apps construct is probably one of the most frustrating downfalls of Fire OS. To switch between apps you literally have to go back to the home screen and select the app you're trying to switch, essentially multitasking is impossible on this tablet.

Now, the good. If you're a prime subscriber and heavily invested in Amazon's entertainment selection, then that aspect of this tablet will work great for you. Having access to the Kindle owner's library is a huge plus. The prime video functionality is nice, as I can download prime video to the tablet so I can keep up with shows I'm watching even when I'm not connected. Prime music just added stations that genre/sub-genre focused. For Amazon entertainment services, this thing is great but that's about all it's good for.p you're trying to switch, essentially multitasking is impossible on this tablet.

Now, the good. If you're a prime subscriber and heavily invested in Amazon's entertainment selection, then that aspect of this tablet will work great for you. Having access to the Kindle owner's library is a huge plus. The prime video functionality is nice, as I can download prime video to the tablet so I can keep up with shows I'm watching even when I'm not connected. Prime music just added stations that genre/sub-genre focused. For Amazon entertainment services, this thing is great but that's about all it's good for.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Very difficult to understand not for a person that's been using Google.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: We received this super fast, but am VERY disappointed with the delivery.  They delivered this on a Sunday and put it in my mailbox.  I was home all day and it was not attempted to deliver it to my door.  With the amount of money I spent on this, I would expect it to be delivered to my door and not my mailbox!!!!!!!!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: So far so good.  I am only a few weeks  in but it's woderful. Wish I'd waited a week because it is now $30.00 less than what I paid. 2016...now starting to really falter . Tech support suggested rebooting silk browser. Emptied all book marks ,read later....still not fixed...then she told me they are aware of the ongoing problem...after erasing my stuff. Really? I most likely would not but fire again.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Like a brand new bike, but missing a wheel!
review_body:
Amazing tablet overall. I am a huge amazon fan and they did not disappoint with this tablet, the only thing that I found was a severe hindrance was the app store. I bought this for my little brother for videos and gaming, and was disappointed when I went to the app store and did not find popular games such as Clash of Clans. Upon further research, I realized that the amazon app store is severely lacking compared to Google Play.

I felt really bad about giving up such an amazing tablet just because it did not have the apps I wanted, but as is, this tablet is like a brand new bike that is missing a wheel; It looks great and would perform excellently, but without a big app store it is useless! What's more, you cannot download the Google Play app store unless you "root" your device, which is a whole other story...

Pros:
-Great Quality
-Amazing screen quality/colors
-Sound is flawless
-layout is great, works well with Prime instant videos

Cons:
-Amazon's app store

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Freezing up and shutting down constantly!!!!!
review_body: Loved it at first... it was a mother's day present from my daughter.  Now it keeps freezing and shutting down constantly. I have tried several solutions with no success. Would not recommend purchasing the Fire to anyone.

review_body: Clear picture but slower than my phone to search the internet.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Amazon places restrictions on the use of the Fire.
review_body: It would be great if not for the built in restrictions.  Google play isn't an approved app, so those apps that I've already purchased on Google play aren't accessible without going to effort to bypass the standard methods.  And ebooks that I've purchased elsewhere aren't readily usable either, the only readers available on the fire are designed for reading ONLY the ebooks purchased from Amazon.  Yeah, I know that there are ways around both of these restrictions, but Amazon tries to restrict them.  I may have to actually root the Fire in order to do what I'd like to do with it.  That's inconvenient and annoying.  I should probably have bought a different Android tablet, but I liked the looks of this one.  It's nice enough, but their attempts to keep it restricted make it less useful to me.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Avoid unless you want it for the Amazon content. Then it is an excellent choice.
review_body: Very restrictive. Can't modify the main page to get rid of the annoying carousel. Can't install from Google Play. Not as stable as Samsung's offerings. Is really only useful if you use a lot of Amazon's content.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: it was ok. there were a few glitches and ...
review_body: it was ok. there were a few glitches and it won't turn on sometimes. the battery died quickly and some apps would just close randomly. i had to buy a second kindle because my first one broke. in all it is an ok gift.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Not as good as earlier versions
review_body: This is my 3rd Kindle Fire and I'm not impressed by this model at all. I did my homework before buying and narrowed my options down to the HDX and the HD 7. Based on the reviews and the fact that the HD 7 was recently released, I decided on the HD 7. Right out of the box I found it to be much slower than earlier models, plus it had several glitches and bugs, such as frequent freezing, not going to the last page read on books, shutdown of apps and failure to link to websites within email and apps.  I tried a few fixes suggested by Kindle Help but eventually replaced the device within a month of purchase. Fortunately Amazon has good customer service so I was able to get a replacement within two days. The replacement is better but still seems a bit slow and the whole experience has soured me on the device. There was a time when I wouldn't leave home without my Kindle so I am somewhat disappointed. If I was new to Kindle this would be a minor annoyance but at this price point I suppose it is what it is.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: crashing and red streak in less than a year
review_body:
I'm so dissatisfied in that in less than a year my safari crashes consistently and I have a red streak crossing my entire screen. The product was great until about 6 months in.
So dissapointing.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Since purchasing this device I have had so many issues with it and they seem to worsen the longer I have it.  It gives me low storage warnings regardless of what I have stored on it and it won't even show me what the storage is (a feature the Kindle has).  Most recently it deleted all of my books from the device and from my favorites list.  It also won't let me see all the books I have on the cloud, only the most recent purchases.  It also is now telling me it can't access a wireless connection due to storage. When I brought this up on the support site I was told to factory reset.  How many times should I have to factory reset?!!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: don't buy products that lock you out
review_body: I would not buy any kindle products again. There are several apps and programs you can't run because Amazon has something against Google and won't allow you to download certain types of apps. This type of competitive game only hurts the consumer.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I really dislike this tablet. It's not intuitive at all and doesn't come with a users guide. It's difficult to figure out how to move apps between profiles or where the apps go after you've purchased them. We are beginning to figure it out but are continually dissatisfied with this device. We just subscribed to the Freetime free trial and again, it's so hard to understand how to use it that we're not getting anywhere near the full functionality. We bought this for our 3-year-old and she gets frustrated as well. I would not recommend this product.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I wasn't aware they took out the HDMI connector and there is no light to tell me it is fully charged like earlier versions.  It feels awkward and some things just aren't there.  One of the things which bugs me is the on / off button is so small that I can't immediately feel it and have to search for it.    My previous kindle kept freezing, customer service tried to make it out to be a cache problem even though I only had two apps and then they told me to charge the device even though the battery was at 96% but I plugged it in and it stopped freezing which told me that it was a power issue and that I will never buy certified refurbished again.    I'm not sold on the Fire HD.  The advertising is intrusive and not wanted because they are showing me stuff I have no interest in buying.  I bought a unit that is blue but I am unhappy with black being on the face of the Kindle because I thought I was going to get a Kindle that was one color but it is two.    Pros: There is an app to let you download pictures from a separate digital camera which might help on vacation for people who take a lot of pictures and want to free up the memory on their cameras.  There is also a slideshow app to let you look at your pictures on your Kindle.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Works well Asa reader. Words With Friends app available on Kindle is outdated and graphics are poor. I am in Amazon Prime and the videos are hard to pull down. Graphics are very good when I play videos.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: My friend acquired one of these recently and loves it.  Excellent display, decent battery life, intuitive user interface; he's happy as a clam with his.  But me?  Sorry, but not having an SD card slot on this device is a show-stopper for me.  I accept that this omission was probably dictated by some marketing weenie, but I don't have to like it.  It would have cost about 13 cents to include one on this unit.  I just don't trust "the cloud" and prefer to keep my content where I can always get to it.  I'll stick with my Samsung mid-range tablet.  I didn't give a one star review here because while it would have been pointless to "hate" something that I don't have, I still wanted to show my disdain for this product's lack of what I consider to be a very basic and necessary feature..

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I was super excited to get a kindle fire after my original kindle died. I had looked at the 6 and 7 both looked appealing but i decided price made the 6 a better deal. At the store the sale price swayed me to get the 7. Totally unhappy that an 8g hard drive has less than 4.5 available. Not worth the extra money!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Not as happy as I was with my old Kindle Fire HD.
review_body: I had the first generation of the Kindle Fire HD, and lost it on a plane.  I just got this version and haven't been loving it as much.  When I try to follow a link from twitter or facebook I have to do it twice because the first time it doesn't work.  The kindle app also needs two times to open a book.  That never happened with my old one.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Not interested in ad delivery device
review_body: I have a first generation Kindle Fire. I had this in my cart and was ready to check-out. That's when I saw I had to pay $15 to remove the ads from it. I'm not buying a Fire to be subjected to an ad-delivery device. I'm buying it to read books. My opinion of Amazon dropped a lot after I saw this.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I am deeply disappointed with the book applications in the Kindle
review_body: I am deeply disappointed with the book applications in the Kindle.  This was one of the main reason that I purchased the Kindle over the nook. It is surprising that the IPhone's Kindle app has more choices in how to view and interact with the e-book applications.  There are too few ways to organize the books in the Kindle.  I want the Kindle to automatically organize the books purchased into genre , clarification/type (novels, history, science, biography, etc)  personal star rating give to books, average ratings of the book,  books read or unread etc. The background color and  upset are too limited. The Kindle should also let you create your own categories, share your book ratings with other reading websites like goodreads.  The e-reader does not always use the correct words. The documents applications are extremely limited and difficult to work with you cannot create your own projects and documents.  You can only important books not purchase through Amazon in to the documents and not the book applications. You cannot download document or video applications wanted! Very frustrating and unfriendly.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Like the Kindle but don't totally discount the Samsung.........
review_body:
I just read the Amazon comparison of the Samsung Tablet and the Amazon Kindle - and the only difference between the two they are showing is the price!! That is so funny b/c the Samsung retail price is shown, so you really can't compare since most time these things are on sale!

BUT - we own 4 Kindles in our house; one paperwhite, two Kindle Fire 8GB HD's 7" and one Kindle Fire 16GB 8.9". We really like them all, but the memory on the 8GB's falls short. We often have to delete things to the cloud so the kids can load different games. We've had to stop using the Kid screen because they can't do any of this themselves without the password, so its just easier to just keep them on the main screen.

We have Samsung Galaxy phones and because the Samsung supports both Google Play and the Amazon App store - we're pretty sure our next tablets with be Samsung. I even think the extra cost will be worth it - there are some things we can only use our phones for (like the popular app Fitbit and Disney Movies Anywhere) b/c its only supported by Google Play. Watching a Disney movie on a PHONE screen is not the same as watching it on a 7" or 8.9" Screen - especially for a kid. So even if the Samsung costs more, I think we'd pay it!!! We really like the Kindles but in this area they fall short. Sorry Amazon!

And we've had to call numerous times b/c the latest updates totally messed up our kids Kindles - its still not straightened out and we've talked to so many people in customer service. My husband had to teach the kids to use a "go around" to get to the right info. Someone in Customer Service offered to replace our one Kindle 7" to try to solve the problem - but not the other one! Reason -- it was a week past warranty. Both were purchased as Christmas gifts but a week apart. Nevertheless - one was eligible for replacement one was not. SIGH.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Why NOT to buy an Kindle Fire
review_body:
1 Star for an otherwise awesome piece of hardware? In this review, you will find out things that should keep you away from purchasing this device. I have in my household, an ASUS Transformer, a Nook, 3 HD7 2012 versions, and the 2013 HD7. The only one I'd like to throw through the wall is the new version. Here's why:

1. Restriction of applications to profiles is really hard to manage, and frankly doesn't work. Archived applications still show up, and the interface is not intuitive. I had thought you couldn't see what was accessible, but each profile image shows up next to the applications. The archiving doesn't seem to do anything to any of the lists or access from a Kindle, so removing them their was a waste of time. I happen to get several apps that after research are sketchy with hidden applications. I don't want to remove because developers fix this kind of thing all the time.

2. Removing an application from a child's profile is impossible on the Kindle. I've archived one app, removed from the cloud and from the device in my account, restricted in the Family Library, and it's still available.

3. Interface. It's somewhat intuitive, but it forces plenty of things at you from the get go, and the control of the carousel and other features is clunky compared to the simplicity of the standard android interface.

4. Alternate installation of applications. I have alot of other apps which I need to load in outside of Amazon. First, that process is not as easy as it could be, and they do not show up in the Family Profile either.

If you can get past these limitations and actually like the interface and other benefits (books & Prime) that the Kindle gets you, go for it. For me, I've rooted and installed KitKat on the other three devices. Just waiting for a root for the new Fire to get this one straightened out.

review_headline: Fire HD 7,Great!!, Worst shipping ever!!!!! Got lucky packaging and box product was in were the only thing that got damaged.
review_body:
I made this purchased as a Christmas gift for my daughter. The rating I am giving does not reflect the product it?? self but the delivery method and condition it was received in, A WET SOGGY MESS. I expected this package to be delivered by FedX as stated on my order confirmation page, but instead it was delivered by US Postal Service in a torn open package and stuffed in a rule rout mail box with the lid left opened to get rained on. Really, this is the shipping method you are going to use for a piece of electronic equipment with a value of over 100 dollars. Amazon you might want to rethink your shipping methods for this type of product. I did remove the tablet from the mess and powered it on and thankfully it does work. So I have re-boxed it up in a new box and rapped it to give to my daughter on Christmas morning. I got lucky, so buyer be ware.

Next time I'll buy at a local retailer for this type of product unless Amazon can prove to me they will use a better shipping method.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Loved the idea of a tablet at this price point
review_body: Loved the idea of a tablet at this price point.  Knew it was not going to be an iPad, but owned a previous Kindle and it served the purpose.  Unfortunately, the HD 7 was no longer technically compatible with many of the apps we used on it.  Tech dept says that these are known bugs due to new operating system and will at some point be fixed, however there is no ETA. As a result, the device is not usable.  Returned.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: instead of operating like DOS - that lasts more than a year - ...
review_body:
This review is about Kindle in general.

I'm on my third Kindle, will never buy another one. If only they would design an eReader to simply perform as it should, to focus on its original purpose. I don't need to go to the rodeo.
I don't care about internet or games or camera or or clouds or kryptonite glass or another phone or that it can even talk to me, its a "reader. I simply want an eReader;
- with storage
- a backlight
- a long lasting battery
- min 7"
- that turns on when you press the "on" button, every time
- has a charger and cable that lasts longer than the eReader itself
- swipes
- organizes books in a logical order, drag and drop, instead of operating like DOS
- that lasts more than a year
- under $100
- allows me to add books of any file format without jumping through hoops for 1 hour, wifi, login,upload, download, send to etc
- provides loyal customers with a discount when they upgrade with a new version
- accepts and converts file formats automatically, people loan books, buy and sell used, books, why not files
- free international shipping for exchanges, so Amazon can really share the cost and frustration that we do on their product failures (note to Amazon - there is a world outside the USA. People travel, work and live outside USA)

How many people are on their 3rd, 4th or 5th version or replacement? One person wrote they are on their 8th. Has the company president owned 8 Kindles?

The company is having an internal identity crisis. Product developers in the tablet arena are smoking Kindles. What next, laptops? Quit trying to be a tablet and be the best, most reliable, dependable, Herculean , affordable, simplest eReader on the market.

Too many bells and whistles = too many things that can go wrong. When you try to deliver too much, less gets done right. What percentage of R&D is being spent on perfecting the primary function of the Kindle?

So I am finished with Amazon / Kindle. I'm simply going to use a Kindle app on my laptop and my Sony Experia smart phone, which outperforms any of the functions Kindle is still troubleshooting on a new crop of guinea pigs as evident by the reviews. I'll also be able to use any file format other than .mobi.

You know......., I almost wish I could work for this company and give them a slap in the face "I needed that" reality check because they are losing their way, and with it, market share. With the direction they are going and the speed at which competitors are developing, I don?? see Kindle lasting 10 years. They are going the way of the VHS tape, Discman and iPod. They will show up on those online quizzes asking "How may of you remember these?"

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: ARE YOU KIDDING ME? DOES NOT STREAM ONLINE VIDEOS
review_body:
I owned the first generation kindle fire, it still works perfectly.
I bought my 8 year old cousin the 2nd generation Kindle Fire 6 months ago still works.
Both 1st and 2nd generations are great.

So, I figured the 3rd generation of Kindle Fire would be great too, plus the special offer of $109 for Kindle Fire HD7, so I bought one for my dad.
Boy was I wrong. What piece of **** is the new Silk browser? The videos in the websites that he used doesn't even stream, at all.
So I tried to download other browsers such as opera, UC browser and etc.NOPE. "[browser name] IS INCOMPATIBLE WITH YOUR DEVICE." I tried to download 5 different browsers. All says its incompatible.
I tried using youtube.com, only certain videos stream. Seriously, what's the point of a tablet when you can't stream videos?
So I checked online if others have this issue. Yep, the same thing. They said the new the Fire OS replaced the Android OS on Kindle HD. What's the point of placing all those apps and games on your appstore if ITS INCOMPATIBLE WITH THE DEVICE?

So, naturally I contacted customer service.

"The ad plays, but the main video doesn't
Angela:In this case, I need to transfer you to our Kindle Department so that they will help you and provide you a more information about the problem of your item.
Me:I tried downloading other browsers such as opera but it says its not compatible with the device
Angela:Yes, I understand.
Since you having a problem with your device I need to transfer you to our kindle department.
Please stay connected to transfer you.
A Customer Service Associate will be with you in a moment.
!!You are now connected to Marian from Amazon.com!!
Me:hello?
Marian:Hi there, Nathan.
Me:Videos don't play on the silk browser.
Tried downloading other browsers but it says its not compatible with the device
!!Marian from Amazon.com has left the conversation."!!

I waited 15 minutes for "Marian" to talk first, nothing. So I said "hello?
It took 15 minutes for "Marian" to reply and after 10 minutes, he left the conversation.

How rude is that? What happened to Amazon's amazing customer service? For a customer service representative to just leave the conversation?

No wonder its on sale. They want to get rid of their faults.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Has a better battery than most
review_body: The only thing I could give it more than 4 stars for would be the battery. Has a better battery than most . Other than than that I'm still having issues with sound on it. Speakers crackle. This is my 6th Kindle and still haven't got one that worked. Dissappointed I keep receiving refurbished models and have to send back.Amazon not working well to replace it. Won't buy another one of this model.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Amazon was offering a deal to try this device for 30 days, no money down. So, I ordered one up. The construction of this device was nice. Lightweight and a sleek design made me want to love this thing. Everything was great until I got this thing turned on and how terrible the OS is. It's a failed droid platform without the googleplay app store. In addition to the OS being garbage amazon made sure to add as many advertisements as possible built within the android software. Battery life is terrible. This thing has no standby battery life either, which was a let down. So now down to the price. $140 for a droid based tablet sounds like a awesome price and deal. After sitting down and really thinking about this device I've come to a conclusion. $140 for a tablet with a advertisement ridden OS, no googeplay, terrible battery life and $150 less then an ipad mini 2. The $140 pricetag is actually expensive for what this device offers compared to its competition. This thing sucked so bad I bought an ipad mini. The ipad has more features, faster, better battery life, better os, sleeker and prettier. I'd pay $160 bux more any day for a superior device. If this kindle was priced at $60 this is one hell of a pricepoint device, but its not.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I'm new to the Kindle/Android world.  We're a house with three iPads but I wanted to give my 10-yr-old daughter device all her own and took a leap.  For those with iPads in the house, be warned: many, many apps available on iPad are not available on Kindle.  What's more aggravating is that many apps sold on Amazon.com aren't compatible with the Kindle.  I don't know if this latter issue is more related to the Android development community than it is Amazon's device but, in the aggregate, I'm disappointed with the device.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Just arrived today.  Played with it for a while.  Got upset when it would only go so far on Facebook and then freeze.  There was still plenty of battery time left.  So don't know why that kept happening.  I'm looking forward to watching shows, media, etc.  when I get the time.  I'm hoping that it doesn't freeze up while watching movies and television shows.  Will be very disappointed if it does.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Total piece of junk - buy an IPad, DO NOT BUY A KINDLE
review_body: What an awful piece of dreck this is. Terrible browsing, constant barrage of advertisements, and an interface that looks like it was designed by chimpanzees on bad vodka. The apps selection is really bad, the browser is something called \\"Silk\\" which crashes all the time, and the screen is tiny with no zoom. Why would anyone buy this?    The only, I mean ONLY, reason you might buy one of these is if you really hate Apple and just can't give them your money. Other than that, maybe you just like flushing a hundred dollar bill down the toilet and wondering if it will come back up as two. Because you'll have more fun doing that than \\"playing\\" with your Kindle.    You may think \\"well, I buy a lot of digital books, this will make it easier to buy, download, sort, and read them.\\" You would be wrong an ALL counts. There is no easy way to search for just Kindle/digital books (despite the menu promising you are)...you are constantly directed to the main Amazon store, so you finally have to enter the word \\"\\"kindle\\" after any book in your search term to see if there is one. LAME.    The expected ability to created folders and some kind of organizational scheme for your book downloads is extremely limited and only accessible in a nested folder. There is no way to customize this thing and you have to wade through Amazon's menu selections for Games, Web, Offers, and a bunch of other stuff you didn't buy it for.    As for the reading experience, which you would think is the bread and butter of this machine, you would be shocked at how limited the settings are. You get about five fonts, arrow keys for font sizing, and no column options. It takes forever to boot up too. Yeah, you read that correctly. A tablet that you stare at while it plods up to a start screen.    This thing is a cheap knock-off of the iPad. It has nothing to recommend it other than it's found-in-a-dumpster pricing. You've been warned. Run far, run fast, from Kindle.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: and I loved it. Even though it was refurbished
review_body: I bought this because I had previously purchased the last generation of the 7, and I loved it.  Even though it was refurbished, it worked great and I never had a problem with it.  Since I liked it so much, I decided to buy a brand new one of the latest HD7, and I have been less than impressed.  It seemed to work fine at first, but I noticed that it had to be charged every other day even though I didn't read more than an hour on it every day.  One day the battery was down to 2%, so I plugged it in before I left for work and when I came home it was completely dead.  I thought maybe it was the electrical plug, so I brought the charger into another room but it still wouldn't charge.  I ended up having to contact customer support and they told me that I should be using the 9W charger, not the 5W charger that came with the device.  They sent me a free 9W charger and it worked fine with the Kindle and recharged it.  But then about a week later I realized that I was having problems removing books from the device, and it wouldn't show any books in my library.  I was also having problems with it turning on.  I contacted customer support again and after trying to do a hard restart they told me they would replace the device.  I received the replacement device and it seems to work a little better, as far as the battery goes, but every now and then I still have problems with my library and removing things from the device.  All I use it for is reading and it certainly suits my purposes for that, but it just seems to have a few bugs still.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: It's a great item. The only thing that I don't like about it,  is the battery life doesn't last very long.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: If I could give it less than 1 star I would.  Amazon's Kindle products are great at first, but once that 1 year warranty runs out, it breaks down and Amazon will not replace it even though they are aware of documented problems.  They will try and upsell you on a new product with a "discount" but claim that they can't do anything.  So, if you want a product that lasts just one year, then this is the product for you.  I would suggest you spend a bit more money and buy an iPad.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: advertising is included in all "special offers"  see my chat with customer service
review_body:
advertising included in all "special offers"

You are now connected to Rajaa from Amazon.com

Me:do the new kindles all come with advertising ?

Rajaa:Hello, my name is Rajaa. I'll certainly try to help regarding your concern.

Me:I have read reviews that say that the new kindle fire devices all come with preloaded advertising. Is that true?

Rajaa:Vernon, currently all the new devices comes only with special offers since we ship them currently only within US.

Me:Uhh, I find your answer unclear. Please answer YES or NO. Do they come with advertising?

Rajaa:Yes, Vernon. They come with special offers.

Me:Well, count me out. I was going to replace our two kindles, but I don't want advertising. This is a bad, bad way for Amazon to do business. Very disrespectful of good customers.

Rajaa:Vernon, I completely understand your concern.

Me:Yes, please forward our concerns to your bosses.

Rajaa:We're planning to make the new Kindles available without special offers.

I'll be sure to pass your message on to the appropriate people in our company.

Me:When?

Rajaa: We're regularly working on improvements to your Kindle experience.

The Kindle without special offers will soon become available on our website in a couple of weeks.

You can purchase the new Kindle without special offers without Christmas, Vernon.

*before Christmas

Me:Please - "special offers" is not a synonym for advertising. And it is unclear. Thanks.

Rajaa:You're welcome!

To ensure the utmost attention, I've also passed your message on to the appropriate people in our company.

However, this is something that we need to take serious consideration for change in how this process works.

Me:Thanks for your good responses and that is all for now. I will check back again beforeChristmas. bye

Rajaa:We value customer feedback such as yours as it helps us continue to improve the service and selection we provide.

You're most welcome!

Is there anything else I can do for you today, Vernon?

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I was deeply disappointed with the performance relative to my older Kindles
review_body:
I was deeply disappointed with the performance relative to my older Kindles. Game play is much, much slower than on the older Kindle Fires that I have. And the form factor is a bit odd. I was hoping that the screen would be larger and I didn't expect the newer Kindle to be so much thicker than the old ones. One nice thing is that the power cord connects to the side instead of coming out of the top or bottom. Not having the kindle sit on top of the power plug is an improvement.

For a very cheap, low-end product, it fills the bill, but don't expect it to be better than the higher-end models.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: First of all, to have to pay extra money so ads wont pop up all the time is bulls***. I regret not buying it so that it wont pop up. If they want to continually advertise to me, I shouldn't have to pay for the fire to begin with. Also a week after I bought  it goes on sale for black Friday for 30 dollars less is just some salt in the wound.  It works fine, nice screen. Simple to use. If it wasn't for the ads id give it 5 stars. If it wasn't so cheap id give it 1 start because of the pop up ad crap, and every time I open it I have another ad trying to sell me something stupid.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I really haven't had a chance to play with it like I wanted to yet. But I know it will be great! I got it for my birthday.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: ... recollect seeing that there were 2 USB ports but disappointed that there is only one in the actual product
review_body:
When I checked the specs I recollect seeing that there were 2 USB ports but disappointed that there is only one in the actual product. The problem with only one USB port is that it is used for recharging the battery and it wears out from the continuous use. I bought two Fire HDX 7 for my grandkids two years ago and although the tablet itself is of very good quality and survived the abuse, the USB port wore out in a little over one year and replacement of them is a very troubled operation that requires the technician to work under a microscope and using specialized tools generally not available in a hobbyist shop.
The USB port itself is mechanically impaired by the customization to surface mount it to the PC board. Standard USB ports are mounted on PC boards via through holes which give them mechanical robustness and integrity. The Kindle USB is customized to eliminate the through holes pins and is only soldered to copper traces on the board surface only which serve the dual function of providing electrical connection and mechanical strenght. This reduces both the mechanical soundness and electrical integrity of the interface. Being that there is only one USB port, the dual use of it for interfacing to other PCs and to recharge the batteries which is most frequent and repeated on a daily basis, greatly reduce the product's useful life. The mechanical force required to insert and extract the charging socket into the USB port and the reduced mechanical capabilities result in early failure. Therefore the otherwise very good quality of the kindle Fire is greatly diminished by this simple but crucial weakness. After all a chain is only as strong as its weakest link and adding a second USB port would at least double the product's life. Being that this problem was well exposed and documented in the earlier version of this tablet, shame on Amazon and its Engineers for not at least adding a second port to this newest version if not restore the mechanical robustness of through hole mounting. I am an EE myself so I know what I'm talking about and I also know that unanticipated weaknesses sometime do not become obvious until real life use. However once they are discovered, they must be remediated in future generations. To not do so is engineering malpractice and should be punishable by law. Since that is not yet the law of the land until then my only recourse will be to not buy any more versions of this product and be negatively disposed towards any additional Amazon products.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: It's okay but not a replacement for the 2012 Fire.
review_body: Miss my dead 2012 Kindle Fire but this is okay. A lot of things I don't want or use like cameras and and non-removable software. Not as straight forward to use as the old one. Would prefer to have better on-device  storage control. Hate all the ads and tracking especially after paying extra to keep the "special offers" away. Love the improved audio. Overall a good but not as good device as the old Fire. Also a bit miffed the price dropped $20 within a week or so after getting my trial device I've decided to keep.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I love reviews for that reason
review_body: I was going to buy one, but after reading the reviews about software issues, I'm not. I love reviews for that reason. Get to see the good and bad of things. Thank you people. If they fix it post an update please. Happy Thanksgiving!!!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I'm still learning to use this.  I had the Paperweight and I prefer it for reading library books.  It's much easier to handle, lighter weight and you don't get fingerprints all over the screen from swiping it to turn pages.  I do like the cord attaching at the top since it's easy to break a cord if you use it to continue reading a book when it's attached at the bottom of the device.  There is no question that the Fire HD is much, much better than the Paperweight if you want to do anything on the Internet plus you have color.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: After I get used to this I should be fine.
review_body: I am still learning - takes me longer to figure everything out - plus the small letters, keep hitting the wrong letters (words).  After I get used to this I should be fine.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Charging ports fail after a couple years
review_body:
I absolutely LOVED my daghters kindle fire so I bought one for myself and my mother. We have all used it not only to read on but for the games and movie's.
After owning it for two to three years, it wasn't wanting to charge. I had to fanaggle it so the cord sat just right in the port so the kindle charged. Soon after mine started that problem, my daughter was having to do the same thing as well as my mother. Now they won't charge at all. All of them are dead. I called IPod drop and I was told the solder was weak inside the kindle and after awhile it breaks, there is no fixing and it and I might as well use it as a door stop.
I contacted Amazon and was pretty much told the same thing, and they knew about the problem.
I was so disappointed, I cherished my kindle and now I won't buy a new one because the one I had wasnt that old and was still working awesome. I'm afraid to spend the money on a new for fear of the same thing happening, and Amazon telling me pretty much telling me, "oh well, buy a new one".
I'm switching to the nook, I won't be happy about it but everyone I know who has one has never had any problems with them

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Amazon had a "deal" - Fire HD 7" on sale for one day - reg. $139 for $119. So I ordered it for my wife who already owned a kindle that had stopped working (it was several years old and wouldn't charge anymore). There was tax on it which I expected but I was also charged shipping. So much for free shipping on orders of $99 or more. So my final price was $135 - so I saved a whopping $4 and had to wait 5 days for it to arrive. I could have purchased it for the same price at Best Buy and had it the same day. BTW My wife and children all have Kindles and after about 1 1/2 years they all have/had charging problems. I would have purchased something different for my wife but she really liked her previous Kindle so that's what I got her. As for me, I switched to Samsung tablets and love it. A little more money but it has been a great experience. In the future I think I will be re-equipping the family with Samsungs - the shipping charges really irked me so this will be the last one I purchase - there was no significant savings for me.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Got one of these as a replacement for a 2 year old kindle Fire...I don't know what they did to this model, but it SUCKS! I cannot stream video anywhere I used to (Including my fracking house)...Amazon tried to tell me it was my Wi-Fi (even though my old model Kindle Fire connects to and streams to it just fine) and I had just replaced the modem AND router (802.11ac- it doesn't get any better than that right now). This was their second attempt to get me one that works (they sent me a replacement after a week) but this one doesn't fracking work either! I won't be buying another one of these until Amazon can get the kinks worked out. Very disappointed, since I have never had problems with Kindle Fire products until this version...

After a year the third will no longer turn on on the battery or with the cord -so it is absolutely useless. The fourth is OK. Big disappointment for the kid.  Don't buy!!!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I am thoroughly disappointed in the Fire HD. I bought this for my four year old grandson because he is so proficient with my iPad. When you turn the Fire on, you get advertisements, an endless stream of ads. He can't read yet, so he can't get to his games. Also, I bought the monthly kiddie service which is supposed to give you access to appropriate games for his age. The problem is, it only allows you access to the very first level of each game. Once this is purchased, the parent can't purchase the entire game so that the child can continue to progress. I am sorry I wasted my money on this... my son uses it to search the web while my grandson uses their iPad to use the learning games.

The advertising and information on the Amazon site makes this product look good but doesn't give you the whole picture!!!!!!!!!!!!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Don't buy any Kindles. Amazon needs to recall them for malfunctioning charging issues!
review_body:
Zero Stars... I didn't want to post a star but I wouldn't be allowed to post a comment if I didn't. Don't buy any Kindles!
Amazon needs to recall the Kindles for their malfunctioning charging issues. I bought 2 Kindle Fire HD's for my sons 2 years ago and have had problems within the first few months regarding charging them. I've called Amazon and they are denying that I've called them and now they say it's out of warranty. Meanwhile my sons had stopped using them cause they don't charge. If you google this problem, it's all over the internet and there are Youtube instructions for trying to fix it. The temporary fix only works temporarily, then it gets worse. So if it's a software issue then that also needs to be addressed by Amazon. The only offer they have given me is that I can trade ours in for a "certified refurbished" one for $80. So I'm suppose to give them my $249 Kindle so they can fix it for $5 and resell it (?!) while I buy another used fixed one from them? I don't think so!!! Amazon needs to recall these electronics and fix them for their customers! This is outrageous and a disgrace. I now will no longer support praise to Amazon or their product of any Kindle tablet. Scrooge on you Amazon!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
The quality control of the display on this unit is apparently not very good. The first Fire HD 7 that I received had was dim along the right side of the screen and especially in the bottom right corner. The replacement unit that I was shipped had the same problem but on BOTH sides of the screen, AND the backlight was inferior (dimmer, warmer toned).

To Amazon's credit, customer service was a breeze the whole way, however I am returning both my original unit and the replacement, and I would never buy a Fire HD again.

The Fire HD is perhaps not a bad idea if the Fire user is going to be undiscerning - perhaps for children, the elderly, or other casual users. But if you want a tablet with high production standards, skip this and put some extra cash toward an iPad or something. You might even try the HDX, but I personally I would hold off on Amazon tablets until they get their quality control figured out.

2. Battery life. It says 8hrs, which isn't all that great to begin with, but think it is probably closer to 6hrs of continuous use.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Not all that and a bag of chips...do your homework
review_body:
I was unaware of what "Special Offers" consisted of when ordering the new Kindle Fire. It consists of heavy marketing from the time you open it until it is closed. I open my Kindle to an ad, then under each icon is a variety of apps "suggested", then in the games more ads (typically something I've recently looked up). Frankly I would have paid more to NOT have the "Special Offers" had I known. I am already marketed to by every Tom, Dick & Harry on TV & the internet...last thing I want is to be marketed to further when I am sitting down to relax with a book or game.

Also, I am already a Prime member so apparently I did not get the 30 day Prime that was supposed to come with it. In addition to this, I have less control over my email than I had with my previous Fire. You can set it to "manual", but I have yet to find out how that works exactly...there's no icon for it. I have to wait for it to refresh in 15 minutes. The quick icon for amazon is no longer there either, you have to search the internet for it. I do like the "silk"...very smooth to use. I don't have as many security pop ups as before (with my earlier Fire), but then again I don't have the choices in settings I once had either.

My last complaint is that it is difficult to purchase accessories for my new Kindle due to "generation" issues. This generation cover doesn't fit that generation Kindle, screen protectors, replacement chargers, etc. Too complicated! Find a style and stick with it!

I've always liked amazon's products, service and quality....but they are getting a little sloppy on products and shipping in lieu of marketing. If the customer service goes, so will I.

Overall, if I had it to do over, I would have purchased one without the special offers, and would have done more research and asked more questions about its format. Other notebooks may cost a little more, but may also "have" a little more. Justmy opinion.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Disappointment upon receipt of the product (No Mirroring option available on the Fire HD...needed to buy Fire HDX)
review_body: Was excited in anticipation of receiving this tablet from Amazon.  From what I had read, I would be enabled to use the Mirroring option to view what I had displayed on the tablet, on my HDTV screen through my Fire TV connection.  After having opened and registering the tablet with Amazon, found out that I would have needed to purchase the HDX version to utilize the Mirroring option that I had been looking for.  Also, the online price was reduced by $20, just two days after ordering and receiving the product.  Could have spent the same money on an HDX FIre tablet (less than $200).

Thank you,
D. Fraser

review_headline: What good is to make a nice device with poor quality
review_body:
I have had 2 different model of Kindle that have got the frozen screen of death in less than 2 years. We are talking here about devices that for no reason go into a zombie mode and cannot be repaired, reset or anything. Amazon apologizes and gives you $15 or $20 so you can get another one. Shame on you, Amazon. What good is to make a nice device with poor quality? I am used to take good care of my gadgets, they usually last many years, the Kindles are the only ones that have failed, both in a couple of months after the 1-year warranty expired, So if you plan to buy a Kindle, please make sure you get the additional warranty. Don't say no one warned you. O go get a nice Android tablet or even better, and Ipad.

I feel bad because I have bought several Kindles as presents as well to friends and colleagues...

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
So we bought a kindle specifically for my 7year old because of the FreeTime app, we wanted something to help manage content and also the daily learning goals is great! It's been a few months now and I've just figured out that when you want to buy an in app purchase for your child's profile, you are not allowed to. We purchased the different math levels in a learning game because my daughters math skills have improved and want to keep her going. But upon buying the in-app unlocks, we didn't know the unlocks wouldn't work in FreeTime. This is just crazy, I don't see how this makes any sense. I even tried deleting app, then redownloading to add to FreeTime again, still not available. What's the point of FreeTime if I can't upgrade my child's learning in a great app they love and understand?!?!?! I hope this issue is resolved soon, there's only so many "great" learning apps that actually show up in "learning" apps in FreeTime. Another issue is when you look in Educational games in the App Store, you would think they would all show up in your child's FreeTime app as a learning game to complete their Daily Goal in learning activities, but they don't. Out of maybe 15 educational apps I downloaded, only 5 showed up. Her writing apps, a few reading ones, and word games didn't show up for her daily goal activities.

If you have younger children, this may not be an issue, but for now this is just annoying. Going through the apps, trying to find ones they'll like and use is a mission, so finding this out is a bummer.

Other then this, I haven't had any other problems. The kindle is great for managing your kids time on watching videos, playing games, etc. Kindle has a great idea with this, I'm actually an iPad user and if iPad had this feature, I wouldn't have bought a kindle. Get this fixed please!

The first wouldn't remove things from the carousel as advertised, the second just froze up when starting, and the third shuts down when the battery gets below 50%.  AVOID this piece of junk at all costs if you want to maintain your sanity.  I'm planning on returning the one I have now as soon as I can.  Junk, junk, junk.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: they are less useful than any other Android tablet out there
review_body:
To me, due to the removal of the HDMI port, this is a severe downgrade from the older model. The HDMI port allowed me to connect my Kindle to any TV with HDMI, or a projector screen, which I used frequently. The new models only seem to connect to specifically equipped TV's...so to connect to a TV, I'll have to go out and buy a whole new TV!

I was looking forward to the new models for the larger storage capacity...but without the HDMI, they are less useful than any other Android tablet out there, which have access to 3/4 million more apps than the Kindles do.

Bad move, Amazon....

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: A timid step instead of a quantum leap
review_body:
I've owned one of the first B&W readers, and then a 1st generation Fire. I consider both ground breaking. Really jaw dropping. This Fire is more of a "so-so" improvement. It's not as intuitive to learn as the 1st generation fire, and the screen really isn't all that much better (which, by the way, isn't bad).
I suppose what gave it away to me was that when I got a survey from Amazon shortly after I received my new Fire, the questions had to do with my color preference. No questions about ease of use, "gee wiz" technology, etc., just the color I chose.
So, I'm an Amazon Fire fan - I was just hoping to see another quantum leap. It was more of a timid step.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: This item could really be good, but falls short without storage and can't use android market for apps
review_body:
I did the 30 day free risk-free trial (more on that in a minute).

The unit might be nice for someone for whom this is their first 'tablet' but not if you've even had experience with even the most BASIC generic android tablets (i.e., less than $79 or so). The big failing of this unit is that it has no means of inserting an SD card for storage. It gives you either 8GB or 16GB (depending on which option you pick) and the O/S and other installed apps take most of the memory for the unit with 8GB, leaves you about 3GB. To give you a comparison I have a generic AGPtek android tablet which has nearly all the functionality of this device (less bluetooth) it cost nearly half as much, takes microSD cards for storage.

The other drawback is that you can't use Google Play for android Apps, one is limited to the comparatively limited options of the Amazon App store.

What pushed me to return it (only used it a couple of days before making the decision) is that for the price I am getting so much less - had it even had the option of an SD card I would have kept it, even though I thought the unit a tad pricey for its limitations.

If you are looking for a truly functional tablet that can store locally as well as access a cloud drive,,, this is not the unit you want.

I wanted to like this thing, but as I already said; it paled by comparison to basic android tablets in terms of options and functionality.

Wanted to add that despite the 30 day free trial 'risk-free', Amazon had me pay (although only $2.95) to return the unit - to me that isn't a 'risk-free' trial since I had to pay to return it.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: The only real negative is it isn't an Apple iOS device
review_body:
Loses the first star because it isn't an iOS device (see review). Loses the second star because of the cheaper feel of the backing material and a not-as-pretty-or-intuitive interface.

This is a fantastic product. The display is great. The available apps are plenty useful and powerful. This is a great first-time tablet for someone who has never used an iPad/iPhone. It feels solid and sturdy, even if the backing plastic does feel "cheap."

I am heavily invested in Amazon Prime content. I use the cloud drive for my photos (free as prime member, don't need to pay for extra storage like I do eventually with Apple). I LOVE the addition of music to prime. I read Kindle ebooks. I use Prime Instant Video. Those features are great and built in. Easy to use and is a great content-using device.

Quite simply, the only reason I am returning this device (a potential five-star device for the right user) is because it isn't an iOS device. My wife. My brother. My in-laws and the majority of my friends and family all use Apple devices. We can share photo albums easily of our children. We FaceTime. We iMessage. We play games against each other on our devices.

When using this Fire device, I can't do any of those things with all of the people that I would WANT to do those things with.

Make no mistake, this is a great product, especially for that price. It just can't be the device for me, because I've invested (and so have the people I interact with on phones/tablets) in iOS devices.
