Forget about being able to use a different browser, not going to happen either.  Go get a nexus they are superior in every aspect.

review_body: I don't see how anyone could give this tablet a good review. My tablet glitched. I would be right in the middle of doing something and BOOM my Kindle would switch off. product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Beautiful and fast tablet, yet, a little disappointed...
review_body: I was all excited to recieve my new Kindle Fire HD as I was already extremely pleased with my Fire TV. I was switching from a Samsung galaxy tablet (as it was very slow) to the Kindle Fire HD. The Kindle Fire HD in magenta is very appealing to the eye. Don't get me wrong, it is a gorgeous tablet. No complaints there. The camera is decent, but I rarely take pictures with a tablet camera. The display is bright and beautiful, and it is super fast with it's quad core. I was however, disappointed with how heavy it is compared to my old tablet. Not great for holding for long periods of time. I was also disappointed that as an "android" device, that not many apps that I normally use are available for it. (ie. games and such) It also did not have the option of mirroring the screen on my fire tv in the display settings like the hdx does. All in all, It's great for streaming with it's speed and display. But this is not a tablet for people who like to play a lot of game apps.

review_body: I would have given this a 5 star rating but the app market is what holds this back. It does have a a great picture and sound works flawlessly to surf the net . Movie play back is ok frame blurring or slow down does happen during heavy action scenes. I am a  high end gamer so if your looking for a good gaming tablet this is definitely not the one you want. But hey for only a $140 you have a larger version of a smart phone that has no calling or 3_4g capabilities.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB

review_body: I ordered this kindle because I wanted to be able to take pictures as well as have easy access to the web. It is a little heavier than my other kindle but not an inconvenience. The pic quality isn't good and I have to be standing absolutely still as well as picture subjects to get anything close to a good picture. So I would rate picture capability a 3 out of 10. Also the battery life decreases much faster than my older kindle. Not sure if this is to be expected because it has more storage, I only have 7 pics saved, or if it is a malfunction. Will have to keep using to find out.....

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: not for use with kids... beyond disappointed!
review_body:
This product did not live up to expectations at all.
There are supposedly "parental locks" but don't be fooled by this. If you engage them it means the child can not watch prime kid shows without you unlocking it every time they want to watch a show.. so if your child changes there mind within 2 mins. you are once again helping them out. On the front page it shows a large icon of the show they have previously watched (which for us is a prime show) but underneath that are smaller icons for kid friendly shows and none of them are ever prime shows..
There is a child free play area to set up for kids... and labeled as a great way to set up only those shows and books your child can watch/read... but you can not add prime shows to that area. So you'd have to spend a bunch of money to get much use out of it.
It is pretty much useless for kids. These seem like very deliberate ways for a company to try to make money fully knowing that kids will order items a lot easier than a parent will. I am so offended that I am posting this poor review. The only thing I feel good about is they are willing to take the product back.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Not in love with Kindle anymore
review_body: Very disappointed about the \\"special offers\\". You basically have to pay to not see ads on your Kindle. Seriously? Two years ago I received a Kindle Fire for my birthday and loved it so much that I have purchased 3 as gifts. The last one that I purchased for my granddaughter had \\"special offers\\" selected at checkout. When I unselected this box the price of the Kindle went up. This kind of ticked me off because if I am paying for the Kindle, why in the heck do I have to pay to not see ads?    Like I've stated, I have been loyal to Kindle until this point and I went ahead and purchased the Kindle anyway because I promised it to my granddaughter. But, this is the last Kindle I am giving as a gift. I had planned to give 2 for Christmas, but now I'm taking a look at Samsung 7 inch tablets instead.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: A 2.5 rating because it does about half of what a tablet can do for me. If you're only looking for books you can find on Amazon or movies you can find on Amazon or Netflix then this is the tablet for you. If you're looking for more than that then look elsewhere.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: A recent update from Kindle installed a program that I didn't authorized, which is now requiring a password that I never set up.  Rather than admitting to their error, I'm being asked to reset my Kindle and lose everything I have on it--with no chance of saving anything because of this program download.  Horrible system.............

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: AMAZON Customer Service drops the ball!
review_body:
We ordered this for my daughter's birthday. We have now had the device for over two weeks and have yet to get it to work properly. We have reached out to Amazon (getting hold of them was hard) and spent several hours with a technician. They went through their entire bag of tricks and never could get the child's profile to work. This is the key reason we bought the device. The latest word we have from Amazon is that "they are looking into it." We got a call about a week ago saying they are "still looking into it" (it was a recording, I believe).
It is amazing to me that a company like Amazon has not figured out what to do about a defective device after two weeks of trying to fix it. We have been longtime members of Prime and have been exceedingly patient. Yet we are no where.

AMAZON: Make it right!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Freetime is severely compromised by new settings
review_body: If you're buying this to use Freetime, don't bother: it's a WASTE OF TIME on this new kindle fire. The code to turn the kindle on, separate from the Parental Code, allows the child to modify all parental settings ( it took my 8 year old  one afternoon to work that out) and you can't turn this code off. Amazon customer service apologise there is nothing they can do and told me it is a common complaint.  We wanted our son to have the independence of his own device with our safety-conscious controls on it; you can't do this with the new kindle fire,unless you are prepared to be the one turning it on every single time it's going to be used.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I like the earlier fire better. This one doesn't seem as though it turns off completely, and I have 100% battery on turn off, and then 49% battery turning back on. Very odd!

The screen also flickers at times. Not really happy about this!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Graphics are good, irritating I had to buy it in order ...
review_body: Graphics are good, irritating I had to buy it in order to watch Amazon video, as it is blocked on my Samsung galaxy - not terribly user friendly to navigate and the commercials you have to swipe past every time you turn it back on are REALLY WRONG.  If you're going to make me buy the Kindle, I shouldn't have to help you make more money by looking at your ads - that should only happen if you give the Kindle to me.  You're losing your way Amazon.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: before if was an easy to find round button
review_body: I cracked the screen on my Fire HDX and replaced it with this.  The battery life on this Fire seems noticeably less.  I've been turning off the wireless to save battery life, but I never had to do that before.  The one/off button is now a small, hard-to-feel button on the top, before if was an easy to find round button, center bottom.  I use this Fire HD every day for reading and videos and it does that fine, but, all in all, I wish I hadn't cracked my HDX.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: requiring one to go through an extremely tedious "hard" reboot
review_body: The new device has serial problems reconnecting properly to wifi when it goes out of range, especially when it?? in the middle of a download, whereupon it "freezes" the download even after reconnecting to wifi, requiring one to go through an extremely tedious "hard" reboot, reconnect to wifi from scratch, and then re-download the purchase. It also has considerable problems with refreshing the screen which don?? seem to exist in the original Fire (which I own) or the paperwhite Kindle, which I also own. It often gets into a tate where it displays a blank screen whilst it struggles to catch up with whatever the heck it thinks that it ought to be doing.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Save your money. Get a Galaxy tab.
review_body: I won this device in a game so can't complain too much. But if I had paid with my own money I would be pretty upset. First off the device is glitchy. At first I couldn't get it to sync up to my Wifi. Left it alone over night and suddenly it worked. Still has intermittent problems. The next thing I don't like is the inability to customize. By customize I mean change anything. It's an android base operating system but set up more restrictive than an apple device. No access to the Google play store. The device also doesn't have a slot for external memory. The last thing is this device is just an add machine for Amazon. Adds on lock screen. Adds randomly on device. My suggestion would be to take you money and get a Samsung Galaxy tab. I bought one for the GF for the same price as this. Way better device. You get more for your money without the adds.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: The silk browser isn't great and it's difficult to bypass. Also if I had known I couldn't disable those adds I certainly would not have purchased the Kindle, I would have gotten the iPad. Even though the iPad is more expensive, the  extra money would have been worth if it meant no ads. How many times do I have to pay for the Kindle by looking at ads for things I'm not interested in.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I was hoping for so much more from the Kindle Fire
review_body: I had an iPad prior to deciding to give this a try.  It was much more reasonably priced and seemed to have the same features.  My iPad battery was down to the point where it only lasts for a day on a charge.  I got my Fire about a week ago now.  The camera that it has is TERRIBLE.  It's like going back 20 years to the earliest days of point and shoot digital.  You have to hold it very still for multiple seconds while it "captures" the image.  And usually the image is blurry due to this lag.  It is also terrible in low light conditions.  I was shocked because I have a new iPhone and the camera in that is light years better and it's a smaller device.  The battery life on the Fire turned out to be less than a day which was the main reason I was replacing the iPad to begin with.  I will say that the apps available for the Fire are pretty comparable with the apps available for the iPad.  I also got the Fire because I wanted something smaller than the iPad I had.  I am still deciding whether I like that or not.  The 7 inch is pretty small.  I can't imagine what the 6 inch would be like.  Overall I'm super disappointed in this and likely will go back to the iPad when it's time to replace.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
The Tablets Functionality: While Apps launch quickly and the automatic organization schemes are useful and he tablet itself looks very nice and seems to be designed well as well as having a good weight to it and clean lines those are almost the only good things I can say about Amazon's foray into the tablet industry.

The Browser: The Silk browser is terrible, absolutely dreadful. When it does actually load a page (Which is hit or miss at the best of times) It's usually a mobile version of that page, which has limited functionality usually to account for slower connection speeds on smaller devices. Also the browser is sluggish and the built-in tools such as bookmarking utilities are clunky.

The App-Store: Kindle's app store is hilariously low on content and usable apps. Productivity wise the app store is useless, for spreadsheets or word processors or anything business or school related the best you can get is knock off apps half-designed by somebody trying to cash in on you upgrading to a "better" or "pro" version with is hardly better than the base version.

For school and business this Kindle is not something you want, it doesn't work for these applications and looks like it won't for a very long time. Amazon is a fantastic service and I love being able to buy things I need at the click of a button with little-to-no hassle. But this is a flop from beginning to end.

The only thing, and I mean the ONLY thing this tablet does well is render books. But I, and anyone else buying this tablet aren't looking for a reader, if we were we'd head over to the paperwhite section and buy that. Probably be really happy with it to. But if you buy a kindle fire its for multi-purpose use, not JUST as a reader.

If I could return this product I would, It's the single biggest waste of money I've ever encountered and if I hadn't waited so long hoping I could beat the learning curve and get it to work even partially like I needed it to or had intended it to I would return this product.ke I needed it to or had intended it to I would return this product.

The email is barely usable because there is no way to separate junk mail from inbox (as there is with a google mail app on android which is totally user friendly). There is an app for gmail but it doesn't function properly and significantly slows down devise.  The layout on the home page is clunky and obnoxious with huge pictures of the last things you've used and no way to go to a grid view. All in all I believe that Amazon's inability to play nice with google punishes the users of the kindle fires rendering the kindle for me virtually unusable. I will return and exchange for an android. Android is more user friendly all around and a better buy.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
There goes everything.

Be prepared for this when you buy a Kindle Fire. Eventually something will happen and you are going to be forced to reset your Kindle Fire to factory defaults. For me it was after the latest update when all of a sudden my Kindle had a new password that I didn't know. The only way to get a new password for your Kindle, by the way, is to reset the device to factory defaults. Now restoring your device is supposed to be relatively painless, everything is supposed to be backed up on the cloud.

It isn't.

In fact, surprisingly little is actually backed up. Now, I could deal with being locked into the Amazon app store, which has about 10% of the Play store. I could deal with having to side load Chrome onto an Android device. I could even deal with many of the apps for my kids not working in Freetime. But on a device that can be remotely deactivated, that has offers pushed remotely to it, that has so many of it's features based off of remote access, to have the only way to reset the password be to nuke it, that is untenable.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: If you're looking to spend nearly $200 on a device ...
review_body: If you're looking to spend nearly $200 on a device that is practically guaranteed to die almost exactly one year after you bought it - this is the device for you. I purchased this one year and 36 days ago. Today, while reading, it switched to the Kindle Fire screen and there it remains - frozen. But, unfortunately, I can't let it go because Amazon's customer service says "we can't fix it - buy a new one". Wow. So I rented a device for one year and thirty six days for the low, low price of $169 and Amazon won't stand behind their product. Their idea of customer service is to encourage me to buy another piece of junk. But wait! They'll guarantee it! For exactly 12 months. So when the next one dies at one year and thirty six days, I can buy another one, and another one, and another one. It's called engineered obsolescence and it's a complete scam. No wonder Amazon's stock is down nearly 7 points.

review_headline: AMAZON OVERCHARGED MY CARD $500 AND SAID I JUST HAD TO WAIT
review_body: My review is more in regards to the service i received from Amazon on an order that included this. Amazon put a hold or sent through numerous transaction to my card totaling $1142. My purchase which included 2 Kindles was about 600. I had an excess of $500 frozen from my account and spent over 2 hours on with customer service to resolve the issue and was basically told sorry cant do anything about it. will have to wait 24 hours to review it. Was told it was my bank's fault. i ordered at least 20 items all of which were prime eligible. Most of the order has shipped and my account has still not been updated or erroneous charges removed. I have been told by 3 reps in conversation and 3 reps via email that there isnt anything they can do. My bank says it is Amazons responsibility. I have NEVER had an issue like this but to have $500 over your purchase on hold b/c they sent over all the transactions and then to be told you'll just have to wait... BUYER BEWARE. check your statements and be careful. I never would have expected service like this from Amazon. A loyal Prime member since 2012 and TOTALLY DISSATISFIED WITH SERVICE RECEIVED FROM AMAZON

review_headline: Incompatible with Many Games from Amazon's Own App Store
review_body: Last year we bought our son a Kindle Fire HD.  He loved it.  Some of his favorite games were Spiderman, Spiderman 2, and Crazy Taxi.  Unfortunately he dropped his Kindle today and we had to run to Best Buy to replace it (Thankful for Warranties).  Anyway, they informed us that they only had newer generation models, so we paid a bit extra to get this Kindle Fire HD 7.Our excitement soon turned to frustration once we realized that several games (including those listed above) are not compatible with this new Kindle.  This stinks because I have spent decent money on purchasing apps that I can no longer use.  Instead of continuously releasing new generations of Kindles, I feel that Amazon should focus on fixing such issues with the ones they have already created.  I would definitely NOT buy this kindle if you are used to gaming.  I expected better quality from Amazon.

This tablet is not abused, but is regularly used and it is obviously not good quality workmanship.  At least my l last kindle fire lasted two years before I decided to replace it.  The fire hd obviously cannot handle normal wear and tear, even with a case for protection.  What is the point of having a tablet if it cannot be removed from the house?  What is the point of putting music on it, if I cant bring it with me when I go out?  I have asked my husband for another tablet for Christmas, but it looks like I might explore other tablets, because what is the point of having a kindle, if I can't use it or listen to music with it?  Piss poor workmanship, guys.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Not worth your time or money
review_body: I bought 2 Kindle Fire HD's for my boys (age 14 and 10) for Christmas last year.  They enjoy them very much - the programs are great, and they used them frequently (except being bothered by the pop up ads).  However, after only 9 months, my younger son's motherboard completely fried.  When I took it in, I was told that it was made improperly - it was missing a key component which was supposed to prevent it from overheating and frying out. I was forced to replace the motherboard.  Just 2 months later, my other son's Kindle locked up with the "Faststart" screen, and shortly after completely died.  It won't even turn on or be recognized in any way.  Being a Kindle owner myself (mine is the older version, not HD and still works like a charm) I have been extremely disappointed with the quality of these more recent purchases. They should definitely last for more than 10 months!  I recommend that if you purchase the Kindle Fire HD, it's in your best interest you get an extended warranty - you will get your money's worth.

I asked him if it was as good as the HDX. He told me it was better, and so I expected it to be. But it  doesn't have Text to speech which I definitely want. I want to send it back to get the HDX 7.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: This was given to me as a gift, and I thought that the device was beautiful -- until I signed in to my amazon account.  Then the startup screen began to advertise to me.  I could not find a way to disable this \\"feature\\" and my google searches seem to indicate that this is in fact true.  If I can figure out a way to root the thing, I may use it, otherwise it'll go into the trash can.  I'll certainly never buy an amazon device now that I've had this exposure to their \\"advertising platform\\".  The experience has put me off buying things online too, so amazon has already lost more business from me than they \\"gained\\" by selling this device.    If you're like most people and you don't mind advertising permeating your life, then this device would be a good deal.  Not for me though.    EDIT: Thanks to my review, I found that you can \\"purchase\\" freedom from ads for only fifteen bucks.  Totally worth it to me, but your mileage may vary.

It generally will continue to use up charge even if I am plugged in while I am using the Fire and if you want a hi speed charger you have to buy it extra. I would have much preferred to pay more up front than to have to be troubled to order another charger. The low speed charger is a pain in the neck.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Seems pretty greedy to me that you pay yourself an American ...
review_body:
Crashes constantly. Turns off and won't turn back on. Lack of Customer Support that is a nightmare even if you get them on the phone. Amazon only cares about GETTING your money, they don't care about talking to you once you have paid. Why not spend some of those BILLIONS that you have Bezos on hiring Americans in this country instead of paying pennies to someone offshore? Seems pretty greedy to me that you pay yourself an American Salary and the rest of your company slave wages. Perhaps I would have been able to get thru to Customer Support and had this nightmare resolved. Oh, I switched to the Nook and love the Nook!

It took 4 days, and 16 hours of phone calls to learn which model I had to order a case, and even then Customer Support wasn't able to help me with the model case I needed. That was before I learned that the machine didn't stay turned on when I needed it to.

One more nightmare, the browser software STORES YOUR PASSWORDS even if you don't want it to. I am not worried about losing it and being hacked by a stranger who can just sign into my password protected sites .. and Amazon Customer Service tells me that this is impossible because they know better than me. So what did I do? I took it to a friend, and my friend signed into ALL my accounts without me uttering a word .. That is a nightmare that Amazon won't address.

Oh -- and the spamming adverts!! Worse than Daytime Network TV -- constant and relentless .. And no, it isn't worth $70 a year for me to keep them off the machine, as I will rarely use the Kindle over the Nook. Bad move Bezos on the greed factor.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Simple feature like Date & Time wouldn't work
review_body: It wouldn't let me set up the time and date manually; and the most annoying part is, its automatic timezone options do not provide the correct date & time! They sent a replacement tablet and the same issue occurred. I've spent more than 5 hours talking to the customer representative trying to fix the issue, all of them ended up saying they needed to transfer the case to software developer to investigate and wanted me to wait for the response. With similar price, you can get an Android tablet that's at least showing you the correct time and date. I can't imagine how many more issues there would be with Fire HD, given that they couldn't even have a simple feature like date and time right!

review_body: The tablet itself if great,  NO problems,  its worth more than they are selling it for, and that is partly because they are using their fire operating system  and have adds on your tablet,  so the outcome for amazon is great, they make money on these after we buy them  And that doesn't really matter to me, you get the same quality tablet as the Samsung galaxy tab, and i am a huge Samsung galaxy fan, I own only galaxy phones,  etc...But my issue is the operation system,  They fool you a little by calling it Android when in fact IT IS NOT,  there isn't any way to got the google play store and download apps, googles apps are also  designed for Android, you can go to the site, yes, but you cannot download apps,  the apps on the kindle fire operating system ARE VERY limited, if you are looking for the fun, and popular games,  clash of clans,  boom beach...and so so many more! and coc...well..  I love this game,  clash of clans,  and had so hoped to play it on this tablet,  so much bigger than a phone, and the HD colors,  so vivid,  so what a disappointment it was and is,  that you are not an android tablet,  and you have so few applications.  Other wise,  if you dont care about the android style or their apps, and Google play has millions of them, if  that is of no concern to you,  then yes,  absolutely a wonderful tablet,  color, sound, design,  feel, battery life....all is exceptional.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I changed from nook to the Kindle Fire 6 recently. I had it 3 days and was sick of the advertising always popping up. Sent it back to where it came from. I figured you get what you pay for, and gave Kindle another shot with purchasing the Fire HD 7, with the 16 gb. Guess what, ALMOST AS MUCH ADVERTISING. This is also going back to the store tomorrow! I will go ahead and pay the money out for the expensive charging cable for my old nook and stick with it. Sorry Amazon. I just can't deal with all those ads.

On the other side, simplicity is great. the apps are great, light, easy to handle/learn. If you don't mind the ads, go for it.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
This is a good tablet with good price, but not good for multi-tasking. for example if I use one tab in the browser for listening to something, when I open a new tab, the sound is gone! Or when I start to browse Internet while talking to someone in skype, after a minute or two the call will be terminated!!
That's very strange to me.
I also believe that battery gets low quickly. When I play a game while keeping the Kindle connected to power outlet, it still runs out of battery! also very weird! (I have tried to minimize the power usage by changing the brightness setting, but had no effect.)

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: The reader itself is excellent. But this device is clearly set up mainly ...
review_body:
The reader itself is excellent. But this device is clearly set up mainly to sell products through the Amazon store.

The general OS software, including little things like setting up your email, just isn't as user friendly as Apple's iOS which automatically detects whether your email account is set up as POP3, IMAP, etc. I bought this for a specific consulting assignment to help a friend test her e-book before submitting it for publication. If I were buying on my own right now, I probably would spend the extra money and get an iPad mini for the overall software experience.

But Amazon is getting closer to being a no-compromise alternative to the iPad with this Fire device, and for most standard uses the experience is quite good. Their helpline assistance was also quite good and involved little wait to get a rep on the phone. So Amazon is doing quite well on the tech support aspect of owning a Fire.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: What to expect? ...You really get what you pay for
review_body: I thought it was a good buy based on the specs comparison between the galaxy tab 4 and Fire HD 7, the reality is that the OS is sluggish, hard to get familiar with. The unit feels rather heavy, and overall  it feels cheap (specially the back of the unit, like low quality plastic). There are a couple of things that I liked: The speakers sound really loud and clear and the fact that you can download "some" videos for free to watch when no wifi is available, unfortunately the (very) limited selection of videos available at Amazon to download for free does not justify the $180 (after tax with no special offers). Another disappointment is the camera, believe me I'm not expecting a ultra HD camera for a $180 tablet, but the camera quality is really really awful. another annoying thing is the fact that it doesn't have a home button, so if you want to "awake" the tablet you have to actually press the power button that is rather small, its not that hard to find it, it's just that it goes against of what people are used to. and the last but not least disappointment is the fact that is not expandable as the Galaxy tab, now days 8GB are NOTHING if you rent/download 2 HD movies you will run out of space, so no space for music or anything else....needless to say this Fire its on its way back for refund.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Update    I just upgraded my Kindle Fire from the original Fire to the new Kindle Fire 4. I actually got the blue Kindle Fire 4, didn't realize I wrote this under the black product name but I'll assume the color has nothing with how it works. I'm still working my way through this new device and although it may not sound like it I do like my new Kindle I'm just trying get used to the difference between what I've had for so long.    For those of you considering the new Kindle Fire (4th Generation). Here are my observations. -Warning this is pretty lengthy.    1. I've seen and handled both the 6\\" and the 7\\", in my opinion that extra inch does matter. The 6\\" can be compare to the Samsung Note 4 roughly in size for a tablet. The 7\\" is (I'll assume) the same size as the 3rd Generation 7\\", in comparison to the original Fire it is lighter, and much thinner. The color is brighter and the icons on the carousal appear larger to me.    2. The new features include, front and rear cameras, Bluetooth ability (I assume that Generation 3 has that), It claims a faster processor, which I guess is relative depending on your WIFI connection. I don't notice much of a speed difference between this and the original, but I do notice a battery issue (I'll discuss that later), it comes in 5 different colors (black, white, yellow(citron) , navy blue (cobalt), pink-(magenta- at least it looks like that to me). I can't remember if the original Fire came in a 16 GB or if it had \\"special offers\\" but this one does (I'll discuss that later), volume controls on the outside, five new drop down menus,-Shop, a Games drop down menu (don't know why I have a Games drop down menu and an Apps drop down menu), Audiobooks (I'll discuss later), Photos and Offers. You can also adjust the font size for the homepage-not something I remember being able to do on the original. They also have a free time for the kids and a quiet time I guess for the adults. The family share feature I'm not quite sure the purpose for it. I've not tried the feature that let's you watch a movie by \\"flinging\\" it to your tv. Sounds interesting but I'm thinking I need some accessory to make that happen.    3. Now for my concerns with the new Kindle-Battery life-it almost non-existent if you use the WIFI alot. I called Amazon about this issue because I thought my device was defective. With my original I never had to worry about my battery going down while I was in WIFI mode (I also didn't have an Airport mode either, so maybe that's why) all I do know is that inorder to save battery life you have to constantly flip between Airport mode on/off, on your device to save the battery life and for it to charge completely. a real hassle considering what all you have to do to get to the Airport mode to turn it off and on. It doesn't matter if you keep you devise plugged in while in WIFI mode because it still won't charge completely unless you have the Airport mode on (WIFI off). Also just a ticky issue for me-I miss my charging light, with original Fire when you plugged it in if the light was orange then you knew it was charging and once the light turned green you knew you device was close to being fully charged. Now with the new Kindle fire you have to look for this very tiny, battery icon and look on it for an even smaller lighting bolt to determine if the device is charging (not good for people with sight issues) As you can see, this is a major issue for me.    4. As discussed earlier my issues with the \\"special offers'. The advertising makes it seem as if you only see these ads when your device powers down and are like screen savors, what they don't tell you is that the ads are everywhere. I did not know that I would get \\"recommendations\\" for every icon on my carousal (not something on the original-but then I didn't have \\"special offers\\" on my first Kindle), unless you again go into the settings and hide the recommendations. I also, consider it over kill to have both a Shop and Offers drop down menu (a petpeeve of mine), with the help of a very helpful Amazon Rep, I was able to \\"hide\\" the recommendations for every icon on my carousal I was so bothered by the \\"special offers\\" and \\"recommendations\\" I considered sending the device back and paying the extra $20 just so I don't have deal that, who knows I may still do that, it might also improve my battery life.    5. Audiobooks drop down menu-Helpful, no longer need to download Audio app to listen to audiobooks, that said I am having a difficult time closing out of my audiobooks. You can't just close the book you have remove it from your device (not a issue with the original Fire). You can stop the recording but it doesn't close the book, an it drains the battery because you can't close the book.    6. Apps. I'm also discovering that not all my old apps work on the new device. I'm not looking forward to purchasing the same apps over. I guess it's a good thing that I only gave the old one to my son so I can use that app again if I want to. Another ticy issue of mine-I'm not a fan of the layout where you go to shop for apps and it doesn't matter which one you go under- games or app drop down. It used to be left side pay apps, right side free apps, now they're all mixed up and everywhere, more annoying than anything for me.    7. Camera-From what I can tell, it takes a nice enough picture. I just don't know how hard it will be to make \\"hard\\" copies or possibly download the pictures to a computer. I was surprised that you can take pictures without WIFI, so that's a plus.    So for now that's all I've observed. I'll update as I continue to find new things with my new device.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I was very disappointed with the speed
review_body:
Our family has the 2012 version of this kindle,that one works very well and is made of high quality materials. So seeing that this has an upgraded core and many other upgraded features, I was very disappointed with the speed, poor quality of the cameras and the cheaply made plastic casing.

Switching from an app to the home screen consistently lags. Videos that were downloaded lag and cause the video to go out of sync with the audio. The rear camera is not 1080p quality, it's very grainy.

I have contacted support in case the one I have is defective, and if it's defective and gets replaced with one that doesn't do what is described above, I will change the review. But as it stands now, I am disappointed with the quality of this version.

review_body: The screen graphics and volume are awesome, but I am very disappointed that I cannot get certain apps that only an android powered tablet can get and utilize.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: This is really a trumped down version of a laptop.  I do find it useful at times.  My older Gateway stopped working correctly, then I donated it.  I had this Kindle to use with my home wifi, but it is difficult to navigate throughout the small screen with your fingertips and using Google maps was difficult.  I could not expand/decrease the map the way I needed.  I eventually had to drive all the way over to the local jr. college to use their computers.  I was in between moving, so I had my home wifi disconnected and decided to buy another desktop once I got moved.  Well on this Kindle most of the games I downloaded, though free, will not work unless you have wifi.  The only ones that worked were the card games like Gin rummy and chess.  Also, this Kindle will prompt you to erase many of your apps and games stating that it is low on storage even when most of your games are less than 3 mb.  Thankfully, I bought this used and paid a lot less than the new one.  Also, when starting this kindle when you press  the ON button you have to wait 35 seconds before it powers up.  I thought it worked like most gadgets and powered up right away, so I kept pressing the button until a tech person told me to wait.  This kindle also takes a very long time to charge for the limited amt of usage that you do get out of it.  If given a choice, I would just get a used laptop.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB

review_body: I have had mine for 2 days.It is being replaced by another one after over an hour with tech support....have I been sold that bridge?

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: and loved it. I decided to upgrade because of the ...
review_body:
I had an original Kindle Fire, and loved it. I decided to upgrade because of the storage (double the original) and because of the camera features. Well.... fail on the camera - it is horribly grainy. Dig out your old flip phone... seriously. More space is good of course, but it comes at a price: the thing runs super-hot within 10 minutes of turning it on, the battery power is not nearly as robust as the first, and it's also thicker, so if you have covers & cases for the original 7" fire - throw them out.
I have upgrade regret bigtime.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body:
I am disappointed in this newest kindle. The sound quality is excellent. The picture quality is poor, contrast is terrible, the clarity suffers from blurred edges. The hd is lacking. I compared this newest kindle with my second generation kindle and my daughters two year old hd kindle . I am so disappointed. The sound on my older kindle may not be as good as I would like, but the picture quality is excellent, and when I use earbuds the sound is very good.
I will be returning this kindle as soon as I can get my printer running.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: My husband and I both have the Kindle HD Fire 6 and love them. My daughter enjoyed playing the games I ...
review_body: I ordered this Kindle for my daughter. My husband and I both have the Kindle HD Fire 6 and love them. My daughter enjoyed playing the games I had downloaded to mine so felt like she wanted one. She has been unable to download the apps to this new one, says message is "it's incompatible" .  She called customer service and they said they were aware the apps weren't compatible with the 7, that they are working on it and she should just keep trying to download them. I feel like this issue should be referred to in description of product or that product should not be available until all the bugs are worked out.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Semi disappointed because of the cheap design but on the bright ...
review_body: Semi disappointed because of the cheap design but on the bright side its pretty durable with good battery life. I'm not a fan of the layout as its not very customizable, you're stuck with their wallpapers but its good for netflix and reading so its an alright deal I guess.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: camera picture are always fuzzy

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: You get what you pay for!
review_body: I was in the market for a tablet, and when I came across the Fire HD I was amazed at how cheap it is.  I decided to give it a try and was very disappointed.  For someone who has an android phone and have used an iPad in the past, I maybe had high expectations.  When I got the device I thought it was very cute, and was excited to use it.  Once I got the thing running I was surprised to find how limited it is compared to other tablets in the market.  There was no option to stream it to my apple tv.  You had to find an app that allows you to do this and even then it was completely limited.  I couldn't believe that there was no option to use chrome as your browser! I even tried to download the app and they didn't have it in the store. You are basically forced to use the built in browser, which was very annoying since I have all my bookmarks in chrome. I am a HUGE fan of kindle/amazon as I only use my kindle to read my books, but my current kindle is the touch which doesn't have a color screen.  As a kindle book reader this device would be great, but I don't recommend you buy this as a tablet. The interface itself is not easy to use.  I hate that you can't customize the device.  Maybe I made the mistake of not paying extra for the ad free version, but I like to feel like my device is personal by being able to pick my own photo for the lock screen and background screen and there was no option for this. I had to return it and will likely be buying a samsung tablet instead.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Don't get me wrong the HD Quality is great, but I want to see that on my ...
review_body: It's okay but not okay, it happens to freeze every time I watch a TV Series or Movie and I have tried everything to resolve this matter. I have downloaded apps that  I thought would help and to no avail it steel freeze, Don't get me wrong the HD Quality is great, but I want to see that on my 50" HD via HDMI Cable. I have went throw 2 cables and on adapter to later find out I need A 5 Pin Micro USB to HDMI Cable in order for to to work and I'm hesitation to buy one because I don't know which one will work. So if you have an Fire HD 7; please help me out. I really like this Tablet, and I would hate to sent it back or sell it. Thanks.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Kindle fire and customer service a huge disappointment!!
review_body: This device is a piece of junk! Do Not Waste Your Money!! I bought this as a gift for my mom, and in 8 months, the screen went black and the device could not be charged or used at all. I called customer service and I was told my mom would be receiving a new device. The device that arrived was a refurbished device. I was not happy with this and called again and was told that the replacement could be new or refurbished.  The refurbished device malfunctioned in the same exact way as the original, screen is black and unable to charge or use in any way. I called customer service again, and was told a new device would be sent. When I questioned what they meant by new, the customer service representative told me the device would be new and not refurbished, and what arrived was another refurbished device. I called customer service again, very unhappy, requesting a new device, and I was told that their warranty states they can replace a device with one that is refurbished. So they refused to send a new device, and refused to extend the warranty, so when this device malfunctions, as I'm sure it will, I will be left with a dead kindle fire and no warranty. All they offered me was $5 for my inconvenience!! Insulting is an understatement.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Terrible. I have last year's Fire and it works much better.  Hangs constantly when trying to access web pages.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I'll keep using My Dell Venue Pro with Windows 8.1 instead.
review_body:
It's a very limited toy like device. Poor cameras, little storage. Interface is limited and awkward. Battery life not great either.
Can't see how for the same price I can get a Windows Dell Pro tablet 8" that has more apps too. The inky thing OK really is the Kindle integration. It's as if this is just a Kindle and they said 'why not add Android stuff' too

Priced way too high. Windows tablets are $100 for much more hardware and software.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Got this just three minutes ago. Fully charged, but plugged it in. The first thing I checked after downloading Netflix was the sound. Very low sound compared to the previous Kindle Fire HD. I compared the sound with my old one and my old one overpowered it. To be sure it wasn't just a weird version of Netflix, I decided to download one of my songs from the Cloud. It paused over and over as it struggled to play. Remember - I literally just got this device. Typing as I am going through the options. So far, my bought videos and tv shows don't show - it only leads me to the Amazon store with no option to download my previous purchases. Finally found three tiny lines on the left side with options - my videos are hidden in there (thanks for making it so user-friendly). The battery dropped from 99 to 87% within nine-ten minutes. Not sure what's eating up the battery this fast, but okay. Attempting to download one of my film purchases and the d/l speed is really, really slow. Fire HD 2013 was super fast. This tablet is a lot thicker than the 2013 model, smaller speakers though. The camera takes grainy photos. Well, this is pretty disappointing. I wanted to upgrade, but it appears I've downgraded. Nothing I play on youtube or from my song library plays without major pausing/skipping. Anyone else experience this?

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Battery life worse as result of quad core (although it's snappy), UI changes with new OS are ugly and decrease visibility, no 32 gb option and I am not getting the hdx for it because I already did the battery life on it is atrocious due to hi res screen. I also agree that app compatibility is less compared to older models, which is silly because the kindles are so similar. Sideloaded YouTube app no longer works. :( Loading it in Silk is terrible.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Avoid,  there are better products from Samsung and Apple
review_body: Horrible user interface.  Slow and clunky, the screen is not as good as Apple or Samsung devices I have used.  Bought this for my daughter and thinking I should have got the mini.  I would stick with the old kindle for reading books and get a real tablet.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I loved this product until it stopped working correctly.  I am now on Kindle #3,  my original and two reconditioned.  On all three the screen would go black, come back on, go black again, and the come on - usually at a different place place on whatever site I was on than before the screen going black.  This latest one goes one better.  After going black twice I end up on a totally different site.  I am so tired of calling repeatedly, always having to explain everything from the start, that I will just suffer with it till I can get a different product.  It was only about 7 months old when all this started.  Now, almost a year, it's still not fixed.  Part of the problem is the kindle, and part is customer service.  I can speculate that my reconditioned kindle had the same problem, but since it doesn't show up on a schedule, they were deemed in good condition, and sent out a gain.  SO disappointed with the whole experience.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Great device, but why aren't my old Kindle games compatible?
review_body: After just a few hours with my newest generation Kindle Fire 7 HD (16 GB).  I will tell you it's fast, easy to set up and beautiful.  If you've had other versions of the Kindle you will be able to jump right in rather quickly and feel right at home.  The main reason I'm even writing this review is to warn customers of the current lack of app support.  Yes there are "Thousands" of apps out there, but many of my old kindle apps are not compatible with the new Fire, specifically games.  Stranger still is many would seem to benefit from the more powerful tablet.  Games such as Asphalt, Duke Nukem 3D and NBA2K15 (among many others) are not compatible!  New games to show off the device are not out there as of this writing (granted it's the day it came out).  I have no doubt things will improve with time.  But if you're someone like me who was anxious to show off the new device, you'll probably be disappointed  if your a gamer.  Otherwise, I believe you'll love it.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: unable to use my hdmi cable to view movies as I was able to with earlier kindle. My TV isn't one of the few that will allow the kindle to send movies to it. If I had known this I wouldn't have gave away my older kindle and purchased this one. Guess I won't need prime anymore

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I really liked the kindle fire but the quality is not that good. We have had one that after 7 months wouldn't turn on any more and then they sent us a replacement kindle for free. Well after about 6 months of having that kindle it will only stay powered on if it is plugged into a power source. We cannot get this one replaced because it's past our original 1 year warranty. So in all I've learned that kindle fire tablets only last about 6 or 7 months before the power mechanism goes bad on them.I will be searching for a different brand tablet.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: so all the new technology and opportunities for many functions is annoying to me
review_body: II wanted a reader that had back lighting, so all the new technology and opportunities for many functions is annoying to me.  It flits around to easily to be a good reader.  It is not easy to order books.  I liked my old primitive reader that turn pages with a side toggle.  I really don't even like the touch stuff.  My husband loves his, so our votes cancel each other. Shirley Scott

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: I want to purchase a Kindle Fire IF I can download a subscription to the London Daily Mail. I would like someone to tell me if I can do this.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB

One other thing is I hate those little icons right in the middle of the screen, based on what you are doing.  Wish I could rid the screen of that clutter. 0/5 stars.

The sound is distorted and sounds very strange and you only know what is being said because of the picture. I want my money back and will get her an iPad mini.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Idk I was excited now I wish I just stayed w google and got a galaxy tablet #disappointed I will say I AM happy w the speed and
review_body:
Charge wire is the shortest thing ever for a tablet w a battery that goes so quick
Also I've turned off the lock screen ads at least thirty times yet every time I turn on my tablet I have to see advertisements w NO way to change it..Also no memory card slot?..even my cheap Polaroid tablet had a slot for extra storage. Idk I was excited now I wish I just stayed w google and got a galaxy tablet #disappointed I will say I AM happy w the speed and functionality..just the ad thing is really annoying.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Had the Kindle HD less than 2 years, and ...
review_body: Had the Kindle HD less than 2 years, and the connection to charge it doesn't work half the time, so I can't charge it. Have to play around with it for a few minutes to get the connection just right. Won't buy another kindle, might as well just buy a tablet for the same price.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Battery goes fast. Not loud enough

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: Don't expect it to last too long.
review_body:
Had my Kindle Fire HD for 1 3/4 years; within the last 6 mths, it's stopped working reliably. First, the charging cable that came with it died. Then, while I was typing, it would just freeze and not type anymore. Then, the sound started becoming distorted. Now the sound no longer works at all. Amazon walked me through a couple basic things, then said they can't do a darn thing for it and want me to buy a refurbished device. They don't even have service centers. So where do they get these refurbished devices?
I wouldn't buy another one. I'll just use this one for the occasional ebook I find and go back to my local library for real books. Not happy with Amazon, contributor to over-consumption and global waste.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Kindle help line number is 866-321-8851.  However, it is offshore and I could not understand much of what was said.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I hear so many good things about it
review_body:
I was really excited for this item, I hear so many good things about it, what a let down!

the touch screen hates me, any selection I make has to be pressed at least 10 times or more (I have tried different styluses and just touch screen and it still doesn't help)

I don't know anymore about it as that was so annoying and off putting I don't even want to keep attempting to use the dang thing!

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I'm very disappointed by the limited number of apps
review_body:
I'm very disappointed by the limited number of apps... I bought the fire hd 7 so I could study my programming books while in the same room with my Wife in the evening -- I was hopeful I could switch over to the Lynda.com app and and review what I'm reading about in their videos. The app is sold on Amazon as a Kindle app, yet it doesn't work with the new HD7?

Why not?

I will gladly give this whole review a 5 if you could work with Lynda.com to get this resolved.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: New Buyers Might Like but Not as good as the 2012 Kindle Fire HD 7
review_body: Disappointed and I will be returning it.  I have the Kindle Fire HD 7 2012 model  and was looking forward to this Fire HD 7 as a replacement.  I'll keep the 2012 model.    I like the smaller form factor of the newer model but it just seems to me to be a downgrade from the 2012 model in terms of picture quality and speed.    The Silk browser crashes often and the whole  experience using this is just, again, disappointing.  Some apps I use on the 2012 model are not available on the new one, a couple being USA Today and Overdrive.  Updates to these apps may be coming but you would think if apps were available for a 2012 model they would be available for the newest model.    If you are a first time Kindle Fire HD 7 buyer, you may be pleased by this model.    If Amazon ever updates the Kindle Fire 7 HDX, I may consider it.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: You get what you pay for...
review_body: It is allright.. you get what you paid for.. Thick.. Front facing camera is not good...i do Skype a lot so it matters to me... Slow on performance... FB photos takes forever to load... but for the Price worth...if you are techie... i dont think you would like it... returning it...

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Awful, I have the first Fire, love it.  The screen broke so I bought this one as soon as it came out. It drops signal constantly, restarts every few minutes and has no battery life.  When trying to place an order online, it kicked me out 7 times.  I finally went and got the old one with the broken screen.  Don't waste your money or time.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I like kindle, but this one was a waste of
review_body:
It crashes. Battery at 45%? Crash. Follow a link on pinterest? Crash.
Have book open longer than 30 minutes? Crash.
It constantly reboots and shuts down. I like kindle,but this one was a waste of money

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: I was so disappointed and upset about this purchase
review_body: I was so disappointed and upset about this purchase. My time zone is eastern standard time which  was correct on the kindle but the actual time was wrong.by eight hours. I called support and they worked with me to try to set it and turns out all of the time zones were wrong.  So being Amazon they sent me a replacement and guess what. You got it, same problem. They offered to send me another one but  after being on the phone for an hour or more each time I was getting pretty aggravated and I told them you can't just keep sending me replacements because it looks like I'm going to have the same problem and I refuse to have a brand new one fixed when they should have fixed the issues before they sold them.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_headline: It?? a shame because I really like the hardware
review_body:
I picked up an Amazon Fire HD 7 on a whim and I just figured it was an Android tablet with their UI and such on it, along with the average level of lockdown. I didn?? realize they actually ship a fork of Android with every bit of Google infrastructure removed and go above and beyond to keep the device locked down.

It?? a shame because I really like the hardware. It?? a bit heavy but feels sturdy. The OS runs smoothly and under the expected use, I imagine it would continue to do well.

It?? just that, there?? plenty I have on Google?? cloud that I?? like to be available for a given tablet to be most useful. Not having calendar and contacts I can sync with my phone (note it?? not a Fire Phone), is core competency as far as I?? concerned. Not all Play apps are on Amazon App Store, and while I can sideload some, a lot of functionality is broken without Google Services Framework on the system.

And while I?? sure the device will eventually be cracked somehow, I don?? think it?? worth it to worry about blocking updates, keeping it cracked/rooted, and maintaining a patchset or entirely new rom on it just to keep basic apps running.

I get that they sell them at a loss and want to lock buyers into the Amazon ecosystem in order to recoup that, but I?? have bought media from Amazon whether I was locked in or not, so for me the broken OS is such a deterrent they??e entirely lost my potential purchases from having a device I carry with convenient Amazon integration. It's just not well suited to a user like me.

product_title: Fire HD 7, 7" HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
review_body: Just wondering why the video ad says the tablets are 1080p, when the specs on both the 6" and 7" say 720p? Which is it?
